ff513ca4-ef4b-484a-80aa-f637d0144fee Dice fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes. Scald with hot water for 5 minutes. Drain and cool.
ff513ca4-ef4b-484a-80aa-f637d0144fee Slightly warm up the blood and mix with rye meal. Add fat cubes and spices and mix together.
ff513ca4-ef4b-484a-80aa-f637d0144fee Stuff loosely into 36 mm hog casings or a linen bag.
ff513ca4-ef4b-484a-80aa-f637d0144fee Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
ff513ca4-ef4b-484a-80aa-f637d0144fee Place in cold water for 10 minutes.
ff513ca4-ef4b-484a-80aa-f637d0144fee Dry briefly and refrigerate.
f1fd965f-3b4e-4cc4-a3ad-23e30495789c Cook skins in water at 95° C (203° F) until soft Cool.
f1fd965f-3b4e-4cc4-a3ad-23e30495789c Grind meats, skins and fat through 1/8” (3 mm) plate. Make sure the fat is partially frozen.
f1fd965f-3b4e-4cc4-a3ad-23e30495789c Add salt, cure #1 and spices to ground meats and mix well.
f1fd965f-3b4e-4cc4-a3ad-23e30495789c Add raisins, pine nuts and blood and mix all together.
f1fd965f-3b4e-4cc4-a3ad-23e30495789c Stuff into beef rounds making 16” (40 cm) rings or stuff into pork stomachs.
f1fd965f-3b4e-4cc4-a3ad-23e30495789c Cook in water 80° C (176° F) unitl the sausage reaches 72° C (160° F) internal temperature.
f1fd965f-3b4e-4cc4-a3ad-23e30495789c Cool in cold water for 5-10 minutes.
f1fd965f-3b4e-4cc4-a3ad-23e30495789c Drain and spread on the table to cool.
f1fd965f-3b4e-4cc4-a3ad-23e30495789c Refrigerate.
71b42f10-497e-402e-b3d5-a46775b5e404 Mix diced fat with blood and other ingredients.
71b42f10-497e-402e-b3d5-a46775b5e404 Stuff loosely into 32 - 36 mm hog casings. Make 12” rings.
71b42f10-497e-402e-b3d5-a46775b5e404 Cook in a hot water at 176° F (80° C) for about 40 minutes. Any sausage that floats to the top should be pricked to remove air. Don’t increase temperature as the casings may burst.
71b42f10-497e-402e-b3d5-a46775b5e404 Store in refrigerator.
488f612f-4d39-40af-9dad-4da15d7eede7 Dice back fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
488f612f-4d39-40af-9dad-4da15d7eede7 Cook barley in water. Drain.
488f612f-4d39-40af-9dad-4da15d7eede7 Mix barley when still warm with all materials and seasonings.
488f612f-4d39-40af-9dad-4da15d7eede7 Stuff into beef runners or 36-40 mm hog casings.
488f612f-4d39-40af-9dad-4da15d7eede7 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes or until sausage reaches 72° C (160° F) internal temperature.
488f612f-4d39-40af-9dad-4da15d7eede7 Cool in cold water, hang in air to evaporate moisture. Keep refrigerated.
521b8358-8a2a-4099-ab02-a01e345eaacc Dice back fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
521b8358-8a2a-4099-ab02-a01e345eaacc Cook barley in water. Drain.
521b8358-8a2a-4099-ab02-a01e345eaacc Mix barley when still warm with all materials and seasonings.
521b8358-8a2a-4099-ab02-a01e345eaacc Stuff into beef runners or 36-40 mm hog casings.
521b8358-8a2a-4099-ab02-a01e345eaacc Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes or until sausage reaches 72° C (160° F) internal temperature.
521b8358-8a2a-4099-ab02-a01e345eaacc Cool in cold water, hang in air to evaporate moisture. Keep refrigerated.
02fe7f45-41a9-48b7-a205-295f99d10d10 Dice back fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
02fe7f45-41a9-48b7-a205-295f99d10d10 Cook barley in water. Drain.
02fe7f45-41a9-48b7-a205-295f99d10d10 Mix barley when still warm with all materials and seasonings.
02fe7f45-41a9-48b7-a205-295f99d10d10 Stuff into beef runners or 36-40 mm hog casings.
02fe7f45-41a9-48b7-a205-295f99d10d10 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes or until sausage reaches 72° C (160° F) internal temperature.
02fe7f45-41a9-48b7-a205-295f99d10d10 Cool in cold water, hang in air to evaporate moisture. Keep refrigerated.
54c4847b-a8b4-4887-a84d-db696a838159 Cut suet. Commercial producers cleanly cut suet in bowl cutters into 1-5 mm pieces. In home production partially frozen suet can be manually cut into 3-5 mm pieces. It can be ground through 1/8” (3 mm) plate, however, particle definition will be poor due to fat smearing.
54c4847b-a8b4-4887-a84d-db696a838159 Chop the onions finely.
54c4847b-a8b4-4887-a84d-db696a838159 Mix all ingredients with blood. Where dried blood is used, water is added to rehydrate the blood; this method is used when large volumes of pudding are required as it is not possible to transport such volumes of liquid blood. The mixture should exhibit a thick porridge-like consistency which can still be stirred but with some effort.
54c4847b-a8b4-4887-a84d-db696a838159 Stuff the mixture into large sausage casings using a stuffer. The skins are made from cellulose which is an organic compound produced for industrial use. Synthetic casings are used for the production of Stornoway Black Pudding due to large volumes required for commercial manufacture; however, natural casings may also be used in small scale production and subject to availability of animal intestines (sheep, cow, pig).
54c4847b-a8b4-4887-a84d-db696a838159 Smaller amounts of sausage can be stuffed using a ladle by manually placing the sausage skin onto a large funnel.
54c4847b-a8b4-4887-a84d-db696a838159 The ends are then either hand-tied with string or clipped by machine.
54c4847b-a8b4-4887-a84d-db696a838159 The puddings are then boiled or steamed for up to 2.5 hours at temperatures between 70-86° C (158-186° F).
54c4847b-a8b4-4887-a84d-db696a838159 Once cooked, each pudding is hung individually on a rack to cool gradually to an ambient temperature of 12° C (53° F), this can take between 2.5 - 4 hours. They are then placed in a chiller and stored at a temperature of 2° C (35° F).
d9f2b744-8066-4e09-8989-4ee52bce6e81 Dice back fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
d9f2b744-8066-4e09-8989-4ee52bce6e81 Cook barley in water. Drain.
d9f2b744-8066-4e09-8989-4ee52bce6e81 Mix barley when still warm with all materials and seasonings.
d9f2b744-8066-4e09-8989-4ee52bce6e81 Stuff into beef runners or 36-40 mm hog casings.
d9f2b744-8066-4e09-8989-4ee52bce6e81 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes or until sausage reaches 72° C (160° F) internal temperature.
d9f2b744-8066-4e09-8989-4ee52bce6e81 Cool in cold water, hang in air to evaporate moisture. Keep refrigerated.
6ae65b6b-d3a3-4b12-888a-e1cacc53e2cb Dice back fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
6ae65b6b-d3a3-4b12-888a-e1cacc53e2cb Cook barley in water. Drain.
6ae65b6b-d3a3-4b12-888a-e1cacc53e2cb Mix barley when still warm with all materials and seasonings.
6ae65b6b-d3a3-4b12-888a-e1cacc53e2cb Stuff into beef runners or 36-40 mm hog casings.
6ae65b6b-d3a3-4b12-888a-e1cacc53e2cb Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes or until sausage reaches 72° C (160° F) internal temperature.
6ae65b6b-d3a3-4b12-888a-e1cacc53e2cb Cool in cold water, hang in air to evaporate moisture. Keep refrigerated.
d6786e3e-b20e-497b-84e5-b0a10d51a2c8 Soak oatmeal in water. Drain.
d6786e3e-b20e-497b-84e5-b0a10d51a2c8 Cook barley in water for 30 minutes. Drain.
d6786e3e-b20e-497b-84e5-b0a10d51a2c8 Dice fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
d6786e3e-b20e-497b-84e5-b0a10d51a2c8 Finely dice onions and fry in a little fat until glassy. Mix with oats and barley.
d6786e3e-b20e-497b-84e5-b0a10d51a2c8 Mix blood with salt, add spices and cream. Pour over barley and oats. Mix all well together.
d6786e3e-b20e-497b-84e5-b0a10d51a2c8 Stuff loosely into 32 - 36 mm hog casings.
d6786e3e-b20e-497b-84e5-b0a10d51a2c8 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for about 40 minutes. Store in refrigerator. The sausage can be eaten cold or fried.
0bf00cde-9fcf-4038-833b-f98ea3407502 Chop the fat into 1/8” (3 mm) cubes.
0bf00cde-9fcf-4038-833b-f98ea3407502 Pre-cook liver and kidneys in hot water. Drain and cool.
0bf00cde-9fcf-4038-833b-f98ea3407502 Chop liver and kidneys into 1/8” (3 mm) cubes.
0bf00cde-9fcf-4038-833b-f98ea3407502 Chop onions finely.
0bf00cde-9fcf-4038-833b-f98ea3407502 Mix meat, fat, milk, lamb stock, oats, flour, onions and spices together.
0bf00cde-9fcf-4038-833b-f98ea3407502 Mix everything with blood.
0bf00cde-9fcf-4038-833b-f98ea3407502 Stuff loosely into sheep stomach.
0bf00cde-9fcf-4038-833b-f98ea3407502 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) until the meat reaches 72° C (160° F) internal temperature.
42e978ce-7cb5-43d5-8689-f3392f7005cf Grind meat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
42e978ce-7cb5-43d5-8689-f3392f7005cf Dice partially frozen back fat into 1/2” (12 mm) cubes.
42e978ce-7cb5-43d5-8689-f3392f7005cf Mix ground meat with salt and spices.
42e978ce-7cb5-43d5-8689-f3392f7005cf Add fat cubes and mix again.
42e978ce-7cb5-43d5-8689-f3392f7005cf Stuff into beef (or pork) stomach.
42e978ce-7cb5-43d5-8689-f3392f7005cf Cook in hot water at 80° C (176° F) until the sausage reaches 72° C (160° F) internal temperature what should take about 2 hours. Partially cool in cold water, finish cooling in the air.
42e978ce-7cb5-43d5-8689-f3392f7005cf Refrigerate. Sausage can be eaten cold or hot.
9b930c9a-e38b-4c85-b7d1-4da533c40b90 Rinse skins, lungs and all meats in cold running water.
9b930c9a-e38b-4c85-b7d1-4da533c40b90 Boil all meats:skins at 85-95º C (185º -203º F) until soft. if lungs are used, remove harder connective tissues from lungs. poach jowls at 85º C (185º-203º F) until semi-soft. spread all meats on the table to cool down.
9b930c9a-e38b-4c85-b7d1-4da533c40b90 Bring meat stock to boil then insert buckwheat grouts or barley and cook for about 30 minutes, stirring oftencook buckwheat groats in 160 milliliters of meat stock until semi-soft cook barley groats in 200 milliliters of meat stock until semi-soft. cover the pot with a lid and leave cooked groats 60 minutes.
9b930c9a-e38b-4c85-b7d1-4da533c40b90 Grind all meats and fats through 8 mm (3/8") plate. Grind bacon, fat and skins with 3 mm (3/16") plate. If jowls are used, they can be cut with a knife into 5 mm (1/4") cubes (no grinding necessary).
9b930c9a-e38b-4c85-b7d1-4da533c40b90 Spread all meats and fats on the bottom of a mixing tub. Spread hot groats evenly on top of meats without disturbing them. Pour blood on top of groats and mix together. Add salt and spices and mix all well together.
9b930c9a-e38b-4c85-b7d1-4da533c40b90 Stuff warm sausage mass loosely into hog casings. Make 12" long links, form pairs.
9b930c9a-e38b-4c85-b7d1-4da533c40b90 Insert sausages into boiling water but poach at 80º C (176º F) for about 30 minutes to reach internal sausage temperature of 68º-72º C (154º-161º F).
9b930c9a-e38b-4c85-b7d1-4da533c40b90 Remove from water and cool down to 6º C (42º F)
9b930c9a-e38b-4c85-b7d1-4da533c40b90 Refrigerate.
5722f28b-88a7-41a0-a6a1-e4e0c793ced9 Poach meats (except liver) in small amount of water: skins at 203° F (95° C) until soft;
5722f28b-88a7-41a0-a6a1-e4e0c793ced9 other meats at 176-185° F (80-85° C) until soft.
5722f28b-88a7-41a0-a6a1-e4e0c793ced9 Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool. Save stock.
5722f28b-88a7-41a0-a6a1-e4e0c793ced9 Boil buckwheat or barley grouts in left over stock or water until semi-soft. Boil grouts for about ½ hr continuously stirring. After boiling leave for ½ to 1 hr covered.
5722f28b-88a7-41a0-a6a1-e4e0c793ced9 Grind pork through 10 mm plate. Grind boiled skins through 3 mm plate. Grind raw liver through 3 mm plate.
5722f28b-88a7-41a0-a6a1-e4e0c793ced9 Add salt and spices to ground meats, mix barley or buckwheat grouts with blood and then mix everything well together.
5722f28b-88a7-41a0-a6a1-e4e0c793ced9 Stuff mixture loosely into pork middles, beef rounds or synthetic casings.
5722f28b-88a7-41a0-a6a1-e4e0c793ced9 Place sausages in boiling water and poach at 176-185° F (80-85° C) for about 60-90 min until internal meat temperature reaches 68-70° C (154-158° F).
5722f28b-88a7-41a0-a6a1-e4e0c793ced9 Place sausages for 5 min in cold running water, then spread them on a flat surface to cool down below 6° C (43° F).
5722f28b-88a7-41a0-a6a1-e4e0c793ced9 Store in refrigerator.
f0c00a52-3f8d-4666-93a6-7900597b3fe0 Poach meats in small amount of water: heads, lungs and bloody meats at 80-85° C (176-185° F); skins at 95° C (203° F) until soft. After poaching remove gristle from lungs and meat from heads. Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool. Save stock.
f0c00a52-3f8d-4666-93a6-7900597b3fe0 Grind all meats through 2 mm plate. Soak bread crumbs (or dry bread rolls) in 30% (in relation to the weight of the rolls) of left over poaching stock.
f0c00a52-3f8d-4666-93a6-7900597b3fe0 Add salt and spices to ground meats and then mix in bowl cutter together with blood and soaked rolls. Alternatively, you can use food processor or grind meats with a small plate.
f0c00a52-3f8d-4666-93a6-7900597b3fe0 Stuffing materials: pork hog casings, butcher’s twine. Stuff casings loosely and form twisted links 8-12 cm (3-5”) each. Make pairs and tie the ends with twine. Remove air pockets with a needle.
f0c00a52-3f8d-4666-93a6-7900597b3fe0 Immerse sausages in boiling water and poach at 80-82° C (176-180° F) for 25-30 min until internal meat temperature reaches 68-70° C (154-158° F).
f0c00a52-3f8d-4666-93a6-7900597b3fe0 Immerse sausages for 5 min in cold running water, then hang them to cool down below 6° C (43° F). If no suitable cooling conditions are available, arrangements need to be made to bring the temperature to 12° C (53° F) or less.
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Cook in a small amount of water:
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 skins at 95° C (203° F) until soft (don’t overcook); jowls and hearts at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until done. Save meat stock.
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Grind the skins with 1/8” (3 mm) plate. You can emulsify ground skins in food processor adding a small amount of meat stock.
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Cut up hearts and jowls by hand into 3/4” (20 mm) pieces.
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Scald the pork back fat by pouring boiling water over it for a few minutes. Then cut it into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes by hand.
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Mix all meats with spices, flour and the blood.
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Stuff loosely into beef bungs, beef middles, beef rounds or large synthetic casings.
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Cook in water at at 80° C (176° F) for about 60-90 min until sausages reach 68-70° C (154-158° F) internal temperature.
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Cool in cold water until thoroughly cooled.
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Place in refrigerator and allow it to remain there 12 hours before cutting.
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Note: for better appearance and stronger red color it is recommended to cure hearts and jowls before processing:
ccac5a76-d006-420c-972a-9186e64c44e9 Immerse hearts and jowls for 7 days in 16° Bé (60° SAL) cure solution. 16° Bé (60° SAL) cure solution is made by mixing 1.32 lb (598 g) salt, 4.2 oz (120 g) cure #1 and one gallon of water. Use 1/2 part (by weight) of meat to 1 part curing solution: 100 g of meat to 200 g (200 ml) curing solution.
028942dc-40af-4331-9625-c895675e1b22 Wash meats in cold water, soak any salted meats for 2-3 hrs in cold running water.
028942dc-40af-4331-9625-c895675e1b22 Poach meats in small amount of water: skins at 95° C (203° F) until soft; other meats at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until soft. After poaching remove gristle from lungs and meat from heads.
028942dc-40af-4331-9625-c895675e1b22 Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool. Don’t cool by rinsing with water.
028942dc-40af-4331-9625-c895675e1b22 Take 200-250 g of broth (from poaching meats) or water per 100 g of rice. Add rice to boiling stock/water and stir frequently. After boiling leave for ½-1 hr covered.
028942dc-40af-4331-9625-c895675e1b22 Grind head meat, jowls, snouts through 8 mm plate. Grind lungs (if used) and skins through 3 mm plate. Grind boiled skins through 3 mm plate.
028942dc-40af-4331-9625-c895675e1b22 Add salt and spices to ground meats, and mix with blood and rice everything well together.
028942dc-40af-4331-9625-c895675e1b22 Stuffing materials: Large hog casings, after ends, butcher’s twine. Stuff casings loosely and make sausage links 15-30 cm (6-12”) long, up to 8 cm (3”) diameter. Tie the ends with twine.
028942dc-40af-4331-9625-c895675e1b22 Immerse sausages in boiling water and cook at 80-85° C (176-185° F) for about 60-90 min until internal meat temperature reaches 68-70° C (154-158° F).
028942dc-40af-4331-9625-c895675e1b22 Spread sausages on a flat surface to cool down below 6° C (43° F). If no suitable cooling conditions are available, arrangements need to be made to bring the temperature to 12° C (53° F) or less.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Cook in a small amount of water: ears at 95° C (203° F) until done; snouts at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until done. Save meat stock.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Grind the ears with 1/8” (3 mm) plate. You can emulsify ground ears in food processor adding a small amount of meat stock.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Cut up snouts by hand into 1/2” (12 mm) pieces or grind with 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Scald the pork back fat by pouring boiling water over it for a few minutes. Then cut it into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes by hand.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Mix all meats with spices, flour and the blood.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Stuff loosely into beef bungs, beef middles, beef rounds or large synthetic casings.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Cook in water at at 80° C (176° F) for about 60-90 min until sausages reach 68-70° C (154-158° F) internal temperature.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Cool in cold water until thoroughly cooled.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Place in refrigerator and allow it to remain there 12 hours before cutting.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Note: for better appearance and stronger red color it is recommended to cure snouts before processing:
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 Immerse the snouts for 7 days in 16° Bé (60° SAL) cure solution.
0ccd64c9-ff0b-4df1-b864-2dbb40db0a18 16° Bé (60° SAL) cure solution is made by mixing 1.32 lb (598 g) salt, 4.2 oz (120 g) cure #1 and one gallon of water. Use 1/2 part (by weight) of meat to 1 part curing solution: 100 g of meat to 200 g (200 ml) curing solution.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Blanch tongues in hot water and remove the skin before submitting them for curing.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Immerse tongues for 7 days in 16° Bé (60° SAL) cure solution.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f 16° Bé (60° SAL) cure solution is made by mixing 1.32 lb (598 g) salt, 4.2 oz (120 g) cure #1 and one gallon of water. Use 1/2 part (by weight) of meat to 1 part curing solution: 100 g of meat to 200 g (200 ml) curing solution. Rinse tongue with fresh water.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Cook in a small amount of water: skins at 95° C (203° F) until soft (don’t overcook); tongues at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until soft. Save stock.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Cut tongues into strips.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Dice back fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Grind skins with 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Mix meat with blood, flour and spices.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Stuff loosely into beef bungs, beef middles, beef rounds or large synthetic casings.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Cook in water at at 80° C (176° F) for about 60-90 min until sausages reach 68-70° C (154-158° F) internal temperature.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Cool in cold water until thoroughly cooled.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Place the sausages in cold water for 15 minutes and then spread them on a flat surface to cool.
dcfc7c3d-e3ff-4ddc-9d7e-09dd0e0cf98f Refrigerate.
d69be0aa-842c-4876-9074-f5d4b74545ce Take a mixing bowl and fill with blood, water, fat, chopped onions and parsley. Mix all together and start adding flours slowly until a dough like texture is obtained. Let it rest for one hour.
d69be0aa-842c-4876-9074-f5d4b74545ce Place some fat in the center and shape the mass into an elongated oval ball. Immerse borono in a boiling water and cook for 90-120 minutes depending on a size. At first the sausage will sink to the bottom, then it will rise to the surface. Drain and cool in air.
d69be0aa-842c-4876-9074-f5d4b74545ce Refrigerate.
488c6705-d320-4dc9-aeb0-03998525eaba Cook split head and skins in a little water on slow heat until meat separates from bones. In last 30 minutes of cooking add back fat or pork belly.
488c6705-d320-4dc9-aeb0-03998525eaba Remove meat, save meat stock. Using fingers separate meat from bones when still warm.
488c6705-d320-4dc9-aeb0-03998525eaba Grind meat and fat through 5 mm (1/4”) plate.
488c6705-d320-4dc9-aeb0-03998525eaba Chop the onions and fry in lard or oil until glassy and golden.
488c6705-d320-4dc9-aeb0-03998525eaba Mix them with blood, ground meat and all ingredients.
488c6705-d320-4dc9-aeb0-03998525eaba Stuff into 36 mm pork casings.
488c6705-d320-4dc9-aeb0-03998525eaba Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes.
f04b8aed-7673-49ed-a816-e7b3912fced3 Cure meats (optional).** Cook meats in a little water until soft. Separate meat from bones. Save meat stock.
f04b8aed-7673-49ed-a816-e7b3912fced3 Place buckwheat groats in 400 ml of boiling meat stock, lower temperature and simmer for 25 minutes until soft, but not overcooked.
f04b8aed-7673-49ed-a816-e7b3912fced3 Grind all meats, fat and skins and onions through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
f04b8aed-7673-49ed-a816-e7b3912fced3 Mix ground meats, fats, skins, onions, buckwheat groats with blood and all ingredients together.
f04b8aed-7673-49ed-a816-e7b3912fced3 Stuff into 40 mm synthetic waterproof casings forming 50 cm (20") loops.
f04b8aed-7673-49ed-a816-e7b3912fced3 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 50 minutes.
f04b8aed-7673-49ed-a816-e7b3912fced3 Immerse in cold water for 5 minutes. Finish cooling in air. Refrigerate.
d567c31e-c1b9-48cc-a91f-9b778616e930 Cure meats (optional).* Cook meats in a little water until soft. Separate meat from any bones. Save meat stock.
d567c31e-c1b9-48cc-a91f-9b778616e930 Soak raisins in a little water. Drain.
d567c31e-c1b9-48cc-a91f-9b778616e930 Place barley in 400 ml of meat stock, lower temperature and simmer for 25 minutes until soft, but not overcooked.
d567c31e-c1b9-48cc-a91f-9b778616e930 Grind all meats, fat, skins and onions through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
d567c31e-c1b9-48cc-a91f-9b778616e930 Mix ground meats, fats, skins, barley, onions, potato flour with blood and all ingredients together.
d567c31e-c1b9-48cc-a91f-9b778616e930 Stuff into 40 mm synthetic waterproof casings forming 50 cm (20") loops.
d567c31e-c1b9-48cc-a91f-9b778616e930 Cook in water at 80º C (176º F) for 50 minutes.
d567c31e-c1b9-48cc-a91f-9b778616e930 Immerse in cold water for 5 minutes. Finish cooling in air.
d567c31e-c1b9-48cc-a91f-9b778616e930 Refrigerate.
a712bf39-086b-4c2b-86c1-8165d5991161 Cure meats (optional).** Cook meats in a little water until soft. Separate meat from any bones. Save meat stock.
a712bf39-086b-4c2b-86c1-8165d5991161 Place oats in 400 ml of boiling meat stock, lower temperature and simmer for 25 minutes until soft, but not overcooked.
a712bf39-086b-4c2b-86c1-8165d5991161 Grind all meats, fat and skins and onions through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
a712bf39-086b-4c2b-86c1-8165d5991161 Mix ground meats, fats, skins, oats, onions with blood and all ingredients together.
a712bf39-086b-4c2b-86c1-8165d5991161 Stuff into 40 mm synthetic waterproof casings forming 50 cm (20") loops.
a712bf39-086b-4c2b-86c1-8165d5991161 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 50 minutes.
a712bf39-086b-4c2b-86c1-8165d5991161 Immerse in cold water for 5 minutes. Finish cooling in air.
a712bf39-086b-4c2b-86c1-8165d5991161 Refrigerate.
8920d31f-4545-4823-b635-642a389d04ff Cure meats (optional).**
8920d31f-4545-4823-b635-642a389d04ff Cook meats in a little water until soft. Separate meat from any bones. Save meat stock.
8920d31f-4545-4823-b635-642a389d04ff Place oats in 400 ml of boiling meat stock, lower temperature and simmer for 25 minutes until soft, but not overcooked.
8920d31f-4545-4823-b635-642a389d04ff Grind all meats, fat and skins and onions through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
8920d31f-4545-4823-b635-642a389d04ff Mix ground meats, fats, skins, oats, onions with blood and all ingredients together.
8920d31f-4545-4823-b635-642a389d04ff Stuff into 40 mm synthetic waterproof casings forming 50 cm (20") loops.
8920d31f-4545-4823-b635-642a389d04ff Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 50 minutes.
8920d31f-4545-4823-b635-642a389d04ff Immerse in cold water for 5 minutes. Finish cooling in air.
8920d31f-4545-4823-b635-642a389d04ff Refrigerate.
7f36972a-1050-422e-9adb-9b708176b2dd Curing meat.* Cut shoulder and jowls into 25 mm (1") cubes. Mix with salt and Cure #1. Place in container, cover with cloth and hold in refrigerator for 48 hours. The purpose of curing meat is to make it red so it creates contrast with pumpkin cubes.
7f36972a-1050-422e-9adb-9b708176b2dd Boil shoulder meat, jowls and skins in at 80° C (176° F) until softer. The skins will need longer cooking time.
7f36972a-1050-422e-9adb-9b708176b2dd Dice shoulder and jowls into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
7f36972a-1050-422e-9adb-9b708176b2dd Grind raw liver, onion and cooked skins through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
7f36972a-1050-422e-9adb-9b708176b2dd Cook pumpkin, drain and dice into 8 mm (3/8") cubes.
7f36972a-1050-422e-9adb-9b708176b2dd Mix all meat, liver, pumpkin, spices and blood together.
7f36972a-1050-422e-9adb-9b708176b2dd Stuff into 60 mm synthetic waterproof casings forming 50 cm (20") sections.
7f36972a-1050-422e-9adb-9b708176b2dd Boil in water at 80° C (176° F) for 60 minutes.
7f36972a-1050-422e-9adb-9b708176b2dd Cool and refrigerate.
1e372112-c708-4551-befd-8917e37ce4d1 Add rye grain to leftover meat stock or to water in which meat bouillon cubes were dissolved. Let soak for a few hours. Bring to boil and simmer for 20 minutes.
1e372112-c708-4551-befd-8917e37ce4d1 Grind fat, onions and ray grain through 3 mm (1/8") plate then mix with blood and all ingredients. This can also be accomplished in a food processor.
1e372112-c708-4551-befd-8917e37ce4d1 Stuff into 40 mm synthetic waterproof casings forming 50 cm (20") loops.
1e372112-c708-4551-befd-8917e37ce4d1 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 50 minutes.
1e372112-c708-4551-befd-8917e37ce4d1 Cool and refrigerate.
1cc38edf-a31d-4e8f-ad5e-1a17ce3a2532 Soak dry rolls or white bread in blood.
1cc38edf-a31d-4e8f-ad5e-1a17ce3a2532 Grind meat, fat and onions through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
1cc38edf-a31d-4e8f-ad5e-1a17ce3a2532 Mix ground meats, fats, soaked rolls with all ingredients together. You can perform grinding and mixing in a food processor.
1cc38edf-a31d-4e8f-ad5e-1a17ce3a2532 Stuff into 40 mm synthetic waterproof casings forming 50 cm (20") loops.
1cc38edf-a31d-4e8f-ad5e-1a17ce3a2532 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 50 minutes.
1cc38edf-a31d-4e8f-ad5e-1a17ce3a2532 Immerse in cold water for 5 minutes. Finish cooling in air.
1cc38edf-a31d-4e8f-ad5e-1a17ce3a2532 Refrigerate.
f2329d35-6f12-43c1-84fd-229d9d7529b6 Cook lungs, heart and stomach until soft. Cool and grind through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
f2329d35-6f12-43c1-84fd-229d9d7529b6 Grind fat through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
f2329d35-6f12-43c1-84fd-229d9d7529b6 Mix meat, fat and all ingredients together. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
f2329d35-6f12-43c1-84fd-229d9d7529b6 Stuff into 32 mm pork casings.
f2329d35-6f12-43c1-84fd-229d9d7529b6 Apply a thin cold smoke 18° C (64° F) for 10 days. Traditionally, the sausage was hung above the wood fired kitchen stove where it acquired different flavors and smoke from everyday cooking.
f2329d35-6f12-43c1-84fd-229d9d7529b6 Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 75-85% humidity for 2 weeks.
f2329d35-6f12-43c1-84fd-229d9d7529b6 Store in cool, not humid and well ventilated place. The sausages keep well for up to 6 months.
f3659ff4-22ae-4782-ab33-8b4a7a504a7b Peel onions and cook in water for 60 minutes. Drain, cut in half and let cool.
f3659ff4-22ae-4782-ab33-8b4a7a504a7b Grind meat, fat and onions through 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
f3659ff4-22ae-4782-ab33-8b4a7a504a7b Mix all materials with salt, spices and blood together.
f3659ff4-22ae-4782-ab33-8b4a7a504a7b Stuff into 32-34 mm beef or pork casings. Make rings about 35-40 cm (13-16”) long or form links about 10 cm (4”) long.
f3659ff4-22ae-4782-ab33-8b4a7a504a7b Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
f3659ff4-22ae-4782-ab33-8b4a7a504a7b Cool in air and refrigerate.
06a593a1-bec8-46e0-b471-b1e54a635638 Place lungs and skins in a boiling water and cook at 95-100° C (203-212° F) for 45 minutes. Cool and grind through 5 mm (1/4”) plate.
06a593a1-bec8-46e0-b471-b1e54a635638 Place skins in a boiling water and cook at 95-100° C (203-212° F) until soft.
06a593a1-bec8-46e0-b471-b1e54a635638 Grind skins when still warm through 5 mm (1/4”) plate.
06a593a1-bec8-46e0-b471-b1e54a635638 Grind back fat through 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
06a593a1-bec8-46e0-b471-b1e54a635638 Mix ground meat, fat, blood and spices together.
06a593a1-bec8-46e0-b471-b1e54a635638 Stuff into 34-38 mm pork casings linking sausages every 35-40 cm (14-16”).
06a593a1-bec8-46e0-b471-b1e54a635638 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 45-60 minutes.
06a593a1-bec8-46e0-b471-b1e54a635638 Keep refrigerated. The sausage is ready to eat without cooking, however it is often fried.
56e90f72-ab1d-4aad-b763-599c82edfc7d Cut the fat into 25 mm (1”) pieces and cook in hot water, at 90° C (194° F) for 20 minutes. Immerse in cold water to cool.
56e90f72-ab1d-4aad-b763-599c82edfc7d Grind the fat through 8 mm (3/8”) plate.
56e90f72-ab1d-4aad-b763-599c82edfc7d Peel onions then cook them in water at 90° C (194° F) for 5 minutes. Chop the onions finely then fry them on low heat in some lard. Stir the onions often and fry for 60 minutes, do not let them become brown.
56e90f72-ab1d-4aad-b763-599c82edfc7d Precook head meat or skins in water at 90° C (194° F) until softer.
56e90f72-ab1d-4aad-b763-599c82edfc7d Using food processor blend blood, milk, cream, meat/skins, onions and all ingredients together.
56e90f72-ab1d-4aad-b763-599c82edfc7d Using ladle pour the sausage mass loosely into 36 mm pork casings making one long spiral. Create shorter links by twisting or using butcher twine.
56e90f72-ab1d-4aad-b763-599c82edfc7d Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
56e90f72-ab1d-4aad-b763-599c82edfc7d Immerse in cold water for 5 minutes. Drain and spread on the table to evaporate moisture.
56e90f72-ab1d-4aad-b763-599c82edfc7d Refrigerate.
81183546-e124-489b-b996-a186113e161a Cook meats in hot water (below the boilng point) until semi-soft.
81183546-e124-489b-b996-a186113e161a Dice the onions finely and fry in grease/oil on low heat until glassy.
81183546-e124-489b-b996-a186113e161a Soak raisins in water, then drain.
81183546-e124-489b-b996-a186113e161a Grind lean meat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
81183546-e124-489b-b996-a186113e161a Dice fat into 1/4 (6 mm) cubes.
81183546-e124-489b-b996-a186113e161a Mix everything together.
81183546-e124-489b-b996-a186113e161a Stuff into 32 mm hog casings.
81183546-e124-489b-b996-a186113e161a Cook in hot water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes. Cool in cold water, dry briefly and refrigerate.
bd941cf5-b516-4705-aa84-bb8e97b5e968 Cut the fat into 25 mm (1”) pieces and cook in hot water, at 90° C (194° F) for 20 minutes. Immerse in cold water to cool.
bd941cf5-b516-4705-aa84-bb8e97b5e968 Grind the fat through 8 mm (3/8”) plate.
bd941cf5-b516-4705-aa84-bb8e97b5e968 Peel onions then cook them in water at 90° C (194° F) for 5 minutes. Chop the onions finely then fry them on low heat in some lard. Stir the onions often and fry for 60 minutes, do not let them become brown.
bd941cf5-b516-4705-aa84-bb8e97b5e968 Precook head meat or skins in water at 90° C (194° F) until softer.
bd941cf5-b516-4705-aa84-bb8e97b5e968 Chop nuts into smaller pieces.
bd941cf5-b516-4705-aa84-bb8e97b5e968 Using food processor blend blood, milk, cream, meat/skins, onions, nuts and all ingredients together.
bd941cf5-b516-4705-aa84-bb8e97b5e968 Using ladle pour the sausage mass loosely into 36 mm pork casings making one long spiral. Create shorter links by twisting or using butcher twine.
bd941cf5-b516-4705-aa84-bb8e97b5e968 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
bd941cf5-b516-4705-aa84-bb8e97b5e968 Immerse in cold water for 5 minutes. Drain and spread on the table to evaporate moisture.
bd941cf5-b516-4705-aa84-bb8e97b5e968 Refrigerate.
db67b32f-905a-406d-82a6-6033f10f31ad Finely chop onions and fry them in butter until glassy and without color. Add chopped shallots, parsley, scallions and all ingredients. Mix and let cool. Add blood and remix. Place in a large bowl with a spout.
db67b32f-905a-406d-82a6-6033f10f31ad Cut back fat into long strips about 1/2” (12 mm) square.
db67b32f-905a-406d-82a6-6033f10f31ad Slip 56 mm hog casings on the tip of the funnel and drop the fat strips down the funnel. Pour the blood paste down into the casing or use a laddle. Twist the sausage to make links or tie off the links with a string.
db67b32f-905a-406d-82a6-6033f10f31ad Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
db67b32f-905a-406d-82a6-6033f10f31ad Cool in cold water, dry and refrigerate.
db67b32f-905a-406d-82a6-6033f10f31ad To serve, fry in butter or barbecue.
bff9c67c-e6f0-48fe-89ba-37a7c4f3031a Dice the fat or grind it through 8 mm (3/8”) plate.
bff9c67c-e6f0-48fe-89ba-37a7c4f3031a Place some lard on a hot frying pan then fry the fat stirring often until light brown. Drain the fat through a strainer (save the liquid fat). Place the fat into boiling water for 1-2 minutes then drain it again.
bff9c67c-e6f0-48fe-89ba-37a7c4f3031a Peel onions then cook them in water at 90° C (194° F) for 5 minutes. Chop the onions finely then fry them on low heat in a liquid fat that was saved from filtering fat. Stir the onions often and fry for 60 minutes, do not let them become brown.
bff9c67c-e6f0-48fe-89ba-37a7c4f3031a Precook head meat or skins in water at 90° C (194° F) until softer.
bff9c67c-e6f0-48fe-89ba-37a7c4f3031a Using food processor blend blood, milk, meat/skins, onions and all ingredients together.
bff9c67c-e6f0-48fe-89ba-37a7c4f3031a Using ladle pour the sausage mass loosely into 36 mm pork casings making one long spiral. Create shorter links by twisting or using butcher twine.
bff9c67c-e6f0-48fe-89ba-37a7c4f3031a Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
bff9c67c-e6f0-48fe-89ba-37a7c4f3031a Immerse in cold water for 5 minutes. Drain and spread on the table to evaporate moisture.
bff9c67c-e6f0-48fe-89ba-37a7c4f3031a Refrigerate.
23fb6fc4-76f4-480d-96fe-ad27524d6334 Cook split pork head in a little water on slow heat until meat separates from bones.
23fb6fc4-76f4-480d-96fe-ad27524d6334 Remove meat, save meat stock. Separate meat from bones when still warm.
23fb6fc4-76f4-480d-96fe-ad27524d6334 Soak crushed rolls in meat stock until they fully absorb the liquid.
23fb6fc4-76f4-480d-96fe-ad27524d6334 Grind meat through 5 mm (1/4”) plate.
23fb6fc4-76f4-480d-96fe-ad27524d6334 Chop the onions and fry in lard or oil until glassy and golden.
23fb6fc4-76f4-480d-96fe-ad27524d6334 Squeeze the liquid out from the rolls, them mix them with blood, ground meat and all ingredients.
23fb6fc4-76f4-480d-96fe-ad27524d6334 Stuff into 36 mm pork casings.
23fb6fc4-76f4-480d-96fe-ad27524d6334 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes.
5e4436af-b9f1-4ca2-a48d-959bd2a755be Grind meats and fat through 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
5e4436af-b9f1-4ca2-a48d-959bd2a755be Mix ground meat with spices and blood.
5e4436af-b9f1-4ca2-a48d-959bd2a755be Stuff into 20 mm sheep casings forming 10-12 cm (4-5”) long links.
5e4436af-b9f1-4ca2-a48d-959bd2a755be Cook in water at 80° (176° F) for 30 minutes.
4df799c4-21de-4b92-9f0e-fe05cb3c5d57 Cook skins and split heads (if used) in water at 95° C (203° F) until meat separates from bones. Spread on the table, cool and when still warm, but comfortable to handle, separate meat from bones. Break or cut into smaller pieces.
4df799c4-21de-4b92-9f0e-fe05cb3c5d57 Dice back fat into 6 mm (1/4”) cubes.
4df799c4-21de-4b92-9f0e-fe05cb3c5d57 Mix all materials with salt, spices and blood.
4df799c4-21de-4b92-9f0e-fe05cb3c5d57 Stuff into 50-70 mm pork bungs forming 50 cm (20”) closed loops.
4df799c4-21de-4b92-9f0e-fe05cb3c5d57 Cook at 85° C (185° F) for 45-75 minutes depending on the diameter of the sausage.
4df799c4-21de-4b92-9f0e-fe05cb3c5d57 Store in refrigerator.
58713523-280e-46a2-9dc9-ca9551ad031c Chop onion finely and fry in a little oil until glassy but not browned.
58713523-280e-46a2-9dc9-ca9551ad031c Cut back fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
58713523-280e-46a2-9dc9-ca9551ad031c Cook the skins in a little water (below the boiling point) until soft. Drain and cool.
58713523-280e-46a2-9dc9-ca9551ad031c Grind the skins through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
58713523-280e-46a2-9dc9-ca9551ad031c Grind all meats through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
58713523-280e-46a2-9dc9-ca9551ad031c Mix all meats, fat, spices and blood together.
58713523-280e-46a2-9dc9-ca9551ad031c Stuff into 36 mm hog casings forming 12” (30 cm) long loops.
58713523-280e-46a2-9dc9-ca9551ad031c Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
58713523-280e-46a2-9dc9-ca9551ad031c Cool in cold water for 10 minutes. Cool in air to evaporate moisture and refrigerate.
e78c040c-6799-47a2-8d06-97e0d3b3a91a Dice back fat and fat trimmings into small pieces.
e78c040c-6799-47a2-8d06-97e0d3b3a91a Grind beef through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
e78c040c-6799-47a2-8d06-97e0d3b3a91a Mix beef, pork fat, blood and all ingredients.
e78c040c-6799-47a2-8d06-97e0d3b3a91a Stuff into small 32-36 mm beef or pork casings.
e78c040c-6799-47a2-8d06-97e0d3b3a91a Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes. Prick the sausage with a needle and if the blood is not visible, the sausage is cooked.
e78c040c-6799-47a2-8d06-97e0d3b3a91a Cool in cold water for 10 minutes.
e78c040c-6799-47a2-8d06-97e0d3b3a91a Cool in air to evaporate moisture and refrigerate.
2e6dc89b-65cf-4abd-95b4-60c0b910510a Boil lungs (if used) for 1-2 hours. Boil skins for 1-2 hours.
2e6dc89b-65cf-4abd-95b4-60c0b910510a Grind lungs, liver and skins through 3 mm (1/8”).
2e6dc89b-65cf-4abd-95b4-60c0b910510a Grind all other meats and fat through 5 mm (1/4”) plate.
2e6dc89b-65cf-4abd-95b4-60c0b910510a Mix all meats and fats with blood and spices.
2e6dc89b-65cf-4abd-95b4-60c0b910510a Stuff into 34-36 mm pork casings forming links 10-12 cm (4-5”) long.
2e6dc89b-65cf-4abd-95b4-60c0b910510a Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 45 minutes.
c7ff571e-f37e-483c-b04d-abdb78b40d64 Cut all meats and fat into 18 mm (3/4”) pieces.
c7ff571e-f37e-483c-b04d-abdb78b40d64 Mix with blood and all ingredients.
c7ff571e-f37e-483c-b04d-abdb78b40d64 Stuff into pork stomachs or bladders.
c7ff571e-f37e-483c-b04d-abdb78b40d64 Cook in water at 80-90° C (176-194° F) for 2-3 hours.
a014c1fc-0d66-4423-b081-4d123c224b66 Grind pork shoulder through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
a014c1fc-0d66-4423-b081-4d123c224b66 Grind belly and fat trimmings through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
a014c1fc-0d66-4423-b081-4d123c224b66 Mix ground meat and fat with salt and sugar.
a014c1fc-0d66-4423-b081-4d123c224b66 Mix all ingredients with wine and soy sauce.
a014c1fc-0d66-4423-b081-4d123c224b66 Pour ingredients over sausage mass and mix together.
a014c1fc-0d66-4423-b081-4d123c224b66 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings.
a014c1fc-0d66-4423-b081-4d123c224b66 Place in a boiling water and cook at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
a014c1fc-0d66-4423-b081-4d123c224b66 Eat cold or pan fry.
f852ddd3-3fef-4f20-b76b-0a4040979116 Precook rice, bur don’t overcook.
f852ddd3-3fef-4f20-b76b-0a4040979116 Mix blood with soy sauce, wine and spices.
f852ddd3-3fef-4f20-b76b-0a4040979116 Add flour, starch, rice and mix all together.
f852ddd3-3fef-4f20-b76b-0a4040979116 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings.
f852ddd3-3fef-4f20-b76b-0a4040979116 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
f852ddd3-3fef-4f20-b76b-0a4040979116 Cool in cold water for 10 minutes.
f852ddd3-3fef-4f20-b76b-0a4040979116 Cool in air.
f852ddd3-3fef-4f20-b76b-0a4040979116 Refrigerate.
34e6beda-7cce-4b72-9772-81606e4fc1f4 Cut meat and fat into 1” (25 mm) pieces.
34e6beda-7cce-4b72-9772-81606e4fc1f4 Finely dice the onions.
34e6beda-7cce-4b72-9772-81606e4fc1f4 Dissolve the chopped onions and all ingredients (except the blood and the flour) in red wine and season the meat. Place for up to 3 days in refrigerator stirring the mixture daily.
34e6beda-7cce-4b72-9772-81606e4fc1f4 Mix the mixture with the blood and flour.
34e6beda-7cce-4b72-9772-81606e4fc1f4 Stuff firmly into 36 mm hog casings and tie the ends together to make a loop about 1’ (30 cm) long.
34e6beda-7cce-4b72-9772-81606e4fc1f4 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 15 days using oak wood. Smoking need not to be continuous as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C.
0dbfa31a-d57e-4755-83fd-c7c71cd05f98 Cook rice, but do not overcook.
0dbfa31a-d57e-4755-83fd-c7c71cd05f98 Grind fat or lard through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
0dbfa31a-d57e-4755-83fd-c7c71cd05f98 Mix rice, blood, fat and spices together.
0dbfa31a-d57e-4755-83fd-c7c71cd05f98 Stuff into 22-26 mm sheep casings forming long loops.
0dbfa31a-d57e-4755-83fd-c7c71cd05f98 Cook delgadillas in hot tomato sauce for 15 minutes. Serve hot with bread and poached or fried eggs, noodles or potatoes.
dc63ad58-6267-4519-aa01-34dd966b7426 Grind pork through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
dc63ad58-6267-4519-aa01-34dd966b7426 Chop green onions, rice paddy and cilantro leaves.
dc63ad58-6267-4519-aa01-34dd966b7426 Mix everything together.
dc63ad58-6267-4519-aa01-34dd966b7426 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings, tie off into links 6” (15 cm) long.
dc63ad58-6267-4519-aa01-34dd966b7426 Cook in water at 80 C (176 F) for 35 minutes.
dc63ad58-6267-4519-aa01-34dd966b7426 Place in cold water for 10 minutes. Remove, dry briefly and refrigerate.
e0984a75-12aa-4b42-b7db-5dd9bdfb3260 Add salt to blood and stir it.
e0984a75-12aa-4b42-b7db-5dd9bdfb3260 Mix blood with cream, then add bread crumbs and other ingredients. Mix all together well.
e0984a75-12aa-4b42-b7db-5dd9bdfb3260 Stuff into largest hog casings (38 - 42 mm), pork stomachs or beef bungs.
e0984a75-12aa-4b42-b7db-5dd9bdfb3260 Place sausages into boiling water and poach at 80º - 85º C (176º - 185º F) for about 60 - 90 minutes to reach internal sausage temperature of 68º - 70º C (154º - 158º F). Stomach will require longer cooking time. When sausage casings are not available bake in oven like a meat loaf. Put into greased glass pan and bake at 300º - 350º F (149º - 177º C) for about 1 hour.
e0984a75-12aa-4b42-b7db-5dd9bdfb3260 Cool and keep in refrigerator.
e0984a75-12aa-4b42-b7db-5dd9bdfb3260 Drisheen is sliced and either fried or grilled, often with bacon, eggs and other sausages.
ac55b83f-11d3-46c9-a699-260c16e0013a Cook cabbage in water until leaves can be separated. This makes them soft and pliable.
ac55b83f-11d3-46c9-a699-260c16e0013a Grind back fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
ac55b83f-11d3-46c9-a699-260c16e0013a In a mixing bowl place fat, chopped onions, parsley, spices and flours. Mix all together and start adding slowly blood until a dough like texture is obtained.
ac55b83f-11d3-46c9-a699-260c16e0013a Shape the sausage mass into balls. Place the ball on a leaf, then wrapped the leaf around. Lace the stuffed sausage with twine all around.
ac55b83f-11d3-46c9-a699-260c16e0013a Immerse sausages in a boiling water and cook for 90-120 minutes depending on a size. Drain and cool in air.
ac55b83f-11d3-46c9-a699-260c16e0013a Refrigerate.
1e63c8fa-e871-4e68-bd24-4fd0c03d644d Cut back fat into 8-10 mm (3/8") pieces.
1e63c8fa-e871-4e68-bd24-4fd0c03d644d Mix fat, chopped onion, oregano and chopped parsley together. Add blood and flour and mix again.
1e63c8fa-e871-4e68-bd24-4fd0c03d644d Stuff into 50 mm pork or 60 mm beef middles.
1e63c8fa-e871-4e68-bd24-4fd0c03d644d Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 90-120 minutes.
1e63c8fa-e871-4e68-bd24-4fd0c03d644d To serve, cut into slices and fry until crispy.
70d6372f-ff3f-4102-9b9b-53b74f2b19d2 Cover meats with water, add one bay leaf and a few black peppercorns. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until cooked. Save stock.
70d6372f-ff3f-4102-9b9b-53b74f2b19d2 Mix 30 g (1 oz) of rusk with 30 ml (1 oz fl) of meat stock.
70d6372f-ff3f-4102-9b9b-53b74f2b19d2 Grind boiled meat with 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
70d6372f-ff3f-4102-9b9b-53b74f2b19d2 Mix meat with soaked rusk and spices. Mix blood with dry rusk and add to the meat mixture. Mix all together.
70d6372f-ff3f-4102-9b9b-53b74f2b19d2 Stuff into sheep casings.
70d6372f-ff3f-4102-9b9b-53b74f2b19d2 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
70d6372f-ff3f-4102-9b9b-53b74f2b19d2 Cool in cold water, drain and let the moisture evaporate. Refrigerate.
70d6372f-ff3f-4102-9b9b-53b74f2b19d2 The sausage can be eaten cold, grilled or pan fried.
79f645f8-2b90-41ae-accb-3bde5fc07102 Cook meats and skins in a small amount of water at 95° C (203° F) until soft.
79f645f8-2b90-41ae-accb-3bde5fc07102 Chop onions finely and fry in fat until glassy.
79f645f8-2b90-41ae-accb-3bde5fc07102 Cut fat into 5-10 mm (1/4-3/8”) cubes. Scald with hot water and drain.
79f645f8-2b90-41ae-accb-3bde5fc07102 Grind meat, skins and onions through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
79f645f8-2b90-41ae-accb-3bde5fc07102 Mix ground meats with spices and blood. Add fat cubes and mix again.
79f645f8-2b90-41ae-accb-3bde5fc07102 Stuff into 36 mm hog or synthetic casing. Make rings.
79f645f8-2b90-41ae-accb-3bde5fc07102 Cook in water at 78° C (174° F) for 40 minutes. Cool and refrigerate.
79f645f8-2b90-41ae-accb-3bde5fc07102 Finished sausages can be cold smoked at 18° C (64° F) for a few hours or more.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Immerse tongue in boiling water for 10 minutes to soften the skin. Remove the skin with a knife. Cut the tongue into 25 mm (1") pieces.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Cut lean pork into 25 mm pieces.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Mix diced lean pork and tongue with salt and Cure #1. Pack tightly in container, cover with cloth and hold for 72 hours in refrigerator.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Boil jowls at 80° C (176° F) for 15 minutes.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Boil skins at 80° C (176° F) until soft.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Grind skins and jowls through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Grind raw liver with raw onion through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Dice partially frozen back fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes. Place fat in colander and scald with hot water for a few minutes.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Mix all materials with blood and all ingredients.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Stuff into 90 mm synthetic casings forming 50 cm (20") sections.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Boil at 80° C (176° F) for 120 minutes.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Immerse in cold water for 10 minutes then place on a flat surface and finish cooling in air.
f1cfade7-d692-4e04-8649-7cbdb494226f Refrigerate.
36b03f92-5e78-4fb6-83cd-ae4cbfed1f85 Grind beef through 1’4” (6 mm) plate.
36b03f92-5e78-4fb6-83cd-ae4cbfed1f85 Mix spices with beef and the blood.
36b03f92-5e78-4fb6-83cd-ae4cbfed1f85 Stuff loosely into 28 mm sheep casings.
36b03f92-5e78-4fb6-83cd-ae4cbfed1f85 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
36b03f92-5e78-4fb6-83cd-ae4cbfed1f85 Place in cold water for 10 minutes.
36b03f92-5e78-4fb6-83cd-ae4cbfed1f85 Dry briefly and refrigerate.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Boil offal meat and pork head (if used) at 95º C (203º F) until meat can be separated from bones. Cool and separate meat from bones.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Boil skins at 95º C (203º F) until soft.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Boil fat trimmings at 95º C (203º F) until soft.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Boil back fat at 95º C (203º F) until soft. Cool and place in freezer for 30 minutes.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Grind meat with 8 mm (3/8") plate.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Grind skins and fat trimmings with 3 mm (1/8") plate.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Dice back at into 5 mm (1/4") cubes.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Mix blood with salt, Cure #1 and all spices. Add all meat and fat and mix all together.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Stuff into 42 mm pork casings making 40 cm (14") rings.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Boil at 80º C (176º F) for 45 minutes.
f84e8a08-42ea-449d-909e-4c0f59025a06 Immerse in cold water for 5 minutes. Cool in air and refrigerate.
05e815a4-9a60-42a4-803a-d02a1ecc264e Boil all meats (except liver) for about 2 hours. Poach liver in hot water until no traces of blood are visible (cut the liver to test).
05e815a4-9a60-42a4-803a-d02a1ecc264e Grind meat through 3/8 plate (8 mm). Grind liver through 3/16" (3 mm) plate.
05e815a4-9a60-42a4-803a-d02a1ecc264e Cook rice for about 15 minutes (don't overcook). Place some bacon fat or lard on a frying pan and fry onions until light brown.
05e815a4-9a60-42a4-803a-d02a1ecc264e Add blood and mix everything together.
05e815a4-9a60-42a4-803a-d02a1ecc264e Stuff loosely (rice may still expand) into 36 mm hog or synthetic casings.
05e815a4-9a60-42a4-803a-d02a1ecc264e Cook for 30 minutes in water at 85º C (185º F).
3ed0573a-0cbd-4a57-b1e0-0d362ecee5cb Slice the liver into thick discs an boil at 80° C (176° F) until cooked. Cool, then dice into 8 mm (3/8") cubes.
3ed0573a-0cbd-4a57-b1e0-0d362ecee5cb Boil pork meat and jowls at 80º C (176º F) until semi-soft.
3ed0573a-0cbd-4a57-b1e0-0d362ecee5cb Cut back fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes and scald for 5 minutes in hot water. Drain.
3ed0573a-0cbd-4a57-b1e0-0d362ecee5cb Boil skins at 90º C (194º F) until soft.
3ed0573a-0cbd-4a57-b1e0-0d362ecee5cb Grind pork meat, jowls, skins and onion through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
3ed0573a-0cbd-4a57-b1e0-0d362ecee5cb Mix blood with all ingredients then add ground meats, cubed fat and diced liver and mix all together.
3ed0573a-0cbd-4a57-b1e0-0d362ecee5cb Stuff into 55 mm pork or beef middles.
3ed0573a-0cbd-4a57-b1e0-0d362ecee5cb Boil in water at 80º C (176º F) for 60 minutes.
3ed0573a-0cbd-4a57-b1e0-0d362ecee5cb Immerse in col water for 10 minutes. Drain and finish cooling in air.
3ed0573a-0cbd-4a57-b1e0-0d362ecee5cb Refrigerate.
a3907fe0-5800-48ee-92c4-6698c19e2b33 Cook meats in small amount of water: jowls at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until semi-soft; pork skins at 95° C (203° F) until soft. Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool.
a3907fe0-5800-48ee-92c4-6698c19e2b33 Cut jowls into 5-8 mm (2-3”) cubes, grind cooked pork skins through 3 mm plate. Cut dry bread rolls, soak in blood for 20-30 min and grind through 8 mm plate.
a3907fe0-5800-48ee-92c4-6698c19e2b33 Add salt and spices to ground meats and ground rolls (if used), add blood and stock fat and mix everything well together.
a3907fe0-5800-48ee-92c4-6698c19e2b33 Stuffing materials: pork hog casings over 36 mm, beef middles up to 40 mm, fibrous casings, butcher’s twine. Stuff casings loosely and form rings. Tie the ends with twine.
a3907fe0-5800-48ee-92c4-6698c19e2b33 Immerse sausages in boiling water and poach at 80-82° C (176-180° F) for 30-35 min until internal meat temperature reaches 68-70° C (154-158° F).
a3907fe0-5800-48ee-92c4-6698c19e2b33 Immerse sausages for 5 min in cold running water, then hang them to cool down below 6°C (43°F). If no suitable cooling conditions are available, arrangements need to be made to bring the temperature to 12° C (53° F) or less.
84fb9b62-b012-4632-af6d-aaab63e39dd9 Cut fat into 5/8” (10 mm) pieces.
84fb9b62-b012-4632-af6d-aaab63e39dd9 Mix fat, blood and spices.
84fb9b62-b012-4632-af6d-aaab63e39dd9 Stuff into 20-40 mm hog casings making 40 cm long horseshoe-shaped rings, with a cotton string tied or twisted around the ends.
84fb9b62-b012-4632-af6d-aaab63e39dd9 Smoke for 10 days with oak wood at 18° C (64° F).
84fb9b62-b012-4632-af6d-aaab63e39dd9 Store at a temperature of between 5° C and 15° C. It can be eaten as it is, roasted, fried or boiled. It is used as an ingredient in many of the traditional local dishes, the most famous of which is cozido à portuguesa. It is also often eaten as a starter or as an aperitif.
362301a8-8aa8-48ae-867f-0803b284802e Boil rice, but do not overcook.
362301a8-8aa8-48ae-867f-0803b284802e Boil meat and fat trimmings in a little water until soft. Cool and chop into 1/4” (6 mm) pieces.
362301a8-8aa8-48ae-867f-0803b284802e Mix meat, rice, onions and all other ingredients with blood.
362301a8-8aa8-48ae-867f-0803b284802e Stuff into 36-40 mm hog casings. Tie off into rings.
362301a8-8aa8-48ae-867f-0803b284802e Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
362301a8-8aa8-48ae-867f-0803b284802e Cool and refrigerate.
f1e53cfc-d301-420b-a36a-d1c85b071914 Make marinade: wine, water, salt and spices.
f1e53cfc-d301-420b-a36a-d1c85b071914 Cut fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes. Mix fat with marinade and hold in refrigerator for 12 hours.
f1e53cfc-d301-420b-a36a-d1c85b071914 Mix fat, red pepper paste (see below) and blood together.
f1e53cfc-d301-420b-a36a-d1c85b071914 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings. Tie the ends together to form a 20” (50 cm) long ring.
f1e53cfc-d301-420b-a36a-d1c85b071914 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 45 minutes.
f1e53cfc-d301-420b-a36a-d1c85b071914 Immerse sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
f1e53cfc-d301-420b-a36a-d1c85b071914 Cool in air and refrigerate.
44d052b4-e109-401c-8aa2-d2e350a69823 Make marinade: wine, water, salt and spices.Cut all meats and fat into 5/8” (10 mm) pieces.
44d052b4-e109-401c-8aa2-d2e350a69823 Mix fat, blood and spices.
44d052b4-e109-401c-8aa2-d2e350a69823 Stuff into 20-40 mm hog casings making 40 cm long horseshoe-shaped rings, with a cotton string tied or twisted around the ends.
44d052b4-e109-401c-8aa2-d2e350a69823 Smoke for 14 days with oak wood at 18° C (64° F).
44d052b4-e109-401c-8aa2-d2e350a69823 Store at 5-12° C (48-53° F).
309abc5d-001e-4711-87ff-76f3e7f73ca8 Peel off onions and chop them finely. Mix them with rice and leave overnight in a suitable container. The rice will absorb onion juice and will increase in volume.
309abc5d-001e-4711-87ff-76f3e7f73ca8 Dice fat into 1/2” cubes.
309abc5d-001e-4711-87ff-76f3e7f73ca8 Stuff loosely into 32-36 mm hog casings as the rice will still increase in volume during cooking. Make 12” rings.
309abc5d-001e-4711-87ff-76f3e7f73ca8 Cook in a hot water at 80° C (176° F) for about 60 minutes. Prick with a needle any sausage that comes to the top to remove air. Don’t increase temperature as the casings may burst.
309abc5d-001e-4711-87ff-76f3e7f73ca8 The color should be dark brown-red with white pieces of fat.
81404b18-36d4-456f-ba02-b5aafd8273da Cook heart, lungs, stomach, skins in hot water (below boiling point) until soft. Grind through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
81404b18-36d4-456f-ba02-b5aafd8273da Grind meat and fat trimmings through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
81404b18-36d4-456f-ba02-b5aafd8273da Dice hard fat (back fat) into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
81404b18-36d4-456f-ba02-b5aafd8273da Mix meat, fat and all ingredients together.
81404b18-36d4-456f-ba02-b5aafd8273da Stuff into 30-32 mm pork or sheep casings.
81404b18-36d4-456f-ba02-b5aafd8273da Dry in a low humidity, cool and well ventilated room, 12-15° C (53-59° F).
845706d6-483a-4309-9a6c-7a17f6cd8842 Grind fat through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
845706d6-483a-4309-9a6c-7a17f6cd8842 Boil the onions until soft, drain and cut up into little cubes. Cool. Mix onions with blood.
845706d6-483a-4309-9a6c-7a17f6cd8842 Place a frying pan on a low heat, add ground fat and melt it down, stirring often.
845706d6-483a-4309-9a6c-7a17f6cd8842 In a bowl mix onions, liquid fat and spices together.
845706d6-483a-4309-9a6c-7a17f6cd8842 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings making rings.
845706d6-483a-4309-9a6c-7a17f6cd8842 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
845706d6-483a-4309-9a6c-7a17f6cd8842 Cool and refrigerate.
845706d6-483a-4309-9a6c-7a17f6cd8842 To serve, fry in butter or barbecue.
1fdb7bdb-e416-4936-abf2-a97cef67f982 Cook offal meat in water (below boiling point) until soft. Cool and grind through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
1fdb7bdb-e416-4936-abf2-a97cef67f982 Grind beef through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
1fdb7bdb-e416-4936-abf2-a97cef67f982 Finely cut onions or grind them through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
1fdb7bdb-e416-4936-abf2-a97cef67f982 Dice fat into 3/8” (10 mm) cubes.
1fdb7bdb-e416-4936-abf2-a97cef67f982 In a skillet warm up some lard on low heat. Add the minced onions, half salt, minced garlic and one bay leaf. Cook uncovered on on very low heat until onions are glassy but not browned. Remove from the heat and place in a mixing bowl. Let them cool.
1fdb7bdb-e416-4936-abf2-a97cef67f982 Except fat, mix blood, meat and all other ingredients. Add diced fat and mix again.
1fdb7bdb-e416-4936-abf2-a97cef67f982 Laddle the mixture loosely through a funnel into 36 mm hog casings. Tie into 12” (30 cm) rings.
1fdb7bdb-e416-4936-abf2-a97cef67f982 Place the sausages into a large pot with hot water. Cook at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
1fdb7bdb-e416-4936-abf2-a97cef67f982 Cool the sausages in air.
1fdb7bdb-e416-4936-abf2-a97cef67f982 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 3 weeks. Cold smoking is not a continuous process so do not worry if there is no smoke overnight as long as the temperature stays below 18° C. Cold smoking is drying with smoke.
aacee4d4-1c38-4598-82c4-c6e5ff9bed24 Dice fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
aacee4d4-1c38-4598-82c4-c6e5ff9bed24 Chop the onions. Mix fat, blood, onions and spices together.
aacee4d4-1c38-4598-82c4-c6e5ff9bed24 Stuff into beef middles or 45 mm pork casing making 10-15 cm (4-6 inch) long links.
aacee4d4-1c38-4598-82c4-c6e5ff9bed24 Start smoking with oak wood at 28-30° C (82-86° F), high humidity. As the smoking progresses start lowering temperature and humidity. This process continues for 6-7 days.
8e39352e-4230-45d4-a0fc-aaf9e1efa497 Cook the rice, but don’t overcook.
8e39352e-4230-45d4-a0fc-aaf9e1efa497 Grind fat through 5 mm (1/4”) plate.
8e39352e-4230-45d4-a0fc-aaf9e1efa497 Chop the onions finely and fry in a little lard until glassy. Remove from heat and stir in salt and spices.
8e39352e-4230-45d4-a0fc-aaf9e1efa497 Add blood and rice and mix all together.
8e39352e-4230-45d4-a0fc-aaf9e1efa497 Stuff into 36 mm pork casings.
8e39352e-4230-45d4-a0fc-aaf9e1efa497 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes.
8e39352e-4230-45d4-a0fc-aaf9e1efa497 Cool and refrigerate.
012123e6-9925-4b05-92eb-c29b4675baed Cook rice until semi-done, don't overcook.
012123e6-9925-4b05-92eb-c29b4675baed Chop the onions and fry in a little fat on small fire until glassy and gold, then add rice and mix together. Take off the heat and let cool.
012123e6-9925-4b05-92eb-c29b4675baed Add spices and blood and mix all well together.
012123e6-9925-4b05-92eb-c29b4675baed Stuff loosely (the rice may expend) into 45-50 mm pork middles.
012123e6-9925-4b05-92eb-c29b4675baed Cook in water at 80º C (176º F) for 50-60 minutes.
012123e6-9925-4b05-92eb-c29b4675baed Immerse in cold water for 10 minutes, then spread on the table or hang to let the moisture evaporate.
012123e6-9925-4b05-92eb-c29b4675baed Refrigerate.
c282afb6-a7b5-4d7b-bf9d-d151047961ee Cook rice. Chop onions finely.
c282afb6-a7b5-4d7b-bf9d-d151047961ee Mix rice with blood, spices and lard or ground fat.
c282afb6-a7b5-4d7b-bf9d-d151047961ee Stuff into 35-40 mm beef casings, linking every 10 cm (4”).
c282afb6-a7b5-4d7b-bf9d-d151047961ee Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
c282afb6-a7b5-4d7b-bf9d-d151047961ee Refrigerate.
122ffd4f-8420-416e-818e-d0512eac6516 Cook rice, but do not overcook. Chop the onions finely.
122ffd4f-8420-416e-818e-d0512eac6516 Mix onions with rice, spices and blood. Place lard in pot and apply low heat, stirring often. When the lard starts to melt mix it with other ingredients.
122ffd4f-8420-416e-818e-d0512eac6516 Stuff into 35-45 mm natural casings linking every 20 cm (8”).
122ffd4f-8420-416e-818e-d0512eac6516 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes.
122ffd4f-8420-416e-818e-d0512eac6516 Air cool to 8-10° C (47-50° F) and refrigerate.
162e5352-5c8f-4179-bdef-a7f0bbcdc39d Cut fat trimmings into small cubes.
162e5352-5c8f-4179-bdef-a7f0bbcdc39d Make pumpkin puree, place in a drain bag and drain for 6 hours or overnight.
162e5352-5c8f-4179-bdef-a7f0bbcdc39d Mix fat, blood, pumpkin and spices.
162e5352-5c8f-4179-bdef-a7f0bbcdc39d Stuff into 36-40 mm pork or beef casings.
162e5352-5c8f-4179-bdef-a7f0bbcdc39d Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 15 minutes.
162e5352-5c8f-4179-bdef-a7f0bbcdc39d Dry in air to evaporate moisture. Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F) for 2 weeks.
162e5352-5c8f-4179-bdef-a7f0bbcdc39d Store at <12° C (53° F) or refrigerate.
c19d8845-2aee-415a-8a61-2bd18f89cfaf Dice onions and cook in water for 45 minutes. Drain. Spread on the table and let the steam and the moisture to evaporate.
c19d8845-2aee-415a-8a61-2bd18f89cfaf Cut pumpkin into smaller sections, remove seeds and fiber. Cook pumpkin for 25 minutes in water, 15 minutes in steam or bake for 30 minutes at 176° C (350° F). Remove the skin (it peels off easily) and cut the pieces into smaller parts. Place the pumpkin flesh in food processor and emulsify it into the puree. Don’t add any water as pumpkin has plenty of it. Place pumpkin puree in a draining bag, place some weight on top and let it drain overnight.
c19d8845-2aee-415a-8a61-2bd18f89cfaf Cook the rice.
c19d8845-2aee-415a-8a61-2bd18f89cfaf Boil potatoes and drain them.
c19d8845-2aee-415a-8a61-2bd18f89cfaf Grind fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
c19d8845-2aee-415a-8a61-2bd18f89cfaf Grind the pumpkin, onions and potatoes through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
c19d8845-2aee-415a-8a61-2bd18f89cfaf Except blood, mix everything together: fat, spices, pumpkin, potatoes and rice. Add finally the blood and mix all together.
c19d8845-2aee-415a-8a61-2bd18f89cfaf Stuff into 36 mm pork casings forming U-shaped loops about 50 cm (20") long. Tie the ends together with twine.
c19d8845-2aee-415a-8a61-2bd18f89cfaf Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 75-85% humidity for 30 days.
c19d8845-2aee-415a-8a61-2bd18f89cfaf Store at <12° C (53° F), <70% humidity or refrigerate.
95e3f9d7-6732-41f2-802b-6b9f81a0648f Dice the onion and cook in water for 30-45 minutes adding a little salt. Drain and cool.
95e3f9d7-6732-41f2-802b-6b9f81a0648f Dice fat (lard) into cubes.
95e3f9d7-6732-41f2-802b-6b9f81a0648f Mix fat, onions, blood and spices.
95e3f9d7-6732-41f2-802b-6b9f81a0648f Stuff into 36-40 mm pork or beef casings.
95e3f9d7-6732-41f2-802b-6b9f81a0648f Immerse sausages into boiling water and cook at 80° C (176° F) for 45 minutes.
95e3f9d7-6732-41f2-802b-6b9f81a0648f Immerse in cold water for 10 minutes, then cool in air and refrigerate.
488810ba-b8a9-4a82-b500-85fbb124953b Cut fat into 18 mm (3/4”) pieces.
488810ba-b8a9-4a82-b500-85fbb124953b Dice onions into 18 mm (3/4”) cubes. Place in a boiling water and cook for 80 minutes. Add rice, lower the heat and cook for 20 minutes more. Drain.
488810ba-b8a9-4a82-b500-85fbb124953b Mix fat, onions, spices and blood together.
488810ba-b8a9-4a82-b500-85fbb124953b Stuff into 30-40 mm beef or pork casings. Form links 15-18 cm (6-7”) long.
488810ba-b8a9-4a82-b500-85fbb124953b Cook in water at 85° C (185° F) for 30 minutes.
488810ba-b8a9-4a82-b500-85fbb124953b Drain and cool in air.
fb3c513b-cd4d-462f-9961-78f236a00970 Peel onions, cut in half. Cook in water for 60 minutes, then drain and cool.
fb3c513b-cd4d-462f-9961-78f236a00970 Grind back fat and onions through 3 mm (1/8”) plate.*
fb3c513b-cd4d-462f-9961-78f236a00970 Mix onions, blood, salt, spices and fat together.
fb3c513b-cd4d-462f-9961-78f236a00970 Stuff into 25 mm natural casings making 12 cm (5”) long links.
fb3c513b-cd4d-462f-9961-78f236a00970 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
fb3c513b-cd4d-462f-9961-78f236a00970 Hang at room temperature (15° C/59° F) for 2-3 days. This is the optional drying/conditioning step which improves the flavor of the sausage and strengthens the casings so the sausage does not fall apart when fried.
fb3c513b-cd4d-462f-9961-78f236a00970 Keep refrigerated.
66266034-ce73-4d8b-bedd-b0aadbf0d7f4 Grind meat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
66266034-ce73-4d8b-bedd-b0aadbf0d7f4 Dice the back fat into 3/8” (10 mm) cubes. Except fat, combine blood with all other ingredients and mix for 3 minutes. Add diced fat and mix for one more minute.
66266034-ce73-4d8b-bedd-b0aadbf0d7f4 Laddle the mixture loosely through a funnel into 36 mm hog casings. Tie into 12” (30 cm) rings.
66266034-ce73-4d8b-bedd-b0aadbf0d7f4 Place the sausages into a large pot with hot water. Cook at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
66266034-ce73-4d8b-bedd-b0aadbf0d7f4 Cool the sausages in cold water for 10 minutes.
66266034-ce73-4d8b-bedd-b0aadbf0d7f4 Remove from the water and place on the table so the moisture can evaporate.
66266034-ce73-4d8b-bedd-b0aadbf0d7f4 Refrigerate.
b7ec97eb-e451-4b7b-8ead-f3c157ce601b Cook liver, heart, lungs in water until soft. Drain and cool. Grind through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
b7ec97eb-e451-4b7b-8ead-f3c157ce601b Chop the onion finely, place in a drain bag, place weight on top and let it drain for 6 hours.
b7ec97eb-e451-4b7b-8ead-f3c157ce601b Cut dewlap and any fat into small cubes.
b7ec97eb-e451-4b7b-8ead-f3c157ce601b Mix all meats, fat, onions, spices and blood together.
b7ec97eb-e451-4b7b-8ead-f3c157ce601b Stuff into 5-65 mm beef middles.
b7ec97eb-e451-4b7b-8ead-f3c157ce601b Smoke first day with hot smoke, then smoke/dry with cold smoke until sausages develop black color.
33eb129a-ab79-466a-8aec-37483a9f1164 Cook offal meat in water (below the boiling point) until soft. Drain and cool.
33eb129a-ab79-466a-8aec-37483a9f1164 Grind meats and fat through 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
33eb129a-ab79-466a-8aec-37483a9f1164 Mix meat and fat with salt and all spices. Hold for 12-24 hours in refrigerator.
33eb129a-ab79-466a-8aec-37483a9f1164 Stuff into 24-26 mm sheep casings or 34-36 mm pork casings. Make rings about 25 cm (10”) long.
33eb129a-ab79-466a-8aec-37483a9f1164 Dry 24-26 mm sausages for 15-20 days at 12-18° C (53-72° F), 80-85% humidity. Dry 34-36 mm sausages for 30-60 days at 12-18° C (53-72° F), 80-85% humidity.
e4f07516-38c6-4019-a557-e5f0d717f2af Dice tongue into 15-20 mm (1/2-3/4") cubes. Mix with 1/3 salt and 1/3 cure#1 and place for 24 hours in refrigerator. The tongues will develop a nice red color.
e4f07516-38c6-4019-a557-e5f0d717f2af Cut/grind skins, cover with a little water and slow cook (below boiling point) until a gelatin paste is obtained.
e4f07516-38c6-4019-a557-e5f0d717f2af Dice partially frozen back fat into 6-8 mm (1/4-3/8") cubes. Place cubes n a strainer and scald them briefly with hot water, 90° C (194° F) what will remove any melted fat.
e4f07516-38c6-4019-a557-e5f0d717f2af Keep blood warm in a double pot (arrangement baño de Maria) or in a bowl immersed in warm water.
e4f07516-38c6-4019-a557-e5f0d717f2af In a warm bowl start mixing: tongue cubes, fat cubes, gelatin (skins), spices, and blood. The mixture must be warm otherwise the gelatin will prematurely harden.
e4f07516-38c6-4019-a557-e5f0d717f2af Stuff warm mixture into 80-120 mm beef cap end or pork blind caps (caecum).
e4f07516-38c6-4019-a557-e5f0d717f2af Cook in water first at 90° C (194° F) for 15 minutes, then at 80° C (176° F) for 60-90 minutes.
e4f07516-38c6-4019-a557-e5f0d717f2af Immerse the sausages in cold water for 30 minutes. Insert the sausage between two wooden boards, and place a heavy weight on top one. Hold for 24 hours at low temperature or in refrigerator. Then, cold smoke (optional step) for 6 hours.
e4f07516-38c6-4019-a557-e5f0d717f2af Store at 10° C (53° F) or refrigerate.
6388ec9c-84db-4ba0-a129-0b49b591a564 Slice dry bread very thinly. Melt the fat in skillet. Add onions, spices and bread and mix together. Remove from heat.
6388ec9c-84db-4ba0-a129-0b49b591a564 Add blood and mix all together. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
6388ec9c-84db-4ba0-a129-0b49b591a564 Stuff into 36-40 mm pork casings.
6388ec9c-84db-4ba0-a129-0b49b591a564 Cook in water at 80º C (176º F) for 40 min.
6388ec9c-84db-4ba0-a129-0b49b591a564 Hang in a cool place to dry.
6388ec9c-84db-4ba0-a129-0b49b591a564 Refrigerate.
a268c69c-3e39-4576-b9e5-751fc0f94bce Peel the onions. Cook in water for 60 minutes, then drain and cool.
a268c69c-3e39-4576-b9e5-751fc0f94bce Grind lard and onions through 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
a268c69c-3e39-4576-b9e5-751fc0f94bce Mix onions, lard, blood, salt, spices and nuts together.
a268c69c-3e39-4576-b9e5-751fc0f94bce Stuff into 40-45 mm pork middles making 4-6 cm (2”) balls. Keep 4 balls in one string.
a268c69c-3e39-4576-b9e5-751fc0f94bce Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 20 minutes.
a268c69c-3e39-4576-b9e5-751fc0f94bce Cool and store in refrigerator.
7f0772bb-6326-4d9a-8971-69f48a8466f8 Cook rice, but do not overcook.
7f0772bb-6326-4d9a-8971-69f48a8466f8 Chop onions into smaller sections and cook in water for 45 minutes. Drain, spread on the table and cool.
7f0772bb-6326-4d9a-8971-69f48a8466f8 Grind onions and sheep fat through 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
7f0772bb-6326-4d9a-8971-69f48a8466f8 Mix all materials with spices and blood.
7f0772bb-6326-4d9a-8971-69f48a8466f8 Stuff into 32-36 mm sheep casings forming inks or rings.
7f0772bb-6326-4d9a-8971-69f48a8466f8 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
7f0772bb-6326-4d9a-8971-69f48a8466f8 Dry in air. The sausage is ready to eat.
7f0772bb-6326-4d9a-8971-69f48a8466f8 Store in refrigerator.
a4d9f39f-c0d1-467b-a052-65604e1822e5 Keep blood warm in a double pot (arrangement baño de Maria) or in a bowl immersed in warm water.
a4d9f39f-c0d1-467b-a052-65604e1822e5 Cut/grind skins, cover with a little water and slow cook (below boiling point) until a gelatin paste is obtained.
a4d9f39f-c0d1-467b-a052-65604e1822e5 Dice partially frozen back fat into 5 mm (1/4") cubes. Place cubes n a strainer and scald with hot water, 90° C (194° F). Drain in a strainer.
a4d9f39f-c0d1-467b-a052-65604e1822e5 In a warm bowl start mixing: fat cubes, gelatin (skins), spices, and blood. The mixture must be warm otherwise the gelatin will prematurely harden.
a4d9f39f-c0d1-467b-a052-65604e1822e5 Stuff warm mixture into 45-65 mm beef middles.
a4d9f39f-c0d1-467b-a052-65604e1822e5 Cook in water first at 90° C (194° F) for 15 minutes, then at 80° C (176° F) for 30-45 minutes.
a4d9f39f-c0d1-467b-a052-65604e1822e5 Immerse the sausages in cold water for 10 minutes, then hang in a cool room to cool and evaporate the moisture. Next day, cold smoke the sausages.
a4d9f39f-c0d1-467b-a052-65604e1822e5 Store at 10° C (53° F) or refrigerate.
55d5e577-ff89-43aa-9473-ec1db187fa17 Cook the rice, but do not overcook.
55d5e577-ff89-43aa-9473-ec1db187fa17 Dice fat into 10-12 mm (3/8-1/2”) cubes.
55d5e577-ff89-43aa-9473-ec1db187fa17 Chop the onions.
55d5e577-ff89-43aa-9473-ec1db187fa17 Mix rice, onions, fat, blood and spices.
55d5e577-ff89-43aa-9473-ec1db187fa17 Stuff into 40-70 mm pork or beef casings. Make links 20 cm (8”) long or form rings.
55d5e577-ff89-43aa-9473-ec1db187fa17 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40-60 minutes.
55d5e577-ff89-43aa-9473-ec1db187fa17 Immerse for 10 minutes in cold water. Air dry and refrigerate.
79792a2a-1adb-4a68-972e-86c85c77ba4a Soak dry rolls in water until soft. Drain and press dry.
79792a2a-1adb-4a68-972e-86c85c77ba4a Roast pine nuts with butter on a frying pan until light brown.
79792a2a-1adb-4a68-972e-86c85c77ba4a Melt lard on a low heat stirring often. Place lard in a mixing bowl, add all ingredients and mix together. Add blood and mix again. Finally, add soaked bread and the flour and mix until all is well combined.
79792a2a-1adb-4a68-972e-86c85c77ba4a Stuff through a funnel into 36 mm hog casings making 12” (30 cm) loops.
79792a2a-1adb-4a68-972e-86c85c77ba4a Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
79792a2a-1adb-4a68-972e-86c85c77ba4a Cool the sausages cold water for 10 minutes.
79792a2a-1adb-4a68-972e-86c85c77ba4a Drain and place on a table to evaporate the moisture.
79792a2a-1adb-4a68-972e-86c85c77ba4a Refrigerate.
79792a2a-1adb-4a68-972e-86c85c77ba4a To serve: pan fry in oil.
06bd9864-7f25-447a-9217-6fc104c92481 Dice lean pork into 6 mm (1/4”) cubes or grind through 6 mm plate.
06bd9864-7f25-447a-9217-6fc104c92481 Dice cold lard into 6 mm cubes.
06bd9864-7f25-447a-9217-6fc104c92481 Dice uncooked sweet potato into 6 mm (1/4”) cubes.
06bd9864-7f25-447a-9217-6fc104c92481 Slice almonds into 3 mm (1/8”) wafers or crush into large pieces.
06bd9864-7f25-447a-9217-6fc104c92481 Mix ground meats with all ingredients slowly adding blood. Hold the mixture at room temperature, approximately at 16° C (59° F), 75% humidity, for 6 hours.
06bd9864-7f25-447a-9217-6fc104c92481 Stuff into 40 mm pork casings, forming continuous 10 cm (4”) links.
06bd9864-7f25-447a-9217-6fc104c92481 Cook at 65° C (149° F) for 25 minutes.
06bd9864-7f25-447a-9217-6fc104c92481 Immerse in cold water for 10 minutes.
06bd9864-7f25-447a-9217-6fc104c92481 Hang in air for 2-3 hours.
06bd9864-7f25-447a-9217-6fc104c92481 Store in refrigerator.
eea3e5ee-b8c7-45dc-b578-adac8f5fdd73 Cook the rice.
eea3e5ee-b8c7-45dc-b578-adac8f5fdd73 Fry pine nuts in butter or lard until light brown.
eea3e5ee-b8c7-45dc-b578-adac8f5fdd73 Break or slice dry bread thinly.
eea3e5ee-b8c7-45dc-b578-adac8f5fdd73 Mix lard with all spices, then add rice, bread, raisins, nuts and blood and mix all together.
eea3e5ee-b8c7-45dc-b578-adac8f5fdd73 Stuff into 36 mm pork casings forming 40 cm (16") long loops. Tie the ends together.
eea3e5ee-b8c7-45dc-b578-adac8f5fdd73 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
eea3e5ee-b8c7-45dc-b578-adac8f5fdd73 Immerse for 10 minutes in cold water. Air dry and refrigerate.
ad41245b-01fc-4ebb-820b-70b9bba342e7 Cook the rice, but don't overcook.
ad41245b-01fc-4ebb-820b-70b9bba342e7 Grind fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
ad41245b-01fc-4ebb-820b-70b9bba342e7 Break white of bread in smaller pieces and mix with blood, rice, sugar, spices and fat.
ad41245b-01fc-4ebb-820b-70b9bba342e7 Stuff into 32-36 mm pork casings.
ad41245b-01fc-4ebb-820b-70b9bba342e7 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
ad41245b-01fc-4ebb-820b-70b9bba342e7 Refrigerate.
5acca058-71b5-4a1c-8c41-2b5ac8d22c90 Grind pork belly through 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
5acca058-71b5-4a1c-8c41-2b5ac8d22c90 Mix ground meat with blood and spices.
5acca058-71b5-4a1c-8c41-2b5ac8d22c90 Stuff into 28-32 mm pork casings forming 30 cm (12”) rings. Tie the ends together.
5acca058-71b5-4a1c-8c41-2b5ac8d22c90 Dry at around 15° C (59° F) for 3 weeks.
8e9d351b-9fc8-4ac4-82ea-e103e22e0b9f Chop onions finely and fry in lard on small heat until glassy and golden.
8e9d351b-9fc8-4ac4-82ea-e103e22e0b9f Dice fat into small cubes, place in a strainer and scald with hot water.
8e9d351b-9fc8-4ac4-82ea-e103e22e0b9f Cut/grind skins, cover with a little water and slow cook (below boiling point) until a gelatin paste is obtained.
8e9d351b-9fc8-4ac4-82ea-e103e22e0b9f Place a mixing bowl in warm water (arrangement type baño Maria) and start mixing: onions, fat cubes, gelatin, spices, milk and blood. The mixture must be warm otherwise the gelatin will prematurely harden.
8e9d351b-9fc8-4ac4-82ea-e103e22e0b9f Stuff warm mixture into 36-40 mm pork or beef casings.
8e9d351b-9fc8-4ac4-82ea-e103e22e0b9f Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 45 minutes, moving sausages around during first 15 minutes.
8e9d351b-9fc8-4ac4-82ea-e103e22e0b9f Spread sausages on the table, cool and let the moisture evaporate.
8e9d351b-9fc8-4ac4-82ea-e103e22e0b9f Refrigerate.
3f05fb72-9a66-43f2-b207-7fe1f71c2054 If back fat is used freeze it partially then grind through 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
3f05fb72-9a66-43f2-b207-7fe1f71c2054 Grind onions through 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
3f05fb72-9a66-43f2-b207-7fe1f71c2054 Break nuts and figs into smaller pieces.
3f05fb72-9a66-43f2-b207-7fe1f71c2054 Break bread into small chunks and mix with all ingredients and lard (except blood).
3f05fb72-9a66-43f2-b207-7fe1f71c2054 Stir blood to prevent coagulation.
3f05fb72-9a66-43f2-b207-7fe1f71c2054 Mix blood with sausage paste.
3f05fb72-9a66-43f2-b207-7fe1f71c2054 Stuff into 30-50 mm natural casings.
3f05fb72-9a66-43f2-b207-7fe1f71c2054 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
3f05fb72-9a66-43f2-b207-7fe1f71c2054 Dry at 12-16° C (53-59 F), 75-85% humidity for 2 weeks.
3f05fb72-9a66-43f2-b207-7fe1f71c2054 Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <70% humidity or refrigerate.
cf09fa62-0910-470c-8b1a-b465bfa58179 Soak dry wheat bread or rolls in water or bouillon.* Drain and squeeze out the excess of water.
cf09fa62-0910-470c-8b1a-b465bfa58179 Dice 1/3 of hard fat into 6 mm (1/4”) cubes. Grind remaining 2/3 of fat through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
cf09fa62-0910-470c-8b1a-b465bfa58179 Chop onions and fry in round fat until glassy. Add drained bread and all spices during this step.
cf09fa62-0910-470c-8b1a-b465bfa58179 Mix all together with blood and cubed fat.
cf09fa62-0910-470c-8b1a-b465bfa58179 Stuff into pork caps (caecum), stomachs or bladders.
cf09fa62-0910-470c-8b1a-b465bfa58179 Cook at 80° C (176° F) for 2-3 hours.
cf09fa62-0910-470c-8b1a-b465bfa58179 Dry at 12-15°C (53-59° F) for 2-3 months. The sausage can be eaten at any of this time - serve raw, fried or boiled.
75add5a2-9c9e-4378-9982-6e95d594c26c Trim hearts of veins and connective tissue.
75add5a2-9c9e-4378-9982-6e95d594c26c Cook meats in water (below the boiling point) until soft.
75add5a2-9c9e-4378-9982-6e95d594c26c Grind meats through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
75add5a2-9c9e-4378-9982-6e95d594c26c Grind pork belly through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
75add5a2-9c9e-4378-9982-6e95d594c26c Mix meats, all ingredients and blood together.
75add5a2-9c9e-4378-9982-6e95d594c26c Stuff into 36 mm pork casings. Form loops 45 cm (16") long, tie the end with twine.
75add5a2-9c9e-4378-9982-6e95d594c26c Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes.
75add5a2-9c9e-4378-9982-6e95d594c26c Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <70% humidity or refrigerate.
c467d09c-410b-4e2c-9b36-bbb5c0ca693f Mix blood with salt and spices.
c467d09c-410b-4e2c-9b36-bbb5c0ca693f Stuff into 36 mm pork casings. Slip the end of the casings over the narrow part of the funnel and pour the sausage mass into the casing forming one long sausage. Take twine and tie off the sausage into 20 cm (8") links leaving them together.
c467d09c-410b-4e2c-9b36-bbb5c0ca693f Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 45 minutes.
c467d09c-410b-4e2c-9b36-bbb5c0ca693f Cool and refrigerate.
b4f090c2-cd20-47ed-8c20-cbc5bd0dd3c1 Cook the rice, but don't overcook. Cook onions and leeks (if used).
b4f090c2-cd20-47ed-8c20-cbc5bd0dd3c1 Grind onions and lard through 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
b4f090c2-cd20-47ed-8c20-cbc5bd0dd3c1 Mix all materials with spices and blood.
b4f090c2-cd20-47ed-8c20-cbc5bd0dd3c1 Stuff into 32-36 mm hog casings forming 10 cm (4") links.
b4f090c2-cd20-47ed-8c20-cbc5bd0dd3c1 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
b4f090c2-cd20-47ed-8c20-cbc5bd0dd3c1 Cool and dry in the air.
b4f090c2-cd20-47ed-8c20-cbc5bd0dd3c1 Store in refrigerator.
59525d1d-c1aa-4ebb-9613-843a8433e645 Cook skins in hot water (below the boiling point) until soft. Drain and cool.
59525d1d-c1aa-4ebb-9613-843a8433e645 Finely dice the onion. Scald in hot water for 5 minutes. Drain.
59525d1d-c1aa-4ebb-9613-843a8433e645 Grind pork shoulder through 3/8 (10 mm) plate.
59525d1d-c1aa-4ebb-9613-843a8433e645 Grind back fat, skins and onions through 1/4” (5 mm) plate.
59525d1d-c1aa-4ebb-9613-843a8433e645 Mix ground meat, fat, skins with blood and all other ingredients.
59525d1d-c1aa-4ebb-9613-843a8433e645 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings making rings.
59525d1d-c1aa-4ebb-9613-843a8433e645 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
59525d1d-c1aa-4ebb-9613-843a8433e645 Cool and refrigerate.
9403144e-0e86-4ebc-bf4b-4c0ca9b79940 Boil the rice. Add melted butter to the rice. Let it cool. Add bread, cut up butter, blood and mix together. Add sugar and spices and mix again.
9403144e-0e86-4ebc-bf4b-4c0ca9b79940 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings making rings.
9403144e-0e86-4ebc-bf4b-4c0ca9b79940 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
9403144e-0e86-4ebc-bf4b-4c0ca9b79940 Cool and refrigerate.
9403144e-0e86-4ebc-bf4b-4c0ca9b79940 To serve, fry in butter or barbecue.
