f02faf2a-280f-4967-ac4a-6f3d7ab599af Chop onions and boil them for 45 minutes. Drain and spread on the table to cool.
f02faf2a-280f-4967-ac4a-6f3d7ab599af Cook rice until semi-cooked.
f02faf2a-280f-4967-ac4a-6f3d7ab599af Grind fat with 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
f02faf2a-280f-4967-ac4a-6f3d7ab599af Mix fat, onions, rice, blood and spices.
f02faf2a-280f-4967-ac4a-6f3d7ab599af Stuff into 45-60 mm beef or pork casings. Form rings.
f02faf2a-280f-4967-ac4a-6f3d7ab599af Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 45-60 minutes.
12155646-5ce8-4647-bb33-8724d7bc980f Cut fat into small pieces.
12155646-5ce8-4647-bb33-8724d7bc980f Mix with all spices. Add slowly blood mixing everything together.
12155646-5ce8-4647-bb33-8724d7bc980f Stuff into 38-42 mm beef middles or pork casings. Form rings 35-40 cm (14-16”) long.
12155646-5ce8-4647-bb33-8724d7bc980f Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 45 minutes.
12155646-5ce8-4647-bb33-8724d7bc980f Dry at 15° C (59° F) for 2 days.
12155646-5ce8-4647-bb33-8724d7bc980f Refrigerate.
94568851-7520-4a1d-9cb3-ba9677257294 Grind meat and fat through 10 mm (3/8") plate.
94568851-7520-4a1d-9cb3-ba9677257294 Mix ground meat and fat with all ingredients and hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
94568851-7520-4a1d-9cb3-ba9677257294 Mix the mass with blood.
94568851-7520-4a1d-9cb3-ba9677257294 Stuff into 40-50 mm natural casings, forming loops.
94568851-7520-4a1d-9cb3-ba9677257294 Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F) for 30-35 days, 75-85 % humidity.
94568851-7520-4a1d-9cb3-ba9677257294 Store at <12° C (53° F), <70% humidity or refrigerate.
ab598a42-9899-4454-9cc5-558b7f0300e5 Chop onions and cook in water for 30 minutes. Drain.
ab598a42-9899-4454-9cc5-558b7f0300e5 Cut the pumpkin into halves, discard the seeds and boil for 20 minutes. Separate the pumpkin flesh from the skin.
ab598a42-9899-4454-9cc5-558b7f0300e5 Grind fat through 8-10 mm (3/8”) plate.
ab598a42-9899-4454-9cc5-558b7f0300e5 Mix all materials, spices and blood together. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
ab598a42-9899-4454-9cc5-558b7f0300e5 Stuff the mixture into 28-30 mm pork casings. Form 30 cm (12”) links or rings.
ab598a42-9899-4454-9cc5-558b7f0300e5 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 40 minutes.
ab598a42-9899-4454-9cc5-558b7f0300e5 Cool in air.
d5fd2a7a-8dac-4752-a1db-3e4f99903aee Traditionally pork head meat was added with pork belly. Split pork heads (without eyes and brains) were slowly boiled (often with meat scraps, bones, skins and offal meat) until meat would separate from bones. Then, when still warm, the meat was removed from head and chopped or ground together with pork belly.
d5fd2a7a-8dac-4752-a1db-3e4f99903aee Chop onions finely.
d5fd2a7a-8dac-4752-a1db-3e4f99903aee Mix meats, onions, nuts, salt, spices, filler material and blood together.
d5fd2a7a-8dac-4752-a1db-3e4f99903aee Stuff into large 45-50 mm diameter pork casings.
d5fd2a7a-8dac-4752-a1db-3e4f99903aee Cook at 80° C (176° F) for 45 minutes.
d5fd2a7a-8dac-4752-a1db-3e4f99903aee Store in refrigerator.
c63387ba-9dc0-4bf4-9cb7-c4cdd0a12bd7 Break or slice dry bread into smaller pieces.
c63387ba-9dc0-4bf4-9cb7-c4cdd0a12bd7 Chop onions finely and fry in oil, lard or butter until golden, but not brown.
c63387ba-9dc0-4bf4-9cb7-c4cdd0a12bd7 Mix salt, sugar and spices with blood. Add bread, onions and nuts and mix together. Add flour and mix all together. If the mixture is too thick add a little water.
c63387ba-9dc0-4bf4-9cb7-c4cdd0a12bd7 Mix nuts, spices, sugar, flour, onions, bread and blood together.
c63387ba-9dc0-4bf4-9cb7-c4cdd0a12bd7 Stuff into 36 mm pork casings making rings about 30 cm (12") long. Tie the ends together.
c63387ba-9dc0-4bf4-9cb7-c4cdd0a12bd7 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 45 minutes.
c63387ba-9dc0-4bf4-9cb7-c4cdd0a12bd7 Cool in cold water for 15 minutes. Remove from water and let the moisture evaporate.
f58ff211-e4f4-4be4-be47-b2f97f6da85b Cook skins in water (below the boiling point) until soft. Drain and cool.
f58ff211-e4f4-4be4-be47-b2f97f6da85b Grind skins through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
f58ff211-e4f4-4be4-be47-b2f97f6da85b Cut fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
f58ff211-e4f4-4be4-be47-b2f97f6da85b Mix the fat, the skins, the blood and all ingredients together.
f58ff211-e4f4-4be4-be47-b2f97f6da85b Stuff loosely into 36 mm hog casings.
f58ff211-e4f4-4be4-be47-b2f97f6da85b Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
f58ff211-e4f4-4be4-be47-b2f97f6da85b Place in cold water for 10 minutes.
f58ff211-e4f4-4be4-be47-b2f97f6da85b Dry briefly and refrigerate.
101fce91-40b2-4929-bb71-447e5b29817f Grind pork fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
101fce91-40b2-4929-bb71-447e5b29817f Chop onions finely. Cook the onions in a frying pan in oil until glassy and golden. Cool.
101fce91-40b2-4929-bb71-447e5b29817f Mix ground fat, blood, onions, and spices.
101fce91-40b2-4929-bb71-447e5b29817f Stuff into 32-34 mm pork casings.
101fce91-40b2-4929-bb71-447e5b29817f Cook at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
101fce91-40b2-4929-bb71-447e5b29817f Refrigerate.
dda95648-4029-4e27-88a7-123d6eedd084 Soak rye grains for 24 hours in water. Drain.
dda95648-4029-4e27-88a7-123d6eedd084 Grind lean pork through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
dda95648-4029-4e27-88a7-123d6eedd084 Cut fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
dda95648-4029-4e27-88a7-123d6eedd084 Mix everything together.
dda95648-4029-4e27-88a7-123d6eedd084 Stuff loosely into 36 mm casings.
dda95648-4029-4e27-88a7-123d6eedd084 Preheat the oven to 200° C (392° F) and bake the sausages for 25 minutes. Turn the sausages over and bake them for 25 minutes more. Baking the sausages twice makes them crispy.
dda95648-4029-4e27-88a7-123d6eedd084 Cool the sausages at room temperature (1-2 hours).
dda95648-4029-4e27-88a7-123d6eedd084 Refrigerate.
350b6b60-a7ba-40b8-8760-2be964cb9873 Add salt to blood and stir it.
350b6b60-a7ba-40b8-8760-2be964cb9873 Mix blood with all ingredients.
350b6b60-a7ba-40b8-8760-2be964cb9873 Stuff into sheep stomachs or largest hog casings (38 - 42 mm)
350b6b60-a7ba-40b8-8760-2be964cb9873 Place sausages into boiling water and poach at 80º - 85º C (176º - 185º F) for about 60 - 90 minutes to reach internal sausage temperature of 68º - 70º C (154º - 158º F). Stomach will require longer cooking time.
350b6b60-a7ba-40b8-8760-2be964cb9873 Cool and keep in refrigerator.
d98a8110-c7a3-4e8d-9840-aedbe29cded3 Cook all meats below the boiling point of water until soft. Save meat stock.
d98a8110-c7a3-4e8d-9840-aedbe29cded3 Chopped finely the onions and fry in fat until glassy and golden.
d98a8110-c7a3-4e8d-9840-aedbe29cded3 Dice fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes. Heat the diced fat is in the broth in which the meat was cooked until it is slightly translucent and ‘springs away’ when taken in the hand. This ensures that the diced pig fat is not stained red by the blood, so that the white cubes of fat stand out against the dark sausage mixture and give the Oecher Puttes its characteristic cross-section appearance.
d98a8110-c7a3-4e8d-9840-aedbe29cded3 Chop meats and skin or grind through 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
d98a8110-c7a3-4e8d-9840-aedbe29cded3 Warm up the blood to about 45° C (113° F). This reduces the metallic taste of the blood and increases the ability of the sausage mixture to bind when the diced fat is added.
d98a8110-c7a3-4e8d-9840-aedbe29cded3 Mix meats with onions, spices, blood, fat cubes and 30 ml (2 Tbsp) of meat stock.
d98a8110-c7a3-4e8d-9840-aedbe29cded3 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings.
d98a8110-c7a3-4e8d-9840-aedbe29cded3 Boil in water at 78° C (174° F) for 40 minutes.
d98a8110-c7a3-4e8d-9840-aedbe29cded3 Cool and refrigerate.
d98a8110-c7a3-4e8d-9840-aedbe29cded3 Cook before serving.
e681b759-a308-4916-8ad6-112b4052dbf3 Cook skins and meat in water until meat separates from bones. Separate meat from bones.
e681b759-a308-4916-8ad6-112b4052dbf3 Grind meats through 10-12 mm (3/8-1/2") plate.
e681b759-a308-4916-8ad6-112b4052dbf3 Grind skins through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
e681b759-a308-4916-8ad6-112b4052dbf3 Dice back fat into 6-10 mm (1/4-3/8") cubes.
e681b759-a308-4916-8ad6-112b4052dbf3 Mix meat, fat, skins with spices and blood.
e681b759-a308-4916-8ad6-112b4052dbf3 Stuff into natural 36-42 mm (or larger) pork or beef casings forming straight (vela) or U-shaped (sarta) sections 25-35 cm (12-14") long. Both ends of a loop tied with twine.
e681b759-a308-4916-8ad6-112b4052dbf3 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 60 minutes.
e681b759-a308-4916-8ad6-112b4052dbf3 Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F) for 3-4 days (depending on the diameter of the sausage).
da5a8e54-12f8-4ddc-9821-63ba5482ef95 Cook meats (except liver) in a small amount of water: dewlap/jowls at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until semi-soft; lungs at 85° C (185° F); skins, heads at 95° C (203° F) until soft.
da5a8e54-12f8-4ddc-9821-63ba5482ef95 After cooking remove gristle from lungs and meat from heads. Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool.
da5a8e54-12f8-4ddc-9821-63ba5482ef95 Cut dewlap/jowls into 4-5” (10-12 mm) cubes. Grind all other meats through 1/8” (3 mm plate. Soak rolls or bread crumbs in left over stock, using 75% of stock in relation to bread crumbs.
da5a8e54-12f8-4ddc-9821-63ba5482ef95 If semolina is used, emulsify it in a food processor with 75% of meat stock (in relation to semolina).
da5a8e54-12f8-4ddc-9821-63ba5482ef95 Add salt and spices to ground meats and bread crumbs (or semolina flour), add blood and mix everything well together.
da5a8e54-12f8-4ddc-9821-63ba5482ef95 Stuff loosely into pork middles or beef rounds. Pork middles or beef rounds, 16” (40 cm) each. The ends tied with twine. Hanging loop 4-5” (10-12 cm) on one end.
da5a8e54-12f8-4ddc-9821-63ba5482ef95 Immerse sausages in boiling water and cook at 80-85° C (176-185° F) for about 45 min until sausages reach 68-70° C (154-158° F) internal temperature.
da5a8e54-12f8-4ddc-9821-63ba5482ef95 Place the sausages in cold water for 15 minutes and then spread them on a flat surface to cool.
da5a8e54-12f8-4ddc-9821-63ba5482ef95 Refrigerate.
2cd63f00-523c-4633-b91a-30ae69dbb0f1 Wash meats in cold water, soak any salted meats for 2-3 hrs in cold running water.
2cd63f00-523c-4633-b91a-30ae69dbb0f1 Poach meats (except liver, spleen and skwarki *) in small amount of water: lungs at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until soft; skins, beef trimmings, lips, udders, tripe and heads at 95° C (203° F); veal casings at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until semi-soft. After poaching remove gristle from lungs and meat from heads. Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool.
2cd63f00-523c-4633-b91a-30ae69dbb0f1 Boil barley grouts (1 kg) in 2 liters of left over meat stock or water until semi-soft. Boil buckwheat grouts (1 kg) in 3.6-4.0 liters of left over meat stock or water. Slow boil grouts for ½ hr continuously stirring. After boiling leave for ½-1 hr covered.
2cd63f00-523c-4633-b91a-30ae69dbb0f1 Grind beef trimmings,pork skins, beef and veal lips, lungs, udders, veal casings, pork stomachs-all boiled through 3 mm plate. Grind boiled head meat through 3 mm plate. Grind beef and lamb liver, raw spleen and skwarki * through 3 mm plate.
2cd63f00-523c-4633-b91a-30ae69dbb0f1 Add salt and spices to ground meats, mix barley or buckwheat grouts with blood, add stock fat and finely diced onions and then mix everything well together.
2cd63f00-523c-4633-b91a-30ae69dbb0f1 Stuffing materials: 50 mm cellulose or fibrous synthetic casings, butcher’s twine. Form a hanging loop.
2cd63f00-523c-4633-b91a-30ae69dbb0f1 Stuff casings loosely, make straight links 40-45 cm (16-18”) long. Tie the ends with twine. Make hanging loop 10-12 cm (4-5”) at one end.
2cd63f00-523c-4633-b91a-30ae69dbb0f1 Immerse sausages in boiling water and poach at 75-78° C (167-172° F) for about 80-100 min until internal meat temperature reaches 68-70° C (154-158° F).
2cd63f00-523c-4633-b91a-30ae69dbb0f1 Immerse sausages for 5 min in cold running water, then spread them on a flat surface to cool down below 6° C (43° F). If no suitable cooling conditions are available, arrangements need to be made to bring the temperature to 12°C (53°F) or less.
99dd17e8-0a36-45cf-b0ae-84e2762bc764 Boil meat and skins at 90° C (194° F) until softer.
99dd17e8-0a36-45cf-b0ae-84e2762bc764 Grind meat through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
99dd17e8-0a36-45cf-b0ae-84e2762bc764 Dice back fat into 8 mm (3/8") cubes.
99dd17e8-0a36-45cf-b0ae-84e2762bc764 Grind skins and chopped raw onion through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
99dd17e8-0a36-45cf-b0ae-84e2762bc764 Mix meat, fat, skins and blood with all ingredients together.
99dd17e8-0a36-45cf-b0ae-84e2762bc764 Stuff into 90-100 synthetic waterproof casings.
99dd17e8-0a36-45cf-b0ae-84e2762bc764 Boil in water at 80° C (176° F) for 120 minutes.
99dd17e8-0a36-45cf-b0ae-84e2762bc764 Immerse in cold water for 10 minutes. Drain and cool in air.
99dd17e8-0a36-45cf-b0ae-84e2762bc764 Refrigerate.
3273b734-e805-4956-b1f6-45b424f1b07d The fatty cuts of meat are cut into small pieces.
3273b734-e805-4956-b1f6-45b424f1b07d The meat is seasoned with salt, cure #1, red or white wine and garlic. Hold for 2-3 days in refrigerator. Cut the wheat bread is cut small pieces. Soak bread in blood adding chopped onion, chopped parsley, olive oil and spices.
3273b734-e805-4956-b1f6-45b424f1b07d Mix the marinated meat with the bread and the blood.
3273b734-e805-4956-b1f6-45b424f1b07d Stuff into 36 mm hog casings making one continuous coil. Twist the casing to the desired size links. You may use twine to make a knot on each end of the link and then cut the links. Tie the ends together to make a ring.
3273b734-e805-4956-b1f6-45b424f1b07d Apply a thin smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 3-4 days. Smoking need not to be continuous, as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. Think of the process as drying with smoke. Oak wood is used for smoking.
ca9f6bc7-9706-4ae3-94fa-9b69f5ad935e Boil the rice.
ca9f6bc7-9706-4ae3-94fa-9b69f5ad935e Grind suet with 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
ca9f6bc7-9706-4ae3-94fa-9b69f5ad935e Mix everything together.
ca9f6bc7-9706-4ae3-94fa-9b69f5ad935e Stuff loosely into 36 mm hog casings and tie off into 12” (25 cm) long rings.
ca9f6bc7-9706-4ae3-94fa-9b69f5ad935e Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for about 40 minutes. Cool in cold water, dry in air and refrigerate.
ca9f6bc7-9706-4ae3-94fa-9b69f5ad935e Cook before serving.
4e6d1b67-830a-4b79-9208-abd78222ebf9 Wash meats in cold water, soak any salted meats for 2-3 hrs in cold running water.
4e6d1b67-830a-4b79-9208-abd78222ebf9 Poach meats (except liver and skwarki *) in small amount of water: skins at 95° C (203° F); jowls at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until semi-soft; other meats at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until soft. Save the meat stock. After poaching remove gristle from lungs and meat from heads. Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool.
4e6d1b67-830a-4b79-9208-abd78222ebf9 Boil buckwheat grouts (1.5 kg) in 2.7-3.0 liters of left over meat stock or water. Boil grouts for ½ hr continuously stirring. After boiling leave for ½-1 hr covered.
4e6d1b67-830a-4b79-9208-abd78222ebf9 Soak skwarki * in stock using 25% of stock in relation to the weight of skwarki.
4e6d1b67-830a-4b79-9208-abd78222ebf9 Grind all meats, liver, skwarki * and onion through 3 mm plate.
4e6d1b67-830a-4b79-9208-abd78222ebf9 Add salt and spices to ground meats, mix buckwheat grouts with blood, add stock fat and then mix everything well together.
4e6d1b67-830a-4b79-9208-abd78222ebf9 Stuffing materials: hog casings 32-36 mm, butcher’s twine. Stuff casings loosely into 18-20 cm (17-18”) long links. Tie the ends with twine.
4e6d1b67-830a-4b79-9208-abd78222ebf9 Immerse sausages in boiling water and poach at 85° C (185° F) for about 15-20 min.
4e6d1b67-830a-4b79-9208-abd78222ebf9 Immerse sausages for 15 min in cold water (about 5° C, 41° F) then divide them into pairs. Cool them down to below 6° C (43° F). If no suitable cooling conditions are available, arrangements need to be made to bring the temperature to 12° C (53° F) or less.
b25ae0ef-f2c5-42a8-b49d-fab4b390179f Wash pork and veal lungs, groin and skins in cold running water.
b25ae0ef-f2c5-42a8-b49d-fab4b390179f Cook meats in small amount of water: lungs and groin at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until semi-soft; skins at 95° C (203° F) until soft. Save stock. After cooking remove gristle from lungs. Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool.
b25ae0ef-f2c5-42a8-b49d-fab4b390179f Soak dry bread rolls (if used) with an equal amount of meat stock for about ½ hr. Soak skwarki * in stock using 25% of stock in relation to the weight of skwarki.
b25ae0ef-f2c5-42a8-b49d-fab4b390179f Grind soaked rolls through 2 mm plate. Grind all meats through 2 mm plate.
b25ae0ef-f2c5-42a8-b49d-fab4b390179f Mix all ground ingredients with blood, adding salt and spices.
b25ae0ef-f2c5-42a8-b49d-fab4b390179f Stuffing materials: Pork middles, beef rounds, fibrous casings, butcher’s twine. Stuff casings loosely, make 40 cm (16”) links. Tie the ends with twine.
b25ae0ef-f2c5-42a8-b49d-fab4b390179f Immerse sausages in boiling water and poach at 80-85 ° C (176-185° F) for about 50-80 min until internal meat temperature reaches 68-70° C (154-158° F).
b25ae0ef-f2c5-42a8-b49d-fab4b390179f Immerse sausages for 5 min in cold running water, then spread them on a flat surface to cool down below 6° C (43° F). If no suitable cooling conditions are available, arrangements need to be made to bring the temperature to 12° C (53 °F) or less.
2d66550c-1d34-4e86-af0a-a4996d97dbc6 Cook rice.
2d66550c-1d34-4e86-af0a-a4996d97dbc6 Soak noodles in warm water until soft. Drain and chop with knife.
2d66550c-1d34-4e86-af0a-a4996d97dbc6 Finely chop the scallion.
2d66550c-1d34-4e86-af0a-a4996d97dbc6 Mix rice, noodles and all ingredients with blood.
2d66550c-1d34-4e86-af0a-a4996d97dbc6 Stuff loosely into 36 mm hog casings. Tie the ends together to make a ring.
2d66550c-1d34-4e86-af0a-a4996d97dbc6 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
2d66550c-1d34-4e86-af0a-a4996d97dbc6 Keep refrigerated.
f27f2907-7e26-45a4-ae87-2ac41bdd7bd2 Cure lean pork and jowls.*
f27f2907-7e26-45a4-ae87-2ac41bdd7bd2 Boil cured meats at 80° C (176° F) until they are semi-soft. Shower with running water, then dice them into 12 mm (1/2") cubes. Cook skins (below boiling point) until semi soft (a thumb should penetrate the skin). Cook liver (below boiling point) for 15 minutes.
f27f2907-7e26-45a4-ae87-2ac41bdd7bd2 Grind cooked skins, onions and liver through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
f27f2907-7e26-45a4-ae87-2ac41bdd7bd2 Rinse cubed meat with hot water and place into a mixing bowl.
f27f2907-7e26-45a4-ae87-2ac41bdd7bd2 Start mixing and add into the bowl: salt and all ingredients, ground skins, liver, onions, and blood.
f27f2907-7e26-45a4-ae87-2ac41bdd7bd2 Stuff loosely into large natural casings, pork blind caps (caecum), bladders, or synthetic casings.
f27f2907-7e26-45a4-ae87-2ac41bdd7bd2 Cook in hot water at 85° C (185° F): pork caps for 80 minutes; bladders for 105 minutes; synthetic casings - allow 10 minutes boiling time for each 10 mm of casing's diameter (10 mm = 1 cm) i.e. 40 mm sausage will be cooked for 40 minutes.
f27f2907-7e26-45a4-ae87-2ac41bdd7bd2 Immerse in cold water for 10 minutes, Finish cooling in air.
f27f2907-7e26-45a4-ae87-2ac41bdd7bd2 Refrigerate.
fe9fb0e8-ce56-4f76-9825-97a6f1ec6a0c Soak cereal in the fresh pork blood the night befor preparation and keep in a cooler.
fe9fb0e8-ce56-4f76-9825-97a6f1ec6a0c Grind meat with onions through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
fe9fb0e8-ce56-4f76-9825-97a6f1ec6a0c Mix meat with blood and spices.
fe9fb0e8-ce56-4f76-9825-97a6f1ec6a0c Stuff into 40 mm hog casings.
fe9fb0e8-ce56-4f76-9825-97a6f1ec6a0c Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
fe9fb0e8-ce56-4f76-9825-97a6f1ec6a0c Cool and refrigerate.
67775eba-beda-428a-9c7a-876acdbcc036 Cook all meats in water (below the boiling point) until soft. Spread on the table and cool.
67775eba-beda-428a-9c7a-876acdbcc036 Grind the skins through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
67775eba-beda-428a-9c7a-876acdbcc036 Grind other meats and fat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
67775eba-beda-428a-9c7a-876acdbcc036 Boil the cabbage, drain and cool. Grind with onions through 1/8” (6 mm) plate.
67775eba-beda-428a-9c7a-876acdbcc036 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings forming rings 12” (30 cm) long.
67775eba-beda-428a-9c7a-876acdbcc036 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
67775eba-beda-428a-9c7a-876acdbcc036 Place in cold water for 10 minutes.
67775eba-beda-428a-9c7a-876acdbcc036 Dry briefly and refrigerate.
566d3ba9-3a8e-4867-b965-94f2a6795527 Cook meats in a small amount of water: skins at 95° C (203° F) until soft; jowls at 85° C (185° F) until semi-soft; other meats at 80-85° C (176-185° F) until soft.
566d3ba9-3a8e-4867-b965-94f2a6795527 Save meat stock. Remove gristle from lungs and meat from heads when still warm. Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool.
566d3ba9-3a8e-4867-b965-94f2a6795527 Boil barley groats (200 g) in 400-440 ml of left over meat stock or water until semi-soft. Boil groats for 30 minutes stirring often. After boiling leave for 30-60 minutes covered.
566d3ba9-3a8e-4867-b965-94f2a6795527 Grind head meat, hearts, snouts and ¼ (50 g) jowls through 3/8” (10 mm) plate. Grind lungs and remaining ¾ (150 g) jowls through 1/4” (5 mm plate). Grind boiled skins through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
566d3ba9-3a8e-4867-b965-94f2a6795527 Mix salt, spices and chopped onions with ground meats. Mix barley with blood and then mix everything together.
566d3ba9-3a8e-4867-b965-94f2a6795527 Stuff loosely into pork middles or beef rounds forming straight links or rings 6-12” (15-30 cm) each.
566d3ba9-3a8e-4867-b965-94f2a6795527 Immerse sausages in boiling water and cook at 80° C (176° F) for about 60-90 min until the sausages reach 68-70° C (154-158° F) internal temperature.
566d3ba9-3a8e-4867-b965-94f2a6795527 Immerse sausages for 15 min in cold water, then hang in air to cool.
566d3ba9-3a8e-4867-b965-94f2a6795527 Keep refrigerated
c6a75d1a-a3c6-4629-aeb0-359c8f8d3816 Boil skins and pork fat trimmings at 80° C (176° F) until soft. Grind when still warm together with raw chopped onion through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
c6a75d1a-a3c6-4629-aeb0-359c8f8d3816 Dice the cured tongues* into 25-30 mm (1") cubes.
c6a75d1a-a3c6-4629-aeb0-359c8f8d3816 Mix tongues, ground skins, blood and all ingredients together.
c6a75d1a-a3c6-4629-aeb0-359c8f8d3816 Stuff into 120 mm synthetic waterproof casings making 50 cm (20") sections.
c6a75d1a-a3c6-4629-aeb0-359c8f8d3816 Boil at 80° C (176° F) for 180 minutes.
c6a75d1a-a3c6-4629-aeb0-359c8f8d3816 Immerse in tap water for 15 minutes. Place on a flat surface to cool. Roll over once in a while.
c6a75d1a-a3c6-4629-aeb0-359c8f8d3816 Refrigerate.
accb0c65-7e00-45c1-a08b-27b0db67e995 Soak beans in water for 4 hours. Drain, then slow cook until tender. Use enough water to cover the beans.
accb0c65-7e00-45c1-a08b-27b0db67e995 Add beans and 1/2 cup water into food processor and chop until a paste is obtained.
accb0c65-7e00-45c1-a08b-27b0db67e995 Add all ingredients except wheat gluten and emulsify.
accb0c65-7e00-45c1-a08b-27b0db67e995 Add vital wheat gluten and blend everything together. Add more water if necessary.
accb0c65-7e00-45c1-a08b-27b0db67e995 Stuff into desired casings (24-26 mm).
accb0c65-7e00-45c1-a08b-27b0db67e995 Cook sausages in water at 176 F (80 C), about 20 minutes.
accb0c65-7e00-45c1-a08b-27b0db67e995 Cool in cold water.
accb0c65-7e00-45c1-a08b-27b0db67e995 Store in refrigerator.
c2260c24-1971-4c2d-b4a5-de486db7d00e Soak TVP in water for at least 30 minutes.
c2260c24-1971-4c2d-b4a5-de486db7d00e Mix chickpea flour, TVP, starch, salt, carrageenan and spices.
c2260c24-1971-4c2d-b4a5-de486db7d00e Add oil emulsion and remix everything together. Add vital wheat gluten and remix.
c2260c24-1971-4c2d-b4a5-de486db7d00e Stuff into 32 mm casings.
c2260c24-1971-4c2d-b4a5-de486db7d00e Cook in water at 176 F (80 C) for 20 minutes.
c2260c24-1971-4c2d-b4a5-de486db7d00e Cool in cold water.
c2260c24-1971-4c2d-b4a5-de486db7d00e Keep refrigerated.
aafe549b-b6be-42b6-94bb-ce8d10461b65 Mix boiled potatoes, rehydrated TVP, carrageenan, spices and oil emulsion. Add wheat gluten and remix. Add as much water as necessary for the right texture.
aafe549b-b6be-42b6-94bb-ce8d10461b65 Stuff into desired casings (32-36 mm).
aafe549b-b6be-42b6-94bb-ce8d10461b65 Cook sausages in water at 176 F (80 C), about 30 minutes.
aafe549b-b6be-42b6-94bb-ce8d10461b65 Cool in cold water.
aafe549b-b6be-42b6-94bb-ce8d10461b65 Store in refrigerator.
709454d4-8b48-413c-9024-da31182c2422 Combine rice, apple sauce, soy protein isolate, carrageenan and spices.
709454d4-8b48-413c-9024-da31182c2422 Add wheat gluten and remix. Add as much water as needed and remix.
709454d4-8b48-413c-9024-da31182c2422 Stuff into 32 mm casings.
709454d4-8b48-413c-9024-da31182c2422 Cook sausages in water at 176 F (80 C), about 15-20 minutes.
709454d4-8b48-413c-9024-da31182c2422 Cool in cold water. Store in refrigerator.
43e1fa02-c895-4945-b367-4dc55bfa6754 Soak bread crumbs in water.
43e1fa02-c895-4945-b367-4dc55bfa6754 Mix tofu, bread crumbs, carrageenan, salt and spices. Add oil emulsion and remix. Add vital wheat gluten and mix everything together.
43e1fa02-c895-4945-b367-4dc55bfa6754 Stuff into 32 mm casings.
43e1fa02-c895-4945-b367-4dc55bfa6754 Cook in water at 176 F (80 C) for 20 minutes.
43e1fa02-c895-4945-b367-4dc55bfa6754 Cool in cold water.
43e1fa02-c895-4945-b367-4dc55bfa6754 Keep refrigerated.
a2c6e5ff-ac87-40d2-83a5-f47fe83e0cb1 Soak TVP in water for at least 30 minutes.
a2c6e5ff-ac87-40d2-83a5-f47fe83e0cb1 Mix cracker meal, TVP, starch, salt, carrageenan, salt, spices and tomatoes.
a2c6e5ff-ac87-40d2-83a5-f47fe83e0cb1 Add oil emulsion and remix everything together.
a2c6e5ff-ac87-40d2-83a5-f47fe83e0cb1 Stuff into 32 mm casings.
a2c6e5ff-ac87-40d2-83a5-f47fe83e0cb1 Cook in water at 176 F (80 C) for 20 minutes.
a2c6e5ff-ac87-40d2-83a5-f47fe83e0cb1 Cool in cold water.
a2c6e5ff-ac87-40d2-83a5-f47fe83e0cb1 Keep refrigerated.
54431ca0-5673-49ef-9c21-ccf9ef8c4420 Soak TVP in water for at least 30 minutes. Soak bread crumbs in water.
54431ca0-5673-49ef-9c21-ccf9ef8c4420 Mix bread crumbs, TVP, starch, salt, carrageenan and spices.
54431ca0-5673-49ef-9c21-ccf9ef8c4420 Add oil emulsion and remix everything together.
54431ca0-5673-49ef-9c21-ccf9ef8c4420 Stuff into 32 mm casings.
54431ca0-5673-49ef-9c21-ccf9ef8c4420 Cook in water at 176 F (80 C) for 20 minutes.
54431ca0-5673-49ef-9c21-ccf9ef8c4420 Cool in cold water.
54431ca0-5673-49ef-9c21-ccf9ef8c4420 Keep refrigerated.
df14ec54-e78f-43eb-a17c-33686e3de5ff Soak oats in water overnight. Drain, but don't dry.
df14ec54-e78f-43eb-a17c-33686e3de5ff Mix moist oats with other ingredients, except oil emulsion.
df14ec54-e78f-43eb-a17c-33686e3de5ff Add oil emulsion and mix everything together.
df14ec54-e78f-43eb-a17c-33686e3de5ff Stuff into 32 mm casings.
df14ec54-e78f-43eb-a17c-33686e3de5ff Cook in water at 176 F (80 C) for 20 minutes.
df14ec54-e78f-43eb-a17c-33686e3de5ff Cool in cold water.
df14ec54-e78f-43eb-a17c-33686e3de5ff Keep refrigerated.
6e704a27-995a-4955-a16f-3b32e0fe2a07 Cook barley in water for about 20 minutes. Use 1 part barley to 2.1 parts of water.
6e704a27-995a-4955-a16f-3b32e0fe2a07 * make standard emulsion using beet juice instead of water.
6e704a27-995a-4955-a16f-3b32e0fe2a07 Rehydrate TVP in beet juice instead of water.
6e704a27-995a-4955-a16f-3b32e0fe2a07 Vital wheat gluten flour may be replaced with potato flour.
6e704a27-995a-4955-a16f-3b32e0fe2a07 Mix barley, soy-beet emulsion, soaked TVP with spices together. Lastly, add starch, guar and carrageenan and mix all together.
6e704a27-995a-4955-a16f-3b32e0fe2a07 Stuff hard into 38 mm casing.
6e704a27-995a-4955-a16f-3b32e0fe2a07 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
6e704a27-995a-4955-a16f-3b32e0fe2a07 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes. Remove and let them cool.
956f48a2-8616-43a9-9e1d-79916a9dac2b Mix ground gluten with flaxseed emulsion and spices. Add starch, guar and carrageenan and mix all together.
956f48a2-8616-43a9-9e1d-79916a9dac2b Stuff hard into 38 mm casing.
956f48a2-8616-43a9-9e1d-79916a9dac2b Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
956f48a2-8616-43a9-9e1d-79916a9dac2b Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
956f48a2-8616-43a9-9e1d-79916a9dac2b Remove and let them cool.
6342f5b6-62b9-479a-971b-27e7ec3c350c Soak beans in water for 4 hours. Drain, then slow cook until tender. Use enough water to cover the beans. You can use canned beans, just wash and drain them. Take a masher and mash them.
6342f5b6-62b9-479a-971b-27e7ec3c350c Add beans, chopped or ground wheat gluten, soy emulsion, spices and 100 ml water into food processor and chop until a paste is obtained. Add starch, guar gum and carrageenan and emulsify.
6342f5b6-62b9-479a-971b-27e7ec3c350c Add potato flour and emulsify.
6342f5b6-62b9-479a-971b-27e7ec3c350c Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
6342f5b6-62b9-479a-971b-27e7ec3c350c Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes. Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes. Remove and let them cool.
52d568a1-fe82-4bd3-ad83-82995049fd5f Crumble white bread into smaller pieces.
52d568a1-fe82-4bd3-ad83-82995049fd5f Combine bread and soy coconut emulsion.
52d568a1-fe82-4bd3-ad83-82995049fd5f Add raisins, walnuts, honey, sugar, vanilla extract and mix together.
52d568a1-fe82-4bd3-ad83-82995049fd5f Add starch, guar, carrageenan and mix all together.
52d568a1-fe82-4bd3-ad83-82995049fd5f Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
52d568a1-fe82-4bd3-ad83-82995049fd5f Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
52d568a1-fe82-4bd3-ad83-82995049fd5f Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
52d568a1-fe82-4bd3-ad83-82995049fd5f Remove and let them cool.
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Buckwheat to water ratio 1:1.8
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Measure 200 g buckwheat and 450 ml of water.
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Bring water to a boil, add buckwheat and simmer partially covered for 15 minutes. Do not stir.
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Switch off the heat and leave groats uncovered to cool for 30 minutes.
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Make flaxseed emulsion (1:2:2).
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Dice tofu and mix with all ingredients except (0.5 oz fl) potato flour, guar gum and carrageenan.
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Add carrageenan, guar gum and potato flour and mix all together.
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings without delay.
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
6eae932a-416a-4eec-be75-c2ce74104e54 Remove and let them cool.
d82a5ab8-defc-4e1c-846e-fcb9d8508731 For 1 volume part of wild rice use 2 parts of water. Wild rice needs more cooking time, around 40-50 minutes.
d82a5ab8-defc-4e1c-846e-fcb9d8508731 Use a mild hot sauce, for example Mexican Cholula Hot sauce.
d82a5ab8-defc-4e1c-846e-fcb9d8508731 Vital wheat flour may be substituted with potato flour.
d82a5ab8-defc-4e1c-846e-fcb9d8508731 Save vital wheat gluten flour, starch, guar and carrageenan.
d82a5ab8-defc-4e1c-846e-fcb9d8508731 Mix rice, soy emulsion, soy protein isolate with all diced vegetables and spices.
d82a5ab8-defc-4e1c-846e-fcb9d8508731 Add starch, guar, carrageenan and vital wheat gluten flour and mix all together. Add water as needed.
d82a5ab8-defc-4e1c-846e-fcb9d8508731 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
d82a5ab8-defc-4e1c-846e-fcb9d8508731 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
d82a5ab8-defc-4e1c-846e-fcb9d8508731 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
d82a5ab8-defc-4e1c-846e-fcb9d8508731 Remove and let them cool.
527361c9-3be4-4faa-a882-25c01088acfb Grind wheat gluten through a small plate.
527361c9-3be4-4faa-a882-25c01088acfb Except gluten flour, guar and carrageenan, mix all ingredients together.
527361c9-3be4-4faa-a882-25c01088acfb Add gluten flour, guar and carrageenan and mix all together.
527361c9-3be4-4faa-a882-25c01088acfb Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
527361c9-3be4-4faa-a882-25c01088acfb Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
527361c9-3be4-4faa-a882-25c01088acfb Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
527361c9-3be4-4faa-a882-25c01088acfb Remove and let them cool.
a30ab4b1-0c43-41c4-b231-9a60aca7629e Chop onion finely then fry in olive oil until golden.
a30ab4b1-0c43-41c4-b231-9a60aca7629e Mix pumpkin puree with onion, diced garlic and spices. Add starch and flour and mix all together.
a30ab4b1-0c43-41c4-b231-9a60aca7629e Stuff into 36 mm non-animal casings.
a30ab4b1-0c43-41c4-b231-9a60aca7629e Cook for 20 minutes in water at 80° C (176° F).
a30ab4b1-0c43-41c4-b231-9a60aca7629e Cool and refrigerate.
47ccf3c1-a639-4620-b2eb-c0629420103e Chop cranberries and mix with apple sauce.
47ccf3c1-a639-4620-b2eb-c0629420103e Mix rice with flaxseed emulsion, add apple sauce, sugar and spices.
47ccf3c1-a639-4620-b2eb-c0629420103e Add starch, guar, carrageenan and mix all together.
47ccf3c1-a639-4620-b2eb-c0629420103e Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
47ccf3c1-a639-4620-b2eb-c0629420103e Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
47ccf3c1-a639-4620-b2eb-c0629420103e Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
47ccf3c1-a639-4620-b2eb-c0629420103e Remove and let them cool.
998d02f2-adf1-4756-9114-83a045a4e280 Blend protein with water first then gradually add oil.
998d02f2-adf1-4756-9114-83a045a4e280 Soak cracker meal and TVP in water.
998d02f2-adf1-4756-9114-83a045a4e280 Dice jalapenos and cut tofu into 1/8" (3 mm) cubes.
998d02f2-adf1-4756-9114-83a045a4e280 Mix pea flour with soy emulsion then add tofu, cracker meal, vinegar, jalapenos and spices.
998d02f2-adf1-4756-9114-83a045a4e280 Lastly, add starch, guar and carrageenan and mix everything again.
998d02f2-adf1-4756-9114-83a045a4e280 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
998d02f2-adf1-4756-9114-83a045a4e280 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
998d02f2-adf1-4756-9114-83a045a4e280 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
998d02f2-adf1-4756-9114-83a045a4e280 Remove and let them cool.
6c3d6cf4-67e3-483f-ba84-9d985563b328 Place the breadcrumbs, cheese, seasoning, mustard, leek and parsley into a mixing bowl, mix well. Beat the eggs and add to the mixture. Add enough milk for the mixture to bind. Divide the mixture into equal parts. Using hands form each portion into a sausage shape.
6c3d6cf4-67e3-483f-ba84-9d985563b328 Coating mix: beat another egg and add the milk. Spread the breadcrumbs (or flour) on a plate. Roll each sausage in the egg mixture, then roll in the bread crumbs.
6c3d6cf4-67e3-483f-ba84-9d985563b328 Fry the sausages in oil or melted butter for 5-10 minutes until they become gold-brown. Some people prefer to grill them till golden or bake them in an oven for about 15-20 minutes.
bef2a329-44d0-438a-b0c2-bc6f1d065dd0 Rolled oats are the plain instant type of oats.
bef2a329-44d0-438a-b0c2-bc6f1d065dd0 Oats to water ratio 1:2.
bef2a329-44d0-438a-b0c2-bc6f1d065dd0 Cook for 4 minutes.
bef2a329-44d0-438a-b0c2-bc6f1d065dd0 Except starch, guar and carrageenan, mix all ingredients together.
bef2a329-44d0-438a-b0c2-bc6f1d065dd0 Add starch, guar and carrageenan and mix all together.
bef2a329-44d0-438a-b0c2-bc6f1d065dd0 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
bef2a329-44d0-438a-b0c2-bc6f1d065dd0 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
bef2a329-44d0-438a-b0c2-bc6f1d065dd0 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
bef2a329-44d0-438a-b0c2-bc6f1d065dd0 Remove and let them cool.
813b4d44-666d-48e5-b6e9-8ef6214f9370 Mix all ingredients with warm water.
813b4d44-666d-48e5-b6e9-8ef6214f9370 Start slowly adding water and keep on kneading until a soft dough is obtained.
813b4d44-666d-48e5-b6e9-8ef6214f9370 Stuff into 32 mm clear fibrous casings.
813b4d44-666d-48e5-b6e9-8ef6214f9370 Place in a boiling water and cook at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
813b4d44-666d-48e5-b6e9-8ef6214f9370 Refrigerate.
813b4d44-666d-48e5-b6e9-8ef6214f9370 To serve cut the sausage into cubes or slices and fry.
53beb7ac-3992-4413-a8d9-f98d5677fcc6 Mix oil with potato flour to make a paste.
53beb7ac-3992-4413-a8d9-f98d5677fcc6 Except the oil paste, starch, guar and carrageenan, blend all other ingredients together.
53beb7ac-3992-4413-a8d9-f98d5677fcc6 You might need some water - apply as little as possible.
53beb7ac-3992-4413-a8d9-f98d5677fcc6 Lastly, add oil paste, flour, starch, guar, carrageenan and mix all together.
53beb7ac-3992-4413-a8d9-f98d5677fcc6 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
53beb7ac-3992-4413-a8d9-f98d5677fcc6 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
53beb7ac-3992-4413-a8d9-f98d5677fcc6 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
53beb7ac-3992-4413-a8d9-f98d5677fcc6 Remove and let them cool.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Finely chop onion and mushrooms.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Fry on medium heat in a little oil until onions are glassy and light yellow.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Stir in potato flour and cook 4 minutes longer.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Let cool.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Except potato flour, starch, guar and carrageenan, mix all ingredients.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Add starch, guar and carrageenan and mix again.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Lastly, add potato flour and mix all again.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
c4395f64-7931-42af-89c7-b564d6f326ae Remove and let them cool.
ae3a40a5-a28a-4d1b-864b-0ec061de686c Mix oil with soy protein concentrate to create a paste.
ae3a40a5-a28a-4d1b-864b-0ec061de686c Mix all ingredients except gluten flour, carrageenan and guar.
ae3a40a5-a28a-4d1b-864b-0ec061de686c Lastly add gluten flour, carrageenan and guar and mix all together.
ae3a40a5-a28a-4d1b-864b-0ec061de686c Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
ae3a40a5-a28a-4d1b-864b-0ec061de686c Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
ae3a40a5-a28a-4d1b-864b-0ec061de686c Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
ae3a40a5-a28a-4d1b-864b-0ec061de686c Remove and let them cool.
b96b521f-0166-49ec-ab19-16c719abc459 Bring water to a boil, add lentils and simmer for 25 minutes.
b96b521f-0166-49ec-ab19-16c719abc459 Drain.
b96b521f-0166-49ec-ab19-16c719abc459 Mix lentils, emulsion, tofu, vinegar and spices together.
b96b521f-0166-49ec-ab19-16c719abc459 Add starch, guar, carrageenan and mix again.
b96b521f-0166-49ec-ab19-16c719abc459 Add potato flour and mix all together.
b96b521f-0166-49ec-ab19-16c719abc459 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
b96b521f-0166-49ec-ab19-16c719abc459 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
b96b521f-0166-49ec-ab19-16c719abc459 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
b96b521f-0166-49ec-ab19-16c719abc459 Remove and let them cool.
d86ba976-7bab-4203-820a-528062600455 Use 1 part of steel cut oats to 3 parts of water.
d86ba976-7bab-4203-820a-528062600455 Bring water to a boil, add oats and boil at low heat for 15 minutes.
d86ba976-7bab-4203-820a-528062600455 Switch off the heat, remove the lid and let the oats to cool.
d86ba976-7bab-4203-820a-528062600455 Soak raisins in water for 30 minutes and then drain.
d86ba976-7bab-4203-820a-528062600455 Mix all ingredients together.
d86ba976-7bab-4203-820a-528062600455 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
d86ba976-7bab-4203-820a-528062600455 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
d86ba976-7bab-4203-820a-528062600455 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
d86ba976-7bab-4203-820a-528062600455 Remove and let them cool.
4f5cc587-9cf5-45dc-ab05-3b878fdb748c Cook 1 part of oats in 3 parts of water.
4f5cc587-9cf5-45dc-ab05-3b878fdb748c Soak raisins for 30 minutes in water. Drain.
4f5cc587-9cf5-45dc-ab05-3b878fdb748c Make emulsion blending 60 g of ground flaxseed with 240 ml (8 oz fl) of coconut milk.
4f5cc587-9cf5-45dc-ab05-3b878fdb748c Add cocoa powder and mix again.
4f5cc587-9cf5-45dc-ab05-3b878fdb748c Mix emulsion with oats, peanut butter, honey, sugar, raisins and spices.
4f5cc587-9cf5-45dc-ab05-3b878fdb748c Add starch, guar and carrageenan and mix all together.
4f5cc587-9cf5-45dc-ab05-3b878fdb748c Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
4f5cc587-9cf5-45dc-ab05-3b878fdb748c Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
4f5cc587-9cf5-45dc-ab05-3b878fdb748c Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
4f5cc587-9cf5-45dc-ab05-3b878fdb748c Remove and let them cool.
7bb5f1fc-43aa-481b-9d2f-102c3a1d6145 Mix 1 cup of cornmeal with 2 parts of cold water.
7bb5f1fc-43aa-481b-9d2f-102c3a1d6145 In a separate pot bring 1-1/2 cup of water to a boil.
7bb5f1fc-43aa-481b-9d2f-102c3a1d6145 Add soaked cornmeal and simmer for 35 minutes stirring often.
7bb5f1fc-43aa-481b-9d2f-102c3a1d6145 Add maple syrup, vanilla, chopped unsoaked cranberries and raisins to 750 g of cool polenta.
7bb5f1fc-43aa-481b-9d2f-102c3a1d6145 Stir together.
7bb5f1fc-43aa-481b-9d2f-102c3a1d6145 Add starch, guar gum and carrageenan and mix.
7bb5f1fc-43aa-481b-9d2f-102c3a1d6145 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
7bb5f1fc-43aa-481b-9d2f-102c3a1d6145 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
7bb5f1fc-43aa-481b-9d2f-102c3a1d6145 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
7bb5f1fc-43aa-481b-9d2f-102c3a1d6145 Remove and let them cool.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Use 1 cup of wheat to 2-1/2 cups of water.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Bring water to a boil, add wheat, cover and simmer on low heat for about 1 hour until tender.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 If the water is absorbed before the grains are tender, add more as needed.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Stir from time to time. Drain the grains.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Return the grains to the hot pot, let them steam for 10 minutes uncovered.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Bring water to a boil, switch the heat off.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Add poppy seed, stir and leave for 5 minutes. This removes some of poppy seed bitterness.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Drain*.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Soak raisins in water for 30 minutes.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Drain.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Using mixing bowl combine wheat, poppy seeds, sugar, walnuts, raisins, vanilla and water together.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Add starch, guar and carrageenan and mix all together.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
bafa5225-d395-41ee-bb89-bb3353601e23 Remove and let them cool.
c7fbeef8-f386-41c3-9568-c06af44ee64f Soak TVP in 220 ml of water for 20 minutes.
c7fbeef8-f386-41c3-9568-c06af44ee64f Mix with potatoes, tofu and all spices (except flour, starch, guar and carrageenan).
c7fbeef8-f386-41c3-9568-c06af44ee64f Add starch, guar, carrageenan, flour and around 100 ml water and mix all together.
c7fbeef8-f386-41c3-9568-c06af44ee64f Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
c7fbeef8-f386-41c3-9568-c06af44ee64f Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
c7fbeef8-f386-41c3-9568-c06af44ee64f Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
c7fbeef8-f386-41c3-9568-c06af44ee64f Remove and let them cool.
ba392c99-b76d-4d6b-a527-da4d39a78526 Chop pecans and dry cranberries.
ba392c99-b76d-4d6b-a527-da4d39a78526 Mix pumpkin puree with spices and coconut flour. Add pecans and cranberries and mix all together.
ba392c99-b76d-4d6b-a527-da4d39a78526 Stuff into 36 mm non-animal casings. Don’t add water unless the mixture is too hard to stuff.
ba392c99-b76d-4d6b-a527-da4d39a78526 Cook for 20 minutes in water at 80° C (176° F).
ba392c99-b76d-4d6b-a527-da4d39a78526 Cool and refrigerate.
97fe60d2-0a1d-4139-8069-cdf926119883 The following ingredients go well with quinoa - lemon juice, chile peppers, oregano, cilantro, tomatoes, red bell pepper.
97fe60d2-0a1d-4139-8069-cdf926119883 Cook quinoa like rice, use 1 cup quinoa : 2 cups water.
97fe60d2-0a1d-4139-8069-cdf926119883 Mix quinoa, beans, emulsion and spices.
97fe60d2-0a1d-4139-8069-cdf926119883 Add starch, guar, carrageenan and mix all together.
97fe60d2-0a1d-4139-8069-cdf926119883 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
97fe60d2-0a1d-4139-8069-cdf926119883 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
97fe60d2-0a1d-4139-8069-cdf926119883 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
97fe60d2-0a1d-4139-8069-cdf926119883 Remove and let them cool.
7d52b459-fb7f-48a1-a369-e9debbd344a6 Mix apple sauce with raisins, vanilla extract and spices.
7d52b459-fb7f-48a1-a369-e9debbd344a6 Add rice, sugar, soy protein isolate and mix.
7d52b459-fb7f-48a1-a369-e9debbd344a6 Add starch, guar, carrageenan and mix.
7d52b459-fb7f-48a1-a369-e9debbd344a6 Add vital wheat flour and mix all together.
7d52b459-fb7f-48a1-a369-e9debbd344a6 Add water as necessary.
7d52b459-fb7f-48a1-a369-e9debbd344a6 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
7d52b459-fb7f-48a1-a369-e9debbd344a6 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
7d52b459-fb7f-48a1-a369-e9debbd344a6 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
7d52b459-fb7f-48a1-a369-e9debbd344a6 Remove and let them cool.
9334f675-cf0f-4449-8a46-72e267c7b1a7 Grind wheat gluten through a small plate.
9334f675-cf0f-4449-8a46-72e267c7b1a7 Chop cranberries and soak for 30 minutes in water.
9334f675-cf0f-4449-8a46-72e267c7b1a7 Drain.
9334f675-cf0f-4449-8a46-72e267c7b1a7 Mix all ingredients except vital wheat gluten flour, starch, guar and carrageenan.
9334f675-cf0f-4449-8a46-72e267c7b1a7 Add vital wheat gluten flour, starch, guar and carrageenan and mix all together.
9334f675-cf0f-4449-8a46-72e267c7b1a7 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
9334f675-cf0f-4449-8a46-72e267c7b1a7 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
9334f675-cf0f-4449-8a46-72e267c7b1a7 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
9334f675-cf0f-4449-8a46-72e267c7b1a7 Remove and let them cool.
2e514284-6c80-408b-ab8f-c1566c8ad66e Grind wheat gluten through 3/8" (10 mm) plate.
2e514284-6c80-408b-ab8f-c1566c8ad66e Mix ground gluten with emulsion and spices.
2e514284-6c80-408b-ab8f-c1566c8ad66e Add vital wheat gluten, starch, guar, carrageenan and carrageenan and mix all together.
2e514284-6c80-408b-ab8f-c1566c8ad66e Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
2e514284-6c80-408b-ab8f-c1566c8ad66e Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
2e514284-6c80-408b-ab8f-c1566c8ad66e Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
2e514284-6c80-408b-ab8f-c1566c8ad66e Remove and let them cool.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Use 1 cup teff : 1 cup water.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Bring the water to a boil.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Gradually stir in teff, reduce heat, add a pinch of salt, cover and cook for 6 minutes, stirring often until the water is absorbed.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Soak raisins in water for 30 minutes.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Drain.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Mix teff, peanut butter, emulsion, raisins, pecans, sugar, honey and vanilla extract together.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Add starch, guar, carrageenan and mix all together.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
27031c87-b7d2-4f0e-87df-20f8d52cfe72 Remove and let them cool.
ce2ff740-39e2-4447-ba34-92f3369a0d8b Soak about 100 g (3.5 oz) of crushed Nori seaweed (see page 42) in 500 ml (2 cups) of water for 60 minutes.
ce2ff740-39e2-4447-ba34-92f3369a0d8b Drain.
ce2ff740-39e2-4447-ba34-92f3369a0d8b Measure 250 g.
ce2ff740-39e2-4447-ba34-92f3369a0d8b Grind or mash tofu and mix seaweeds, bread crumbs, soy sauce and spices.
ce2ff740-39e2-4447-ba34-92f3369a0d8b Add starch, guar and carrageenan and mix.
ce2ff740-39e2-4447-ba34-92f3369a0d8b Add potato flour and mix all together.
ce2ff740-39e2-4447-ba34-92f3369a0d8b Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
ce2ff740-39e2-4447-ba34-92f3369a0d8b Cook in 176-185° F (80-85° C) water for 20 minutes.
ce2ff740-39e2-4447-ba34-92f3369a0d8b Place sausages in cold water for 5 minutes.
ce2ff740-39e2-4447-ba34-92f3369a0d8b Remove and let them cool.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 Soak cracker meal in 200 ml of water.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 Mix dry TVP, diced tofu, diced tomatoes and cracker meal together.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 Add more water if necessary.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 Cracker meal is a coarse flour which is made from finely milled crackers.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 It is often used as a seafood fry mix.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 It can be replaced with bread crumbs.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 Except starch, guar and carrageenan, add all spices and mix.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 Add tomato paste, starch, guar, carrageenan and mix all together.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 Cook in water at 176-185° F (80-85° F) for 20 minutes.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 Remove and place for 5 minutes in cold water.
61c6e73d-ca80-4817-8ff0-e8019ad17942 Remove from water and let it cool.
06e5a8f5-ec5e-4766-a809-6e3d9e9a7553 Mix dry TVP, diced tofu, cracker meal, tomato sauce and paste together.
06e5a8f5-ec5e-4766-a809-6e3d9e9a7553 Except starch, guar and carrageenan, add all spices and mix.
06e5a8f5-ec5e-4766-a809-6e3d9e9a7553 Add starch, guar, carrageenan and mix all together.
06e5a8f5-ec5e-4766-a809-6e3d9e9a7553 Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
06e5a8f5-ec5e-4766-a809-6e3d9e9a7553 Cook in water at 176-185° F (80-85° F) for 20 minutes.
06e5a8f5-ec5e-4766-a809-6e3d9e9a7553 Remove and place for 5 minutes in cold water.
06e5a8f5-ec5e-4766-a809-6e3d9e9a7553 Remove from water and let it cool.
5d971dc5-c57e-4d56-8a6f-7f6e8d48dcfd Bring 1.2 liter of water to a boil.
5d971dc5-c57e-4d56-8a6f-7f6e8d48dcfd Add 400 g steel cut oats and simmer
5d971dc5-c57e-4d56-8a6f-7f6e8d48dcfd for 30 minutes. Let cool.
5d971dc5-c57e-4d56-8a6f-7f6e8d48dcfd Mix diced tofu, oats, emulsion and spices together.
5d971dc5-c57e-4d56-8a6f-7f6e8d48dcfd Add starch, guar and carrageenan and mix.
5d971dc5-c57e-4d56-8a6f-7f6e8d48dcfd Add flour and mix all together.
5d971dc5-c57e-4d56-8a6f-7f6e8d48dcfd Stuff hard into 38 mm casings.
5d971dc5-c57e-4d56-8a6f-7f6e8d48dcfd Cook in water at 176-185° F (80-85° F) for 20 minutes.
5d971dc5-c57e-4d56-8a6f-7f6e8d48dcfd Remove and place for 5 minutes in cold water.
5d971dc5-c57e-4d56-8a6f-7f6e8d48dcfd Remove from water and let it cool.
4a83c06e-0923-476c-977c-a23499d77980 Grind meat and fish with 1/8" (3 mm) plate.
4a83c06e-0923-476c-977c-a23499d77980 Whisk the egg.
4a83c06e-0923-476c-977c-a23499d77980 Using food processor emulsify meat, fish and all ingredients together.
4a83c06e-0923-476c-977c-a23499d77980 Stuff into 28-32 mm hog casings linking every 4" (10 cm).
4a83c06e-0923-476c-977c-a23499d77980 Keep for 1-2 days in refrigerator or freeze.
4a83c06e-0923-476c-977c-a23499d77980 Cook fully before serving.
85cb383c-adc3-4879-881f-4d616fa3fee2 Grind pork, beef and fish through 1/8" (3 mm) plate.
85cb383c-adc3-4879-881f-4d616fa3fee2 Beat the egg white.
85cb383c-adc3-4879-881f-4d616fa3fee2 Mix ground meats with all ingredients together.
85cb383c-adc3-4879-881f-4d616fa3fee2 Stuff into 32-36 mm hog casings linking at 4" (10 cm).
85cb383c-adc3-4879-881f-4d616fa3fee2 Keep for 1-2 days in refrigerator or freeze.
85cb383c-adc3-4879-881f-4d616fa3fee2 Cook fully before serving.
7a863ad8-84eb-4ced-a7bd-c8e254d29dd1 Grind meat and fish with 3/8" (10 mm) plate.
7a863ad8-84eb-4ced-a7bd-c8e254d29dd1 Mix everything together.
7a863ad8-84eb-4ced-a7bd-c8e254d29dd1 Stuff into 32-36 mm hog casings and link avery 8" (20 cm).
7a863ad8-84eb-4ced-a7bd-c8e254d29dd1 Store up to 2 days in refrigerator.
7a863ad8-84eb-4ced-a7bd-c8e254d29dd1 Cook fully before serving.
e6d41806-3151-4805-ab91-6929a75d4440 Grind fish and fat through 3/8" (10 mm) plate.
e6d41806-3151-4805-ab91-6929a75d4440 Mix with flour, spices, wine and water.
e6d41806-3151-4805-ab91-6929a75d4440 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings making 12" (30 cm) rings.
e6d41806-3151-4805-ab91-6929a75d4440 Cook in water at 80 C (176 F) for 30 minutes.
e6d41806-3151-4805-ab91-6929a75d4440 Cool for 10 minutes in cold water, briefly dry and refrigerate.
f73cdabf-bebe-46ba-a039-7bd08b2a415f Grind boneless, skinless chunks of fish through 1/4 (6 mm) grinder plate. Fish should be partially frozen for easy grind. Grind bacon with the same plate.
f73cdabf-bebe-46ba-a039-7bd08b2a415f Mix ground meat with all ingredients.
f73cdabf-bebe-46ba-a039-7bd08b2a415f Stuff into 28-32 mm hog casings.
f73cdabf-bebe-46ba-a039-7bd08b2a415f Cook in water at 80º C (176º F) for about 30 minutes.
f73cdabf-bebe-46ba-a039-7bd08b2a415f Refrigerate.
3615083d-1b4e-4755-812c-e4cb03165668 Cook pork skins in a little water Below the boiling point) until soft what will take about 60-90 minutes.
3615083d-1b4e-4755-812c-e4cb03165668 Cut tuna into 1" (25 mm) cubes. Mix with Cure 1 and 9 g of salt. Firmly pack in a container, cover with cloth and hold for 72 hours in refrigerator.
3615083d-1b4e-4755-812c-e4cb03165668 Grind fat, skins and cod through 1/8" (3 mm) plate.
3615083d-1b4e-4755-812c-e4cb03165668 Mix all together adding remaining salt and spices. Do not grind tuna, however, you may cut it into smaller pieces if a smaller casing is employed.
3615083d-1b4e-4755-812c-e4cb03165668 Stuff firmly into 4" (10 cm) synthetic protein lined casings.
3615083d-1b4e-4755-812c-e4cb03165668 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 75 minutes.
3615083d-1b4e-4755-812c-e4cb03165668 Cool for 15 minutes in cold water, briefly dry and refrigerate.
062f7e92-7941-4ac5-9264-b2544ffc4413 Grind boneless, skinless chunks of fish through 1/4 (6 mm) grinder plate. Fish should be partially frozen for easy grind. Grind bacon with the same plate.
062f7e92-7941-4ac5-9264-b2544ffc4413 Mix ground meat with all ingredients.
062f7e92-7941-4ac5-9264-b2544ffc4413 Stuff into 28-32 mm hog casings.
062f7e92-7941-4ac5-9264-b2544ffc4413 Cook in water at 80º C (176º F) for about 30 minutes.
062f7e92-7941-4ac5-9264-b2544ffc4413 Refrigerate.
2e9a349e-4366-46b0-b153-c792c0d7f317 Soak rusk in water.
2e9a349e-4366-46b0-b153-c792c0d7f317 Grind fish through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
2e9a349e-4366-46b0-b153-c792c0d7f317 Stuff into 32 mm casings.
2e9a349e-4366-46b0-b153-c792c0d7f317 Refrigerate.
2e9a349e-4366-46b0-b153-c792c0d7f317 Fry or grill before serving.
e979d02a-d46f-4127-99cb-17106cf77048 Grind boneless, skinless chunks of fish through 1/4 (6 mm) grinder plate. Fish should be partially frozen for easy grind.
e979d02a-d46f-4127-99cb-17106cf77048 Mix ground fish with all ingredients.
e979d02a-d46f-4127-99cb-17106cf77048 Stuff into 24-26 mm sheep or synthetic casings.
e979d02a-d46f-4127-99cb-17106cf77048 Refrigerate and fully cook before serving.
fbeb2336-7485-4be5-984e-ec20a49ee98a Grind fish through 1/4" (6 mm) plate.
fbeb2336-7485-4be5-984e-ec20a49ee98a Mix ground fish with all ingredients, adding as much water as necessary.
fbeb2336-7485-4be5-984e-ec20a49ee98a Stuff into 32-36 mm cellulose or synthetic casings.
fbeb2336-7485-4be5-984e-ec20a49ee98a Refrigerate.
fbeb2336-7485-4be5-984e-ec20a49ee98a Fully cook before serving.
12f638f6-1b2a-41dc-977a-0f70eea6b589 Soak bread crumbs in water.
12f638f6-1b2a-41dc-977a-0f70eea6b589 Grind boneless, skinless chunks of fish through 1/4" (6 mm) grinder plate. Fish should be partially frozen for easy grind.
12f638f6-1b2a-41dc-977a-0f70eea6b589 Mix salt, flour, oil, bread crumbs, spices and fish together adding as much water as necessary.
12f638f6-1b2a-41dc-977a-0f70eea6b589 Stuff into 36 mm synthetic casings. Tie off into 6" (15 cm) links.
12f638f6-1b2a-41dc-977a-0f70eea6b589 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
12f638f6-1b2a-41dc-977a-0f70eea6b589 Cool in cold water for 10 minutes, dry briefly and refrigerate.
2bfe4fdc-3efd-41ca-ba67-8a990fe4f6e0 Grind fat and fish through 1/8" (3 mm) plate.
2bfe4fdc-3efd-41ca-ba67-8a990fe4f6e0 Mix fish, fat and all ingredients together.
2bfe4fdc-3efd-41ca-ba67-8a990fe4f6e0 Stuff into 36 mm casings, tie off into 8-10" (20-25 cm) links.
2bfe4fdc-3efd-41ca-ba67-8a990fe4f6e0 Cook in water at 80º C (176º F) for 30 minutes.
2bfe4fdc-3efd-41ca-ba67-8a990fe4f6e0 Immerse sausages in cold water for 10 minutes.
2bfe4fdc-3efd-41ca-ba67-8a990fe4f6e0 Store in refrigerator
3aa162ec-47d7-4ea7-8a38-5da81899a66d Boil potatoes, drain.
3aa162ec-47d7-4ea7-8a38-5da81899a66d Grind fat, fish and potatoes with 1/4" (6 mm) plate
3aa162ec-47d7-4ea7-8a38-5da81899a66d Grind beef with 1/8" (3 mm) plate.
3aa162ec-47d7-4ea7-8a38-5da81899a66d Mix everything together.
3aa162ec-47d7-4ea7-8a38-5da81899a66d Stuff into 36 mm hog casings, link every 8" (20 cm).
3aa162ec-47d7-4ea7-8a38-5da81899a66d Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes.
3aa162ec-47d7-4ea7-8a38-5da81899a66d Immerse sausages in cold water for 10 minutes.
3aa162ec-47d7-4ea7-8a38-5da81899a66d Refrigerate.
d38a65b6-7ff0-4c9c-a882-007938b3f3f8 Grind fish and pork through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
d38a65b6-7ff0-4c9c-a882-007938b3f3f8 Mix with all ingredients.
d38a65b6-7ff0-4c9c-a882-007938b3f3f8 Stuff into 32 mm hog casings.
d38a65b6-7ff0-4c9c-a882-007938b3f3f8 Hold for 30 minutes at room temperature.
d38a65b6-7ff0-4c9c-a882-007938b3f3f8 Smoke at 60° C (140° F) for 60 minutes.
d38a65b6-7ff0-4c9c-a882-007938b3f3f8 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 30 minutes.
d38a65b6-7ff0-4c9c-a882-007938b3f3f8 Cool in cold water for 10 minutes, dry briefly and refrigerate.
cc9f19ad-2013-4c1a-856c-605e3bb1a18a Grind meat and dish through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
cc9f19ad-2013-4c1a-856c-605e3bb1a18a Mix ground fish with all ingredients.
cc9f19ad-2013-4c1a-856c-605e3bb1a18a Stuff into 36 mm hog casings.Tie off into rings 12” (30 cm) long.
cc9f19ad-2013-4c1a-856c-605e3bb1a18a Hang for 30 minutes at room temperature.
cc9f19ad-2013-4c1a-856c-605e3bb1a18a Smoke at 60° C (140° F) for 30 minutes.
cc9f19ad-2013-4c1a-856c-605e3bb1a18a Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 25 minutes.
cc9f19ad-2013-4c1a-856c-605e3bb1a18a Cool in cold water for 10 minutes, dry briefly and refrigerate.
15545e08-e00e-460a-9ada-0bde76043dff Wash sardines with water and drain.
15545e08-e00e-460a-9ada-0bde76043dff Grind all meats and sardines through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
15545e08-e00e-460a-9ada-0bde76043dff Mix with all ingredients.
15545e08-e00e-460a-9ada-0bde76043dff Stuff into 70 mm artificial waterproof casings forming 40 cm (16") links.
15545e08-e00e-460a-9ada-0bde76043dff Hold for 2 hours at room temperature.
15545e08-e00e-460a-9ada-0bde76043dff Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 90 minutes.
15545e08-e00e-460a-9ada-0bde76043dff Cool and refrigerate.
258a30bb-6b13-4c7d-8686-dd7a5b5dcc4e Grate the skin of the lemon, do not include the white underlayer known as pith which is bitter.
258a30bb-6b13-4c7d-8686-dd7a5b5dcc4e Add 30 g of salt (almost 2 tablespoons) to 1 liter (quart) of water and bring to a boil. Choose best looking green cabbage leaves, cut into smaller pieces and blanch them for 5 minutes in a boiling water. Cool in cold water, drain and force the excess water out.
258a30bb-6b13-4c7d-8686-dd7a5b5dcc4e Chop onions finely and fry in lard in a skillet on low-heat until they become glassy and golden.
258a30bb-6b13-4c7d-8686-dd7a5b5dcc4e Add cabbage leaves and fish stock, cover the skillet and simmer on low heat for 30-40 minutes. Drain resulting stew, and cool immediately in refrigerator.
258a30bb-6b13-4c7d-8686-dd7a5b5dcc4e Grind partially frozen fish flesh through 8-10 mm plate.
258a30bb-6b13-4c7d-8686-dd7a5b5dcc4e Mix ground fish, cabbage stew, eggs and spices together.
258a30bb-6b13-4c7d-8686-dd7a5b5dcc4e Stuff the mixture into 30-32 mm pork casings, making 15 cm (6”) links.
258a30bb-6b13-4c7d-8686-dd7a5b5dcc4e Cook in salty water (20 g salt per 1 liter) at 80° C (176° F) for 25 minutes. Cool.
258a30bb-6b13-4c7d-8686-dd7a5b5dcc4e Keep refrigerated.
47e4a230-e80b-4727-8293-0522d1ac40d2 Clean the squids. Discard head/eyes/stomach but keep the tentacles. Rinse the tube well, inside and out, with cold water, then drain. Put 1 teaspoon of flour inside squid body and shake well to coat the inside. Shake any loose flour out of the body tubes. Set aside.
47e4a230-e80b-4727-8293-0522d1ac40d2 Soak noodles in water for 30 minutes. Cook noodles in a boiling water for 3 minutes. Rinse in cold water and drain. Place noodles in a bowl and cut finely with scissors. Boil bean sprouts for 1 minute. Remove, rinse with cold water and drain.
47e4a230-e80b-4727-8293-0522d1ac40d2 Chop tentacles into small pieces then mix into the seasoning paste. Seasoning Paste: Garlic, minced 7.0 g (2 cloves); Scallion, chopped 15 g (1 Tbsp); Red chili pepper 1; Green chili pepper 1; Sesame seeds, roasted 2 tsp; Sesame oil 5 ml (1 tsp); Salt 6.0 g (1 tsp); Black pepper 1.0 g (1/2 tsp). Finely mince the garlic, chopped scallions and peppers. Mix the ingredients together and let stand for 15 minutes.
47e4a230-e80b-4727-8293-0522d1ac40d2 Mash tofu and squeeze the water out. Place tofu in cheese cloth and squeeze out the remaining water.
47e4a230-e80b-4727-8293-0522d1ac40d2 Place in a bowl: seasoning paste with tentacles, been sprouts, tofu, egg, soy sauce, chopped green onion and carrots and mix all together.
47e4a230-e80b-4727-8293-0522d1ac40d2 Stuff squid and seal the open end with a toothpick or cooking thread.
47e4a230-e80b-4727-8293-0522d1ac40d2 Place in steamer basket and steam for 30 minutes. Remove from steamer and cool. Cut into 1/2 inch slices.
47e4a230-e80b-4727-8293-0522d1ac40d2 Serve warm or at room temp with dipping sauce OR carefully insert each disc into a beaten egg and fry on pan on both sides in a little oil or butter on low heat until golden brown. Serve with dipping sauce. Dipping Sauce: Soy sauce 15 ml (1 Tbsp); Rice whine or rice vinegar 15 ml (1 Tbsp); Sugar 3.0 g (1/2 tsp); Sesame seeds, roasted 1 tsp.
009349ce-c1ca-4d5b-b75b-5da056621ae1 *Bean paste. Soak dry beans overnight. Simmer in a little water for a few hours until soft. Rinse and drain. You may simplify the process by using canned beans.
009349ce-c1ca-4d5b-b75b-5da056621ae1 Grind beef through 3/16” (5 mm) plate.
009349ce-c1ca-4d5b-b75b-5da056621ae1 Mix everything together.
009349ce-c1ca-4d5b-b75b-5da056621ae1 Stuff into 36 mm casings.
009349ce-c1ca-4d5b-b75b-5da056621ae1 Cook sausage in water at 176° F (80° C), about 15-20 minutes.
009349ce-c1ca-4d5b-b75b-5da056621ae1 Cool in cold water.
009349ce-c1ca-4d5b-b75b-5da056621ae1 Store in refrigerator.
14d5df17-2cab-4792-a738-4423c045520e Soak TVP in cold water for 30 minutes.
14d5df17-2cab-4792-a738-4423c045520e Grind beef through a small plate (1/8”, 3 mm).
14d5df17-2cab-4792-a738-4423c045520e In a food processor chop cold water, ground meat, salt, phosphate, cure #1, and sodium erythorbate. Add potato starch, non-fat dry milk, carrageenan and chop. Add spices and fat emulsion and chop/emulsify everything together.
14d5df17-2cab-4792-a738-4423c045520e Stuff into 22-26 mm sheep casings.
14d5df17-2cab-4792-a738-4423c045520e Hold at room temperature for 30 minutes.
14d5df17-2cab-4792-a738-4423c045520e Smoke at 65° C (150° F) for 30-40 minutes.
14d5df17-2cab-4792-a738-4423c045520e Cook sausage in water at 176° F (80° C), about 15-20 minutes.
14d5df17-2cab-4792-a738-4423c045520e Cold shower or cool in cold water. Store in refrigerator.
8f5b8c58-e110-487a-96ba-1e15ebdfe51b Soak TVP in cold water for 30 minutes.
8f5b8c58-e110-487a-96ba-1e15ebdfe51b Grind chicken meat through a small plate (1/8”, 3 mm).
8f5b8c58-e110-487a-96ba-1e15ebdfe51b In a food processor chop cold water, ground meat, salt, phosphate, cure #1, and sodium erythorbate. Add potato starch, non-fat dry milk, and chop. Add spices and fat emulsion and chop/emulsify everything together.
8f5b8c58-e110-487a-96ba-1e15ebdfe51b Stuff into 22-26 mm sheep casings.
8f5b8c58-e110-487a-96ba-1e15ebdfe51b Hold at room temperature for 30 minutes.
8f5b8c58-e110-487a-96ba-1e15ebdfe51b Smoke at 65° C (150° F) for 30-40 minutes.
8f5b8c58-e110-487a-96ba-1e15ebdfe51b Cook sausage in water at 176° F (80° C), about 15-20 minutes.
8f5b8c58-e110-487a-96ba-1e15ebdfe51b Cold shower or cool in cold water. Store in refrigerator.
f7ef78f0-0c1b-44f4-8175-ef56fdf51478 Dice fresh pork belly or smoked bacon into 1/4" (5 mm) cubes.
f7ef78f0-0c1b-44f4-8175-ef56fdf51478 Dice hard fat (or fat trimmings) into 1/4" (5 mm) cubes.
f7ef78f0-0c1b-44f4-8175-ef56fdf51478 Chop onion finely.
f7ef78f0-0c1b-44f4-8175-ef56fdf51478 Fry both belly and fat cubes until gold, stirring often.
f7ef78f0-0c1b-44f4-8175-ef56fdf51478 Fry onion in some fat until gold. Don't make it brown as it will taste bitter.
f7ef78f0-0c1b-44f4-8175-ef56fdf51478 Heat up a pot on low fire and start adding pea flour stirring continuously. Add all spices, keep on stirring.
f7ef78f0-0c1b-44f4-8175-ef56fdf51478 Add all meats, fat included, stir together and keep the mass warm otherwise it will harden.
f7ef78f0-0c1b-44f4-8175-ef56fdf51478 Stuff firmly into 40 mm casings making 8" (20 cm) straight links.
f7ef78f0-0c1b-44f4-8175-ef56fdf51478 There is no need for cooking.
aa01cbc9-f49f-419f-8fd8-1fca56289ffe Soak bread crumbs in 60 g of cold water.
aa01cbc9-f49f-419f-8fd8-1fca56289ffe Grind meat through a small plate (1/8”, 3 mm).
aa01cbc9-f49f-419f-8fd8-1fca56289ffe In a food processor chop cold water, ground pork and salt. Add potato starch, bread crumbs and wheat flour and chop. Add spices and fat emulsion and chop/emulsify everything together.
aa01cbc9-f49f-419f-8fd8-1fca56289ffe Stuff into 22-26 mm sheep casings.
aa01cbc9-f49f-419f-8fd8-1fca56289ffe Cool and place in refrigerator. The sausage must be fully cooked before serving OR
aa01cbc9-f49f-419f-8fd8-1fca56289ffe Cook sausage in water at 176° F (80° C), about 15-20 minutes.
aa01cbc9-f49f-419f-8fd8-1fca56289ffe Cold shower or cool in cold water. Store in refrigerator.
50dde44e-8763-495b-882c-a773293a4920 Soak TVP in water for at least 30 minutes.
50dde44e-8763-495b-882c-a773293a4920 Grind meats through a 3/16” (5 mm) plate.
50dde44e-8763-495b-882c-a773293a4920 Mix meats with TVP. Add all remaining ingredients and mix everything together. Add only ½ water, then add more if needed.
50dde44e-8763-495b-882c-a773293a4920 Stuff into 32-36 mm casings.
50dde44e-8763-495b-882c-a773293a4920 Hold at room temperature for 30 minutes.
50dde44e-8763-495b-882c-a773293a4920 Smoke at 65° C (150° F) for 60 minutes.
50dde44e-8763-495b-882c-a773293a4920 Cook sausage in water at 176° F (80° C) for about 30 minutes.
50dde44e-8763-495b-882c-a773293a4920 Cool in cold water.
50dde44e-8763-495b-882c-a773293a4920 Store in refrigerator.
5cda5704-88a6-4032-a50b-2a2c8f56dfa5 Boil peeled potatoes without salt until soft. Drain and leave partially covered to let the steam out. Smash potatoes to make potato purée.
5cda5704-88a6-4032-a50b-2a2c8f56dfa5 Grind meat through 1/8" (3 mm) plate.
5cda5704-88a6-4032-a50b-2a2c8f56dfa5 Mix potatoes, ground meat and spices together.
5cda5704-88a6-4032-a50b-2a2c8f56dfa5 Stuff into 36 mm casings.
5cda5704-88a6-4032-a50b-2a2c8f56dfa5 Cook in water at 176° F (80° C) for 45 minutes.
5cda5704-88a6-4032-a50b-2a2c8f56dfa5 Place sausages on a flat surface to cool.
5cda5704-88a6-4032-a50b-2a2c8f56dfa5 Refrigerate.
ed7d45af-d8b4-476f-9a48-3c7e8b1bebdb Grind beef through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
ed7d45af-d8b4-476f-9a48-3c7e8b1bebdb Male oil emulsion*: soy protein isolate /vegetable oil/water at 1:4:5. Oil emulsion: chop/blend 20 g soy protein isolate and 100 g (ml) water in food processor for 1 minute. Add 80 g oil and chop for 2 minutes.
ed7d45af-d8b4-476f-9a48-3c7e8b1bebdb In food processor chop ground beef, water, salt, phosphate, cure #1 and sodium erythorbate.
ed7d45af-d8b4-476f-9a48-3c7e8b1bebdb Add starch and spices and remix. Add oil emulsion and remix.
ed7d45af-d8b4-476f-9a48-3c7e8b1bebdb Stuff firmly into 40-60 mm synthetic fibrous or cellulose casings.
ed7d45af-d8b4-476f-9a48-3c7e8b1bebdb Hang at room temperature for one hour.
ed7d45af-d8b4-476f-9a48-3c7e8b1bebdb When sausages feel dry to touch, apply hot smoke 50-60º C (120-140 º F) for 2-3 hours.
ed7d45af-d8b4-476f-9a48-3c7e8b1bebdb Poach in water to 160º F (72º C) internal meat temperature.
ed7d45af-d8b4-476f-9a48-3c7e8b1bebdb Shower with or immerse in cold water for 10 minutes.
ed7d45af-d8b4-476f-9a48-3c7e8b1bebdb 9. Store in refrigerator.
4cc46b03-aadb-4b27-8b08-4d474260b8d2 Grind chicken meat through 3/16” (5 mm) plate.
4cc46b03-aadb-4b27-8b08-4d474260b8d2 Mix minced chicken meat with all ingredients together.
4cc46b03-aadb-4b27-8b08-4d474260b8d2 Stuff into synthetic fibrous or cellulose casings.
4cc46b03-aadb-4b27-8b08-4d474260b8d2 Cook in water at 176° F (80° C) until sausage reaches 160° F (72° C) inside.
4cc46b03-aadb-4b27-8b08-4d474260b8d2 Store in refrigerator.
23deb9b0-62dd-4abb-ad5d-db44bed060c2 Grind meats through a 3/16” (5 mm) plate.
23deb9b0-62dd-4abb-ad5d-db44bed060c2 In a food processor chop ground chicken, salt and phosphate for about 2 minutes adding cold water.
23deb9b0-62dd-4abb-ad5d-db44bed060c2 Add soy protein isolate and all other ingredients and blend for 2 more minutes.
23deb9b0-62dd-4abb-ad5d-db44bed060c2 Stuff firmly into 40-60 mm beef middles, fibrous or cellulose casings.
23deb9b0-62dd-4abb-ad5d-db44bed060c2 Hang at room temperature for one hour.
23deb9b0-62dd-4abb-ad5d-db44bed060c2 When sausages feel dry to touch, apply hot smoke 50-60º C (120-140º F) for 2-3 hours.
23deb9b0-62dd-4abb-ad5d-db44bed060c2 Cook in water at 176º F (80º C) until sausages reach 160º F (72º C) internal temperature.
23deb9b0-62dd-4abb-ad5d-db44bed060c2 Shower with or immerse in cold water for 10 minutes.
23deb9b0-62dd-4abb-ad5d-db44bed060c2 Store in refrigerator.
d756e8a5-d7a5-4758-b582-dee48a272625 Grind pork through the 3/8" (10 mm) plate.
d756e8a5-d7a5-4758-b582-dee48a272625 Mix ground meat with all ingredients.
d756e8a5-d7a5-4758-b582-dee48a272625 Stuff into 22-26 mm sheep casings and make 5" - 6" long links.
d756e8a5-d7a5-4758-b582-dee48a272625 When sausages feel dry to touch, apply hot smoke 50 - 60 C (120 - 140 F) for 30 minutes.
d756e8a5-d7a5-4758-b582-dee48a272625 Cook in smokehouse or in water to 160 F (72 C) internal meat temperature.
d756e8a5-d7a5-4758-b582-dee48a272625 Shower with or immerse in cold water for 5 minutes.
d756e8a5-d7a5-4758-b582-dee48a272625 Store in refrigerator.
c2120713-49f0-483b-baa4-30931335fed7 Grind chicken meat through 3/16” (5 mm) plate.
c2120713-49f0-483b-baa4-30931335fed7 * oil emulsion: soy protein isolate /vegetable oil/water at 1:4:5. Oil emulsion: chop/blend 20 g soy protein isolate and 100 g (ml) water in food processor for 1 minute. Add 80 g oil and chop for 2 minutes. Refrigerate.
c2120713-49f0-483b-baa4-30931335fed7 Mix minced chicken meat with all ingredients together.
c2120713-49f0-483b-baa4-30931335fed7 Stuff into 36 mm synthetic fibrous or cellulose casings.
c2120713-49f0-483b-baa4-30931335fed7 Cook in water at 176° F (80° C) to 160° F (72° C) internal sausage temperature..
c2120713-49f0-483b-baa4-30931335fed7 Store in refrigerator.
3422d32f-9e67-4196-868f-df5e2eedfc65 Grind lean pork with 3/8" (10 mm) plate.
3422d32f-9e67-4196-868f-df5e2eedfc65 Mix ground meat with water, cure #1 and spices until the mass feels sticky. Add oil emulsion and remix all together.
3422d32f-9e67-4196-868f-df5e2eedfc65 Stuff mixture into 22-26 mm sheep casings. Link sausage into 60-70 cm (24-27") links so when hung on a smoking stick the individual links (half of the meat stick) will be about one foot long.
3422d32f-9e67-4196-868f-df5e2eedfc65 Leave sausages at room temperature for 30 - 60 minutes.
3422d32f-9e67-4196-868f-df5e2eedfc65 When sausages feel dry to touch, apply hot smoke 50 - 60 C (120 - 140 F) for 45 minutes.
3422d32f-9e67-4196-868f-df5e2eedfc65 Cook in smokehouse or in water to 160 F (72 C) internal meat temperature.
3422d32f-9e67-4196-868f-df5e2eedfc65 Shower with or immerse in cold water for 10 minutes.
3422d32f-9e67-4196-868f-df5e2eedfc65 Store in refrigerator.
f4e4e1cf-35b5-4824-a6f0-726ca650d49c Pre-cook pork meat (not livers) in simmering water until soft, save broth.
f4e4e1cf-35b5-4824-a6f0-726ca650d49c Fry onions in oil until golden. Do not make them brown.
f4e4e1cf-35b5-4824-a6f0-726ca650d49c Grind pork meats and fried onions through 2 mm plate (1/8”). Slice liver in smaller pieces and grind through 2 mm (1/8”) plate.
f4e4e1cf-35b5-4824-a6f0-726ca650d49c Mix ground meat with liver, spices, flour, bread crumbs and broth. Add emulsion and remix.
f4e4e1cf-35b5-4824-a6f0-726ca650d49c Stuff loosely into 36 mm diameter hog or cellulose casings.
f4e4e1cf-35b5-4824-a6f0-726ca650d49c Cook sausages in preheated water at 176 - 185º F (80 - 85º C) until an internal temperature of 160º F (72º C) is reached. The required time is about 35 minutes.
f4e4e1cf-35b5-4824-a6f0-726ca650d49c Cool in cold water for 10 min, drain and air dry.
f4e4e1cf-35b5-4824-a6f0-726ca650d49c Store in refrigerator.
c389dd99-2523-4482-a570-54dbdf002395 Cover meats (not livers) with water and simmer in water until soft, save broth.
c389dd99-2523-4482-a570-54dbdf002395 Cut blood veins out of livers and place them in cold water until all traces of blood are removed. Blanch livers in water at around 158º F (70º C) for 5 min.
c389dd99-2523-4482-a570-54dbdf002395 Cook rice (don’t overcook), then rinse in cold water and drain.
c389dd99-2523-4482-a570-54dbdf002395 Fry onions in oil until golden. Do not make them brown.
c389dd99-2523-4482-a570-54dbdf002395 Grind pork meats and fried onions through 2 mm plate (1/8”). Slice liver in smaller pieces and grind through 2 mm (1/8”) plate.
c389dd99-2523-4482-a570-54dbdf002395 Mix ground meat with liver, spices, rice and broth. Add emulsion and remix.
c389dd99-2523-4482-a570-54dbdf002395 Stuff loosely into 36 mm diameter hog or cellulose casings.
c389dd99-2523-4482-a570-54dbdf002395 Cook in preheated water at 176 - 185º F (80 - 85º C). until an internal temperature of 160º F (72º C) is reached. The required time is about 35 minutes.
c389dd99-2523-4482-a570-54dbdf002395 Cool in cold water for 10 min, drain and air dry.
c389dd99-2523-4482-a570-54dbdf002395 Store in refrigerator.
11777d72-4d23-4c47-99a3-2b0acce1bf1f Grind lean pork with 1/2" (13 mm) plate. Grind beef twice through 1/8" (2-3 mm) plate.
11777d72-4d23-4c47-99a3-2b0acce1bf1f Add cold water into the ground beef and mix well with all ingredients except oil. Add pork and mix all together. Add oil and mix all together.
11777d72-4d23-4c47-99a3-2b0acce1bf1f Stuff mixture into 32 mm hog casings and form 7 - 8" (18 - 20 cm) links.
11777d72-4d23-4c47-99a3-2b0acce1bf1f Hang sausages at room temperature for 2 hours.
11777d72-4d23-4c47-99a3-2b0acce1bf1f Sausage is hot smoked in a few distinct stages:
11777d72-4d23-4c47-99a3-2b0acce1bf1f Shower with cold water for about 5 minutes and place in a refrigerator.
e8b4703d-5a7b-4237-99b3-70819ad5dccd Grind meat through 3/8" (10 mm) plate.
e8b4703d-5a7b-4237-99b3-70819ad5dccd Add salt and Cure #1 and mix well with meat.
e8b4703d-5a7b-4237-99b3-70819ad5dccd Mix dextrose, spices, fat replacer with ground meat and water.
e8b4703d-5a7b-4237-99b3-70819ad5dccd Stuff mixture into 32 - 36 mm hog casings and form 12” links.
e8b4703d-5a7b-4237-99b3-70819ad5dccd Hang on smoke sticks for 1-2 hours at room temperature OR
e8b4703d-5a7b-4237-99b3-70819ad5dccd Place sausages in a preheated smoker at 120º F (49º C) with draft dampers fully open.
e8b4703d-5a7b-4237-99b3-70819ad5dccd When casings feel dry partially close the exit smoke damper and apply smoke for 60 minutes. Keep on increasing the smoking temperature until you reach 170º F (76º C). Sausage is done when the internal temperature reaches 154º F (68º C).
e8b4703d-5a7b-4237-99b3-70819ad5dccd Remove from smoker and shower with water or immerse sausages in cold water.
e8b4703d-5a7b-4237-99b3-70819ad5dccd Store in refrigerator.
b2b465f2-f04c-4136-9401-ee114ca8aa11 Grind meat through 3/8" (10 mm) plate. Add salt and Cure #1 and mix well with meat.
b2b465f2-f04c-4136-9401-ee114ca8aa11 Mix dextrose, spices and fat replacer with ground meat.
b2b465f2-f04c-4136-9401-ee114ca8aa11 Add oil emulsion and mix all together.
b2b465f2-f04c-4136-9401-ee114ca8aa11 Stuff mixture into 32 - 36 mm hog casings and form 12" links.
b2b465f2-f04c-4136-9401-ee114ca8aa11 Hang on smoke sticks for 1 - 2 hours at room temperature OR
b2b465f2-f04c-4136-9401-ee114ca8aa11 Place sausages in a preheated smoker at 120 F (49 C) with draft dampers fully open.
b2b465f2-f04c-4136-9401-ee114ca8aa11 When casings feel dry partially close the exit smoke damper and apply smoke for 60 minutes. Keep on increasing the smoking temperature until you reach 170 F (76 C). Sausage is done when the internal temperature reaches 154 F (68 C).
b2b465f2-f04c-4136-9401-ee114ca8aa11 Remove from smoker and shower with water or immerse sausages in cold water.
b2b465f2-f04c-4136-9401-ee114ca8aa11 Store in refrigerator.
561ed0b0-885b-44d7-b429-8c52e8db3b26 Grind pork and onions through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
561ed0b0-885b-44d7-b429-8c52e8db3b26 Grind beef through 3/16” (5 mm) plate.
561ed0b0-885b-44d7-b429-8c52e8db3b26 Add salt, spices, 1/2 of the water and start mixing with meat sprinkling potato flour and non fat dry milk powder. You could mix all ingredients with half of the water in a blender and then pour over the meat.
561ed0b0-885b-44d7-b429-8c52e8db3b26 Add remaining water and keep on mixing until absorbed.
561ed0b0-885b-44d7-b429-8c52e8db3b26 Stuff into large hog casings 36-40 mm or beef rounds.
561ed0b0-885b-44d7-b429-8c52e8db3b26 Keep under refrigeration.
561ed0b0-885b-44d7-b429-8c52e8db3b26 Cook before serving.
faa950e1-d256-431b-9974-00c42ae5b07f Slice raw potatoes into thin discs and place in cold water. Drain before use.
faa950e1-d256-431b-9974-00c42ae5b07f Grind pork meat through 1/8" (3 mm) plate.
faa950e1-d256-431b-9974-00c42ae5b07f Chop potatoes finely and add to ground meat.
faa950e1-d256-431b-9974-00c42ae5b07f Chop onion finely and fry in lard (fat) until gold. Let cool.
faa950e1-d256-431b-9974-00c42ae5b07f Add spices and mix everything together.
faa950e1-d256-431b-9974-00c42ae5b07f Stuff into 60 mm beef rounds or other suitable casings.
faa950e1-d256-431b-9974-00c42ae5b07f Cook in water at 176° F (80° C) for 60 minutes.
faa950e1-d256-431b-9974-00c42ae5b07f Cool and refrigerate.
3a7e7059-e5d1-4930-a55c-174d3e3e5bfe Grind beef and pork at least two times through a 1/8” (2 mm) or 3/16” (3 mm) plate.
3a7e7059-e5d1-4930-a55c-174d3e3e5bfe Add to meat all remaining ingredients and mix everything well together until feels sticky. Do not add water.
3a7e7059-e5d1-4930-a55c-174d3e3e5bfe Stuff tightly into 36-40 mm hog casings, beef rounds, or synthetic fibrous casings.
3a7e7059-e5d1-4930-a55c-174d3e3e5bfe Hang for 1-2 days at 35º-42º F, (2º-6º C) and 85-90 % humidity.
3a7e7059-e5d1-4930-a55c-174d3e3e5bfe Smoke with a thin cold smoke (below 77º F, 25º C) for 1-2 days until brown-reddish color is obtained. Periodically re-arrange smoke sticks for even smoke distribution.
3a7e7059-e5d1-4930-a55c-174d3e3e5bfe Cool down to less than 53º F (12º C).
3a7e7059-e5d1-4930-a55c-174d3e3e5bfe Store in refrigerator.
6d7f80d7-7913-4f26-88d2-de17cbefe89e Grind all meats through 2 mm plate. Then (optional step), they may be briefly chopped (emulsified) in bowl cutter (food processor) without adding water. During emulsifying the temperature of the meat should not exceed 15° C (59° F).
6d7f80d7-7913-4f26-88d2-de17cbefe89e Mix ground meat with all ingredients (without adding water) until sticky.
6d7f80d7-7913-4f26-88d2-de17cbefe89e Stuff into 50 mm synthetic cellulose or fibrous casings. Form straight 20-25 cm (8-10”) long links.
6d7f80d7-7913-4f26-88d2-de17cbefe89e Hang for 1-2 days at 10° C (50° F) and 85-90% humidity.
