6d7f80d7-7913-4f26-88d2-de17cbefe89e Apply a thin cold smoke for 1-2 days until casings develop light brown color. Re-arrange smoke sticks or smoke carts during smoking.
6d7f80d7-7913-4f26-88d2-de17cbefe89e Cool in air to 12° C (53° F) or lower.
b0192409-0e76-4ef5-a1d7-c2705361e24a Grind beef and pork at least two times through a 1/8” (2 mm) or 3/16” (3 mm) plate.
b0192409-0e76-4ef5-a1d7-c2705361e24a Add to meat all remaining ingredients and mix everything well together until feels sticky. Do not add water.
b0192409-0e76-4ef5-a1d7-c2705361e24a Stuff tightly into 36-40 mm hog casings, beef rounds, or synthetic fibrous casings.
b0192409-0e76-4ef5-a1d7-c2705361e24a Hang for 12 hours at 50º F (10º C) and 85-95 % humidity.
b0192409-0e76-4ef5-a1d7-c2705361e24a Smoke with cold smoke (below 77º F, 25º C) until gold-brown color is obtained. That should take 10-12 hours.
b0192409-0e76-4ef5-a1d7-c2705361e24a Cool down to less than 53º F (12º C).
b0192409-0e76-4ef5-a1d7-c2705361e24a Store in refrigerator.
49290790-484c-4dff-b85c-4665d3660107 Grind all meats through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Re-freeze and grind again. You may grind once and then emulsify in the food processor without adding water.
49290790-484c-4dff-b85c-4665d3660107 Mix meats with all ingredients together.
49290790-484c-4dff-b85c-4665d3660107 Stuff firmly into 45 mm beef middles or fibrous casings. Form 40 cm (16") links or shorter.
49290790-484c-4dff-b85c-4665d3660107 Ferment for 48 hours at 18º C (64º F), 75-80% humidity.
49290790-484c-4dff-b85c-4665d3660107 Apply cold smoke for 12 hours at 18º C (64º F).
49290790-484c-4dff-b85c-4665d3660107 Refrigerate.
95e37045-d149-4474-85c4-054bc918a79b Grind pork and beef through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
95e37045-d149-4474-85c4-054bc918a79b Mix all ingredients with meat.
95e37045-d149-4474-85c4-054bc918a79b Stuff into beef middles or fibrous casings about 60 mm diameter, form 30” links.
95e37045-d149-4474-85c4-054bc918a79b Ferment at 38º C (100º F) for 24 hours, 90-85% humidity.
95e37045-d149-4474-85c4-054bc918a79b Introduce warm smoke (43º C, 110º F), 70% humidity, for 12 hours. Gradually increase smoke temperature until internal meat temperature of 140º F (60º C) is obtained.
95e37045-d149-4474-85c4-054bc918a79b For a drier sausage: dry for 2 days at 22-16º C (60-70º F), 65-75% humidity or until desired weight loss has occurred.
95e37045-d149-4474-85c4-054bc918a79b Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
992bf26b-3007-4ae4-b86b-014cc34b6112 Grind pork through plate 5 (1/4") mm. Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
992bf26b-3007-4ae4-b86b-014cc34b6112 Mix all ingredients with meat.
992bf26b-3007-4ae4-b86b-014cc34b6112 Stuff into beef middles or fibrous casings 40-60 mm, 20” long.
992bf26b-3007-4ae4-b86b-014cc34b6112 Ferment at 24-30º C (75-86º F) for 24 hours, 90-85% humidity.
992bf26b-3007-4ae4-b86b-014cc34b6112 Introduce warm smoke (43º C, 110º F), 70% humidity, for 6 hours. Gradually increase smoke temperature until internal meat temperature of 140º F (60º C) is obtained.
992bf26b-3007-4ae4-b86b-014cc34b6112 For a drier sausage: dry for 3 days at 22→16º C (70→60º F), 65-75% humidity or until desired weight loss has occurred.
992bf26b-3007-4ae4-b86b-014cc34b6112 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity..
08101cd4-2e02-400c-a92f-43c52a522da7 Grind beef through 1/8 - 3/16” (3-5 mm) plate.
08101cd4-2e02-400c-a92f-43c52a522da7 Mix ground beef with all ingredients, including starter culture.
08101cd4-2e02-400c-a92f-43c52a522da7 Stuff sausage mix into 40-120 mm casings. Natural beef middles, collagen or fibrous casings. The larger casings are tied and stockinetted or laced with butcher twine for support as this is a large and heavy sausage.
08101cd4-2e02-400c-a92f-43c52a522da7 Ferment at 24º C (75º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
08101cd4-2e02-400c-a92f-43c52a522da7 Cold smoke for 2 days at < 22º C 72º F, 85% humidity.
08101cd4-2e02-400c-a92f-43c52a522da7 For a drier sausage: dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity.
08101cd4-2e02-400c-a92f-43c52a522da7 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
4cd42060-defa-4c12-92d8-48d2605c6b32 Curing. Grind beef with a large plate (3/4”, 20 mm), mix with salt, Cure #1 and sugar and keep for 10 days at 4-6º C (40-43º F).
4cd42060-defa-4c12-92d8-48d2605c6b32 Grind cured beef through 1/8 - 3/16” (3-5 mm) plate.
4cd42060-defa-4c12-92d8-48d2605c6b32 Mix ground meat with all ingredients.
4cd42060-defa-4c12-92d8-48d2605c6b32 Stuff sausage mix into 40-120 mm casings. Natural beef middles, collagen or fibrous casings. The larger casings are tied and stockinetted or laced with butcher twine for support as this is a large and heavy sausage.
4cd42060-defa-4c12-92d8-48d2605c6b32 Cold smoke for 4-8 days at < 22º C, 72º F, 85% humidity.
4cd42060-defa-4c12-92d8-48d2605c6b32 For a drier sausage: dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity.
4cd42060-defa-4c12-92d8-48d2605c6b32 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), < 75% humidity.
dd6fed7a-7870-4118-8d9e-00bd7e3f3f35 Curing. Cut pork and veal meat into 5-6 cm (2”) pieces, mix with 2-1/2 tsp of salt and Cure 1. Pack tightly in a container, cover with a cloth and leave for 48 hours in refrigerator. Mix fat trimmings with 1/2 tsp salt and place in refrigerator for 48 hours.
dd6fed7a-7870-4118-8d9e-00bd7e3f3f35 Grind collagen rich pork pork (with connective tissue) through 1/8" (2 mm) plate and then emulsify in food processor adding 20-30% of crushed ice or cold water. Add spices at this stage.Cut lean veal into 5-6 cm (2”) pieces. Grind semi-fat veal through 1/2" (10 mm plate). Grind fat pieces through 3/8" (8 mm) plate.
dd6fed7a-7870-4118-8d9e-00bd7e3f3f35 Mix veal class I with veal class II until gluey, then add emulsified mixture and mix everything together.
dd6fed7a-7870-4118-8d9e-00bd7e3f3f35 Stuff sausage into beef bungs or synthetic cellulose or fibrous casings 55-65 mm. Stuff casings firmly and tie the ends with twine. Sausage links 40-45 cm (16-18”), on one end loop 10-12 cm (4-5”) for hanging.
dd6fed7a-7870-4118-8d9e-00bd7e3f3f35 Condition sausages for 12 hours at 35-43°F (2-6°C). Drying is also allowed at room temperature for 3-4 hours.
dd6fed7a-7870-4118-8d9e-00bd7e3f3f35 Apply hot smoke for 90-100 min, then bake sausages for 40 min. Total time 130-150 min until the internal meat temperature reaches 154-158°F (68-70° C).
dd6fed7a-7870-4118-8d9e-00bd7e3f3f35 Hang for 1-2 days at 53-84°F (12-18°C) 75-80% humidity until 84% yield is achieved.
5d1bea27-7216-4c22-8e29-174d1198837c Trim all connective tissue and fat. Grind through a small plate (1/8-3/16”, 3-5 mm). Remove any visible fat and cook in water for about 1 1/2 hours. Cut de-fatted skin (rind) into 2-3 mm (⅛”) thick and ¾” (20 mm) long strips. Cut Bird Eye Chillies 3-5 mm thick.
5d1bea27-7216-4c22-8e29-174d1198837c Mix meat, skins, rice and all other ingredients well together.
5d1bea27-7216-4c22-8e29-174d1198837c Stuff tightly into synthetic casings, about 30 mm diameter and 6-8” (15-20 cm) long.
5d1bea27-7216-4c22-8e29-174d1198837c Ferment at 30º C (86º F) for 46 hours, high humidity.
5d1bea27-7216-4c22-8e29-174d1198837c For a drier sausage: dry for 3 days at 22-16º C (70-60º F), 65-75% humidity or until desired weight loss has occurred.
5d1bea27-7216-4c22-8e29-174d1198837c Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
b08c3666-addd-403f-a288-abb8d69e3a54 Grind pork and beef through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
b08c3666-addd-403f-a288-abb8d69e3a54 Mix all ingredients with meat.
b08c3666-addd-403f-a288-abb8d69e3a54 Stuff into beef middles or fibrous casings about 60 mm.
b08c3666-addd-403f-a288-abb8d69e3a54 Ferment at 38º C (100º F) for 24 hours, 90-85% humidity.
b08c3666-addd-403f-a288-abb8d69e3a54 Optional step: introduce warm smoke (43º C, 110º F), 70% humidity, for 6 hours.
b08c3666-addd-403f-a288-abb8d69e3a54 Gradually increase smoke temperature until internal meat temperature of 140º F (60º C) is obtained.
b08c3666-addd-403f-a288-abb8d69e3a54 For a drier sausage: dry for 2 days at 22-16º C (60-70º F), 65-75% humidity or until desired weight loss has occurred.
b08c3666-addd-403f-a288-abb8d69e3a54 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), < 75% humidity.
de394310-c56c-4ed8-a8b8-768fff7fbae0 Grind pork and beef through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
de394310-c56c-4ed8-a8b8-768fff7fbae0 Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
de394310-c56c-4ed8-a8b8-768fff7fbae0 Stuff into beef middles or fibrous casings about 60 mm.
de394310-c56c-4ed8-a8b8-768fff7fbae0 Ferment at 30º C (86º F) for 24 hours, 90-85% humidity.
de394310-c56c-4ed8-a8b8-768fff7fbae0 Introduce warm smoke (43º C, 110º F), 70% humidity, for 6 hours. Gradually increase smoke temperature until internal meat temperature of 140º F (60º C) is obtained.
de394310-c56c-4ed8-a8b8-768fff7fbae0 For a drier sausage: dry for 3 days at 22-16º C (70-60º F), 65-75% humidity or until desired weight loss has occurred.
de394310-c56c-4ed8-a8b8-768fff7fbae0 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75-80% humidity.
e9f0780c-dadf-4c1c-b4c2-090664a208c6 Grind pork and beef through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
e9f0780c-dadf-4c1c-b4c2-090664a208c6 Grind partially frozen back fat through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
e9f0780c-dadf-4c1c-b4c2-090664a208c6 Mix pork, beef and all ingredients together.
e9f0780c-dadf-4c1c-b4c2-090664a208c6 Stuff into beef middles or fibrous casings 40-120 mm.
e9f0780c-dadf-4c1c-b4c2-090664a208c6 Ferment at 30º C (86º F) for 24 hours, 90-85% humidity.
e9f0780c-dadf-4c1c-b4c2-090664a208c6 Introduce warm smoke at 43º C (110º F), 70% humidity for 5 hours. Gradually increase smoke temperature until meat reaches 60º C (140º F) internal temperature.
e9f0780c-dadf-4c1c-b4c2-090664a208c6 For a drier sausage: dry 2 days at 15-12º C (59-53º F), 75% humidity or until desired weight loss has occurred.
e9f0780c-dadf-4c1c-b4c2-090664a208c6 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
95e63f26-d078-4bc3-9d13-169657776df2 Grind pork through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
95e63f26-d078-4bc3-9d13-169657776df2 Dice partially frozen fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
95e63f26-d078-4bc3-9d13-169657776df2 Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
95e63f26-d078-4bc3-9d13-169657776df2 Mix pork, beef, salt, cure #1 and starter culture together. Add remaining ingredients, diced fat and mix again.
95e63f26-d078-4bc3-9d13-169657776df2 Stuff into 36 mm pork casings forming 40 cm (16") links.
95e63f26-d078-4bc3-9d13-169657776df2 Ferment at 20º C (68º F), 90 → 80% humidity for 3 days.
95e63f26-d078-4bc3-9d13-169657776df2 Cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 24 hours.
95e63f26-d078-4bc3-9d13-169657776df2 Dry at 15→12º C (58 → 53º F), 80-75% humidity for 3 weeks - until the sausage looses 33% of its original weight.
95e63f26-d078-4bc3-9d13-169657776df2 Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
1658f6bb-ea39-4b51-a2f7-af9cc55833e6 Weigh a slab of skinless back fat and rub in 5% salt (50 g salt per 1 kg of back fat) on all sides. Place in refrigerator at 4º C (40º F) for 2 weeks. Rinse with cold water to remove any crystallized salt. Cut up into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
1658f6bb-ea39-4b51-a2f7-af9cc55833e6 Grind pork with 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
1658f6bb-ea39-4b51-a2f7-af9cc55833e6 Grind beef with 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
1658f6bb-ea39-4b51-a2f7-af9cc55833e6 Mix all meats and back fat with salt, cure #2 and spices. Pack tightly in a container about 6” (15 cm) deep and hold for 4 days in refrigerator at 4º C (40º F).
1658f6bb-ea39-4b51-a2f7-af9cc55833e6 Stuff firmly into beef rounds.
1658f6bb-ea39-4b51-a2f7-af9cc55833e6 Dry for 1 week at 10º C (50º F).
1658f6bb-ea39-4b51-a2f7-af9cc55833e6 Apply cold smoke at 18º C (68º F) for 2 days. Use hickory, hard maple or oak sawdust.
1658f6bb-ea39-4b51-a2f7-af9cc55833e6 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
5f733fa9-8212-46b0-b8a6-889d40b6f146 Chop ribs into ¾” (2 cm) long pieces. The bones are not removed. Cut skins into smaller strips.
5f733fa9-8212-46b0-b8a6-889d40b6f146 Mix wine, salt, cure #2 and spices together. Add ribs and skins and mix all together. Place in refrigerator for 48 hours.
5f733fa9-8212-46b0-b8a6-889d40b6f146 Stuff firmly into 50 mm natural casing. Make links 20 cm (8") long.
5f733fa9-8212-46b0-b8a6-889d40b6f146 Smoke/dry for 8-10 days by hanging sausages above the kitchen stove. Move the sausages to a different area of the kitchen and dry them for 1-2 months.*
fc00513c-3eb6-4e33-8a36-93c2543c96a9 Cut rib meat and jowls into 20 mm (3/4") pieces. Cut skins into smaller strips.
fc00513c-3eb6-4e33-8a36-93c2543c96a9 Mix salt, cure #2, spices, meat and skins together. Place in refrigerator for 48 hours.
fc00513c-3eb6-4e33-8a36-93c2543c96a9 Stuff firmly into a 50 mm casing. Make links 20 cm (8") long.
fc00513c-3eb6-4e33-8a36-93c2543c96a9 Smoke/dry for 8-10 days by hanging sausages above the kitchen stove. Move the sausages to a different area of the kitchen and dry them for 1-2 months.*
9fb8b854-261a-4e2c-8cd9-47a6dcdb4f6a Trim off the skin from the butt. Using force rub in a generous amount of coarse salt (as needed) all over butt. The butt should rest in a suitable container on a layer of salt and be well covered with salt all around leaving no exposed areas. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
9fb8b854-261a-4e2c-8cd9-47a6dcdb4f6a Brush off the salt, wash briefly in running water and pat dry with paper towels.
9fb8b854-261a-4e2c-8cd9-47a6dcdb4f6a Mix all ingredients with wine to form the marinade paste. Remainder: multiply the above ingredients per weight of butt. No more salt is needed.
9fb8b854-261a-4e2c-8cd9-47a6dcdb4f6a Apply the paste all around the butt. Hold in refrigerator for 48 hours.
9fb8b854-261a-4e2c-8cd9-47a6dcdb4f6a Stuff the butt into pork bungs that will tightly accommodate the piece.
9fb8b854-261a-4e2c-8cd9-47a6dcdb4f6a Ferment/dry at 22-24° C (72-75° F), 85-90% humidity, for 2 days.
9fb8b854-261a-4e2c-8cd9-47a6dcdb4f6a Dry at 15→12° C (59-53° F), 85→75% humidity for 2 months. The butt should lose about 35% of its original weight.
9fb8b854-261a-4e2c-8cd9-47a6dcdb4f6a Store at 10-12° C (°F), <75% humidity.
33428842-6031-470b-80a3-3ea621e3bf06 Grind meat through 5/16” (8 mm) plate.
33428842-6031-470b-80a3-3ea621e3bf06 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
33428842-6031-470b-80a3-3ea621e3bf06 Mix lean pork with salt and cure #2. Add spices and wine. Lastly, add culture and mix all together.
33428842-6031-470b-80a3-3ea621e3bf06 Stuff tightly into pork caecum, bung or bladder.
33428842-6031-470b-80a3-3ea621e3bf06 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
33428842-6031-470b-80a3-3ea621e3bf06 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 2-3 weeks using oak, beech or mixture of both. Maintain high humidity. Smoking does not have to be continuous as long as a low temperature is maintained. Cold smoking is drying with smoke.
33428842-6031-470b-80a3-3ea621e3bf06 Dry at 15→12° C (59→53° F), 80-75% humidity for 6 weeks.
33428842-6031-470b-80a3-3ea621e3bf06 Dry at 10-12° C (50°-55 F), 75% humidity for 10 weeks.
33428842-6031-470b-80a3-3ea621e3bf06 Store at 10-12° C (50°-55 F), 75% humidity.
fb0de4c4-4c07-4f92-bd56-68fea10ad4b3 Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate and mix with starter culture.
fb0de4c4-4c07-4f92-bd56-68fea10ad4b3 Grind pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate. Mix with all ingredients.
fb0de4c4-4c07-4f92-bd56-68fea10ad4b3 Grind partially frozen pork belly through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
fb0de4c4-4c07-4f92-bd56-68fea10ad4b3 Mix everything together.
fb0de4c4-4c07-4f92-bd56-68fea10ad4b3 Stuff into 28-32 mm pork casings, forming 15 cm (6") links.
fb0de4c4-4c07-4f92-bd56-68fea10ad4b3 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 3 days, 95 → 85% humidity.
fb0de4c4-4c07-4f92-bd56-68fea10ad4b3 Cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 12 hours.
fb0de4c4-4c07-4f92-bd56-68fea10ad4b3 Dry at 15→12º C (58 →53º F), 80-75% humidity for 3 weeks - until sausage looses 33% of its original weight.
fb0de4c4-4c07-4f92-bd56-68fea10ad4b3 Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
4738432d-a812-4f36-b0ed-2b0851ce7027 Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
4738432d-a812-4f36-b0ed-2b0851ce7027 Grind pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
4738432d-a812-4f36-b0ed-2b0851ce7027 Grind pork belly through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
4738432d-a812-4f36-b0ed-2b0851ce7027 Mix all meats with ingredients together.
4738432d-a812-4f36-b0ed-2b0851ce7027 Stuff into 32 mm pork casings.
4738432d-a812-4f36-b0ed-2b0851ce7027 Hold at 18-20º C (64-68º F), 90-85% humidity for 96 hours.
4738432d-a812-4f36-b0ed-2b0851ce7027 Smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 24 hours.
4738432d-a812-4f36-b0ed-2b0851ce7027 Dry at 15→12º C (58 →53º F), 80-75% humidity for 3 weeks - until the sausage looses 33% of its original weight.
4738432d-a812-4f36-b0ed-2b0851ce7027 Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
d6356b57-0a47-4231-81b5-3d6e619c5a6b Chop ribs and tails into smaller pieces. Do not remove bones.
d6356b57-0a47-4231-81b5-3d6e619c5a6b Chop other meats.
d6356b57-0a47-4231-81b5-3d6e619c5a6b Mix salt with all spices adding a little water to create a paste.
d6356b57-0a47-4231-81b5-3d6e619c5a6b Mix meats with the paste and hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
d6356b57-0a47-4231-81b5-3d6e619c5a6b Stuff firmly into pork blind cap (caecum) or large diameter casing.
d6356b57-0a47-4231-81b5-3d6e619c5a6b Using oak wood apply cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) 3-4 days. Try to deliver smoke at least 8 hours each day.
d6356b57-0a47-4231-81b5-3d6e619c5a6b Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 65-75% humidity, for at least 3-4 days.
d6356b57-0a47-4231-81b5-3d6e619c5a6b Refrigerate.
4617bcb3-9591-4bf2-93a9-ec896a1fd5ca Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm). Grind beef with ⅛” (3 mm) plate.
4617bcb3-9591-4bf2-93a9-ec896a1fd5ca Mix all ingredients with meat.
4617bcb3-9591-4bf2-93a9-ec896a1fd5ca Stuff firmly into large diameter (36-40 mm) hog casings. Form 24-30” long links, then tie ends together to make a ring.
4617bcb3-9591-4bf2-93a9-ec896a1fd5ca Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
4617bcb3-9591-4bf2-93a9-ec896a1fd5ca Cold smoke for 12 hours (22º C, 72º F).
4617bcb3-9591-4bf2-93a9-ec896a1fd5ca Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity. In about 6-8 weeks a shrink of 30% should be achieved.
4617bcb3-9591-4bf2-93a9-ec896a1fd5ca Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), below 75% humidity.
3b2c6390-7663-48f0-8b7d-625fde7ab526 Chop ribs into ¾” (2 cm) long pieces. The rib bones are not removed.
3b2c6390-7663-48f0-8b7d-625fde7ab526 Chop other bones with attached meat. Cut skins into smaller strips.
3b2c6390-7663-48f0-8b7d-625fde7ab526 Mix wine, salt and spices together. Add ribs, meat and skins and mix all together. Place in refrigerator for 48 hours.
3b2c6390-7663-48f0-8b7d-625fde7ab526 Stuff firmly into a large diameter casing like pork caecum, stomachs or bladders. The casings are not uniform so the shape of the sausage will vary – caecum being long and oval, round and bag-shaped for bladders and stomachs.
3b2c6390-7663-48f0-8b7d-625fde7ab526 Apply a thin cold smoke 18° C (64° F) for 8-10 days. Traditionally, the sausage was hung above the wood fired kitchen stove or in chimneys where it acquired different flavors and smoke from everyday cooking.
3b2c6390-7663-48f0-8b7d-625fde7ab526 Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F) for 2-3 months.
3b2c6390-7663-48f0-8b7d-625fde7ab526 Store in a cool, well ventilated and dark room or refrigerate.
8ae556ef-b0a3-4d12-8c9c-e32d77b76887 Chop ribs and tails into smaller pieces. Do not remove bones.
8ae556ef-b0a3-4d12-8c9c-e32d77b76887 Chop other meats.
8ae556ef-b0a3-4d12-8c9c-e32d77b76887 Mix meats with salt, cure and all ingredients. Place in refrigerator for 24 hours.
8ae556ef-b0a3-4d12-8c9c-e32d77b76887 Stuff firmly into a large diameter casing like pork cap or bung.
8ae556ef-b0a3-4d12-8c9c-e32d77b76887 Using oak wood apply cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 3-4 days (one day being the minimum).
8ae556ef-b0a3-4d12-8c9c-e32d77b76887 Dry at 16-12° C (60-54° F) for 3 weeks.
8ae556ef-b0a3-4d12-8c9c-e32d77b76887 Store at 12° C (60° F), <65% humidity or refrigerate.
ca88f0a4-6019-415b-ae76-145e56ccb88e Cut meats into 50-60 mm (2 “) long pieces.
ca88f0a4-6019-415b-ae76-145e56ccb88e Mix salt with all spices adding a little water to create a paste.
ca88f0a4-6019-415b-ae76-145e56ccb88e Mix meats with the paste and hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
ca88f0a4-6019-415b-ae76-145e56ccb88e Stuff firmly into pork blind cap (caecum).
ca88f0a4-6019-415b-ae76-145e56ccb88e Using oak wood apply cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) 3-4 days. Try to deliver smoke at least for 8 hours each day.
ca88f0a4-6019-415b-ae76-145e56ccb88e Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 65-75% humidity, from 3-4 days to 15-20 days for a drier sausage.
f4fd7234-c292-49a5-8530-977835520894 Grind pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
f4fd7234-c292-49a5-8530-977835520894 Grind back fat through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
f4fd7234-c292-49a5-8530-977835520894 Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
f4fd7234-c292-49a5-8530-977835520894 Mix ground meats with all ingredients.
f4fd7234-c292-49a5-8530-977835520894 Stuff into 60 mm pork or beef middles or permeable synthetic casings.
f4fd7234-c292-49a5-8530-977835520894 Ferment at 20º C (68º F), 95 → 90% humidity for 3 days.
f4fd7234-c292-49a5-8530-977835520894 Dry at 18º C (64º F), 90 → 85% humidity for 2 days.
f4fd7234-c292-49a5-8530-977835520894 Cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 24 hours.
f4fd7234-c292-49a5-8530-977835520894 Dry at 15 → 12º C (59 → 12º F), 85 → 75% humidity for 4 weeks or until sausage looses 30% of its original weight.
f4fd7234-c292-49a5-8530-977835520894 Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
b3c38aad-dc53-46d6-a8ba-be117b06ad40 Grind all meats through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Re-freeze meats and grind again. You may grind once and then emulsify in the food processor without adding water.
b3c38aad-dc53-46d6-a8ba-be117b06ad40 Add all ingredients during this step.
b3c38aad-dc53-46d6-a8ba-be117b06ad40 Stuff firmly into 40-60 mm beef middles or fibrous casings. Form 8-10” (20-25 cm) links.
b3c38aad-dc53-46d6-a8ba-be117b06ad40 Ferment for 24 hours at 18º C (64º F), 75-80% humidity.
b3c38aad-dc53-46d6-a8ba-be117b06ad40 Cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 12 hours.
b3c38aad-dc53-46d6-a8ba-be117b06ad40 Refrigerate.
78d9cb56-9d05-4d6f-871f-1cf92bab702d Curing meat. Cut meat into 1 inch (25 mm) pieces. Place beef, pork and back fat in separate food grade containers. Mix pork and beef with salt, Cure #1 and sugar according to the recipe (estimate amounts).
78d9cb56-9d05-4d6f-871f-1cf92bab702d Back fat needs salt only. Pack tightly to eliminate air and cover with clean cloth. Place for 72 hours in refrigerator. Discard any liquid brine and submit meat to grinding.
78d9cb56-9d05-4d6f-871f-1cf92bab702d Grind beef through 1/8” (2 mm) plate. Grind pork through 1/8” (2 mm) plate. Dice back fat into 3/16” (4 mm) cubes.
78d9cb56-9d05-4d6f-871f-1cf92bab702d Mix beef with salt, cure, sugar and spices. Add pork and mix. Add fat cubes and remix everything together. Don’t add any water.
78d9cb56-9d05-4d6f-871f-1cf92bab702d Stuff sausages firmly into 45-50 mm beef middles or fibrous casings. Sausage length up to 20” (50 cm).
78d9cb56-9d05-4d6f-871f-1cf92bab702d Hang sausages for 5-7 days at 2-4 C, 85-90% humidity.
78d9cb56-9d05-4d6f-871f-1cf92bab702d Using dry wood, smoke sausages for 2-3 days with cold smoke, 18-22 C.
78d9cb56-9d05-4d6f-871f-1cf92bab702d Dry sausages for 5-7 days (depending on sausage diameter) at 11-15 C, 80-84 humidity. Dry 20-23 days more at 10-12 C, 74-78% humidity.
d798cd7e-f231-44f6-9b98-4b79e552d024 Cut all lean pork, fat, tails, tongues, spare ribs and face meats into smaller (finger length) pieces.
d798cd7e-f231-44f6-9b98-4b79e552d024 Mix meats with salt and spices. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
d798cd7e-f231-44f6-9b98-4b79e552d024 Stuff into pork stomachs.
d798cd7e-f231-44f6-9b98-4b79e552d024 Dry at 20° C (68° F) for 20 days.
d798cd7e-f231-44f6-9b98-4b79e552d024 Dry at 15-10° C (59-50° F) for 1-2 months depending on the size of a stomach.
9739bcc8-05e2-4945-8417-85fba61b978d Meat is manually boned, which enables the thorough removal of sinews, gristle and connective tissue. Cut the meat into 3/16” (5 mm) pieces.
9739bcc8-05e2-4945-8417-85fba61b978d Cut fat into 1/8” (3 mm) pieces.
9739bcc8-05e2-4945-8417-85fba61b978d Mix lean meat with all ingredients. Add fat and remix.
9739bcc8-05e2-4945-8417-85fba61b978d Stuff into horse or 40-85 mm fibrous casings forming 13-20” (33-50 cm) long links.
9739bcc8-05e2-4945-8417-85fba61b978d Apply a thin cold smoke at 16° C (60° F) for 12-20 days using beech wood. Cold smoking is not a continuous process, it can be interrupted often, however, the temperature of 16° C shoud be maintained. You are drying the meat with smoke.
9739bcc8-05e2-4945-8417-85fba61b978d Place sausages in a fermenting/drying room at 10-14° C (50-56° F), 86-90% humidity to permit the growth of mold.
9739bcc8-05e2-4945-8417-85fba61b978d The fermentation/drying process continues for 2-3 months depending on the diameter (not the length) of the sausage. Once the mold appears the relative humidity can be lowered, however, it should not drop below 45% as the drying will be too fast.
9739bcc8-05e2-4945-8417-85fba61b978d The total production time from filling the sausages is at least 90 days.
70c3df2a-e889-4ebb-950d-9266cc6d7239 Mix all ingredients together to create a marinade. Cut meat into small pieces.
70c3df2a-e889-4ebb-950d-9266cc6d7239 Immerse meat in the marinade and hold for 3 days in refrigerator. Drain.
70c3df2a-e889-4ebb-950d-9266cc6d7239 Stuff into pig’s stomach, bladder or a large diameter casing.
70c3df2a-e889-4ebb-950d-9266cc6d7239 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 15 days. Smoking need not to be continuous, for example the fire can be put out at night and restarted in the morning as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. The sausage is smoked with oak, chestnut or a mixture of both.
70c3df2a-e889-4ebb-950d-9266cc6d7239 Dry at 12-15° C (54-59° F), 75% humidity for 14 days.
70c3df2a-e889-4ebb-950d-9266cc6d7239 Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity.
594de2db-30fc-403f-aca5-ee66e40eac29 Grind meat and fat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
594de2db-30fc-403f-aca5-ee66e40eac29 Mix all ingredients with ground meat and fat. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
594de2db-30fc-403f-aca5-ee66e40eac29 Stuff firmly into 32 mm hog casings. Make 24” (60 cm) long links.
594de2db-30fc-403f-aca5-ee66e40eac29 Ferment/dry at 25º C (77º F) for 24 hours, 90-85% humidity.
594de2db-30fc-403f-aca5-ee66e40eac29 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 14 days. Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-54º F), <75% humidity or refrigerate.
c8de8293-5172-42b5-a1b9-1e7d15a9c6bb Grind meat through 13 mm (3/8") plate.
c8de8293-5172-42b5-a1b9-1e7d15a9c6bb Mix ground meat with all ingredients until sticky. Do not add water.
c8de8293-5172-42b5-a1b9-1e7d15a9c6bb Stuff into 32-36 mm hog casings forming 15 cm (6”) long links. Leave links in long coils.
c8de8293-5172-42b5-a1b9-1e7d15a9c6bb Condition (hang) sausage for 1-2 days at 2-6° C (35-42° F) and 85-90% humidity.
c8de8293-5172-42b5-a1b9-1e7d15a9c6bb Apply a thin cold smoke for 1-1.5 days until the casings develop yellow-light brown color. Re-arrange smoke sticks or smoke carts during smoking.
c8de8293-5172-42b5-a1b9-1e7d15a9c6bb Dry at 10-12° C (50-53° F) and 75-80% humidity until the yield is 87% in relation to the original weight of the meat. This should take about 2 weeks. Divide sausage coils into pairs.
c8de8293-5172-42b5-a1b9-1e7d15a9c6bb Store at 53° F (12° C) or lower.
48a86af2-27aa-4e3f-a238-7e80625c3f63 Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm). Grind beef with ⅛” (3 mm) plate.
48a86af2-27aa-4e3f-a238-7e80625c3f63 Mix all ingredients with meat.
48a86af2-27aa-4e3f-a238-7e80625c3f63 Stuff firmly into large diameter 36-40 mm hog casings or beef rounds. Make 6” long links.
48a86af2-27aa-4e3f-a238-7e80625c3f63 Dip into surface mold growing solution - Bactoferm™ M-EK-4.
48a86af2-27aa-4e3f-a238-7e80625c3f63 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 95-90% humidity.
48a86af2-27aa-4e3f-a238-7e80625c3f63 Dry for 2 days at 18-16º C (64-60º F), 90-85% humidity.
48a86af2-27aa-4e3f-a238-7e80625c3f63 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85 -80% humidity.
48a86af2-27aa-4e3f-a238-7e80625c3f63 In about 6-8 weeks a shrink of 30% should be achieved.
48a86af2-27aa-4e3f-a238-7e80625c3f63 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
730e0e59-afa2-4da1-97ec-0ee82589f6b8 Grind pork through 3/8” plate (10 mm).
730e0e59-afa2-4da1-97ec-0ee82589f6b8 Grind fat through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
730e0e59-afa2-4da1-97ec-0ee82589f6b8 Dilute starter culture in 1 tablespoon of de-chlorinated water.
730e0e59-afa2-4da1-97ec-0ee82589f6b8 Mix lean meat with salt and cure #2 until sticky. Add spices, culture and fat and mix again.
730e0e59-afa2-4da1-97ec-0ee82589f6b8 Stuff firmly into 38 mm hog casings forming 6” (15 cm) links.
730e0e59-afa2-4da1-97ec-0ee82589f6b8 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
730e0e59-afa2-4da1-97ec-0ee82589f6b8 Apply thin cold smoke ( < 20º C, 68º F) for a 4 days.
730e0e59-afa2-4da1-97ec-0ee82589f6b8 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 1 month. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
730e0e59-afa2-4da1-97ec-0ee82589f6b8 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
0afce984-876d-49e6-ac86-a14813a30ccc Trim the loin off any fat. Keep at 0° C (32° F) for 24 hours.
0afce984-876d-49e6-ac86-a14813a30ccc Rub in salt (as required) all over the loin and refrigerate for 24 hours.
0afce984-876d-49e6-ac86-a14813a30ccc Wash the loin briefly, then cover all around with marinade made by mixing salt (30 g), oil, wine and spices. Hold for 48 hours in refrigerator.
0afce984-876d-49e6-ac86-a14813a30ccc Stuff into 50-60 mm pork bungs or beef middles. The sausage is in a shape of a cylinder about 70 cm (28”) long.
0afce984-876d-49e6-ac86-a14813a30ccc Dry at 14-15° C (57-59° F), 75% humidity, for 2 months. The temperature in the drying chamber was usually controlled by maintaining a slow burning fire and humidity with pans filled with water.
829a79cd-53ab-429d-bf20-d22f5fbf890b Take a slab of skinless back fat and rub in 5% salt (50 g salt per 1 kg of back fat) on all sides. Place in refrigerator at 4º C (40º F) for 2 weeks. Rinse with cold water to remove any crystallized salt. Cut up into 1/2” (12 mm) cubes.
829a79cd-53ab-429d-bf20-d22f5fbf890b Grind pork with 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
829a79cd-53ab-429d-bf20-d22f5fbf890b Grind beef with 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
829a79cd-53ab-429d-bf20-d22f5fbf890b Mix all meats and back fat with salt, cure #2 and spices. Pack tightly in a container about 6” (15 cm) deep and hold for 4 days in refrigerator.
829a79cd-53ab-429d-bf20-d22f5fbf890b Stuff firmly into hog bungs, beef middles or large diameter synthetic protein lined fibrous casings.
829a79cd-53ab-429d-bf20-d22f5fbf890b Dry for 3 weeks at 10º C (50º F).
829a79cd-53ab-429d-bf20-d22f5fbf890b Apply cold smoke at 18º C (68º F) for 2 days.
829a79cd-53ab-429d-bf20-d22f5fbf890b Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F).
68dd701f-244b-4898-86f5-509187dfa94b Grind all meats through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Cool and grind again.
68dd701f-244b-4898-86f5-509187dfa94b Grind partially frozen back fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
68dd701f-244b-4898-86f5-509187dfa94b Mix meats, and all ingredients together. Add fat and mix again.
68dd701f-244b-4898-86f5-509187dfa94b Stuff into 60 mm beef middles or synthetic protein lined fibrous casings.
68dd701f-244b-4898-86f5-509187dfa94b Ferment at 3 days at 20° C (68° F), 95 → 90% humidity.
68dd701f-244b-4898-86f5-509187dfa94b Smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 24 hours.
68dd701f-244b-4898-86f5-509187dfa94b Dry at 15→12º C (58 →53º F), 80-75% humidity for 6 weeks until sausage looses 33% of its original weight.
68dd701f-244b-4898-86f5-509187dfa94b Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
1aa88d8b-0381-4d15-bdc4-2ee5acace500 Grind pork meat with 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
1aa88d8b-0381-4d15-bdc4-2ee5acace500 Chop offal meat into smaller pieces.
1aa88d8b-0381-4d15-bdc4-2ee5acace500 Mix meats with all other ingredients and hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
1aa88d8b-0381-4d15-bdc4-2ee5acace500 Stuff firmly into 32 mm hog casing forming links or rings.
1aa88d8b-0381-4d15-bdc4-2ee5acace500 Smoke at 18° C (64° F) with oak wood for 2-3 days. The smoking process may be interrupted as long as the temperature stays below 18° C (64° F).
1aa88d8b-0381-4d15-bdc4-2ee5acace500 Dry at 12-15° C (53-5°9 F) for 21 days.
1aa88d8b-0381-4d15-bdc4-2ee5acace500 Store at 12° C (53° F), <65% humidity.
b497e2f4-47d8-4b28-8cfd-142adda127b1 Grind chicken and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
b497e2f4-47d8-4b28-8cfd-142adda127b1 Mix all ingredients with meat.
b497e2f4-47d8-4b28-8cfd-142adda127b1 Stuff firmly into 36-40 mm hog casings.
b497e2f4-47d8-4b28-8cfd-142adda127b1 Ferment for 24 hours at 22º C (72º F), 85% humidity.
b497e2f4-47d8-4b28-8cfd-142adda127b1 Optional: during fermentation cold smoke from time to time at 22º C (72º F) or lower.
b497e2f4-47d8-4b28-8cfd-142adda127b1 Dry for 18 days at 14-12º C (58-54º F), 75% humidity. Drying may continue past 18 days but the sausage will be much drier.
f309ef9a-46ab-4f38-86bd-3ca91a76fdf5 Grind pork and fat through 8 mm (3/8") plate.
f309ef9a-46ab-4f38-86bd-3ca91a76fdf5 30 min before use, mix culture with 15 ml (1 Tbsp) de-chlorinated water.
f309ef9a-46ab-4f38-86bd-3ca91a76fdf5 Mix all ingredients with ground pork.
f309ef9a-46ab-4f38-86bd-3ca91a76fdf5 Stuff firmly into 24 mm sheep casings. Make 24” (60 cm) long links.
f309ef9a-46ab-4f38-86bd-3ca91a76fdf5 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
f309ef9a-46ab-4f38-86bd-3ca91a76fdf5 Dry at 15-12º C (59-53º F), 85-80% humidity for 3 weeks.
f309ef9a-46ab-4f38-86bd-3ca91a76fdf5 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
42156d1a-3337-422e-b556-8f835d21a64f Cut meats into 25 mm (1”) pieces. Mix with all ingredients.
42156d1a-3337-422e-b556-8f835d21a64f Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
42156d1a-3337-422e-b556-8f835d21a64f Grind meats through 8 mm (3/8”) plate.
42156d1a-3337-422e-b556-8f835d21a64f Stuff into 20-24 mm sheep casings, forming 15 cm (6”) straight links.
42156d1a-3337-422e-b556-8f835d21a64f Ferment/dry at 22-24° C (72-75° F), 85-90% humidly for 48 hours.
42156d1a-3337-422e-b556-8f835d21a64f Dry at 15-12° C (59-53° F), 80-85% humidity for 6-25 days (depending on a size). Hold semi-dry sausage in refrigerator. Drying sausage for 25 days or more will produce ready to eat dry sausage.
56017263-5b0c-427c-af5a-a1c82ed37426 Grind meat through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
56017263-5b0c-427c-af5a-a1c82ed37426 Mix meat with all ingredients. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
56017263-5b0c-427c-af5a-a1c82ed37426 Stuff into 36 mm pork or beef casings.
56017263-5b0c-427c-af5a-a1c82ed37426 Apply a thin smoke at 20-24º C (68-75º F) (smoking step is optional) or ferment/dry sausages at 20-24º C (68-75º F) for 24-48 hours.
56017263-5b0c-427c-af5a-a1c82ed37426 Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 75-80% humidity for 15 days.
56017263-5b0c-427c-af5a-a1c82ed37426 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
e70a650c-0468-4b3c-9570-6d95beb8743f Grind pork and fat through 8 mm (3/8”) plate.
e70a650c-0468-4b3c-9570-6d95beb8743f Mix all ingredients with ground meat. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
e70a650c-0468-4b3c-9570-6d95beb8743f Stuff into 32-34 mm pork casings forming 30 cm (12") loops OR into 50-60 mm pork bungs making straight sections.
e70a650c-0468-4b3c-9570-6d95beb8743f Ferment/dry at 25-30º C (77-86º F) 2-3 days, 80-85% humidity. Apply a thin cold smoke at <25° C (77° F) during this step.
e70a650c-0468-4b3c-9570-6d95beb8743f Dry 32-34 mm sausages at 12-15º C (53-59º F), 70-75% humidity for 14 days OR pork bungs for 2 months.
e70a650c-0468-4b3c-9570-6d95beb8743f Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity.
05f1e4b0-8d96-47db-bbef-7d6270da2218 Smash garlic and using mortar and pestle grind it with wine into the paste.
05f1e4b0-8d96-47db-bbef-7d6270da2218 Lean cuts from pork head, loin, shoulder, legs. Remove all membranes, sinews, gristles etc.
05f1e4b0-8d96-47db-bbef-7d6270da2218 Grind meat through 8 mm (3/8") plate.
05f1e4b0-8d96-47db-bbef-7d6270da2218 Mix ground meat with all ingredients adding as little water as needed for proper texture of the meat mass. Hold in refrigerator for 48 hours.
05f1e4b0-8d96-47db-bbef-7d6270da2218 Stuff into 40-55 mm pork middles, tying off 8-10 cm (4") links or into 50-90 mm pork bung. Prick each sausage with a needle, especially in visible air pockets. Ferment/dry at 22-24º C (72-75º F) for 48 hours, 90-85% humidity.
05f1e4b0-8d96-47db-bbef-7d6270da2218 Dry sausages for 30 days at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 75-80% humidity. Dry pork bungs longer, depending on diameter, until the sausage looses 33% of its original weight.
05f1e4b0-8d96-47db-bbef-7d6270da2218 Store at 10° C (53° F) in a cool and ventilated area or refrigerate.
dd217cd3-072a-4314-ab3c-a022f8f7b5e4 Grind meat and belly through 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
dd217cd3-072a-4314-ab3c-a022f8f7b5e4 Mix with all spices. Hold the mixture for 12 hours in refrigerator.
dd217cd3-072a-4314-ab3c-a022f8f7b5e4 Stuff into 32-36 mm hog casings forming links, Tie the ends together.
dd217cd3-072a-4314-ab3c-a022f8f7b5e4 Apply a thin cold smoke and dry at 18° C (64° F) for 2 days. Cold smoking does not have to be a continuous process.
dd217cd3-072a-4314-ab3c-a022f8f7b5e4 Dry sausages for 14 days at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 75-80% humidity.
ba0f788b-a544-43ad-95f6-59e6bb4d512a Grind meat through 8 mm (3/8”) plate. For better particle definition manually cut partially frozen fat into 6-10 mm cubes.
ba0f788b-a544-43ad-95f6-59e6bb4d512a Mix meat, fat and all other ingredients and hold in refrigerator for 48 hours.
ba0f788b-a544-43ad-95f6-59e6bb4d512a Stuff into 40-60 mm pork bungs (“tripa cular”) forming 50-60 cm (20-24”) straight sections.
ba0f788b-a544-43ad-95f6-59e6bb4d512a Dry/ferment for 24 hours at 24° C (75° F), 85-90% humidity.
ba0f788b-a544-43ad-95f6-59e6bb4d512a Dry at 12-14° C (53-57° F), 70-80% humidity for 2 months.
ba0f788b-a544-43ad-95f6-59e6bb4d512a Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <75% humidity or refrigerate.
8fba5ebf-216f-47fe-b086-add26264f17b Grind lean meat through 8 mm (3/8”) plate.
8fba5ebf-216f-47fe-b086-add26264f17b Grind fat cuts through 8 mm (3/8”) plate. You can manually cut partially frozen fat into 8 mm pieces for better particle definition.
8fba5ebf-216f-47fe-b086-add26264f17b Mix ground meat with all spices, then add ground fat and mix again. Pack the mixture in container and place for 24-36 hours in refrigerator.
8fba5ebf-216f-47fe-b086-add26264f17b Stuff into 28-32 mm pork or sheep casings forming 10 cm (4”) long links.
8fba5ebf-216f-47fe-b086-add26264f17b Dry/ferment at 22-24° C (72-75° F), 85-90% humidity for 24 hours.
8fba5ebf-216f-47fe-b086-add26264f17b Dry for 48 hours at 15-18° C (59-64° F), 70-80% humidity.
8fba5ebf-216f-47fe-b086-add26264f17b Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F) for 48 hours. At this point Chorizo de Aragón can be classified a semi-dry sausage which is served fried or cooked.
1c955535-f993-46d3-9acf-de92e79d017c Grind beef through 6 mm (1/4") plate. Grind pork through 8 mm (3/8") plate.
1c955535-f993-46d3-9acf-de92e79d017c Dice partially frozen fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
1c955535-f993-46d3-9acf-de92e79d017c Mix ground meats, fat and all ingredients together. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
1c955535-f993-46d3-9acf-de92e79d017c Stuff firmly into 36 mm casings forming 6” (15 cm) long links.
1c955535-f993-46d3-9acf-de92e79d017c Ferment for 24 hours at room temperature, 90-85% humidity.
1c955535-f993-46d3-9acf-de92e79d017c Refrigerate.
1c955535-f993-46d3-9acf-de92e79d017c Cook before serving.
df8b4aa6-3192-41b8-9aa5-b57515ed8b48 Take heart, lungs, stomach, skins and trimmings and cook in water (below boiling point) until soft. Drain and cool.
df8b4aa6-3192-41b8-9aa5-b57515ed8b48 Grind beef and pork through 8 mm (3/8") plate. Grind cooked meats through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
df8b4aa6-3192-41b8-9aa5-b57515ed8b48 Mix meats and all ingredients together. Hold for 12 hours in refrigerator.
df8b4aa6-3192-41b8-9aa5-b57515ed8b48 Stuff into 40-50 mm pork or beef middles.
df8b4aa6-3192-41b8-9aa5-b57515ed8b48 Ferment/dry at 22-24° C (72-75° F), 90% humidity for 48 hours.
df8b4aa6-3192-41b8-9aa5-b57515ed8b48 Dry at 14-15° C (57-59° F), 70% humidity for 30 days.
df8b4aa6-3192-41b8-9aa5-b57515ed8b48 Store at 10-12° C (50-52 F), 60-65% humidity or refrigerate.
ea59e04d-0370-4407-b102-cd1ce8edcfce Cut meat into small pieces and marinate with salt, cure #1, bay leaf, all spices and wine.
ea59e04d-0370-4407-b102-cd1ce8edcfce Scrape the flesh of the pumpkin, discard the seeds. Mash the flesh with potato masher. Wrap around with a cheese cloth, place in a colander, add some weight on top and let it drain overnight.
ea59e04d-0370-4407-b102-cd1ce8edcfce Mix meat, pumpkin and all ingredients together. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
ea59e04d-0370-4407-b102-cd1ce8edcfce Stuff into 36 mm hog casings.
ea59e04d-0370-4407-b102-cd1ce8edcfce Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
ea59e04d-0370-4407-b102-cd1ce8edcfce Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 30 days. The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost.
ea59e04d-0370-4407-b102-cd1ce8edcfce Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity or refrigerate.
13a12627-0132-4082-947f-a85be7f085ee Grind pork through 10 mm (3/8") plate.
13a12627-0132-4082-947f-a85be7f085ee Dice partially frozen fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
13a12627-0132-4082-947f-a85be7f085ee Mix salt, Cure #1, spices and meats together. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
13a12627-0132-4082-947f-a85be7f085ee Stuff into 40 mm natural casings forming 12 cm (5") links.
13a12627-0132-4082-947f-a85be7f085ee Ferment/dry at 25° C (77° F), 85-90% humidity for 30 hours.
13a12627-0132-4082-947f-a85be7f085ee Dry at 14-15° C (57-59° F), 70-80% humidity for 21 days.
13a12627-0132-4082-947f-a85be7f085ee Store at 10-12° C (50-52 F), 60-70% humidity or refrigerate.
349ff03c-bd3e-4c28-972e-06e243300ddb Remove tendons, sinews, hard connective tissue from offal meats, then cook the meats in water (below boiling point) until soft. Drain and cool.
349ff03c-bd3e-4c28-972e-06e243300ddb Chop the onions and cook in water for 45 minutes. Drain and let the moisture evaporate.
349ff03c-bd3e-4c28-972e-06e243300ddb Grind meats through 6 mm (1/4") plate and mix with all spices. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
349ff03c-bd3e-4c28-972e-06e243300ddb Mix the sausage mix with cooked onions and stuff without delay into 40 mm pig casings forming links ~ 15 cm (6") long.
349ff03c-bd3e-4c28-972e-06e243300ddb Apply cold smoke at 15-18º C (53-64º F) for 7-10 days. Smoking need not to be continuous.
349ff03c-bd3e-4c28-972e-06e243300ddb Dry at 15-12º C (59-53º F), 75-80% humidity for 45 days.
349ff03c-bd3e-4c28-972e-06e243300ddb Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
5244f05d-4f90-4d87-ade4-36a52fc00a15 Grind meat through 8 mm (3/8") plate.
5244f05d-4f90-4d87-ade4-36a52fc00a15 Grind fat through 8 mm (3/8") plate.
5244f05d-4f90-4d87-ade4-36a52fc00a15 Mix meat with all ingredients. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
5244f05d-4f90-4d87-ade4-36a52fc00a15 Stuff into 36 mm pork or beef casings.
5244f05d-4f90-4d87-ade4-36a52fc00a15 Apply a thin smoke at 22-24º C (72-75º F) (smoking step optional) or dry/ferment sausages at 22-24º C (72-75º F) for 24-48 hours.
5244f05d-4f90-4d87-ade4-36a52fc00a15 Dry at 15-12º C (59-53º F), 75-80% humidity for 15 days.
5244f05d-4f90-4d87-ade4-36a52fc00a15 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
10b907b7-99a5-4c0d-809e-266b14dc5e40 Grind meats into 8 mm (3/8”) pieces.
10b907b7-99a5-4c0d-809e-266b14dc5e40 Mix meats with salt and spices. Marinate for 24 hours in refrigerator.
10b907b7-99a5-4c0d-809e-266b14dc5e40 Stuff into 40-45 mm beef middles forming small 15 cm (6”) rings. Tie the ends together.
10b907b7-99a5-4c0d-809e-266b14dc5e40 Apply a thin smoke at 22-24º C (72-75º F) and dry/ferment sausages at 22-24º C (72-75º F) for 24-48 hours.
10b907b7-99a5-4c0d-809e-266b14dc5e40 Dry at 15-12º C (59-53º F), 75-80% humidity for 30 days.
10b907b7-99a5-4c0d-809e-266b14dc5e40 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
99fdc880-1b3e-4d7e-bec2-aeadc11138c8 Grind meat and pork fat through 10 mm (3/8") plate.
99fdc880-1b3e-4d7e-bec2-aeadc11138c8 Mix meats with spices and hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
99fdc880-1b3e-4d7e-bec2-aeadc11138c8 Stuff into 36 mm pork casings forming U-shaped loops with ends tied together.
99fdc880-1b3e-4d7e-bec2-aeadc11138c8 In other locations apply cold smoke at <18° C (64° F) and dry sausages at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 85-75% humidity.
99fdc880-1b3e-4d7e-bec2-aeadc11138c8 Apply a thin smoke at 22-24º C (72-75º F) and dry/ferment sausages at 22-24º C (72-75º F) for 24-48 hours.
99fdc880-1b3e-4d7e-bec2-aeadc11138c8 Dry at 15-12º C (59-53º F), 75-80% humidity for 30 days. The temperature in LeΌn can reach low levels so a slow burning fire is started to warm up the drying chamber. This means that the sausages are additionally cold smoked during the drying stage .
99fdc880-1b3e-4d7e-bec2-aeadc11138c8 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
2ea9ec71-4439-4456-b7c2-ea91401a6432 Grind pork through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
2ea9ec71-4439-4456-b7c2-ea91401a6432 Dice fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
2ea9ec71-4439-4456-b7c2-ea91401a6432 Grind beef through 3-5 mm (1/8”) plate.
2ea9ec71-4439-4456-b7c2-ea91401a6432 Mix ground meats, fat and spices together. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
2ea9ec71-4439-4456-b7c2-ea91401a6432 Stuff into 36 mm pork or beef casings.
2ea9ec71-4439-4456-b7c2-ea91401a6432 Apply a thin smoke at 22-24º C (72-75º F) (smoking step optional) or dry/ferment sausages at 22-24º C (72-75º F) for 24-48 hours.
2ea9ec71-4439-4456-b7c2-ea91401a6432 Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 75-80% humidity for 15 days.
2ea9ec71-4439-4456-b7c2-ea91401a6432 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
8260de3f-fd2c-4623-84ad-a3060d563a54 Grind pork and beef through 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
8260de3f-fd2c-4623-84ad-a3060d563a54 Dice partially frozen back fat 3-5 mm (1/8-1/4”) cubes.
8260de3f-fd2c-4623-84ad-a3060d563a54 Mix ground meats with all spices. Add ground fat and mix all together. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
8260de3f-fd2c-4623-84ad-a3060d563a54 Stuff into 55-80 mm natural or artificial permeable (allowing liquids or gases to pass through) casings. Make straight links ~20 cm (8") long. Prick with needle to remove air.
8260de3f-fd2c-4623-84ad-a3060d563a54 Dry/ferment sausages at 22-24º C (72-75º F) for 48 hours.
8260de3f-fd2c-4623-84ad-a3060d563a54 Dry for 45-60 days at 15→12° C (59→53° F), 65-85% humidity. You can apply old smoke (<18° C/64° F) during this step. Cold smoking is performed with a thin smoke and the process is usually interrupted at night time and resumed in the morning, however cold smoking can be interrupted at any time.
8260de3f-fd2c-4623-84ad-a3060d563a54 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
12c813ad-e796-4cc6-9509-82dcede2b003 Grind meat and belly through 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
12c813ad-e796-4cc6-9509-82dcede2b003 Mix with all ingredients and hold in refrigerator for 12 hours.
12c813ad-e796-4cc6-9509-82dcede2b003 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings and form links using one continuous string of butcher twine.
12c813ad-e796-4cc6-9509-82dcede2b003 Smoke and dry with oak wood at 15-18° C (59-64° F), 70-80% humidity for 25 days. The smoking process can be interrupted, so it is smoking-drying-smoking-drying etc. Usually drying at night and smoking by day. As the process continues start lowering slowly temperature.
cddb740e-6f52-4c92-8368-24d14a05181b Dice a half of the partially frozen fat (150 g) into 6-8 mm (1/4-3/8") cubes.
cddb740e-6f52-4c92-8368-24d14a05181b Grind pork meat and remaining fat (150 g) through 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
cddb740e-6f52-4c92-8368-24d14a05181b Mix meat, all fat with ll ingredients. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
cddb740e-6f52-4c92-8368-24d14a05181b Stuff into 26-80 mm pork or beef casings. Thin sausages were linked with butcher twine (rastra style) or formed into rings with ends tied together (herradura style), and the thick ones left in straight sections (vela style).
cddb740e-6f52-4c92-8368-24d14a05181b Dry/ferment sausages at 22-24º C (72-75º F) for 48 hours.
cddb740e-6f52-4c92-8368-24d14a05181b Dry at 15-12° C (59-53° F), 70-80% humidity, for 30-50 days depending on diameter. The sausages are considered dry when they lose about 33% of their original weight.
d1376510-1a4b-4b57-8946-7931a8adeddd Cut meat and fat into 30 mm (1.3”) pieces.
d1376510-1a4b-4b57-8946-7931a8adeddd Mix meat and fat with salt and spices. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
d1376510-1a4b-4b57-8946-7931a8adeddd Stuff into 40-60 mm pork bungs (tripa cular) or beef bungs (tripa roscal) forming 50-60 cm (20-24”) straight sections (vela) or make loops with ends tied together (herradura).
d1376510-1a4b-4b57-8946-7931a8adeddd Dry/ferment with a thin oak smoke at 22-24° C (72-77° F) for 48 hours.
d1376510-1a4b-4b57-8946-7931a8adeddd Dry at 15-12° C (59-53° F), 60-80% humidity, for 40-60 days, depending on the diameter of the sausage until it loses about 33% of its original weight.
d1376510-1a4b-4b57-8946-7931a8adeddd Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
9c12c9c2-ac3c-4772-9318-a2e343ef9323 Grind lean pork and fat through 5-8 mm (1/4”) plate.
9c12c9c2-ac3c-4772-9318-a2e343ef9323 Mix meats with all ingredients. Hold in refrigerator for 48 hours.
9c12c9c2-ac3c-4772-9318-a2e343ef9323 Stuff into 40-50 mm hog casings. Form 5-10 cm (3-4”) links or 45 cm (18”) straight sections or 45 cm (18”) rings.
9c12c9c2-ac3c-4772-9318-a2e343ef9323 Dry/ferment at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 80-85% humidity, for 2-3 days.
9c12c9c2-ac3c-4772-9318-a2e343ef9323 Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 80% humidity for 1-2 months depending on the diameter of the sausage.
9c12c9c2-ac3c-4772-9318-a2e343ef9323 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
95041aec-d84e-4929-ba85-205c5c5d3e8d Cut or grind meat and fat into 8 mm (3/8') pieces.
95041aec-d84e-4929-ba85-205c5c5d3e8d Mix salt, cure #1 and spices together. Mix with meats.
95041aec-d84e-4929-ba85-205c5c5d3e8d Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
95041aec-d84e-4929-ba85-205c5c5d3e8d Stuff firmly into 36 mm pork casing forming 15 cm (6”) links.
95041aec-d84e-4929-ba85-205c5c5d3e8d Smoke at 18° C (64° F) with oak wood for 12-48 hours.
95041aec-d84e-4929-ba85-205c5c5d3e8d Dry at 12-15° C (53-5°9 F) for 30-45 days.
95041aec-d84e-4929-ba85-205c5c5d3e8d Store in a dark place at 12° C or less, <65% humidity.
a7d3a47c-32db-4a34-9fc7-99795b97545c Cut chilled lean pork into 35 mm (1.5”) pieces.
a7d3a47c-32db-4a34-9fc7-99795b97545c Dice partially frozen fat into 12 mm (1/2”) cubes.
a7d3a47c-32db-4a34-9fc7-99795b97545c Mix meats with salt and spices. Marinate for 24 hours in refrigerator.
a7d3a47c-32db-4a34-9fc7-99795b97545c Stuff into 50-55 mm pork bungs or beef middles, about 40-50 cm (16-20") long.
a7d3a47c-32db-4a34-9fc7-99795b97545c Dry/ferment at 22-24° C (72-77° F), 80-85% humidity, for 48 hours.
a7d3a47c-32db-4a34-9fc7-99795b97545c Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 80% humidity, for about 45 days. When temperatures were dropping low a slow burning fire provided heat in a chamber.
a7d3a47c-32db-4a34-9fc7-99795b97545c Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
c9a88fbe-e4fb-4818-bb0a-01bb935a2f93 Grind meat and pork belly through 8 mm (3/8”) plate.
c9a88fbe-e4fb-4818-bb0a-01bb935a2f93 Dice partially frozen hard fat into 6-8 mm (1/4-3/8") cubes.
c9a88fbe-e4fb-4818-bb0a-01bb935a2f93 Mix meats, fat, potatoes and spices together. Hold for 6 hours in refrigerator.
c9a88fbe-e4fb-4818-bb0a-01bb935a2f93 Stuff into 45-50 mm beef middles forming 20 cm (8”) links.
c9a88fbe-e4fb-4818-bb0a-01bb935a2f93 Dry at 10-12° C (50-53° F), 80% humidity, for 35 days.
c9a88fbe-e4fb-4818-bb0a-01bb935a2f93 Dry at room temperature (below 15° C/59° F) until fully cured what will take about 60 days total, depending on the diameter of the sausage and drying conditions.
6d31e791-496d-4545-a16e-bcebc62ceabb Boil potatoes until cooked, but do not overcook. Drain and cool.
6d31e791-496d-4545-a16e-bcebc62ceabb Cut potatoes, lean pork and fat into 6-8 mm (1/4-3/8”) cubes.
6d31e791-496d-4545-a16e-bcebc62ceabb Mix the mixture with salt, blood and spices. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
6d31e791-496d-4545-a16e-bcebc62ceabb Stuff into 28-40 mm natural casings forming links or loops 15-20 cm (6-5”) long.
6d31e791-496d-4545-a16e-bcebc62ceabb Dry at 14-16° C (57-60° F), 75% humidity, for 10-15 days, depending on the diameter of the sausage.
6d31e791-496d-4545-a16e-bcebc62ceabb Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <65% humidity or in refrigerator.
67c5b083-0131-4da3-b0e6-6f379d2362f0 Grind meat with 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
67c5b083-0131-4da3-b0e6-6f379d2362f0 Mix with all ingredients and place in refrigerator for 24 hours.
67c5b083-0131-4da3-b0e6-6f379d2362f0 Stuff into 32-34 mm hog casings linking sausages every 10 cm (4”).
67c5b083-0131-4da3-b0e6-6f379d2362f0 Apply a thin smoke at 22-24º C (72-75º F) and dry/ferment sausages at 22-24º C (72-75º F), 80-85% humidity for 48 hours.
67c5b083-0131-4da3-b0e6-6f379d2362f0 Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 75-80% humidity for 21 days.
67c5b083-0131-4da3-b0e6-6f379d2362f0 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
6dd3e332-7726-4eae-aadf-81bde9cff75d Grind all meat through 3/8” plate (10 mm).
6dd3e332-7726-4eae-aadf-81bde9cff75d Mix meat with all ingredients.
6dd3e332-7726-4eae-aadf-81bde9cff75d Hold the sausage mass for 24 hours in refrigerator.
6dd3e332-7726-4eae-aadf-81bde9cff75d Stuff the sausage mass in: 32-34 mm pork casings making 30 cm (12") rings (sarta style), OR 40-50 mm pork or beef middles forming straight sections (vela style).
6dd3e332-7726-4eae-aadf-81bde9cff75d Dry/ferment at 22-24º C (72-75º F), 80-85% for 2-4 days. In home production the temperature of the chamber was controlled by burning oak wood.
6dd3e332-7726-4eae-aadf-81bde9cff75d Dry at 12-15º C (53-59º F), 75-80% humidity for: 32-34 mm casings - 15-18 days, OR 40-50 mm pork middles - 25-30 days.
6dd3e332-7726-4eae-aadf-81bde9cff75d Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65-70% humidity or refrigerate.
1499ec2d-d204-4f3e-ac43-dbf6f358a428 Grind meat and fat through 8 mm (3/8") plate.
1499ec2d-d204-4f3e-ac43-dbf6f358a428 Mix all ingredients with meat. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
1499ec2d-d204-4f3e-ac43-dbf6f358a428 Stuff firmly into 32-36 mm hog casings, form 6” long links.
1499ec2d-d204-4f3e-ac43-dbf6f358a428 Ferment/dry at 22-24º C (72-75º F) for 48 hours, 90-85% humidity. A thin smoke at 22-24º C (72-75º F) can be applied during this step.
1499ec2d-d204-4f3e-ac43-dbf6f358a428 Dry for 6-8 weeks at 16-12º C (60-54º F), gradually decreasing humidity from 85 to 75%.
1499ec2d-d204-4f3e-ac43-dbf6f358a428 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity or refrigerate.
c99ce127-0e14-4d30-9743-bcd8bb4e482d Grind meat through 8 mm (3/8”) plate.
c99ce127-0e14-4d30-9743-bcd8bb4e482d Dice fat into 8 mm (3/8”) cubes.
c99ce127-0e14-4d30-9743-bcd8bb4e482d Mix meat and fat with salt and spices. Hold in refrigerator for 12 hours.
c99ce127-0e14-4d30-9743-bcd8bb4e482d Stuff into 20-25 mm sheep casings forming rings about 30 cm (1 foot) long OR into 50-60 mm pork bungs or beef casings forming straight sections.
c99ce127-0e14-4d30-9743-bcd8bb4e482d Dry/ferment at 18-20º C (64-67º F), 85-90% humidity for 3 days.
c99ce127-0e14-4d30-9743-bcd8bb4e482d Dry for 4-8 weeks, depending on diameter, at 15-12º C (59-53º F), gradually decreasing humidity from 85 to 75%.
c99ce127-0e14-4d30-9743-bcd8bb4e482d Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity or refrigerate.
ad168814-a7d9-4e31-b4a7-11085b53a10a Cut all meats into smaller chunks.
ad168814-a7d9-4e31-b4a7-11085b53a10a Mix meats with all ingredients and hold in refrigerator for 48 hours.
ad168814-a7d9-4e31-b4a7-11085b53a10a Stuff firmly into pork blind cap (caecum).
ad168814-a7d9-4e31-b4a7-11085b53a10a Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 8 days.
ad168814-a7d9-4e31-b4a7-11085b53a10a Dry at 15-12° C (59-53° F), 75-80% humidity for minimum of 8 days.
ad168814-a7d9-4e31-b4a7-11085b53a10a Keep refrigerated.
4e5c7570-d499-498f-a7ce-151d8da21c60 Cut all meats into smaller chunks.
4e5c7570-d499-498f-a7ce-151d8da21c60 Mix meats with all ingredients and hold in refrigerator for 2 days.
4e5c7570-d499-498f-a7ce-151d8da21c60 Stuff firmly into pork blind cap (caecum), 60-70 mm pork middles, or 70-90 mm pork bungs.
4e5c7570-d499-498f-a7ce-151d8da21c60 Dry at 15-12° C (59-53° F), 75-80% humidity in a dark, well ventilated rom for 2-3 months. Sausage is done when it loses 30% of its original weight.
4e5c7570-d499-498f-a7ce-151d8da21c60 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity or refrigerate.
df80ae34-a7c1-433b-80d7-8421f7299495 The meat is cut into small pieces, seasoned with salt, cure#1, garlic and wine for 5 days in refrigerator. Then it is drained and paprika is added.
df80ae34-a7c1-433b-80d7-8421f7299495 Stuff the mixture into 36 mm hog casing and tie the ends together forming a ring.
df80ae34-a7c1-433b-80d7-8421f7299495 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 10-15 days. Smoking need not to be continuous, for example the fire can be put out at night and restarted in the morning as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. The sausage is smoked with oak wood.
df80ae34-a7c1-433b-80d7-8421f7299495 Refrigerate.
2398a354-8b30-469a-90e1-6af093ee82d4 Grind meat through 5/16” (8 mm) plate.
2398a354-8b30-469a-90e1-6af093ee82d4 Grind fat through 5/16” (8 mm) plate.
2398a354-8b30-469a-90e1-6af093ee82d4 Mix meat, fat and all ingredients together. Place the mixture for a week in a refrigerator or a cool place where temperature will not exceed 11 ° C (52º F). Cover the container and stir the mixture twice a day.
2398a354-8b30-469a-90e1-6af093ee82d4 Stuff firmly into small diameter (< 30 mm) hog casings forming horse-shoe shaped loops about 1 foot (30 cm) long.
2398a354-8b30-469a-90e1-6af093ee82d4 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 15 days using hard wood chips.
2398a354-8b30-469a-90e1-6af093ee82d4 Dry at 16 → 12º C (60-54º F), 85 → 80% humidity for 21 days. The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost.
2398a354-8b30-469a-90e1-6af093ee82d4 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), < 75% humidity.
8549696b-6a2a-417a-975e-0e953ee8ad47 Cut meat into 1” (25 mm) cubes.
8549696b-6a2a-417a-975e-0e953ee8ad47 Make a marinade by mixing all ingredients with wine and water.
8549696b-6a2a-417a-975e-0e953ee8ad47 Mix meat with marinade and place for 12 hours in refrigerator. Drain.
8549696b-6a2a-417a-975e-0e953ee8ad47 Stuff firmly into 32 mm hog casings. Make a ring by tying both ends together.
8549696b-6a2a-417a-975e-0e953ee8ad47 Hold for 1-2 hours at room temperature.
8549696b-6a2a-417a-975e-0e953ee8ad47 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 14 days. Smoking need not to be continuous, for example the fire can be put out at night and restarted in the morning as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. The sausage is smoked with oak, chestnut or a mixture of both.
8549696b-6a2a-417a-975e-0e953ee8ad47 Dry at 12-15° C (54-59° F), 75% humidity for 21 days.
8549696b-6a2a-417a-975e-0e953ee8ad47 Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity.
d4639863-a446-4bcd-a97d-6a664c312fb6 Cut meat into 3/8” (10 mm) pieces.
d4639863-a446-4bcd-a97d-6a664c312fb6 Mix with all ingredients.
d4639863-a446-4bcd-a97d-6a664c312fb6 Stuff firmly into 36 mm hog casings and tie off into 10” (25 cm) rings.
d4639863-a446-4bcd-a97d-6a664c312fb6 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 2 days.
d4639863-a446-4bcd-a97d-6a664c312fb6 Dry for 30 days at 12-15º C (54-59º F), 70-75% humidity.
d4639863-a446-4bcd-a97d-6a664c312fb6 Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity.
2012815f-3423-4fc1-a74e-f9ddc93f95e7 Chop meat into sizes suitable for cooking. Place all meats in a pot, add some salt and cover with water. Occasionally soup greens are added for better flavor. Simmer the meat until soft. Drain meats but save the meat stock.
2012815f-3423-4fc1-a74e-f9ddc93f95e7 Spread the meat on the table and separate meat from bones when the meat is still warm.
2012815f-3423-4fc1-a74e-f9ddc93f95e7 Break up or cut up white bread (the crust is left on) and soak it in the hot meat stock adding strips of meat, all spices and all ingredients. Drain and squeeze the excess stock out.
2012815f-3423-4fc1-a74e-f9ddc93f95e7 Stuff into 70-100 mm hog casings (pork middles, fatends or bungs) about 10” (25 cm) long.
2012815f-3423-4fc1-a74e-f9ddc93f95e7 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 4 weeks using local wood (oak, chestnut). Smoking need not to be continuous, for example the fire can be put out at night and restarted in the morning as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. Think of the process as drying with smoke.
2012815f-3423-4fc1-a74e-f9ddc93f95e7 Hold at 12-15° C (54-59° F), 75% humidity for 7 days.
2012815f-3423-4fc1-a74e-f9ddc93f95e7 Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity or refrigerate.
d49e4363-86ca-40d9-b671-97c8333bd48c Cut the meat and fat into small pieces and marinate with salt, cure #1, bay leaf, garlic and wine for up to 5 days. Stir daily.
d49e4363-86ca-40d9-b671-97c8333bd48c Scrape the flesh of the squash (or pumpkin), discard the seeds. Wrap around with a cloth (or cheese cloth), place in a colander, add some weight on top and let it drain for 2 days.
d49e4363-86ca-40d9-b671-97c8333bd48c Mix meat, squash, paprika, chili, cinnamon and ginger together.
d49e4363-86ca-40d9-b671-97c8333bd48c Stuff into 60 mm hog casing. The casing is tied shut with two simple knots at each end, using a single piece of cotton twine, giving the sausage a horseshoe shape.
d49e4363-86ca-40d9-b671-97c8333bd48c Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 30 days. Smoking need not to be continuous, for example the fire can be put out at night and restarted in the morning as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. Think of the process as drying with smoke. The sausage is smoked with oak.
d49e4363-86ca-40d9-b671-97c8333bd48c Dry at 12-15° C (54-59° F), 75% humidity for 7 days.
d49e4363-86ca-40d9-b671-97c8333bd48c Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity.
3a2267c5-4f05-4b3d-8d28-b29b3b7227fe Cut meat into 1/2” (12 mm) pieces.
3a2267c5-4f05-4b3d-8d28-b29b3b7227fe Mix with all ingredients.
3a2267c5-4f05-4b3d-8d28-b29b3b7227fe Stuff firmly into 30 mm hog casings. Tie the ends together making a 8-12” (20-30 cm) long loop.
3a2267c5-4f05-4b3d-8d28-b29b3b7227fe Smoke with oak wood at 30° C (86° F) for at least 3 days.
3a2267c5-4f05-4b3d-8d28-b29b3b7227fe Store at at 5-8° C (41-46° F), 75% humidity. The sausage will start loosing moisture and in time will become a dry sausage.
2298a4da-435c-4f2d-8577-5bd407d67990 Make a marinade by mixing all ingredients with wine and water.
2298a4da-435c-4f2d-8577-5bd407d67990 Separately, cut meat and fat into 3/4” (20 mm) pieces.
2298a4da-435c-4f2d-8577-5bd407d67990 Mix meat and fat with marinade. Hold for 2 days at 10° C (50° F), 80-90% humidity or keep in refrigerator. Stir daily.
2298a4da-435c-4f2d-8577-5bd407d67990 Stuff into 36-45 mm hog or beef casings. Tie the ends together to make a loop about 16” (40 cm) long.
2298a4da-435c-4f2d-8577-5bd407d67990 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 3-10 days (depending on diameter). Smoking need not to be continuous, as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. Think of the process as drying with smoke. The sausage is smoked with oak.
2298a4da-435c-4f2d-8577-5bd407d67990 Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity.
9c036659-0c9c-49f1-8013-28a7a7a78603 Pepper paste. Cut bell peppers lengthwise into halves. Discard stems and seeds. Get a suitable pan and sprinkle salt on the bottom. Place peppers on salt, then cover them with more salt. Repeat the procedure creating a multilayer combination with salt being the top layer. Hold for 8 days. Rinse with water, pat dry with paper towel and grind through 1/8” (3 mm) plate or emulsify in food processor.
9c036659-0c9c-49f1-8013-28a7a7a78603 Make marinade by mixing salt, cure #1, spices, water and wine.
9c036659-0c9c-49f1-8013-28a7a7a78603 Chop the meat and fat into 3/8” (10 mm) cubes.
9c036659-0c9c-49f1-8013-28a7a7a78603 Marinate the meat and fat in marinade for 3 days in refrigerator or at <10° C (50° F).
9c036659-0c9c-49f1-8013-28a7a7a78603 Mix pepper paste with marinated meat.
9c036659-0c9c-49f1-8013-28a7a7a78603 Stuff firmly into 36 mm hog casings. Tie the ends together to form a loop.
9c036659-0c9c-49f1-8013-28a7a7a78603 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 7 days. Smoking need not to be continuous, as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. Think of the process as drying with smoke. The sausage is smoked with oak.
9c036659-0c9c-49f1-8013-28a7a7a78603 Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity.
b0f7a207-1a53-4dff-b983-25d32af04a4f Grind lean meat through 1/4” (5 mm) plate, then grind it twice through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
b0f7a207-1a53-4dff-b983-25d32af04a4f Cut pork belly into 1” (25 mm) cubes and partially freeze.
b0f7a207-1a53-4dff-b983-25d32af04a4f Grind pork belly with 1/8” (3 mm) plate, partially refreeze and grind again. Hold in refrigerator until needed.
b0f7a207-1a53-4dff-b983-25d32af04a4f Crush juniper berries and grind them in spice mill.
b0f7a207-1a53-4dff-b983-25d32af04a4f Mix lean meat with all ingredients until sticky.
b0f7a207-1a53-4dff-b983-25d32af04a4f Add ground belly and mix all again.
b0f7a207-1a53-4dff-b983-25d32af04a4f Stuff into beef middles or large diameter hog casings (45 - 100 mm), 6 - 18” (15 - 45 cm) long.
b0f7a207-1a53-4dff-b983-25d32af04a4f Apply a thin cold smoke at 15-18° C (59-64° F) for 2-3 days.
b0f7a207-1a53-4dff-b983-25d32af04a4f Dry sausages for 30 - 45 days (depending on diameter) at 12-15° C (53 - 59°- F), 65-80% humidity.
b0f7a207-1a53-4dff-b983-25d32af04a4f Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), 65-70% humidity.
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Curing back fat. Sprinkle salt on the bottom of the curing container, then take a slab of pork fat and forcefully rub in salt into it on all sides. You could use a zip-lock plastic bag as food container. Sprinkle more salt on top. Hold in refrigerator for 3 weeks. Shake off the salt, rinse with cold water and pat dry. Place in freezer for 30 minutes.
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Grind pork through 1/8” plate (3 mm).
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Stir the culture in 1 tablespoon of cold de-chlorinated water 30 minutes before use.
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Mix/knead ground pork with salt and cure # 2 until sticky. Add all remaining ingredients and mix thoroughly.
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Cut back fat into strips 4’ (100 mm) x 3/4” (20 mm) square.
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Coglioni di Mulo has an oval shape and traditional weight of 330 g (12 oz).
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Divide meat paste into portions of about 330 g. Flatten the meat paste into a 1/2” (12 mm) patty making a heart-shaped form. Place a back fat stick on each end of the patty and fold it up into a tear drop shape (this is why the sausage is called “mule’s balls”).
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Cut a suitable casing such as beef middle or a large hog casings. The casing will overlap the tear drop shaped sausage. It is like wrapping up a gift. Fold the casing over, make loops across with butcher’s twine and tie it lengthwise making a hanging loop at one end..
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 4-6 weeks. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
1cf12975-97f4-4179-b7b2-235617e5ca16 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
dbd49848-cd49-48c6-addf-3b0bd73b07af Meat is manually boned, which enables the thorough removal of sinews, gristle and connective tissue.
dbd49848-cd49-48c6-addf-3b0bd73b07af Grind meat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
dbd49848-cd49-48c6-addf-3b0bd73b07af Grind fat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
dbd49848-cd49-48c6-addf-3b0bd73b07af Mix with salt, cure #2 and spices.
dbd49848-cd49-48c6-addf-3b0bd73b07af Stuff into 40-60 mm hog or synthetic fibrous casings forming 8-22” (20 - 55cm) links.
dbd49848-cd49-48c6-addf-3b0bd73b07af Apply a thin cold smoke for 3-5 days at 20° C (66° F), 70-90% humidity. Original Gyulai kolbasz was smoked with beech wood.
dbd49848-cd49-48c6-addf-3b0bd73b07af Dry for 4 -6 weeks at 18° → 16° C (64-60° F), 90-92% humidity, then gradually reduce humidity to 70 → 65%.
dbd49848-cd49-48c6-addf-3b0bd73b07af Store at 12° C (54° F), 65% humidity.
569bc5c6-e566-4d7b-8dd8-bb5ebcf08fcb Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
569bc5c6-e566-4d7b-8dd8-bb5ebcf08fcb Grind pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
569bc5c6-e566-4d7b-8dd8-bb5ebcf08fcb Grind partially frozen fat through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
569bc5c6-e566-4d7b-8dd8-bb5ebcf08fcb Stuff into 55 mm beef or pork middles or synthetic protein lined casings. Form 50 cm (20") straight links.
569bc5c6-e566-4d7b-8dd8-bb5ebcf08fcb Ferment at 20° C (68° F), 95 → 85% humidity for 3 days.
569bc5c6-e566-4d7b-8dd8-bb5ebcf08fcb Cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 1 day.
569bc5c6-e566-4d7b-8dd8-bb5ebcf08fcb Dry at 15→12º C (58 →53º F), 80-75% humidity for 5 weeks until sausage looses 33% of its original weight.
569bc5c6-e566-4d7b-8dd8-bb5ebcf08fcb Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
34514f63-1bd6-42af-b9f3-67353206a807 Cut meat into 25 mm (1”) pieces. Mix with all ingredients and marinate overnight.
34514f63-1bd6-42af-b9f3-67353206a807 Grind marinated meat with 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
34514f63-1bd6-42af-b9f3-67353206a807 Grind fat with 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
34514f63-1bd6-42af-b9f3-67353206a807 Mix meat and fat together.
34514f63-1bd6-42af-b9f3-67353206a807 Stuff into 24-24 mm sheep casings, link every 10 cm (4”) long.
34514f63-1bd6-42af-b9f3-67353206a807 Air dry at 45-48° C (113-120° F) for 48 hours without smoke.
34514f63-1bd6-42af-b9f3-67353206a807 This is a semi-dry sausage that must be refrigerated and cooked before serving.
34514f63-1bd6-42af-b9f3-67353206a807 To make a dry sausage keep on drying/storing at 1°2 C (53° F) until the sausage loses 35% of its original weight.
21747225-1003-494f-ab09-699d4b603738 Cut the meat into 1” (25 mm) cubes.
21747225-1003-494f-ab09-699d4b603738 Mix with salt and cure #1, pack tightly, cover with clean cloth and place for 2 days in refrigerator.
21747225-1003-494f-ab09-699d4b603738 Grind through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
21747225-1003-494f-ab09-699d4b603738 Mix with all remaining ingredients.
21747225-1003-494f-ab09-699d4b603738 Stuff in to 24 mm sheep casings.
21747225-1003-494f-ab09-699d4b603738 Dry for 2 weeks at 12-15° C (54-59° F), 75-80% humidity.
21747225-1003-494f-ab09-699d4b603738 Store at 12° C (54° F), 60-70% humidity.
695854f3-14e3-489b-8bff-a18a9d131b52 Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Add culture and mix together.
695854f3-14e3-489b-8bff-a18a9d131b52 Grind pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate. Mix with beef adding spices.
695854f3-14e3-489b-8bff-a18a9d131b52 Grind back fat through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
695854f3-14e3-489b-8bff-a18a9d131b52 Mix everything together.
695854f3-14e3-489b-8bff-a18a9d131b52 Stuff into 46 mm pork or beef casings forming loops.
695854f3-14e3-489b-8bff-a18a9d131b52 Ferment at 20º C (68º F), 95 → 75% humidity for 3 days.
695854f3-14e3-489b-8bff-a18a9d131b52 Cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 24 hours.
695854f3-14e3-489b-8bff-a18a9d131b52 Dry at 15→12º C (58 →53º F), 80-75% humidity for 4 weeks until sausage looses 33% of its original weight.
695854f3-14e3-489b-8bff-a18a9d131b52 Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
72622f45-ddae-4fc0-bb21-4081556f53a9 Grind meat and fat through 3-6 mm (1/8-1/4”) plate.
72622f45-ddae-4fc0-bb21-4081556f53a9 Dissolve culture in 1 tablespoon of de-chlorinated water 30 minutes before use.
72622f45-ddae-4fc0-bb21-4081556f53a9 Mix ground meat with salt and cure #2. Add ground fat, spices and the culture and mix all together.
72622f45-ddae-4fc0-bb21-4081556f53a9 Stuff into pork or calf's bladder, blind cap (caecum) or 65 mm beef middles. Make 6-12” (15-30 cm) links.
72622f45-ddae-4fc0-bb21-4081556f53a9 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
72622f45-ddae-4fc0-bb21-4081556f53a9 Ferment/dry at 18º C (64º F), 85-80% humidity for 24 hours.
72622f45-ddae-4fc0-bb21-4081556f53a9 Dry for 5-6 weeks at 15 → 12º C (59 → 54º F), 80 → 75% humidity until the sausage looses 33% of its original weight. The diameter of the sausage influences the drying time.
820eea8b-f9d5-4fa8-9017-41e526b97ace Grind meat and fat through 6-8 mm (1/4-3/8”) plate.
820eea8b-f9d5-4fa8-9017-41e526b97ace Mix meat with spices and stuff into pork bungs or large diameter casings. Leave both ends open for now.
820eea8b-f9d5-4fa8-9017-41e526b97ace Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator. Tie off the ends with twine.
820eea8b-f9d5-4fa8-9017-41e526b97ace Hang for 4 days at 8-10° C (48-50° F).
820eea8b-f9d5-4fa8-9017-41e526b97ace Place on a flat surface, place a suitable board with a weight on it (wooden planks were normally used) and flatten for 24 hours, of course, at low temperature. El Xolis is a flatten sausage, often “8” shaped. The top groove was usually created manually with fingers.
820eea8b-f9d5-4fa8-9017-41e526b97ace Hang at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 80-85% humidity, for 2-3 months.
820eea8b-f9d5-4fa8-9017-41e526b97ace Store at 10-12° C, <75% humidity.
d160a4ed-bae9-452d-90bf-e797d489fca8 Cook onion in water for 45 minutes. Drain.
d160a4ed-bae9-452d-90bf-e797d489fca8 Grind onion, bread and lard together.
d160a4ed-bae9-452d-90bf-e797d489fca8 Mix the ground mixture with all other ingredients.
d160a4ed-bae9-452d-90bf-e797d489fca8 Stuff into 34-36 mm pork casings. Form 40 cm (16”) loops with ends tied together.
d160a4ed-bae9-452d-90bf-e797d489fca8 Dry sausages at 18° C (64° F) for three days. In traditional production the sausages were hung in the kitchen above the wood fired stove for 3 days.
d160a4ed-bae9-452d-90bf-e797d489fca8 Move sausage to a drying chamber and dry them at 12-14° C (53 -57° F), 75% humidity, for 15 days.
69938536-3602-44db-a297-01768e40aaea * Red pepper paste. Cut bell peppers lengthwise into halves. Discard stems and seeds. Get a suitable pan and sprinkle salt on the bottom. Place peppers on salt, then cover them with more salt. Repeat the procedure creating a multilayer combination with salt being the top layer. Hold for 8 days. Rinse with water, pat dry with paper towel and grind through 1/8” (3 mm) plate or emulsify in food processor.
69938536-3602-44db-a297-01768e40aaea Made marinade by mixing salt, cure #1 and spices with wine.
69938536-3602-44db-a297-01768e40aaea Chop fat into 1/4 (6 mm) or smaller pieces.
69938536-3602-44db-a297-01768e40aaea Mix fat with marinade and hold for 3 days at 10 °C (50° F) or lower or in refrigerator.
69938536-3602-44db-a297-01768e40aaea Mix marinated fat, red pepper paste flour and water. Add more water if needed.
69938536-3602-44db-a297-01768e40aaea Mix all together adding flour and water. Add more water if needed.
69938536-3602-44db-a297-01768e40aaea Stuff into beef casings, tie the ends together making 6” (15 cm) long loops.
69938536-3602-44db-a297-01768e40aaea Smoke for 10 days at 30-40° C (86-104° F) with oak wood.
69938536-3602-44db-a297-01768e40aaea Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity or in refrigerator.
7b39ce29-95f7-41ae-ae3e-7b6c0dcb8887 * Pepper paste. Cut bell peppers lengthwise into halves. Discard stems and seeds. Get a suitable pan and sprinkle salt on the bottom. Place peppers on salt, then cover them with more salt. Repeat the procedure creating a multilayer combination with salt being the top layer. Hold for 8 days. Rinse with water, pat dry with paper towel and grind through 1/8” (3 mm) plate or emulsify in food processor.
7b39ce29-95f7-41ae-ae3e-7b6c0dcb8887 Made marinade by mixing salt and spices with wine.
7b39ce29-95f7-41ae-ae3e-7b6c0dcb8887 Chop fat into 1/4 (6 mm) or smaller pieces.
7b39ce29-95f7-41ae-ae3e-7b6c0dcb8887 Mix fat with marinade and hold for 3 days at 10 °C (50° F) or lower or in refrigerator.
7b39ce29-95f7-41ae-ae3e-7b6c0dcb8887 Mix marinated fat, red pepper paste, with flour and hot water. Mix all well together.
7b39ce29-95f7-41ae-ae3e-7b6c0dcb8887 Stuff into beef casings, tie the ends together making 6” (15 cm) long loops.
7b39ce29-95f7-41ae-ae3e-7b6c0dcb8887 Smoke for 7 days at 30-40° C (86-104° F) with oak wood.
7b39ce29-95f7-41ae-ae3e-7b6c0dcb8887 Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity or in refrigerator.
f7090047-17ef-4823-a918-7ed35700089b Grind pork through ⅜” plate (10 mm). Dice back fat or pork fat trimmings into 1/4” (6 mm) pieces. Grind beef with 1/4” (6 mm) plate, partially freeze and regrind again through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
f7090047-17ef-4823-a918-7ed35700089b Mix all ingredients with meat.
f7090047-17ef-4823-a918-7ed35700089b Stuff firmly into 60 mm beef middles or protein lined fibrous casings. Make 16” long links.
f7090047-17ef-4823-a918-7ed35700089b Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
f7090047-17ef-4823-a918-7ed35700089b Cold smoke at 20º C (68º C) or lower for 24 hours.
f7090047-17ef-4823-a918-7ed35700089b Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity, for 2-3 months. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
f7090047-17ef-4823-a918-7ed35700089b Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
834db44b-8565-445c-aa4c-5be48a7c07da Grind pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
834db44b-8565-445c-aa4c-5be48a7c07da Grind back fat through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
834db44b-8565-445c-aa4c-5be48a7c07da Mix meat, fat and all ingredients together.
834db44b-8565-445c-aa4c-5be48a7c07da Stuff into 55 mm pork or beef middles forming loops.
834db44b-8565-445c-aa4c-5be48a7c07da Ferment at 20° C (68° F), 95 → 85% humidity for 3 days.
834db44b-8565-445c-aa4c-5be48a7c07da Cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 24 hours.
834db44b-8565-445c-aa4c-5be48a7c07da Dry at 14 → 12° C (58 → 53° F), 85 → 75% humidity for 5 weeks.
834db44b-8565-445c-aa4c-5be48a7c07da Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <75% humidity.
098f8544-074c-43f0-8ce8-7b6f8c1a5261 Discard all sinews, gristle and connective tissue.
098f8544-074c-43f0-8ce8-7b6f8c1a5261 Dice lean pork into small pieces and mix with blood. Dice liver into ½” (25 mm) cubes. Dice partially frozen fat into ¼” (6 mm) cubes. Mix lean pork with liver and all spices. Add fat and mix again.
098f8544-074c-43f0-8ce8-7b6f8c1a5261 Stuff firmly into 36 mm hog casings forming 2 feet long u-shaped loops.
098f8544-074c-43f0-8ce8-7b6f8c1a5261 Cold smoke at 16° C/64° F for 2 days.
098f8544-074c-43f0-8ce8-7b6f8c1a5261 Dry in air at 12-15° C/53-59° F for 3 weeks.
098f8544-074c-43f0-8ce8-7b6f8c1a5261 Store at 12° C/53° F, 65% humidity. Drying and storing is often accomplished in a cellar.
c654716d-40c8-445a-bb52-1259bda64a60 Curing: cut meat into 1-2” (2.5-5 cm) pieces and mix with salt and Cure #1. Pack tightly in container, cover with cloth and keep in refrigerator for 3 days.
c654716d-40c8-445a-bb52-1259bda64a60 Grind pork through 5/16” (8 mm) plate.
c654716d-40c8-445a-bb52-1259bda64a60 Mix pork with all ingredients until sticky.
c654716d-40c8-445a-bb52-1259bda64a60 Stuff into 22 mm or larger sheep casings. Form 15-18 cm (6-7”) links leaving them in a continuous coil.
c654716d-40c8-445a-bb52-1259bda64a60 Hang for 8 hours at 2-4° C (35-40° F), 85-90-% humidity or for 1 hour at room temperature.
c654716d-40c8-445a-bb52-1259bda64a60 Cold smoke at 18-22º C (64-72º F).for 6-8 hours until light brown.
c654716d-40c8-445a-bb52-1259bda64a60 Dry at 10-12° C (50-53° F) until 84% yield is obtained..
c654716d-40c8-445a-bb52-1259bda64a60 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
