385068bd-838d-44eb-b39e-a8a762e70d67 Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
385068bd-838d-44eb-b39e-a8a762e70d67 Mix all ingredients with meat.
385068bd-838d-44eb-b39e-a8a762e70d67 Stuff firmly into hog, beef middles or 38-50 protein lined fibrous casings.
385068bd-838d-44eb-b39e-a8a762e70d67 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
385068bd-838d-44eb-b39e-a8a762e70d67 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 1-2 months.
385068bd-838d-44eb-b39e-a8a762e70d67 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
637ec70e-024c-4b89-b733-0662d3b4831f Grind lean pork and pork belly through 6-8 mm (1/4") plate.
637ec70e-024c-4b89-b733-0662d3b4831f Mix all ingredients with meat.
637ec70e-024c-4b89-b733-0662d3b4831f Stuff into 34-36 mm pork casings making straight links.
637ec70e-024c-4b89-b733-0662d3b4831f Dry at 14-15º C (54-59º F), 75-80% humidity for 12 days.
637ec70e-024c-4b89-b733-0662d3b4831f Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity or refrigerate.
1ceff614-fa37-4f0c-931f-0818d2f8fcd0 Grind all meat with all ingredients through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
1ceff614-fa37-4f0c-931f-0818d2f8fcd0 Mix with all ingredients.
1ceff614-fa37-4f0c-931f-0818d2f8fcd0 Stuff into 32 mm pork casings forming 15-20 cm (6-8") links.
1ceff614-fa37-4f0c-931f-0818d2f8fcd0 Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator at 75-80% humidity.
1ceff614-fa37-4f0c-931f-0818d2f8fcd0 Cold smoke at <180 C (640 F) for 12 hours until gold-yellow.
1ceff614-fa37-4f0c-931f-0818d2f8fcd0 Refrigerate.
4695c0a3-8df6-44ea-90ad-94f1b7fab65f Grind pork through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
4695c0a3-8df6-44ea-90ad-94f1b7fab65f Grind fat through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
4695c0a3-8df6-44ea-90ad-94f1b7fab65f 30 minutes before use mix culture with 1 tablespoon of de-chlorinated water.
4695c0a3-8df6-44ea-90ad-94f1b7fab65f Mix ground meat with salt and cure #1, vinegar and spices.
4695c0a3-8df6-44ea-90ad-94f1b7fab65f Stuff firmly into 32-36 mm hog casings. Make links 6” (15 cm) long.
4695c0a3-8df6-44ea-90ad-94f1b7fab65f Dry for 2 months at 15 →12º C (59 → 54º F), 85-75% humidity.
4695c0a3-8df6-44ea-90ad-94f1b7fab65f Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 70% humidity.
13eaf3d7-7e11-4504-95af-cab21370ffb1 Grind pork trimmings through ½ in plate and dice the chilled back fat into 6 mm (¼-in cubes). Grind liver through a 3 mm (1/8 in) plate. Mix lean meat and liver with salt, sugar, soy sauce, wine, cure 1 and spices. Add diced fat and mix all together. Stuff into 24-26 mm sheep casings. Make links 4” long. Preheat the smokehouse and dry sausages at 45-48° C (113-120° F) for 48 hours without smoke. This is a semi-dry sausage that must be refrigerated and cooked to at least 59° C (137° F) internal temperature before serving.
fde7412e-3011-4203-bc38-c98df9ba6136 Grind meat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
fde7412e-3011-4203-bc38-c98df9ba6136 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
fde7412e-3011-4203-bc38-c98df9ba6136 Mix ground meat with salt, sugar, cure #2, culture and spices.
fde7412e-3011-4203-bc38-c98df9ba6136 Stuff into 40 mm beef casings. Make links about 18” (45 cm) long, tie off the ends together making a loop.
fde7412e-3011-4203-bc38-c98df9ba6136 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90 → 85% humidity.
fde7412e-3011-4203-bc38-c98df9ba6136 Dry at 18-15º C (64-59º F), 85→75% decreasing humidity for 20 days. The sausages are compacted once or twice with metal presses arranged on wooden boards. During the drying process, the surface of the sausages acquires an even coating of white mold which grows naturally in the room.
fde7412e-3011-4203-bc38-c98df9ba6136 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
b0ea1b54-d440-479b-b28a-06256c86db15 Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm). Grind beef with ⅛” plate.
b0ea1b54-d440-479b-b28a-06256c86db15 Mix all ingredients with meat.
b0ea1b54-d440-479b-b28a-06256c86db15 Stuff firmly into 60 mm beef middles or protein lined fibrous casings. Make 16” long links.
b0ea1b54-d440-479b-b28a-06256c86db15 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
b0ea1b54-d440-479b-b28a-06256c86db15 Cold smoke below 20º C (68º C) with thin smoke for 24 hours.
b0ea1b54-d440-479b-b28a-06256c86db15 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity, for 2-3 months. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
b0ea1b54-d440-479b-b28a-06256c86db15 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
68b49b42-05ec-40a8-be33-606922efd953 Grind lean meat and belly meat through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
68b49b42-05ec-40a8-be33-606922efd953 Cut belly fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
68b49b42-05ec-40a8-be33-606922efd953 Dissolve culture in 1 tablespoon of de-chlorinated water 30 minutes before use.
68b49b42-05ec-40a8-be33-606922efd953 Mix ground meat with salt and Cure #2. Add fat cubes, spices and the culture and mix all together.
68b49b42-05ec-40a8-be33-606922efd953 Stuff into 70-105 mm natural casings without creating air pockets. Typically, it is filled into bladder-shaped natural casings, the bladder shape being either long-drawn-out or compressed.
68b49b42-05ec-40a8-be33-606922efd953 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
68b49b42-05ec-40a8-be33-606922efd953 Dry for 45-90 days at 15→12º C (59-53º F), 80-75% humidity until the sausage looses 35% of its original weight. Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
2809853c-9733-40c2-a561-0d4a6d18b92f Grind lean meat and belly meat through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
2809853c-9733-40c2-a561-0d4a6d18b92f Cut belly fat into 6 mm (1/4") plate.
2809853c-9733-40c2-a561-0d4a6d18b92f Dissolve culture in 1 tablespoon of de-chlorinated water 30 minutes before use.
2809853c-9733-40c2-a561-0d4a6d18b92f Mix ground meat with salt and Cure #2. Add fat cubes, spices and the culture and mix all together.
2809853c-9733-40c2-a561-0d4a6d18b92f Stuff into 40-60 mm natural casings making straight links which can vary in length.
2809853c-9733-40c2-a561-0d4a6d18b92f Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
2809853c-9733-40c2-a561-0d4a6d18b92f Dry for 4-5 weeks at 15→12º C (59→53º F), 80-75% humidity until the sausage looses 35% of its original weight.
2809853c-9733-40c2-a561-0d4a6d18b92f Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
730ae094-d098-4815-b9d7-6cd6b8c5f1cf Grind meats with 3/8” (10 mm) plate. Cut fat manually into ¾ “ (20 mm) cubes.
730ae094-d098-4815-b9d7-6cd6b8c5f1cf Mix all ingredients with meat adding rum. Then add diced fat and mix everything together.
730ae094-d098-4815-b9d7-6cd6b8c5f1cf Stuff firmly into 45 mm beef middles or fibrous casings.
730ae094-d098-4815-b9d7-6cd6b8c5f1cf Place sausages between two wooden boards, place weight on top and leave in a cool place (50-54º F, 10-12º C) for 2 weeks.
730ae094-d098-4815-b9d7-6cd6b8c5f1cf Remove boards and hang sausage in a ventilated cool place for 3 days.
730ae094-d098-4815-b9d7-6cd6b8c5f1cf Cold smoke for 7 days.
730ae094-d098-4815-b9d7-6cd6b8c5f1cf Store in a cool, dry place.
27ee05ee-0826-4694-8a1f-c3d7fc7c4a0a Grind pork through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
27ee05ee-0826-4694-8a1f-c3d7fc7c4a0a Grind beef with 6 mm (1/4") plate.
27ee05ee-0826-4694-8a1f-c3d7fc7c4a0a Grind pork belly with 6 mm (1/4") plate.
27ee05ee-0826-4694-8a1f-c3d7fc7c4a0a Cut back fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
27ee05ee-0826-4694-8a1f-c3d7fc7c4a0a Mix lean pork and beef with salt and Cure #2. Add ground pork belly, spices, culture and mix. Add fat cubes and mix all together.
27ee05ee-0826-4694-8a1f-c3d7fc7c4a0a Stuff into 40 mm natural or fibrous casings.
27ee05ee-0826-4694-8a1f-c3d7fc7c4a0a Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
27ee05ee-0826-4694-8a1f-c3d7fc7c4a0a Apply a thin cold smoke (with intervals) at 18° C (64° F) for 4 days. Cold smoking is drying with smoke. Traditionally, the sausage was smoked with beech wood.
27ee05ee-0826-4694-8a1f-c3d7fc7c4a0a After smoking the sausages are stacked in two layers on the shelves in drying/ripening chambers and dried for 4-5 weeks at 12-15º C (54-59º F), 75-80% humidity until sausages loose 30-35% of its original weight.
27ee05ee-0826-4694-8a1f-c3d7fc7c4a0a Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 75% humidity.
89d6fc80-8dea-45b0-a1bc-5eef88f533c9 Cook lungs and heart in water for 30 minutes. Drain and cool.
89d6fc80-8dea-45b0-a1bc-5eef88f533c9 Scald liver in hot water for 5 minutes. Drain and cool.
89d6fc80-8dea-45b0-a1bc-5eef88f533c9 Grind all meats through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
89d6fc80-8dea-45b0-a1bc-5eef88f533c9 Mix with all ingredients. Hold for 12 hours in refrigerator.
89d6fc80-8dea-45b0-a1bc-5eef88f533c9 Stuff into 20-24 mm sheep casings forming 10-15 cm (4-6") links.
89d6fc80-8dea-45b0-a1bc-5eef88f533c9 Dry at 12-15º C (53-59º F), 75-80% humidity for 14 days.
17d7f204-3e83-4d02-b24a-b1fd761579b0 Grind meat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
17d7f204-3e83-4d02-b24a-b1fd761579b0 Grind fat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
17d7f204-3e83-4d02-b24a-b1fd761579b0 Mix with salt, cure #2 and spices.
17d7f204-3e83-4d02-b24a-b1fd761579b0 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings forming 8” (20 cm) links.
17d7f204-3e83-4d02-b24a-b1fd761579b0 Apply a thin cold smoke for 2-3 days at 20° C (66° F), 70-90% humidity. Original Gyulai kolbasz is smoked with beech wood.
17d7f204-3e83-4d02-b24a-b1fd761579b0 Dry for 2 weeks at 18° → 16° C (64-60° F), 90-92% humidity, then gradually reduce humidity to 70 → 65%.
17d7f204-3e83-4d02-b24a-b1fd761579b0 Store at 12° C (54° F), 65% humidity.
d7f4d181-f94a-49d6-9789-f0d1a9a20166 Grind pork and beef through 5 mm (1/4”) plate.
d7f4d181-f94a-49d6-9789-f0d1a9a20166 Grind partially frozen pork fat through 5 mm (1/4”) plate.
d7f4d181-f94a-49d6-9789-f0d1a9a20166 Mix ground meat with all ingredients, including starter culture. Add ground fat last and mix again.
d7f4d181-f94a-49d6-9789-f0d1a9a20166 Stuff firmly into 60 mm beef middles or synthetic fibrous casings.
d7f4d181-f94a-49d6-9789-f0d1a9a20166 Ferment at 22º C (72º F), 90% humidity for 72 hours.
d7f4d181-f94a-49d6-9789-f0d1a9a20166 Dry at 22→14º C (72→58º F), 85→80% humidity for 5 days.
d7f4d181-f94a-49d6-9789-f0d1a9a20166 Dry at 14→12º C (57→53º F), 80→75% humidity for 5 weeks until the sausage loses about 32% of its original weight..
d7f4d181-f94a-49d6-9789-f0d1a9a20166 Store at 10-12º C, <70% humidity.
b4c74061-d915-4490-b38d-2f5eed19ad17 Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Place in refrigerator to cool.
b4c74061-d915-4490-b38d-2f5eed19ad17 Grind fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Place in freezer for 20-30 minutes.
b4c74061-d915-4490-b38d-2f5eed19ad17 Grind beef second time through 3 mm (1/8") plate adding salt and all ingredients. Grind fat second time through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
b4c74061-d915-4490-b38d-2f5eed19ad17 Mix all together. Stuff into 40 mm cellulose casings.
b4c74061-d915-4490-b38d-2f5eed19ad17 Hold at 15° C (59° F), high humidity for 10 hours.
b4c74061-d915-4490-b38d-2f5eed19ad17 Cold smoke with beech wood at 18° C (64° F) for 8 hours. Refrigerate. Serve as it is, the sausage is not cooked.
6e1d650d-8f0e-48f9-b13a-d4e056991a0b Grind pork through 5 mm (1/4”) plate. Grind beef with 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
6e1d650d-8f0e-48f9-b13a-d4e056991a0b Mix all ingredients with meat.
6e1d650d-8f0e-48f9-b13a-d4e056991a0b Stuff firmly into 60 mm beef middles or protein lined fibrous casings. Make 16” long links.
6e1d650d-8f0e-48f9-b13a-d4e056991a0b Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
6e1d650d-8f0e-48f9-b13a-d4e056991a0b Cold smoke at 18º C (64º C) for 24 hours.
6e1d650d-8f0e-48f9-b13a-d4e056991a0b Dry at 15→12º C (59-53º F), 85-80% humidity, for 5 weeks. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
6e1d650d-8f0e-48f9-b13a-d4e056991a0b Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
734fb3e8-4f5a-48f8-b169-5fa71b74365a Grind meat through 2 mm plate. Cut back fat into 15 mm (1/4”) pieces.
734fb3e8-4f5a-48f8-b169-5fa71b74365a Mix ground beef adding pepper until the mass feels sticky. Mix diced back fat with paprika, then mix everything together. Do not add water.
734fb3e8-4f5a-48f8-b169-5fa71b74365a Stuff firmly into 40 mm beef rounds, 20-30” (50-75) cm long. Do not add water. Prick any visible air pockets with a needle.
734fb3e8-4f5a-48f8-b169-5fa71b74365a Hang for 1-2 days at 2-6° C (35-42° F), 85-90% humidity. At this stage curing continues and beneficial curing and flavor forming bacteria start to grow.
734fb3e8-4f5a-48f8-b169-5fa71b74365a Smoke with a thin cold smoke for 3-4 days until a yellow color with occasional red areas is obtained. At this stage natural fermentation takes place although pH drop (acidity increase) is insignificant as no sugar is added. Due to a large amount of fat (fat contains only 15% water), the sausage loses moisture rapidly.
734fb3e8-4f5a-48f8-b169-5fa71b74365a Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity, for 1-2 months. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
734fb3e8-4f5a-48f8-b169-5fa71b74365a Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
40feb529-9dc1-4472-986c-5d89931ec48a Grind lean pork and fat through 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
40feb529-9dc1-4472-986c-5d89931ec48a Mix ground meats with salt and spices. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
40feb529-9dc1-4472-986c-5d89931ec48a Stuff the mixture into 38-40 mm natural casings forming straight links 30 cm (12”) long.
40feb529-9dc1-4472-986c-5d89931ec48a Dry/ferment at 20-27° C (68-80° F), 90-85% humidity, for 30 hours.
40feb529-9dc1-4472-986c-5d89931ec48a Dry at 15-12° C (59-53° F), 85-75% humidity, for 15 days.
40feb529-9dc1-4472-986c-5d89931ec48a Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <70% humidity or refrigerate.
933091cd-f856-4e36-a35d-7066bf40162f Grind lean pork and belly through 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
933091cd-f856-4e36-a35d-7066bf40162f Mix ground meats with salt and spices. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
933091cd-f856-4e36-a35d-7066bf40162f Stuff into 38-40 mm calf casings forming links 20 cm (8”) long.
933091cd-f856-4e36-a35d-7066bf40162f Dry at 15-12° C (59-53° F), 85-75% humidity for 15-20 days.
933091cd-f856-4e36-a35d-7066bf40162f Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <70% humidity or refrigerate.
e2e7ccb4-9ced-4d58-89c9-34f399ecb136 Grind meat through 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
e2e7ccb4-9ced-4d58-89c9-34f399ecb136 Manually cut partially frozen back fat into 6 mm (1/4”) cubes.
e2e7ccb4-9ced-4d58-89c9-34f399ecb136 Mix ground meat with all ingredients. Add fat cubes and mix again.
e2e7ccb4-9ced-4d58-89c9-34f399ecb136 Stuff firmly into 60 mm natural casings making 50 cm (20") links.
e2e7ccb4-9ced-4d58-89c9-34f399ecb136 Hold for 2-3 days in cool room at 1° C (34° F) and 95-100% humidity.
e2e7ccb4-9ced-4d58-89c9-34f399ecb136 Cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) using beech wood for 12 hours. Wipe off any slime with clean wet cloth.
e2e7ccb4-9ced-4d58-89c9-34f399ecb136 Ferment/dry at 9-12° C (48-53° F), 90-95% humidity. When mold appears wash it off by hand with pure water and then proceed to the drying stage.
e2e7ccb4-9ced-4d58-89c9-34f399ecb136 Dry at 10° C (50° F), 75-80% humidity.
e2e7ccb4-9ced-4d58-89c9-34f399ecb136 Maturing/drying process lasts about 8 weeks. During that time the sausage looses around 40% of its original weight.
44600494-cbd6-49b7-af5e-92e08c54d5f3 Cut fat into 1/2” (12 mm) cubes.
44600494-cbd6-49b7-af5e-92e08c54d5f3 Grind pork through 1/4” (5 mm) plate.
44600494-cbd6-49b7-af5e-92e08c54d5f3 Grind beef through 1/4” (5 mm) plate.
44600494-cbd6-49b7-af5e-92e08c54d5f3 Mix beef with salt and cure #2. Add pork and remix.
44600494-cbd6-49b7-af5e-92e08c54d5f3 Mix spices with wine and add to the mixture. Finely, add cubed fat and mix all again.
44600494-cbd6-49b7-af5e-92e08c54d5f3 Stuff firmly into beef middles or 40-42 mm hog casings. Form 8” (20 cm) long links.
44600494-cbd6-49b7-af5e-92e08c54d5f3 Hang for 1-2 days at 2-6º C (35-42º F) and 85-90% humidity.
44600494-cbd6-49b7-af5e-92e08c54d5f3 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 2 days. Dry at 12º C (53º F), 75-80% humidity for 3 weeks.
44600494-cbd6-49b7-af5e-92e08c54d5f3 Store at 10º C (53º F) or lower.
b6eaa8c9-abd4-4417-aca8-da62839cb0ee Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
b6eaa8c9-abd4-4417-aca8-da62839cb0ee Mix all ingredients with meat.
b6eaa8c9-abd4-4417-aca8-da62839cb0ee Stuff loosely (80% capacity) into large diameter fibrous casings (70 mm). Place stuffed sausage between two boards, with some weight on top to flatten the sausage. Then move to a fermentation room.
b6eaa8c9-abd4-4417-aca8-da62839cb0ee Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 96 hours, 95-90% humidity.
b6eaa8c9-abd4-4417-aca8-da62839cb0ee Remove boards and wipe off any slime that might have accumulated under boards.
b6eaa8c9-abd4-4417-aca8-da62839cb0ee Dry at room temperature until casings are dry to the touch. Hang square shaped sausages on smokesticks.
b6eaa8c9-abd4-4417-aca8-da62839cb0ee Cold smoke (20º C, 68º F) for a few hours to prevent growth of mold.
b6eaa8c9-abd4-4417-aca8-da62839cb0ee Dry for 2 days at 20-18º C (68-64º F), 90-85% humidity. Apply smoke from time to time.
b6eaa8c9-abd4-4417-aca8-da62839cb0ee Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85 -80% humidity. In about 8 weeks a shrink of 30% should be achieved.
b6eaa8c9-abd4-4417-aca8-da62839cb0ee Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
cb36a5c8-ef57-4f9d-badb-7bb444054805 Smoke raw belly at 18° C (64° F) for 6 hours.
cb36a5c8-ef57-4f9d-badb-7bb444054805 Grind lean pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
cb36a5c8-ef57-4f9d-badb-7bb444054805 Grind pork belly through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
cb36a5c8-ef57-4f9d-badb-7bb444054805 Mix meat, fat and all ingredients together.
cb36a5c8-ef57-4f9d-badb-7bb444054805 Stuff into 60 mm natural casings.
cb36a5c8-ef57-4f9d-badb-7bb444054805 Ferment at 3 days at 20° C (68° F), 95 → 90% humidity.
cb36a5c8-ef57-4f9d-badb-7bb444054805 Dry for 2 days at 18° C (64° F), 90 → 85% humidity.
cb36a5c8-ef57-4f9d-badb-7bb444054805 Dry at 14→ 12° C (58 → 53° F), 85 → 75% humidity for 5 weeks until sausages loose 30% of their original weight.
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Cut meat into 2” pieces. Rub in salt, Cure # 2 and sugar and leave on a screen for 3-4 days at 3-4° C (37-40° F).
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Cut pork into 20-30 mm (¾-1¼”) by 10-15 mm (3/8-5/8”) pieces.
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Grind beef through 2-3 mm (1/8”) plate.
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Mix beef with all spices. Add pork and mix everything together.
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Stuff firmly into pork stomach, bladder, 60 mm beef middles or 60 mm fibrous casings. Reinforce with butcher’s twine: two loops lengthwise and loops across the casings every 2” (5 cm). Form 10-12 cm (4-5”) hanging loop on one end.
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Hang for 2 months at 2-4° C (35-40° F).
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Apply cold smoke 18-22° C (64-72° F) for 8 hours.
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Hang in a cool place for 2 weeks.
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Apply cold smoke again at 18-22° C (64-72° F) for 8 hours.
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Dry for 2 months at 8° C (46° F) and 75% humidity. The sausage should lose about 35% of its original weight.
62187c5a-e7b2-48ac-88f0-3c6973ade1d2 Store in a dark, cool and dry place.
e8e0eaac-2abb-470b-b9d7-1260daaabfae Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
e8e0eaac-2abb-470b-b9d7-1260daaabfae Grind pork through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
e8e0eaac-2abb-470b-b9d7-1260daaabfae Grind fat through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
e8e0eaac-2abb-470b-b9d7-1260daaabfae Mix beef with pork and spices. Add fat and culture and mix again.
e8e0eaac-2abb-470b-b9d7-1260daaabfae Stuff into 36 mm hog casings.
e8e0eaac-2abb-470b-b9d7-1260daaabfae Ferment at 20° C (68° F), 95-85% humidity for 3 days.
e8e0eaac-2abb-470b-b9d7-1260daaabfae Apply cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 24 hours.
e8e0eaac-2abb-470b-b9d7-1260daaabfae Dry at 14→12° C (58→54° F), 85-80% humidity for 4 weeks or until sausage looses 30% of its original weight.
e8e0eaac-2abb-470b-b9d7-1260daaabfae Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <75% humidity.
f7aa54e5-f38c-4040-9c6d-af435ad7b2dd Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
f7aa54e5-f38c-4040-9c6d-af435ad7b2dd Cook skins** (if used) in water until soft, cool and grind through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
f7aa54e5-f38c-4040-9c6d-af435ad7b2dd Grind pork through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
f7aa54e5-f38c-4040-9c6d-af435ad7b2dd Mix beef with pork and spices. Add culture and mix again.
f7aa54e5-f38c-4040-9c6d-af435ad7b2dd Stuff into 30 mm hog casings.
f7aa54e5-f38c-4040-9c6d-af435ad7b2dd Ferment at 18° C (64° F), 80-90% humidity for 4 days.
f7aa54e5-f38c-4040-9c6d-af435ad7b2dd Apply cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 24 hours.
f7aa54e5-f38c-4040-9c6d-af435ad7b2dd Dry at 14→12° C (58→54° F), 85-80% humidity for 3 weeks or until sausage looses 30% of its original weight.
f7aa54e5-f38c-4040-9c6d-af435ad7b2dd Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), 65-70% humidity.
a632351b-af56-4e2f-84ed-d196f4ea6dd5 Grind meats through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
a632351b-af56-4e2f-84ed-d196f4ea6dd5 Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
a632351b-af56-4e2f-84ed-d196f4ea6dd5 Stuff firmly into beef middles or 3” protein lined fibrous casings.
a632351b-af56-4e2f-84ed-d196f4ea6dd5 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
a632351b-af56-4e2f-84ed-d196f4ea6dd5 Cold smoke for 4 days (< 22º C, 72º F). You can smoke during last day of fermentation.
a632351b-af56-4e2f-84ed-d196f4ea6dd5 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 2-3 months.
a632351b-af56-4e2f-84ed-d196f4ea6dd5 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
86ccc418-d979-4512-a58a-13f03082d70f Grind lean beef through 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
86ccc418-d979-4512-a58a-13f03082d70f Grind lean pork through 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
86ccc418-d979-4512-a58a-13f03082d70f Grind fatty pork and fat trimmings through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
86ccc418-d979-4512-a58a-13f03082d70f Mix beef and pork with salt and Cure #2. Add fat, remaining spices, starter culture and mix all together.
86ccc418-d979-4512-a58a-13f03082d70f Stuff into 45-50 mm natural or synthetic fibrous casings.
86ccc418-d979-4512-a58a-13f03082d70f Ferment at 18° C (64° F), 80-90% humidity for 4 days.
86ccc418-d979-4512-a58a-13f03082d70f Apply cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 24 hours.
86ccc418-d979-4512-a58a-13f03082d70f Dry at 14→12° C (58→54° F), 85-80% humidity for 4 weeks or until sausage looses 30% of its original weight.
86ccc418-d979-4512-a58a-13f03082d70f Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), 65-70% humidity.
3b74dd8a-9639-4def-bdcd-f3043d30da6b Curing meat: cut meat into 1 inch (25 mm) pieces. Dice fat into 3/16” (4 mm) cubes Place beef, sheep meat and sheep fat in separate food grade containers. Mix sheep fat with 3 g (1/2 tsp) salt. Mix sheep meat with 24 g (4 tsp) salt, 3/4 cure #1 and ½ sugar. Mix beef with 3 g (1/2 tsp) salt, ¼ cure #1 and ½ sugar. Estimate amounts. Pack tightly to eliminate air and cover with clean cloth. Hold for 72 hours in refrigerator. Discard any liquid brine and submit meat to grinding.
3b74dd8a-9639-4def-bdcd-f3043d30da6b Grind beef through 1/8” (2 mm) plate. Grind sheep meat with 1/8” (2 mm) plate. Dice fat into 3/16” (4 mm) cubes.
3b74dd8a-9639-4def-bdcd-f3043d30da6b Mix beef with spices. Add pork and mix. Add fat and remix everything together. Don’t add any water.
3b74dd8a-9639-4def-bdcd-f3043d30da6b Stuff sausages firmly into 40-55 mm beef middles or fibrous casings.
3b74dd8a-9639-4def-bdcd-f3043d30da6b Hang sausages for 5-7 days at 2-4º C (34-40º F).
3b74dd8a-9639-4def-bdcd-f3043d30da6b Cold smoke for 2-3 days at 18-22º C (64-72º F).
3b74dd8a-9639-4def-bdcd-f3043d30da6b Dry sausages for 5-7 days (depending on sausage diameter) at 11-15º C (53-59º F), 80-84 humidity.
3b74dd8a-9639-4def-bdcd-f3043d30da6b Dry 20-23 days more at 10-12º C (50-54º F), 74-78% humidity. Finished sausage should retain 60% of its original weight.
25039f38-2c8b-4979-ab9f-05140420ad2c Grind pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate. Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
25039f38-2c8b-4979-ab9f-05140420ad2c Mix all ingredients with meat.
25039f38-2c8b-4979-ab9f-05140420ad2c Stuff loosely (80% capacity) into 32-36 mm hog casings. Make links 8” (20 cm) long. Place stuffed sausage between two boards, with some weight on top, to flatten the sausage. Then move to a fermentation room.
25039f38-2c8b-4979-ab9f-05140420ad2c Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 95-90% humidity.
25039f38-2c8b-4979-ab9f-05140420ad2c Remove boards and wipe off any slime that might have accumulated under boards.
25039f38-2c8b-4979-ab9f-05140420ad2c Dry at room temperature until casings are dry to the touch. Hang square shaped sausages on smoke sticks.
25039f38-2c8b-4979-ab9f-05140420ad2c Cold smoke at < 20º C (68º F) for a few hours to prevent growth of mold.
25039f38-2c8b-4979-ab9f-05140420ad2c Dry at 14→12° C (58→54° F), 85-80% humidity for 3 weeks or until sausage looses 30% of its original weight.
25039f38-2c8b-4979-ab9f-05140420ad2c Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <75% humidity.
6a630221-57fd-4f36-ba94-933f41c468af Grind pork and back fat through 3/8” (10 mm) plate. 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
6a630221-57fd-4f36-ba94-933f41c468af Mix all ingredients with meat.
6a630221-57fd-4f36-ba94-933f41c468af Stuff firmly into 18-26 mm (3/4-1”) hog or sheep casings. Form 5-6” (15 cm) long links.
6a630221-57fd-4f36-ba94-933f41c468af Ferment at 38º C (100º F) for 24 hours, 90-85% humidity.
6a630221-57fd-4f36-ba94-933f41c468af Gradually increase the temperature until the sausage reaches 60º C (140º F) internal temperature.
6a630221-57fd-4f36-ba94-933f41c468af For a drier sausage: dry 2 more days at 22-16º C (70-60º F), 75-65% humidity, or until desired weight loss has occurred.
6a630221-57fd-4f36-ba94-933f41c468af Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F), 65% humidity.
8a4edbbe-cb8e-4082-8716-b4f077754e08 * Pepper paste. Cut bell peppers lengthwise into halves. Discard stems and seeds. Get a suitable pan and sprinkle salt on the bottom. Place peppers on salt, then cover them with more salt. Repeat the procedure creating a multilayer combination with salt being the top layer. Hold for 8 days. Rinse with water, pat dry with paper towel and grind through 1/8” (3 mm) plate or emulsify in food processor.
8a4edbbe-cb8e-4082-8716-b4f077754e08 Made marinade by mixing salt, cure #1, sugar and spices with wine and water.
8a4edbbe-cb8e-4082-8716-b4f077754e08 Chop meat and fat into 3/8” (10 mm) pieces.
8a4edbbe-cb8e-4082-8716-b4f077754e08 Mix meat and fat with marinade and hold for 2 days at 10 °C (50° F) or lower (refrigerator). Drain. Mix marinated meat and red pepper paste together.
8a4edbbe-cb8e-4082-8716-b4f077754e08 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings, tie the ends together making 12” (30 cm) long loops.
8a4edbbe-cb8e-4082-8716-b4f077754e08 Using oak wood apply a thin smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 7 days. Smoking need not to be continuous, as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. Think of the process as drying with smoke. Due to seasonal variations in temperature, the sausage is smoked for 3-4 days in the summer and 5-6 days in the winter.
8a4edbbe-cb8e-4082-8716-b4f077754e08 Dry at 12-15° C (54-59° F), 75-80% humidity for 10 days.
8a4edbbe-cb8e-4082-8716-b4f077754e08 Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity.
55bac974-dff8-4b07-af5a-8d3db8050095 * Pepper paste. Cut bell peppers lengthwise into halves. Discard stems and seeds. Get a suitable pan and sprinkle salt on the bottom. Place peppers on salt, then cover them with more salt. Repeat the procedure creating a multilayer combination with salt being the top layer. Hold for 8 days. Rinse with water, pat dry with paper towel and grind through 1/8” (3 mm) plate or emulsify in food processor.
55bac974-dff8-4b07-af5a-8d3db8050095 Made marinade by mixing salt, cure #1, sugar and spices with wine and water.
55bac974-dff8-4b07-af5a-8d3db8050095 Chop meat and fat into 3/8” (10 mm) pieces.
55bac974-dff8-4b07-af5a-8d3db8050095 Mix meat and fat with marinade and hold for 3 days at 10° C (50° F) or lower or in refrigerator. Drain.
55bac974-dff8-4b07-af5a-8d3db8050095 Mix marinated meat and red pepper paste together.
55bac974-dff8-4b07-af5a-8d3db8050095 Stuff into 28 mm hog or sheep casings, tie the ends together making 20” (50 cm) long loops.
55bac974-dff8-4b07-af5a-8d3db8050095 Using oak wood apply a thin smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 7 days.
55bac974-dff8-4b07-af5a-8d3db8050095 Dry at 12-15° C (54-59° F), 75-80% humidity for 10 days.
55bac974-dff8-4b07-af5a-8d3db8050095 Store at 12° C (54° F), 70% humidity.
f5254942-def0-48c6-b4b0-5bd4a23cf4f6 Grind all meats with a 3/8” grinder plate. Manually cut back fat into and ⅛ x ⅛ x ¾” strips.
f5254942-def0-48c6-b4b0-5bd4a23cf4f6 Mix everything together.
f5254942-def0-48c6-b4b0-5bd4a23cf4f6 Stuff firmly into 45 mm beef middles or fibrous casings.
f5254942-def0-48c6-b4b0-5bd4a23cf4f6 Place sausages between two wooden boards, place weight on top and leave in a cool place (50-54º F, 10-12º C) for 2 weeks.
f5254942-def0-48c6-b4b0-5bd4a23cf4f6 Remove boards and hang sausage in a ventilated cool place for 3 days.
f5254942-def0-48c6-b4b0-5bd4a23cf4f6 Cold smoke for 7 days.
f5254942-def0-48c6-b4b0-5bd4a23cf4f6 Store in a cool, dry place.
53c925e5-05c0-45c6-bbac-5863638b8dbf Grind meats through 8-10 mm (3/8”) plate.
53c925e5-05c0-45c6-bbac-5863638b8dbf Mix ground meat with salt and spices. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
53c925e5-05c0-45c6-bbac-5863638b8dbf Stuff into 20-22 mm sheep or hog casings. Form links about 35-40 cm (13-16”) long.
53c925e5-05c0-45c6-bbac-5863638b8dbf Dry at 16-12° C (59-53° F), 75-85% humidity for 15-20 days.
53c925e5-05c0-45c6-bbac-5863638b8dbf Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <65% humidity or in refrigerator.
e85c9225-2e10-4bdc-b9ef-2c6f42a171a9 Trim off the skin and connective tissue from the loin. Using force rub in a generous amount of coarse salt (as needed) all over loin. The loin should rest in a suitable container on a layer of salt and be well covered with salt all around leaving no exposed areas. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
e85c9225-2e10-4bdc-b9ef-2c6f42a171a9 Brush off the salt, wash briefly in running water and pat dry with paper towels.
e85c9225-2e10-4bdc-b9ef-2c6f42a171a9 Mix all ingredients with wine and oil together to form the marinade paste. Remainder: multiply the above ingredients per weight of loin.
e85c9225-2e10-4bdc-b9ef-2c6f42a171a9 Apply the paste all around the loin. Hold in refrigerator for 48 hours.
e85c9225-2e10-4bdc-b9ef-2c6f42a171a9 Stuff the loin into pork bungs that will tightly accommodate the loin.
e85c9225-2e10-4bdc-b9ef-2c6f42a171a9 Ferment/dry at 22-24° C (72-75° F), 85-90% humidity, for 2 days.
e85c9225-2e10-4bdc-b9ef-2c6f42a171a9 Dry at 15→12° C (59-53° F), 85→75% humidity for 2 months. The loin should lose about 35% of its original weight.
e85c9225-2e10-4bdc-b9ef-2c6f42a171a9 Store at 10-12° C (°F), <75% humidity.
00d10c89-26ff-421e-bb66-5e215b00c901 Trim off the skin and connective tissue from the loin. Using force rub in a generous amount of coarse salt (as needed) all over loin. The loin should rest in a suitable container on a layer of salt and be well covered with salt all around leaving no exposed areas. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
00d10c89-26ff-421e-bb66-5e215b00c901 Brush off the salt, wash briefly in running water and pat dry with paper towels. Mix all ingredients with wine and oil together to form the marinade paste. Remainder: multiply the above ingredients per weight of loin.
00d10c89-26ff-421e-bb66-5e215b00c901 Apply the paste all around the loin. Hold in refrigerator for 48 hours.
00d10c89-26ff-421e-bb66-5e215b00c901 Stuff the loin into pork bungs that will tightly accommodate the loin.
00d10c89-26ff-421e-bb66-5e215b00c901 Dry at 14-15° C (58-59° F), 75% humidity for 2-3 months depending on diameter. If needed, the temperature was regulated by burning wood in the drying chamber, so the loin was also cold smoked. The loin should lose about 33% of its original weight. Store at 10-12° C (°F), <75% humidity.
44fb7324-cd61-445e-adbc-8459d54b244c Trim off the skin and connective tissue from the loin. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours at 0-2° C (32-35° F).
44fb7324-cd61-445e-adbc-8459d54b244c Make a strong curing solution of Baume 20° (80° Salometer) by dissolving 290 g of salt and 40 g of cure #1 in 1250 ml of water. This amount of solution is enough for 2-3 kg loin.
44fb7324-cd61-445e-adbc-8459d54b244c Immerse loin into the curing solution, keep it submerged and hold in refrigerator for 3-4 days. Wash the loin briefly with water to remove salt crystals, then soak it in cold water for 12-24 hours to equalize salt distribution. Hang it to dry until the loin stops dripping water. Pat it dry with paper towels.
44fb7324-cd61-445e-adbc-8459d54b244c Mix spices with a little of water or white wine to create paste. Remainder: multiply the above ingredients per weight of loin.
44fb7324-cd61-445e-adbc-8459d54b244c Rub the paste into the loin all around and hold for 48 hours in refrigerator.
44fb7324-cd61-445e-adbc-8459d54b244c Stuff loin into 50-80 mm veal or beef bungs. The length of stuffed loin around 50-70 cm (20-28”).
44fb7324-cd61-445e-adbc-8459d54b244c Ferment/dry at 18-20° C (64-68° F), 80-85% humidity, for 24-48 hours.
44fb7324-cd61-445e-adbc-8459d54b244c Dry at 12-14° C (53-57° F), 75-80% humidity, for 2-3 months until the loin loses about 33% of its original weight.
f7386741-aa51-4c4c-af3e-2c7ac1defcfb Trim off the skin and connective tissue from the loin. Using force rub in a generous amount of salt (as needed) all over loin. The loin should rest in a suitable container on a layer of salt and be well covered with salt all around leaving no exposed areas. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
f7386741-aa51-4c4c-af3e-2c7ac1defcfb Brush off the salt, wash briefly in running water and pat dry with paper towels. Mix all ingredients with wine and oil together to form the marinade paste. Remainder: multiply the above ingredients per weight of loin.
f7386741-aa51-4c4c-af3e-2c7ac1defcfb Apply the paste all around the loin. Hold in refrigerator for 48 hours.
f7386741-aa51-4c4c-af3e-2c7ac1defcfb Wipe off the paste and stuff the loin into 55-70 mm beef bungs (tripa cular). The length of stuffed loin around 70-90 cm (28”).
f7386741-aa51-4c4c-af3e-2c7ac1defcfb Ferment/dry at 18-22° C (64-72° F), for 15 days.
f7386741-aa51-4c4c-af3e-2c7ac1defcfb Dry at 12-14° C (53-57° F), 75-80% humidity for 6-8 weeks until the sausage loses 33% of its original weight.
eb2dfd27-7931-4d14-99e0-c8876f99cbe0 Remainder: multiply the above ingredients per weight of loin.
eb2dfd27-7931-4d14-99e0-c8876f99cbe0 Trim off the skin and connective tissue from the loin. Using force rub in a generous amount of salt (as needed) all over loin. The loin should rest in a suitable container on a layer of salt and be well covered with salt all around leaving no exposed areas. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
eb2dfd27-7931-4d14-99e0-c8876f99cbe0 Brush off the salt, wash briefly in running water and pat dry with paper towels. Mix spices, cure #2, lemon juice and oil. Rub in all over the loin. Marinate in refrigerator for 48 hours.
eb2dfd27-7931-4d14-99e0-c8876f99cbe0 Stuff the loin into 55-70 mm pork or beef bungs, about 50-70 cm (20-28") long.
eb2dfd27-7931-4d14-99e0-c8876f99cbe0 Dry/ferment at 18-20° C (64-68° F), 80-85% humidity, for 24-48 hours.
eb2dfd27-7931-4d14-99e0-c8876f99cbe0 Dry at 12-14° C (53-57° F), 75-80% humidity, for 3 months.
82b9d432-e809-442a-9aba-da0581f47e72 Trim off the skin and connective tissue from the loin. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours at 0-2° C (32-35° F).
82b9d432-e809-442a-9aba-da0581f47e72 Make a strong curing solution of Baume 20° (80° Salometer) by dissolving 290 g of salt and 40 g of cure #1 in 1250 ml of water. This amount of solution is enough for 2-3 kg loin.
82b9d432-e809-442a-9aba-da0581f47e72 Immerse loin into the curing solution, keep it submerged and hold in refrigerator for 3-4 days. Wash the loin briefly with water to remove salt crystals, then soak it in cold water for 12-24 hours to equalize salt distribution. Hang it to dry until the loin stops dripping water. Pat it dry with paper towels.
82b9d432-e809-442a-9aba-da0581f47e72 Mix spices with a little of water or white wine to create paste. Remainder: multiply the above ingredients per weight of loin.
82b9d432-e809-442a-9aba-da0581f47e72 Rub the paste into the loin all around and hold for 48 hours in refrigerator.
82b9d432-e809-442a-9aba-da0581f47e72 Stuff into 55-70 mm pork bung forming straight links about 45-60 cm (18-24”) long.
82b9d432-e809-442a-9aba-da0581f47e72 Hold in a drying chamber at 10-12° C (50-53° F), 80% humidity, for 40 days.
82b9d432-e809-442a-9aba-da0581f47e72 Hold at room temperature (on in drying chamber) at 18° C (64° F) or lower until fully cured what will take about 3-4 months, depending on the diameter of the sausage and drying conditions.
c465afbc-4a0e-4208-9b76-8c5159b7d058 Dice loin pieces into 1-3 cm (1/4 - 1") cubes. Trim off the skin and connective tissue from the loin. Mix meat with all ingredients well together. Hold in refrigerator for 48 hours.
c465afbc-4a0e-4208-9b76-8c5159b7d058 Stuff tightly into 50-80 mm pork bungs, synthetic permeable casings or blind cap (caecum).
c465afbc-4a0e-4208-9b76-8c5159b7d058 Ferment at 20-22° C (68-72° F), 95→90% humidity, for 48 hours.
c465afbc-4a0e-4208-9b76-8c5159b7d058 Dry at 15→12° C (59-53° F), 85→75% humidity for 2-3 months, depending on diameter. The loin should lose around 33% of its original weight.
c465afbc-4a0e-4208-9b76-8c5159b7d058 Store at 10-12° C (°F), <75% humidity.
e4bf1c6e-1acc-4b35-a1b8-655b0238567c Smash garlic and using mortar and pestle grind it with wine into the paste.
e4bf1c6e-1acc-4b35-a1b8-655b0238567c Grind meat and back fat through 10-12 mm (3/8-1/2") plate.
e4bf1c6e-1acc-4b35-a1b8-655b0238567c Mix meat, fat and all ingredients adding water as necessary to produce a firm paste. Hold the paste for 48 hours in refrigerator.
e4bf1c6e-1acc-4b35-a1b8-655b0238567c Stuff into 34-36 mm pork or beef casings forming 40-60 cm (16-24") sections.
e4bf1c6e-1acc-4b35-a1b8-655b0238567c Dry/ferment at 22-24º C (72-75º F) for 24 hours, 90-85% humidity.
e4bf1c6e-1acc-4b35-a1b8-655b0238567c Dry sausages for 16 days at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 75-80% humidity.
e4bf1c6e-1acc-4b35-a1b8-655b0238567c Store at 10° C (50° F) in a cool and ventilated area or refrigerate.
5165f4c9-2fd2-406c-8a65-80924d524d33 Grind pork with 1/8" plate.
5165f4c9-2fd2-406c-8a65-80924d524d33 Mix all ingredients with meat.
5165f4c9-2fd2-406c-8a65-80924d524d33 Stuff firmly into 40-45 mm beef middles or protein lined fibrous casings.
5165f4c9-2fd2-406c-8a65-80924d524d33 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
5165f4c9-2fd2-406c-8a65-80924d524d33 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for about 2 months. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
5165f4c9-2fd2-406c-8a65-80924d524d33 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
c77880fe-5f1a-42b8-b523-c2127383aff1 Grind meat and fat through 8 mm (3/8”) plate.
c77880fe-5f1a-42b8-b523-c2127383aff1 Mix ground meats with all ingredients. Hold the mixture for 24-36 hours in refrigerator.
c77880fe-5f1a-42b8-b523-c2127383aff1 Stuff into 22-32 mm pork or sheep casings, making horseshoe loops about 40 cm (16”) long. Hold for 8-10 hours in refrigerator or at low temperature.
c77880fe-5f1a-42b8-b523-c2127383aff1 Hang the sausages for 3-4 days at 15-20° C (59-68° F), 60-70% humidity. At this point longaniza can be classified a semi-dry sausage which is served fried or cooked.
c77880fe-5f1a-42b8-b523-c2127383aff1 To make a dry sausage continue drying at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 75-90% for 1-2 weeks depending on diameter. The dry sausage can be consumed raw.
6c57433d-9c16-42e2-a334-e57ba4f1ad2f Smash garlic and using mortar and pestle grind it with wine into the paste.
6c57433d-9c16-42e2-a334-e57ba4f1ad2f Grind meat and back fat through 12 mm (1/2") plate.
6c57433d-9c16-42e2-a334-e57ba4f1ad2f Mix meat, fat and all ingredients adding water as necessary to produce a firm paste.
6c57433d-9c16-42e2-a334-e57ba4f1ad2f Hold the paste for 48 hours in refrigerator.
6c57433d-9c16-42e2-a334-e57ba4f1ad2f Stuff into 25-35 mm veal casings forming 40-60 cm (16-24") sections. Prick air pockets with a needle.
6c57433d-9c16-42e2-a334-e57ba4f1ad2f Ferment at 24º C (75º F) for 12 hours, 90-85% humidity.
6c57433d-9c16-42e2-a334-e57ba4f1ad2f Dry sausages for 12-14 days at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 75-80% humidity.
6c57433d-9c16-42e2-a334-e57ba4f1ad2f Store at 10° C (53° F) in a cool and ventilated area or refrigerate.
caa348da-5590-4587-8e42-d69b492d1c41 Grind pork with 1/8" plate.
caa348da-5590-4587-8e42-d69b492d1c41 Mix all ingredients with meat.
caa348da-5590-4587-8e42-d69b492d1c41 Stuff firmly into 40-45 mm beef middles or protein lined fibrous casings.
caa348da-5590-4587-8e42-d69b492d1c41 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
caa348da-5590-4587-8e42-d69b492d1c41 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for about 2 months. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
caa348da-5590-4587-8e42-d69b492d1c41 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
864c183d-a143-43bc-9fb4-871d19e56841 Grind meat with 8 mm (3/8”) plate.
864c183d-a143-43bc-9fb4-871d19e56841 Mix meat with all ingredients. Hold for 12 hours in refrigerator.
864c183d-a143-43bc-9fb4-871d19e56841 Stuff firmly into 30-34 mm hog casings forming long loops.
864c183d-a143-43bc-9fb4-871d19e56841 Dry/ferment at 24º C (75º F) for 12 hours, 90-85% humidity.
864c183d-a143-43bc-9fb4-871d19e56841 Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 80% humidity for 8 days.
864c183d-a143-43bc-9fb4-871d19e56841 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <70% humidity or refrigerate.
b3e92633-bfbd-4be6-a63a-e94665afde48 Grind pork belly through 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
b3e92633-bfbd-4be6-a63a-e94665afde48 Mix ground meat with all ingredients.
b3e92633-bfbd-4be6-a63a-e94665afde48 Stuff into pork 30-34 mm casings. Form rings about 60 cm (2 feet) long.
b3e92633-bfbd-4be6-a63a-e94665afde48 Hold at 24° C for 12 hours.
b3e92633-bfbd-4be6-a63a-e94665afde48 Dry at room temperature* for 8 days. This will semi-dry sausage. You may continue drying at 12-15° C (53-59° F) to make dry sausage. When the sausage loses about 33% of its original weight it is ready to eat without cooking.
a5e31ad9-4371-45ec-a452-3dd0cf30ebbb Grind pork meat with 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
a5e31ad9-4371-45ec-a452-3dd0cf30ebbb Chop offal meat into smaller pieces.
a5e31ad9-4371-45ec-a452-3dd0cf30ebbb Mix meats with all other ingredients and hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
a5e31ad9-4371-45ec-a452-3dd0cf30ebbb Stuff firmly into 32 mm hog casing.
a5e31ad9-4371-45ec-a452-3dd0cf30ebbb Smoke at 18° C (64° F) with oak wood for 2-3 days. The smoking process may be interrupted as long as the temperature stays below 18° C (64° F).
a5e31ad9-4371-45ec-a452-3dd0cf30ebbb Dry at 12-15° C (53-5°9 F) for 21 days.
a5e31ad9-4371-45ec-a452-3dd0cf30ebbb Store at 12° C (53° F), <65% humidity.
f67cf1df-6573-4e1d-9cd7-117f9c3c1884 Grind all meats through 8-10 mm (3/8”) plate.
f67cf1df-6573-4e1d-9cd7-117f9c3c1884 Mix meat with salt and spices.
f67cf1df-6573-4e1d-9cd7-117f9c3c1884 Stuff into 12 mm sheep casings forming 20-30 cm (8-12”) long links.
f67cf1df-6573-4e1d-9cd7-117f9c3c1884 Dry at 18→12° C (64→59° F) for 7-10 days.
f67cf1df-6573-4e1d-9cd7-117f9c3c1884 Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F) in a cool and ventilated area or refrigerate.
82dc2ecc-43c9-494b-b384-91c9998b7841 Grind meat and fat through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
82dc2ecc-43c9-494b-b384-91c9998b7841 Mix meat, fat and all ingredients. Hold the paste for 48 hours in refrigerator.
82dc2ecc-43c9-494b-b384-91c9998b7841 Stuff into 55 mm pork middles. Prick air pockets with a needle.
82dc2ecc-43c9-494b-b384-91c9998b7841 Dry/ferment at 24º C (75º F) for 12 hours, 90-85% humidity.
82dc2ecc-43c9-494b-b384-91c9998b7841 Dry sausages for 30 days at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 75-80% humidity.
82dc2ecc-43c9-494b-b384-91c9998b7841 Store at 10° C (53° F) in a cool and ventilated area or refrigerate.
701fdcae-fc2e-448e-960e-cfcf7a52fa1d Cut or grind meats through 12 mm (1/2”) plate.
701fdcae-fc2e-448e-960e-cfcf7a52fa1d Mix meats with salt and spices. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
701fdcae-fc2e-448e-960e-cfcf7a52fa1d Stuff in 30-36 mm hog casings forming loops about 50 cm (20”) long.
701fdcae-fc2e-448e-960e-cfcf7a52fa1d Dry/ferment at 17-18° C (62-64° F), 95→80% humidity for 24 hours.
701fdcae-fc2e-448e-960e-cfcf7a52fa1d Dry at 12-14° C (53-58° F), 70-75% humidity for 15-30 days.
701fdcae-fc2e-448e-960e-cfcf7a52fa1d Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <70% humidity or refrigerate.
068fb0a2-4f16-4a14-98e4-4ba2b6aa9af3 Grind pork and back fat through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
068fb0a2-4f16-4a14-98e4-4ba2b6aa9af3 Mix all ingredients with meat and hold for 24 hours in refrigerate.
068fb0a2-4f16-4a14-98e4-4ba2b6aa9af3 Stuff firmly into 40 mm beef middles or protein lined fibrous casings. U-shaped loops.
068fb0a2-4f16-4a14-98e4-4ba2b6aa9af3 Ferment/dry at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
068fb0a2-4f16-4a14-98e4-4ba2b6aa9af3 Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85-80% humidity for about 2 months. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
068fb0a2-4f16-4a14-98e4-4ba2b6aa9af3 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
d75bf725-99a5-423d-b8dc-4273040783c9 Grind lean pork and fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
d75bf725-99a5-423d-b8dc-4273040783c9 Mix all ingredients with meat.
d75bf725-99a5-423d-b8dc-4273040783c9 Stuff firmly into 28-30 mm hog casings.
d75bf725-99a5-423d-b8dc-4273040783c9 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity. At the beginning of the fermentation process place weight on sausages to flatten them out.
d75bf725-99a5-423d-b8dc-4273040783c9 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for about 1-2 months.
d75bf725-99a5-423d-b8dc-4273040783c9 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
21755daa-2c94-424d-b355-b64dafb43bbb Cut or grind meat through a 3/8” (10 mm) plate. Cut fat into 3/8” (10 mm) cubes.
21755daa-2c94-424d-b355-b64dafb43bbb Roast pine nuts in butter or lard until light brown. Mix salt, cure #2 and spices with garum sauce then mix with ground meat. Add pepper corns, roasted pine nuts, fat and mix again.
21755daa-2c94-424d-b355-b64dafb43bbb Stuff firmly into 32-26 mm hog casings making pairs. Make links 12” (30 cm) long. Smoke with a thin cold smoke at 18° C (68° F) for two days. Dry sausage for a month at 12° C (53° F) at low humidity. Store at 12° C ( 53° F).
21755daa-2c94-424d-b355-b64dafb43bbb An easier to make hot smoked version: Decrease the amount of salt to 12 g (2 tsp). Except smoking other processing steps remain the same. Smoke sausage for 2 hours at 60° C (140° F). Increase smokehouse temperature to 85° C (185° F) and bake the sausage for 90 minutes or cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 35 minutes. Cool in cold water, dry briefly and refrigerate.
c0ae69cb-fcb4-4b88-b94a-71cf705503ed Grind 1/2 lean pork (250 g) through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
c0ae69cb-fcb4-4b88-b94a-71cf705503ed Grind remaining lean pork and belly through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
c0ae69cb-fcb4-4b88-b94a-71cf705503ed Mix ground meats with all ingredients.
c0ae69cb-fcb4-4b88-b94a-71cf705503ed Stuff into 60 mm pork or beef middles or permeable synthetic casings.
c0ae69cb-fcb4-4b88-b94a-71cf705503ed Ferment at 20º C (68º F), 95 → 90% humidity for 3 days.
c0ae69cb-fcb4-4b88-b94a-71cf705503ed Dry at 18º C (64º F), 90 → 85% humidity for 3 days.
c0ae69cb-fcb4-4b88-b94a-71cf705503ed Dry at 15 → 12º C (59 → 12º F), 85 → 75% humidity for 4-5 weeks or until the sausage looses 30% of its original weight..
c0ae69cb-fcb4-4b88-b94a-71cf705503ed Store at 10-12º C (50-53º F),75% humidity or refrigerate.
472f53fb-f635-4312-a96d-13fc092af568 Boil potatoes.
472f53fb-f635-4312-a96d-13fc092af568 Grind all meats through 3/16” (5 mm) plate. Re-freeze and grind again through 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
472f53fb-f635-4312-a96d-13fc092af568 Mix everything together, add 1 cup of water.
472f53fb-f635-4312-a96d-13fc092af568 Stuff into 35-40 mm hog, beef middles or fibrous casings.
472f53fb-f635-4312-a96d-13fc092af568 Ferment at 24° C (75° F), 80-85% humidity for 72 hours.
472f53fb-f635-4312-a96d-13fc092af568 Apply cold smoke for about 1 hour each day.
472f53fb-f635-4312-a96d-13fc092af568 Partially cook to 60° C (140° F) internal meat temperature.
472f53fb-f635-4312-a96d-13fc092af568 OR
472f53fb-f635-4312-a96d-13fc092af568 Smoke for 6 hours at 46° C (115° F) gradually raising temperature until sausage reaches 140° F (60° C) inside.
80b9affa-392a-420f-ab6d-057446194296 Grind lamb through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
80b9affa-392a-420f-ab6d-057446194296 Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
80b9affa-392a-420f-ab6d-057446194296 Stuff firmly into sheep casings 18-26 mm and form 5-6” (15 cm) long links or leave in one continuous rope.
80b9affa-392a-420f-ab6d-057446194296 Ferment at 24º C (75º F) for 48 hours, 90-85% humidity.
80b9affa-392a-420f-ab6d-057446194296 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 18 days.
80b9affa-392a-420f-ab6d-057446194296 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
0d6586cf-1730-40f3-9b67-17ee28a991ab Grind all meats through 3 mm (1/8" plate). Re-freeze meats and grind again. You may grind once and then emulsify in the food processor without adding water.
0d6586cf-1730-40f3-9b67-17ee28a991ab Add all ingredients during this step.
0d6586cf-1730-40f3-9b67-17ee28a991ab Stuff firmly into 40-60 mm beef middles or fibrous casings. 40 cm (16") links.
0d6586cf-1730-40f3-9b67-17ee28a991ab Ferment for 48 hours at 18º C (64º F), 75-80% humidity.
0d6586cf-1730-40f3-9b67-17ee28a991ab Apply cold smoke for 12 hours at 18º C (64º F).
0d6586cf-1730-40f3-9b67-17ee28a991ab Store in a refrigerator
f0bc6bea-3579-449e-97d6-204e7e45a323 Curing: cut meat into 5-6 cm (2”) cubes, mix with salt and cure #1. Keep pork and beef separate. Pack tightly in containers and cover with a clean cloth. Place in a cooler at 4-6º C (40-42º F) for 72 hours.
f0bc6bea-3579-449e-97d6-204e7e45a323 Grind all meats through 1/8” (3 mm plate), refreeze and grind again OR grind once and then emulsify in food processor without adding water. Add spices when grinding or emulsifying.
f0bc6bea-3579-449e-97d6-204e7e45a323 Stuff firmly into 40 mm beef middles or fibrous casings. Form 8-10” (20-25 cm) links.
f0bc6bea-3579-449e-97d6-204e7e45a323 Hang for 1-2 days at 2-6° C (35-43° F) and 85-90% humidity.
f0bc6bea-3579-449e-97d6-204e7e45a323 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18-22° C (64-72° F) for 1-2 days until casings develop brown color.
f0bc6bea-3579-449e-97d6-204e7e45a323 Cool in air to 12° C (53° F) or lower. Store in refrigerator.
ef5289ec-099c-4110-833f-f042f0bc16d9 Grind meats through 6 mm (1/4”) plate. Beat the eggs.
ef5289ec-099c-4110-833f-f042f0bc16d9 Mix meats with eggs and all ingredients. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
ef5289ec-099c-4110-833f-f042f0bc16d9 Stuff into 30 mm pork or beef casings forming rings about 25-40 cm (10-16”) long. Tie the ends together.
ef5289ec-099c-4110-833f-f042f0bc16d9 Hold at 20-25° C (60-77° F), 75-85% humidity, for 10 days.
ef5289ec-099c-4110-833f-f042f0bc16d9 Store at 20-22° C (60-71° F) 70-75% humidity or refrigerate.
2215486b-32d5-4da9-8576-044127febf25 Manually cut pork meat with fat attached into 20-30 mm (3/4-1.5") cubes.
2215486b-32d5-4da9-8576-044127febf25 Mix all ingredients with meat together. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
2215486b-32d5-4da9-8576-044127febf25 Stuff firmly into pork cap (caecum) large intestine, around 18-25 cm (8-10”) long. Reinforce lengthwise and across with twine.
2215486b-32d5-4da9-8576-044127febf25 Dry at 12-15° C (53-59° F), 75-80% humidity for 2-3 months. The total time depends on the diameter of the sausage and temperature/humidity. In natural chambers without control of temperature and humidity the drying time could be from 3-4 months or even longer.*
2215486b-32d5-4da9-8576-044127febf25 Store at 12° C (53° F), 65% humidity.
4b368059-a592-4aa1-8036-570a74022262 Cut meat with attached fat into 25 mm (1”) pieces.
4b368059-a592-4aa1-8036-570a74022262 Mix with salt and spices. Hold for 24 hours in refrigerator.
4b368059-a592-4aa1-8036-570a74022262 Stuff into pork blind cap (caecum) casing. The casing is about 18-25 cm long. Reinforce lengthwise and across with butcher twine. The stuffed morcón looks like an oval small rugby ball.
4b368059-a592-4aa1-8036-570a74022262 Ferment/dry at 20° C (68° F), 85-90% humidity, for 48 hours.
4b368059-a592-4aa1-8036-570a74022262 Dry at 10-15° C (50-59° F), 80% humidity, for 2-3 months. The total time depends on the diameter of the sausage and temperature/humidity. In natural chambers without control of temperature and humidity the drying time could be from 3-4 months or even longer.
4b368059-a592-4aa1-8036-570a74022262 Store at 12° C (53° F), 65% humidity.
8e94d39f-91b7-4457-a739-2c6f5ad98f00 Cut meat into 25 mm (1”) pieces.
8e94d39f-91b7-4457-a739-2c6f5ad98f00 Mix well meat with salt and spices.
8e94d39f-91b7-4457-a739-2c6f5ad98f00 Stuff into pork large intestine blind cap (caecum) casing. The casing is about 18-25 cm long. Reinforce lengthwise and across with twine. The stuffed morcón looks like an oval small rugby ball.
8e94d39f-91b7-4457-a739-2c6f5ad98f00 Hold at 10° C (50° F), 90% humidity, for 8-10 days.
8e94d39f-91b7-4457-a739-2c6f5ad98f00 Dry at 12-14° C (53-57° F), 80% humidity, for 2-3 months. The total time depends on the diameter of the sausage and temperature/humidity. In natural chambers without control of temperature and humidity, drying time could be 3-4 months or even longer.
8e94d39f-91b7-4457-a739-2c6f5ad98f00 Store at 12° C (53° F), 65% humidity.
0cb00d33-e59a-471f-9972-b9b6a4ac5a1b Grind lean meat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
0cb00d33-e59a-471f-9972-b9b6a4ac5a1b Dice fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
0cb00d33-e59a-471f-9972-b9b6a4ac5a1b 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
0cb00d33-e59a-471f-9972-b9b6a4ac5a1b Mix lean pork with salt and cure #2. Add spices and culture. Mix. Add diced fat and mix all together.
0cb00d33-e59a-471f-9972-b9b6a4ac5a1b Stuff firmly into 40 mm natural casings making 8” (20 cm) links.
0cb00d33-e59a-471f-9972-b9b6a4ac5a1b Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
0cb00d33-e59a-471f-9972-b9b6a4ac5a1b Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F), 65-75% humidity for 2 days.
0cb00d33-e59a-471f-9972-b9b6a4ac5a1b Dry at 15→12° C (59→53° F), 65-75% humidity for 30 days.
0cb00d33-e59a-471f-9972-b9b6a4ac5a1b Store at 10-12° C (50°-55 F), 75% humidity.
d7afd806-40a2-4179-93dd-75d51f3f703f Cut back fat ino 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
d7afd806-40a2-4179-93dd-75d51f3f703f Grind pork through 3/8” plate (10 mm). Refreeze and grind again through 1/8” plate (3 mm). Do the same with beef.
d7afd806-40a2-4179-93dd-75d51f3f703f Mix all ingredients with meat and diced fat.
d7afd806-40a2-4179-93dd-75d51f3f703f Stuff firmly into 100-120 mm (4-5”) protein lined fibrous casings, 12” long.
d7afd806-40a2-4179-93dd-75d51f3f703f Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
d7afd806-40a2-4179-93dd-75d51f3f703f Preheat smokehouse (no smoke applied) to 49º C (120º F) and hold sausages at this temperature for 12 hours (to remove the moisture from the sausage). Gradually increase temperature until an internal temperature of 138º F (59º C) is obtained.
d7afd806-40a2-4179-93dd-75d51f3f703f Cool down sausages by hanging them at room temperature.
d7afd806-40a2-4179-93dd-75d51f3f703f Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
0f347d9d-76cd-4128-8cf8-a621ca89a61a Curing meat. Cut meat into 1 inch (25 mm) pieces. Place beef and fat in separate food grade container. Mix beef with 24 g (4 tsp) salt, Cure #1 and sugar. Mix pork fat with 11 g (2 tsp) salt. Pack tightly to eliminate air and cover with clean cloth. Place for 72 hours in refrigerator. Discard any liquid brine and submit meat to grinding.
0f347d9d-76cd-4128-8cf8-a621ca89a61a Grind beef through 1/8" (2 mm) plate. Dice back fat into ¼” (6 mm) cubes.
0f347d9d-76cd-4128-8cf8-a621ca89a61a Mix beef with spices. Add fat cubes and mix everything together. Don’t add any water.
0f347d9d-76cd-4128-8cf8-a621ca89a61a Stuff sausages firmly into 45-55 mm beef middles or fibrous casings. Make 10-20” (25-50 cm) links.
0f347d9d-76cd-4128-8cf8-a621ca89a61a Hang sausages for 5-7 days at 2-4 C, 85-90% humidity.
0f347d9d-76cd-4128-8cf8-a621ca89a61a Using dry wood, smoke sausages for 2-3 days with cold smoke, 18-22 C.
0f347d9d-76cd-4128-8cf8-a621ca89a61a Dry sausages for 5-7 days (depending on sausage diameter) at 11-15 C, 80-84 humidity. Dry 20-23 days more at 10-12 C, 74-78% humidity.
29a89889-432c-4460-9bf4-00befc29271a Soak minced garlic and fennel seeds in red wine.
29a89889-432c-4460-9bf4-00befc29271a Grind pork shoulder through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
29a89889-432c-4460-9bf4-00befc29271a Grind partially frozen fat through 1/8” (3 mm) plate. Place for 30 minutes in a freezer and grind again.
29a89889-432c-4460-9bf4-00befc29271a 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
29a89889-432c-4460-9bf4-00befc29271a Mix pork shoulder with salt and cure #2. Add spices, wine and culture. Mix. Add ground fat and mix all together.
29a89889-432c-4460-9bf4-00befc29271a Stuff firmly into 60 mm pork or beef middles.
29a89889-432c-4460-9bf4-00befc29271a Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
29a89889-432c-4460-9bf4-00befc29271a Apply a thin cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 2 days. Smoking does not have to be continuous as long as 18º C temperature is maintained.
29a89889-432c-4460-9bf4-00befc29271a Dry at 15→12° C (59→53° F), 65-75% humidity for 3-4 weeks.
29a89889-432c-4460-9bf4-00befc29271a Store at 10-12° C (50°-55 F), 75% humidity.
38d061a4-a71f-4aca-b2e1-f672c5ebd1ce Curing meat. Cut meat into 1 inch (25 mm) pieces. Place beef, pork and pork back fat in separate food grade containers. Mix pork back fat with 12 g (2 tsp) salt. Mix beef and pork meat with 18 g salt, Cure #1 and sugar according to the recipe (estimate amounts). Pack tightly to eliminate air and cover with clean cloth. Place for 72 hours in refrigerator. Discard any liquid brine and submit meat to grinding.
38d061a4-a71f-4aca-b2e1-f672c5ebd1ce Grind beef through 1/8” (2 mm) plate. Grind pork through 1/8” (2 mm) plate. Dice back fat into ¼" (6 mm) cubes.
38d061a4-a71f-4aca-b2e1-f672c5ebd1ce Mix beef with salt, cure, sugar and spices. Add pork, wine and mix. Add fat cubes and remix everything together. Don’t add any water.
38d061a4-a71f-4aca-b2e1-f672c5ebd1ce Stuff sausages firmly into 45 mm beef rounds or hog casings. Links in ring shape, from 3-6” (8-15 cm) inside diameter.
38d061a4-a71f-4aca-b2e1-f672c5ebd1ce Hang sausages for 5-7 days at 2-4 C, 85-90% humidity.
38d061a4-a71f-4aca-b2e1-f672c5ebd1ce Using dry wood, smoke sausages for 2 days with cold smoke, 18-22 C.
38d061a4-a71f-4aca-b2e1-f672c5ebd1ce Dry sausages for 5 days (depending on sausage diameter) at 11-15 C, 80-84 humidity. Dry 20 days more at 10-12 C, 74-78% humidity.
363c2749-f7ba-48f5-a0bb-11fcb2270eb3 Curing meat. Cut meat into 1 inch (25 mm) pieces. Place beef, pork and pork belly in separate food grade containers and mix with salt, Cure #1 and sugar according to the recipe (estimate amounts). Pack tightly to eliminate air and cover with clean cloth. Place for 72 hours in refrigerator. Discard any liquid brine and submit meat to grinding.
363c2749-f7ba-48f5-a0bb-11fcb2270eb3 Grind beef through 1/8" (2 mm) plate. Grind pork through 1/8" (2 mm) plate. Slice pork belly into strips, ½" x ¼" x ¼" (12mm x 5mm x 5mm).
363c2749-f7ba-48f5-a0bb-11fcb2270eb3 Mix beef with salt, cure, sugar and spices. Add pork and mix. Add bacon strips and remix everything together. Don’t add any water.
363c2749-f7ba-48f5-a0bb-11fcb2270eb3 Stuff sausages firmly into 45-55 mm beef middles or fibrous casings. Make links up to 20” (50 cm ) long.
363c2749-f7ba-48f5-a0bb-11fcb2270eb3 Hang sausages for 5-7 days at 2-4 C, 85-90% humidity.
363c2749-f7ba-48f5-a0bb-11fcb2270eb3 Using dry wood, smoke sausages for 2-3 days with cold smoke, 18-22 C.
363c2749-f7ba-48f5-a0bb-11fcb2270eb3 Dry sausages for 5-7 days (depending on sausage diameter) at 11-15 C, 80-84 humidity. Dry 20-23 days more at 10-12 C, 74-78% humidity.
102d7de7-fd92-46f9-ab6c-bb1655d46b6f Cut beef into 2” (5 cm) cubes. Mix with salt, cure #2, sugar and pack tightly in a container, covering the meat with a clean cloth to prevent discoloration of the top layer of the meat. Hold in a refrigerator for 10 days.
102d7de7-fd92-46f9-ab6c-bb1655d46b6f Grind the meat through 3/8” (8 mm) plate.
102d7de7-fd92-46f9-ab6c-bb1655d46b6f Mix the ground meat with all ingredients.
102d7de7-fd92-46f9-ab6c-bb1655d46b6f Stuff into beef middles. Hold in the refrigerator for 24 hours.
102d7de7-fd92-46f9-ab6c-bb1655d46b6f Apply a thin cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 1 day. Oakwood or beech wood is used.
c267aa1b-ec7f-480b-85a7-13806ee615c4 Made marinade by mixing salt, cure #1, spices and wine.
c267aa1b-ec7f-480b-85a7-13806ee615c4 Chop meat and fat into 3/4” (20 mm) pieces.
c267aa1b-ec7f-480b-85a7-13806ee615c4 Mix meat and fat with marinade and hold for 2 days in refrigerator.
c267aa1b-ec7f-480b-85a7-13806ee615c4 Mix marinated meat and red pepper paste together.
c267aa1b-ec7f-480b-85a7-13806ee615c4 Stuff into 36-40 mm hog casings forming 1 foot (30 cm) links.
c267aa1b-ec7f-480b-85a7-13806ee615c4 Using oak wood apply a thin smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 7 days. Smoking need not to be continuous, as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. Think of the process as drying with smoke. Due to seasonal variations in temperature, the sausage is smoked for 3-4 days in the summer and 5-6 days in the winter.
c267aa1b-ec7f-480b-85a7-13806ee615c4 Dry/store at 12° C (53° F). 70% humidity.
6ce0f585-885f-43ca-93f0-ed413fd89a7c * Pepper paste. Cut bell peppers lengthwise into halves. Discard stems and seeds. Get a suitable pan and sprinkle salt on the bottom. Place peppers on salt, then cover them with more salt. Repeat the procedure creating a multilayer combination with salt being the top layer. Hold for 8 days. Rinse with water, pat dry with paper towel and grind through 1/8” (3 mm) plate or emulsify in food processor.
6ce0f585-885f-43ca-93f0-ed413fd89a7c Made marinade by mixing salt, cure #1, spices and 60 ml of water.
6ce0f585-885f-43ca-93f0-ed413fd89a7c Chop meat and fat into 3/8” (10 mm) pieces.
6ce0f585-885f-43ca-93f0-ed413fd89a7c Mix meat and fat with marinade and hold for 2 days at 10 °C (50° F) or lower (refrigerator). Drain.
6ce0f585-885f-43ca-93f0-ed413fd89a7c Mix marinated meat and red pepper paste together.
6ce0f585-885f-43ca-93f0-ed413fd89a7c Stuff into large hog casings. This is a large sausage, which has a straight cylindrical section, measuring between 5-8” (12-20 cm) in length and between 60-150 mm in diameter.
6ce0f585-885f-43ca-93f0-ed413fd89a7c Using oak wood apply a thin smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 7 days. Smoking need not to be continuous, as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. Think of the process as drying with smoke. Due to seasonal variations in temperature, the sausage is smoked for 3-4 days in the summer and 5-6 days in the winter.
6ce0f585-885f-43ca-93f0-ed413fd89a7c Dry/store at 5-15° C (41-59° F).
5c842c9d-9f7f-45ee-af49-9bfec61f40d1 Grind pork through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
5c842c9d-9f7f-45ee-af49-9bfec61f40d1 Marinate ground pork with salt and the local red wine for 4 days.
5c842c9d-9f7f-45ee-af49-9bfec61f40d1 Drain any excess of wine, add spices and mix all together.
5c842c9d-9f7f-45ee-af49-9bfec61f40d1 Stuff into 32 mm hog casings and form 3-7 sausage links in each consecutive section.
5c842c9d-9f7f-45ee-af49-9bfec61f40d1 Dry sausages at 12 -15º C (53-59º F), low humidity for 30 days.
ed2a0934-ef14-42c7-acb8-f3547dc8d6b9 Grind pork through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
ed2a0934-ef14-42c7-acb8-f3547dc8d6b9 Grind fat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
ed2a0934-ef14-42c7-acb8-f3547dc8d6b9 Peel potatoes and boil them until soft. Drain potatoes and smash them. Set mashed potatoes on a flat surface and allow them to release steam and moisture.
ed2a0934-ef14-42c7-acb8-f3547dc8d6b9 Except starter culture, mix meat, fat, potatoes with other ingredients.
ed2a0934-ef14-42c7-acb8-f3547dc8d6b9 30 minutes before mixing add starter culture to 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
ed2a0934-ef14-42c7-acb8-f3547dc8d6b9 Mix meat, fat, potatoes and all other ingredients together.
ed2a0934-ef14-42c7-acb8-f3547dc8d6b9 Stuff firmly into 36 mm hog casings. Make 12” (30 cm) loops.
ed2a0934-ef14-42c7-acb8-f3547dc8d6b9 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
ed2a0934-ef14-42c7-acb8-f3547dc8d6b9 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 30 days. The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost.
ed2a0934-ef14-42c7-acb8-f3547dc8d6b9 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
16065f4a-2e8f-44af-b6b8-03e6c0b23637 Grind pork and beef through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
16065f4a-2e8f-44af-b6b8-03e6c0b23637 Mix all ingredients with meat.
16065f4a-2e8f-44af-b6b8-03e6c0b23637 Stuff firmly into beef middles or 2” fibrous casings.
16065f4a-2e8f-44af-b6b8-03e6c0b23637 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
16065f4a-2e8f-44af-b6b8-03e6c0b23637 Optional step: cold smoke for 8 hours (< 22º C, 72º F).
16065f4a-2e8f-44af-b6b8-03e6c0b23637 Dry at 16 -12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity. In about 6-8 weeks a shrink of 30% should be achieved.
16065f4a-2e8f-44af-b6b8-03e6c0b23637 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), < 75% humidity.
9bf2d983-a252-43f5-84ad-510b6de71f85 Grind pork through 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
9bf2d983-a252-43f5-84ad-510b6de71f85 Grind fat through 5 mm (1/4”) plate.
9bf2d983-a252-43f5-84ad-510b6de71f85 Grind beef through 10 mm plate (1/4”), then grind again with 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
9bf2d983-a252-43f5-84ad-510b6de71f85 Mix meats with all ingredients together, Add ground fat and mix again.
9bf2d983-a252-43f5-84ad-510b6de71f85 Stuff into 60 mm beef middles.
9bf2d983-a252-43f5-84ad-510b6de71f85 Ferment at 20° C (68° F), 90 → 85% humidity for 3 days.
9bf2d983-a252-43f5-84ad-510b6de71f85 Smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 24 hours.
9bf2d983-a252-43f5-84ad-510b6de71f85 Dry at 14 → 12° C (57 → 53° F), 80 → 75% humidity for 5 weeks or until sausage looses 33% of its original weight.
9bf2d983-a252-43f5-84ad-510b6de71f85 Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <75% humidity.
67524672-709f-4913-b26c-c072cc65571d Grind the lean meat with a 3/8” grinder plate and the fat meat through 3/16” plate.
67524672-709f-4913-b26c-c072cc65571d Mix everything together.
67524672-709f-4913-b26c-c072cc65571d Stuff mixture into 32 - 36 mm hog casings and form links 12 - 13” 30 - 35 cm. Leave links in long coils.
67524672-709f-4913-b26c-c072cc65571d Hang for 1-2 days at 2-6°C (35-42°F) and 85-90% humidity.
67524672-709f-4913-b26c-c072cc65571d Apply thin cold smoke for 1-1.5 days until the casings develop yellow-light brown color. Re-arrange smoke sticks or smoke carts during smoking.
67524672-709f-4913-b26c-c072cc65571d Dry at 10-12°C (50-53°F) and 75-80% humidity until the yield is 87% in relation to the original weight of the meat.
67524672-709f-4913-b26c-c072cc65571d Divide into pairs.
67524672-709f-4913-b26c-c072cc65571d Store in refrigerator or continue drying.
fdabd101-f00f-47d2-a109-dba182f8050c Grind all meats and fat through 5 mm plate.
fdabd101-f00f-47d2-a109-dba182f8050c Mix ground meats with all ingredients until sticky.
fdabd101-f00f-47d2-a109-dba182f8050c Place the mixture in a container for 24 hours at 2-4° C (35-40° F) which is refrigerator temperature.
fdabd101-f00f-47d2-a109-dba182f8050c Stuff into 60 mm synthetic fibrous casings.
fdabd101-f00f-47d2-a109-dba182f8050c Place sausages in a container one on top of another and hold for 4-5 days at 2-4° C (35-40°F), 85-90% humidity.
fdabd101-f00f-47d2-a109-dba182f8050c Hang for 2-3 days at 8-10° C (46-50° F), 80-85% humidity.
fdabd101-f00f-47d2-a109-dba182f8050c Apply cold smoke for 2-3 days until brown in color.
fdabd101-f00f-47d2-a109-dba182f8050c Cool in air to 10-12° C (50-53° F) or lower. Hold at this temperature at 75-85% humidity for 7-10 days.
2bda1134-166e-454b-ada7-4b9a730a9db5 Curing meat. Cut meat into 1 inch (25 mm) pieces. Place beef, pork and fat in separate food grade containers and mix beef and pork with salt, Cure #1 and sugar according to the recipe (estimate amounts). Fat needs salt only. Pack tightly to eliminate air and cover with clean cloth. Place for 72 hours in refrigerator. Discard any liquid brine and submit meat to grinding.
2bda1134-166e-454b-ada7-4b9a730a9db5 Grind beef through 1/8" (2 mm) plate. Grind pork through 1/8" (2 mm) plate. Dice pork belly into 1/8" (3 mm) cubes.
2bda1134-166e-454b-ada7-4b9a730a9db5 Mix beef with spices. Add pork and wine and mix. Add fat cubes and remix everything together. Don’t add any water.
2bda1134-166e-454b-ada7-4b9a730a9db5 Stuff sausages firmly into 35-45 mm beef rounds or hog casings. Sausage in ring shape, inside diameter 3-6” (8-15 cm). Both ends tied together.
2bda1134-166e-454b-ada7-4b9a730a9db5 Hang sausages for 5-7 days at 2-4 C, 85-90% humidity.
2bda1134-166e-454b-ada7-4b9a730a9db5 Using dry wood, smoke sausages for 2-3 days with cold smoke, 18-22 C.
2bda1134-166e-454b-ada7-4b9a730a9db5 Dry sausages for 5-7 days (depending on sausage diameter) at 11-15 C, 80-84 humidity. Dry 20-23 days more at 10-12 C, 74-78% humidity.
03b153a4-ab69-4716-bba9-0c22382dd223 Grind lean pork and belly through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
03b153a4-ab69-4716-bba9-0c22382dd223 Mix the sausage mass with all ingredients.
03b153a4-ab69-4716-bba9-0c22382dd223 Stuff into 36 mm pork casings forming 36 cm (15") links.
03b153a4-ab69-4716-bba9-0c22382dd223 Ferment for 48 hours at 18° C (64° F), 75-80% humidity.
03b153a4-ab69-4716-bba9-0c22382dd223 Cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 12 hours.
03b153a4-ab69-4716-bba9-0c22382dd223 Refrigerate.
7da9c685-a02a-424c-971e-b38fbb689909 Grind meat through 5/16” (8 mm) plate.
7da9c685-a02a-424c-971e-b38fbb689909 Using a sharp knife cut partially frozen back fat into 5/16” (8 mm) cubes. Dilute culture in 1 tablespoon of de-chlorinated water 3o minutes before mixing.
7da9c685-a02a-424c-971e-b38fbb689909 Mix ground lean meat with salt and cure #2 until sticky.
7da9c685-a02a-424c-971e-b38fbb689909 Add fat cubes, culture and spices and mix all together.
7da9c685-a02a-424c-971e-b38fbb689909 Stuff firmly into 50 mm hog or beef middles.Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
7da9c685-a02a-424c-971e-b38fbb689909 Dry at 16 → 12º C (60-54º F), 85 → 80% humidity for 45 days. The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost. The sausage should develop a white mold which is expected and desired.
7da9c685-a02a-424c-971e-b38fbb689909 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
d5bd6c70-979c-4b2e-a220-75526526e781 Cut meat and fat into 5-6 cm (2”) pieces, mix with salt, sugar and Cure # 1 and place in a cool area for 4 - 5 days.
d5bd6c70-979c-4b2e-a220-75526526e781 Grind beef with 3/8” (10 mm) plate. Manually cut back fat into ¼” (6 mm) cubes.
d5bd6c70-979c-4b2e-a220-75526526e781 Mix all ingredients with meat adding wine. Mix until all wine is absorbed by the mixture. Then add diced fat and mix everything together.
d5bd6c70-979c-4b2e-a220-75526526e781 Stuff into dry beef middles or synthetic fibrous casings 40-60 mm and form 12” (30 cm) long links.
d5bd6c70-979c-4b2e-a220-75526526e781 Hang for 2 days in a cool place.
d5bd6c70-979c-4b2e-a220-75526526e781 Cold smoke for 6 days.
d5bd6c70-979c-4b2e-a220-75526526e781 Dry for 25 - 30 days in a cool, dry and drafty area.
3b206c3c-8424-4af2-8fd2-e79fe9b0245f Cook heart, lungs, stomach in water (below boiling point) until soft. Scald liver in hot water for 5 minutes.
3b206c3c-8424-4af2-8fd2-e79fe9b0245f Grind beef and fat through 10 mm (3/8") plate. Grind offal meats through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
3b206c3c-8424-4af2-8fd2-e79fe9b0245f Mix meats, fat and all ingredients together. Hold for 12 hours in refrigerator. Stuff into 40-50 mm pork or beef middles.
3b206c3c-8424-4af2-8fd2-e79fe9b0245f Ferment/dry at 25° C (77° F), 90% humidity for 48 hours.
3b206c3c-8424-4af2-8fd2-e79fe9b0245f Dry at 14-15° C (57-59° F), 70% humidity for 30 days.
3b206c3c-8424-4af2-8fd2-e79fe9b0245f Store at 10-12° C (50-52° F), 60-65% humidity or refrigerate.
21ff0d6d-dc6a-43e2-9f29-1c6f90966c8b Grind lean pork and belly through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
21ff0d6d-dc6a-43e2-9f29-1c6f90966c8b Mix with all ingredients.
21ff0d6d-dc6a-43e2-9f29-1c6f90966c8b Stuff into 42 mm pork or beef casings forming 50 cm (20") rings.
21ff0d6d-dc6a-43e2-9f29-1c6f90966c8b Ferment for 24-48 hours at 18° C (64° F), 75-80% humidity.
21ff0d6d-dc6a-43e2-9f29-1c6f90966c8b Cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 12 hours.
21ff0d6d-dc6a-43e2-9f29-1c6f90966c8b Refrigerate.
45089d7c-ba60-4351-ab7d-9fe38559bd18 Grind lean meat through 1/8-3/16” (3-4 mm) plate.
45089d7c-ba60-4351-ab7d-9fe38559bd18 Cut fat into 1/8-3/16” (3-4 mm) cubes or grind through 1/8-3/16” (3-4 mm) plate.
45089d7c-ba60-4351-ab7d-9fe38559bd18 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
45089d7c-ba60-4351-ab7d-9fe38559bd18 Mix lean pork with salt and cure #2. Add spices and culture. Mix. Add diced fat and mix all together.
45089d7c-ba60-4351-ab7d-9fe38559bd18 Stuff firmly into 60-90 mm horse or collagen casings making 8-12” (20-30 cm) straight links, clipped or tied at both ends.
45089d7c-ba60-4351-ab7d-9fe38559bd18 Dry sausages for 24 hours at 10-15° C (50-59° F) with moderate air circulation.
45089d7c-ba60-4351-ab7d-9fe38559bd18 Apply cold smoke at 10-24° C (50-75° F) for 3 to maximum 10 days, with relative humidity of 85 to 92%, using oak, beech or mixture of both woods. Smoking does not have to be continuous as long as low temperature is maintained. Cold smoking is drying with smoke. Fermentation takes place during the smoking step.
45089d7c-ba60-4351-ab7d-9fe38559bd18 When no more smoke is applied (smoke prevents growth of mold) the sausages are sprayed with Penicillium nalgiovense mold growing culture. The temperature is maintained at 10-24° C (50-75° F), 85% humidity for about 10-12 days.
45089d7c-ba60-4351-ab7d-9fe38559bd18 When the sausages are completely covered with white, grey, or white yellow mold, they are manually brushed what creates a better look and facilitates drying. Then the sausages are dried/matured at 10-15° C (50-59° F) for about 60 days. As the drying continues the humidity is lowered.
45089d7c-ba60-4351-ab7d-9fe38559bd18 Store sausages at 10-12° C (50°-55 F), 60-70% humidity.
88070610-6641-4911-9ad2-90fc29c60e8c 1. Chop the tongue into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes and marinade in red wine for at least 2 hours.
88070610-6641-4911-9ad2-90fc29c60e8c 2. Cut the liver into 1/8” (3-4 mm) slices.
88070610-6641-4911-9ad2-90fc29c60e8c 3. Dice back fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
88070610-6641-4911-9ad2-90fc29c60e8c 4. Grind other meats through 5/16” (8 mm) plate.
88070610-6641-4911-9ad2-90fc29c60e8c 5. 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
88070610-6641-4911-9ad2-90fc29c60e8c 6. Mix everything well together.
88070610-6641-4911-9ad2-90fc29c60e8c 7. Stuff firmly into pork bladder.
88070610-6641-4911-9ad2-90fc29c60e8c 8. Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
88070610-6641-4911-9ad2-90fc29c60e8c Dry at 9-13° C (48-56° F) for 6 months.
88070610-6641-4911-9ad2-90fc29c60e8c Store at 10-12 C (50-55 F), 75% humidity.
1cda4ef1-f1ff-4e6c-b3d6-d32fb6c2e4c1 Grind lean pork through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
1cda4ef1-f1ff-4e6c-b3d6-d32fb6c2e4c1 Dice fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
1cda4ef1-f1ff-4e6c-b3d6-d32fb6c2e4c1 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
1cda4ef1-f1ff-4e6c-b3d6-d32fb6c2e4c1 Mix lean pork with salt and cure #2. Add spices, wine and culture. Add diced fat and mix all together.
1cda4ef1-f1ff-4e6c-b3d6-d32fb6c2e4c1 Stuff firmly into 40 mm hog casings.
1cda4ef1-f1ff-4e6c-b3d6-d32fb6c2e4c1 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
1cda4ef1-f1ff-4e6c-b3d6-d32fb6c2e4c1 Dry at 9-13° C (48-56° F) for 3 weeks.
1cda4ef1-f1ff-4e6c-b3d6-d32fb6c2e4c1 Store at 10-12° C (50-55° F), 75% humidity.
2360a7c8-b11b-444e-885b-879c20029115 Grind lean pork through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
2360a7c8-b11b-444e-885b-879c20029115 Dice fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
2360a7c8-b11b-444e-885b-879c20029115 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
2360a7c8-b11b-444e-885b-879c20029115 Mix lean pork with salt and cure #2. Add spices, wine and culture. Mix. Add diced fat and mix all together.
2360a7c8-b11b-444e-885b-879c20029115 Stuff firmly into 65 mm natural casings.
2360a7c8-b11b-444e-885b-879c20029115 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
2360a7c8-b11b-444e-885b-879c20029115 Dry at 15→12° C (59→53° F), 65-75% humidity for 6 weeks.
2360a7c8-b11b-444e-885b-879c20029115 Store at 10-12° C (50°-55 F), 75% humidity.
67604c01-2046-44eb-b6bc-026aadddf564 Grind lean pork through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
67604c01-2046-44eb-b6bc-026aadddf564 Dice fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
67604c01-2046-44eb-b6bc-026aadddf564 Soak minced garlic in red wine.
67604c01-2046-44eb-b6bc-026aadddf564 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
67604c01-2046-44eb-b6bc-026aadddf564 Mix lean pork with salt and cure #2. Add spices, wine and culture. Mix. Add diced fat and mix all together.
67604c01-2046-44eb-b6bc-026aadddf564 Stuff firmly into 65 mm natural casings.
67604c01-2046-44eb-b6bc-026aadddf564 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
67604c01-2046-44eb-b6bc-026aadddf564 Dry at 15→12° C (59→53° F), 65-75% humidity for 6 weeks.
67604c01-2046-44eb-b6bc-026aadddf564 Store at 10-12° C (50°-55 F), 75% humidity.
9d7c5db9-11fa-4bbc-a8de-cc73bb0da3ce Grind meat through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
9d7c5db9-11fa-4bbc-a8de-cc73bb0da3ce Cut fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
9d7c5db9-11fa-4bbc-a8de-cc73bb0da3ce Dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water 30 minutes before mixing step.
9d7c5db9-11fa-4bbc-a8de-cc73bb0da3ce Mix ground meat with salt and cure #2.
9d7c5db9-11fa-4bbc-a8de-cc73bb0da3ce Add fat, spices, wine and culture to the mixture and re-mix.
9d7c5db9-11fa-4bbc-a8de-cc73bb0da3ce Stuff into 40 mm hog casings.
9d7c5db9-11fa-4bbc-a8de-cc73bb0da3ce Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90 → 85% humidity.
9d7c5db9-11fa-4bbc-a8de-cc73bb0da3ce Dry at 15→12º C (59→54º F), 85→75% decreasing humidity for 45 days. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
9d7c5db9-11fa-4bbc-a8de-cc73bb0da3ce Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
1b441112-2ca4-43dd-9493-d4583ee490dc Cut meat into 3/8” 10 mm cubes.
1b441112-2ca4-43dd-9493-d4583ee490dc 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
1b441112-2ca4-43dd-9493-d4583ee490dc Mix meat with all ingredients.
1b441112-2ca4-43dd-9493-d4583ee490dc Stuff into large 40-60 mm hog casings.
1b441112-2ca4-43dd-9493-d4583ee490dc Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90 → 85% humidity.
1b441112-2ca4-43dd-9493-d4583ee490dc Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85→75% decreasing humidity for 30-45 days. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
1b441112-2ca4-43dd-9493-d4583ee490dc Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
db8ab5c2-3caf-46bf-bc40-64171942046d Grind beef and pork with connective tissue through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
db8ab5c2-3caf-46bf-bc40-64171942046d Grind lean pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
db8ab5c2-3caf-46bf-bc40-64171942046d Grind partially frozen back fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
db8ab5c2-3caf-46bf-bc40-64171942046d Mix meats, and all ingredients together. Add fat and mix again.
db8ab5c2-3caf-46bf-bc40-64171942046d Stuff into 28 mm pork casings linking every 20 cm (8").
db8ab5c2-3caf-46bf-bc40-64171942046d Ferment at 20° C (68° F), 95 → 90% humidity for 3 days.
