db8ab5c2-3caf-46bf-bc40-64171942046d Dry at 18° C (64° F), 90 → 80% humidity for 2 days.
db8ab5c2-3caf-46bf-bc40-64171942046d Dry at 15 → 12° C (59 → 53° F), 80 → 75% humidity for 3 weeks.
db8ab5c2-3caf-46bf-bc40-64171942046d Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <75% humidity.
f09553f3-4488-4acb-be0b-9591858c9939 Grind beef through 1/4” plate (6 mm).
f09553f3-4488-4acb-be0b-9591858c9939 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
f09553f3-4488-4acb-be0b-9591858c9939 Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
f09553f3-4488-4acb-be0b-9591858c9939 Stuff into 60 mm beef middles or fibrous casings.
f09553f3-4488-4acb-be0b-9591858c9939 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
f09553f3-4488-4acb-be0b-9591858c9939 Apply cold smoke at 18-22° C (64-72° F) for 12 hours.
f09553f3-4488-4acb-be0b-9591858c9939 Dry for 6-8 weeks at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85-80% humidity.
f09553f3-4488-4acb-be0b-9591858c9939 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), < 75% humidity.
95acb3b5-9c3b-4481-8783-9f99834a800b Grind lean pork through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
95acb3b5-9c3b-4481-8783-9f99834a800b Grind fat through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
95acb3b5-9c3b-4481-8783-9f99834a800b 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
95acb3b5-9c3b-4481-8783-9f99834a800b Mix lean pork with salt and cure #2.
95acb3b5-9c3b-4481-8783-9f99834a800b Grind spices in a spice mill.
95acb3b5-9c3b-4481-8783-9f99834a800b Add spices, wine and culture to the mixture and re-mix. Finally, add fat and mix again.
95acb3b5-9c3b-4481-8783-9f99834a800b Stuff into 40-42 mm hog casings forming 24” (60 cm) links.
95acb3b5-9c3b-4481-8783-9f99834a800b Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90 → 85% humidity.
95acb3b5-9c3b-4481-8783-9f99834a800b Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85→75% decreasing humidity for 1 month. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
95acb3b5-9c3b-4481-8783-9f99834a800b Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
a6db510c-72ab-4922-a74a-c4656c28ff3d Grind pork and back fat through ⅜ - ½” (10-12 mm) plate. Grind beef with ⅜” (10 mm), refreeze and grind again with ⅛” (3 mm) plate.
a6db510c-72ab-4922-a74a-c4656c28ff3d Mix all ingredients with meat
a6db510c-72ab-4922-a74a-c4656c28ff3d Stuff firmly into 60-70 mm beef middles or protein lined fibrous casings. Make 12” long links.
a6db510c-72ab-4922-a74a-c4656c28ff3d Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
a6db510c-72ab-4922-a74a-c4656c28ff3d Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 2-3 months. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
a6db510c-72ab-4922-a74a-c4656c28ff3d Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
9776a447-81a1-4c3c-b460-a6dbe93fe263 Grind pork through 1/4” (6 mm) mm cubes.
9776a447-81a1-4c3c-b460-a6dbe93fe263 Grind beef through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
9776a447-81a1-4c3c-b460-a6dbe93fe263 Cut back fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
9776a447-81a1-4c3c-b460-a6dbe93fe263 Soak nutmeg and minced garlic in red wine.
9776a447-81a1-4c3c-b460-a6dbe93fe263 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
9776a447-81a1-4c3c-b460-a6dbe93fe263 Mix meat and fat with all ingredients.
9776a447-81a1-4c3c-b460-a6dbe93fe263 Stuff into 40 mm hog casings.
9776a447-81a1-4c3c-b460-a6dbe93fe263 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90 → 85% humidity.
9776a447-81a1-4c3c-b460-a6dbe93fe263 Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85→75% decreasing humidity for 30 days. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
9776a447-81a1-4c3c-b460-a6dbe93fe263 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
b5063d8e-8240-4079-8293-3c55d6e9fef4 Separately, grind lean pork and fat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
b5063d8e-8240-4079-8293-3c55d6e9fef4 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
b5063d8e-8240-4079-8293-3c55d6e9fef4 Mix ground meat with salt and cure #2.
b5063d8e-8240-4079-8293-3c55d6e9fef4 Add fat, spices, wine and culture to the mixture and re-mix.
b5063d8e-8240-4079-8293-3c55d6e9fef4 Stuff into large pork casings and make 18” (45 cm) sections.
b5063d8e-8240-4079-8293-3c55d6e9fef4 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90 → 85% humidity.
b5063d8e-8240-4079-8293-3c55d6e9fef4 Dry for 30 days at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85→75% decreasing humidity.
b5063d8e-8240-4079-8293-3c55d6e9fef4 The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
b5063d8e-8240-4079-8293-3c55d6e9fef4 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
980232c2-dc76-4b5d-8644-02935328f1ba Grind meat and fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
980232c2-dc76-4b5d-8644-02935328f1ba Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
980232c2-dc76-4b5d-8644-02935328f1ba Stuff firmly into beef middles or 46-60 mm protein lined fibrous casings.
980232c2-dc76-4b5d-8644-02935328f1ba Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
980232c2-dc76-4b5d-8644-02935328f1ba Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for about 30 days. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
980232c2-dc76-4b5d-8644-02935328f1ba Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
73ae71dd-8674-4ced-b632-8a811cd2b646 Grind pork and back fat through ⅜” plate (10 mm). Grind beef with ⅛” plate.
73ae71dd-8674-4ced-b632-8a811cd2b646 Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
73ae71dd-8674-4ced-b632-8a811cd2b646 Stuff firmly into beef middles or 46-60 mm protein lined fibrous casings. Make links 16-20” long.
73ae71dd-8674-4ced-b632-8a811cd2b646 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
73ae71dd-8674-4ced-b632-8a811cd2b646 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 2-3 months. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
73ae71dd-8674-4ced-b632-8a811cd2b646 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
ef4c11a1-80ac-42ec-bffa-b6993e2cdcfb Grind beef and pork with connective tissue through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
ef4c11a1-80ac-42ec-bffa-b6993e2cdcfb Grind lean pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
ef4c11a1-80ac-42ec-bffa-b6993e2cdcfb Grind partially frozen back fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
ef4c11a1-80ac-42ec-bffa-b6993e2cdcfb Mix meats, and all ingredients together. Add fat and mix again.
ef4c11a1-80ac-42ec-bffa-b6993e2cdcfb Stuff into 70 mm synthetic protein lined fibrous casings.
ef4c11a1-80ac-42ec-bffa-b6993e2cdcfb Ferment for 3 days at 20° C (68° F), 95 → 90% humidity.
ef4c11a1-80ac-42ec-bffa-b6993e2cdcfb Dry for 2 days at 18° C (64° F), 90 → 80% humidity.
ef4c11a1-80ac-42ec-bffa-b6993e2cdcfb Smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 24 hours.
ef4c11a1-80ac-42ec-bffa-b6993e2cdcfb Dry at 15 → 12° C (59 → 53° F), 85 → 75% humidity for 6 weeks or until sausage looses 30% of its original weight.
10ace5b7-8f4f-4da7-92a7-b9729cabe0c5 Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
10ace5b7-8f4f-4da7-92a7-b9729cabe0c5 Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
10ace5b7-8f4f-4da7-92a7-b9729cabe0c5 Stuff firmly into beef middles or 3” protein lined fibrous casings.
10ace5b7-8f4f-4da7-92a7-b9729cabe0c5 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
10ace5b7-8f4f-4da7-92a7-b9729cabe0c5 Cold smoke for 4 days (<22º C, 72º F). You can apply smoke during fermentation.
10ace5b7-8f4f-4da7-92a7-b9729cabe0c5 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 2-3 months.
10ace5b7-8f4f-4da7-92a7-b9729cabe0c5 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
f377eca1-b5ed-4932-a433-26cee2d84e0f Curing: cut meat into 3-4” (10 cm) pieces and place in a slightly raised container with holes in the bottom to allow for draining of liquid. Leave for 24 hours at 1-2° C (33-35° F), then grind with ¾” plate and leave for additional 2-3 days. During that period turn meat around 1-2 times. Leave sheets of unsalted back fat for 2-3 days at -2° C (28° F) to - 4° C (24° F) and then dice into 1/8” 3 mm cubes.
f377eca1-b5ed-4932-a433-26cee2d84e0f Mix meat, back fat, salt, nitrite and spices together. Grind through 1/8” (3 mm) plate. Leave the sausage mass for 36-48 hours at 2-4° C (35-40° F).
f377eca1-b5ed-4932-a433-26cee2d84e0f Stuff firmly into 55-60 mm beef middles. Make links 16-18” long. Lace up with twine: once lengthwise and every 4-5 cm (1.5-2”) across. The ends tied up with a twine, 10-12 cm (4-5”) hanging loop on one end.
f377eca1-b5ed-4932-a433-26cee2d84e0f Hang for 2-4 days at 2-4° C (35-40° F), 85-90% humidity.
f377eca1-b5ed-4932-a433-26cee2d84e0f Apply a thin cold smoke 16-18° C (60-64° F) for 5-7 days, until dark red color is obtained.
f377eca1-b5ed-4932-a433-26cee2d84e0f Dry in a dark, lightly drafty area at 10-12° C (50-53° F), humidity 90%, for 2 weeks until salami develops white, dry mold on outside. If green mold appears wipe it off and move the sausage for 4-5 hours to a drier place. Then it can go back to the original room for drying.
f377eca1-b5ed-4932-a433-26cee2d84e0f Place covered with white mold sausages for 2-3 months in a dark and lightly drafty area at 12-15° C (54-59° F), 75-85% humidity, until 63% yield is obtained.
de3e131a-4984-4c13-863c-4950349d4ae9 Cut meat and fat into 2” (5 - 6 cm) pieces. Add salt, Cure # 2, garlic and pepper and mix well.
de3e131a-4984-4c13-863c-4950349d4ae9 Grind mixture through 3/16” (4 mm) plate. Pack ground meat tightly into suitable containers (stainless steel, food grade plastic) and cover with a layer of skins or butcher paper. Keep for 10 - 14 days at 35º - 39º F (2º - 4º C).
de3e131a-4984-4c13-863c-4950349d4ae9 Stuff into 60 mm beef middles or synthetic fibrous casings, make straight links 40 - 45 cm long. Pack the meat very tightly to eliminate air pockets. Make 10 - 12 cm loop at one end for hanging.
de3e131a-4984-4c13-863c-4950349d4ae9 Hang for two hours in a well ventilated area.
de3e131a-4984-4c13-863c-4950349d4ae9 Smoking:
de3e131a-4984-4c13-863c-4950349d4ae9 Hang in a shaded well ventilated area at 10º-12º C, 80 - 85 % humidity for 5 - 6 weeks until salami develops white mold on outside. In case the mold becomes wet and green in color wash the sausages with warm salty water and wipe them dry. Dry salami until it loses 35 % of its original weight.
de3e131a-4984-4c13-863c-4950349d4ae9 Hold in a dry place.
a1433572-5893-42ab-9a5c-785e5aa0ef9e Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm). Grind beef with ⅛” plate.
a1433572-5893-42ab-9a5c-785e5aa0ef9e Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
a1433572-5893-42ab-9a5c-785e5aa0ef9e Stuff firmly into large hog casings or 40-60 mm protein lined fibrous casings. Make 12-16” long links.
a1433572-5893-42ab-9a5c-785e5aa0ef9e Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
a1433572-5893-42ab-9a5c-785e5aa0ef9e Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 1-2 months. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
a1433572-5893-42ab-9a5c-785e5aa0ef9e Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
94d0324b-cf5e-48eb-8bb4-c6d2b545387e Grind pork through 5 mm (3/16”) plate.
94d0324b-cf5e-48eb-8bb4-c6d2b545387e Grind partially frozen back fat through 5 mm (3/16”) plate.
94d0324b-cf5e-48eb-8bb4-c6d2b545387e Grind beef with 3 mm (1/8") plate.
94d0324b-cf5e-48eb-8bb4-c6d2b545387e Mix all ingredients with ground meat adding fat last.
94d0324b-cf5e-48eb-8bb4-c6d2b545387e Stuff firmly into 60 mm protein lined fibrous casings. Make 25” long links.
94d0324b-cf5e-48eb-8bb4-c6d2b545387e Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90→85% humidity.
94d0324b-cf5e-48eb-8bb4-c6d2b545387e Dry at 14→12º C (57-54º F), 85→75% humidity for 5 weeks. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
94d0324b-cf5e-48eb-8bb4-c6d2b545387e Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
4a7c02ab-ee63-43b3-94a7-ca75b0459f72 Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm). Grind beef with ⅛” plate.
4a7c02ab-ee63-43b3-94a7-ca75b0459f72 Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
4a7c02ab-ee63-43b3-94a7-ca75b0459f72 Stuff firmly into 80 mm protein lined fibrous casings. Make 25” long links.
4a7c02ab-ee63-43b3-94a7-ca75b0459f72 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
4a7c02ab-ee63-43b3-94a7-ca75b0459f72 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 2-3 months. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
4a7c02ab-ee63-43b3-94a7-ca75b0459f72 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
ee9f6411-5bf1-48fd-a35a-6ccb781ab5e5 Grind lean pork through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
ee9f6411-5bf1-48fd-a35a-6ccb781ab5e5 Dice fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
ee9f6411-5bf1-48fd-a35a-6ccb781ab5e5 Soak minced garlic in red wine.
ee9f6411-5bf1-48fd-a35a-6ccb781ab5e5 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
ee9f6411-5bf1-48fd-a35a-6ccb781ab5e5 Mix lean pork with salt and cure #2. Add spices, wine and culture. Mix. Add diced fat and mix all together.
ee9f6411-5bf1-48fd-a35a-6ccb781ab5e5 Stuff firmly into 65 mm natural casings making 6” (15 cm) links.
ee9f6411-5bf1-48fd-a35a-6ccb781ab5e5 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
ee9f6411-5bf1-48fd-a35a-6ccb781ab5e5 Dry at 18-25° C (64-77° F), 65-75% humidity for 1 week.
ee9f6411-5bf1-48fd-a35a-6ccb781ab5e5 Dry at 15→12° C (59→53° F), 65-75% humidity for 3-4 weeks.
ee9f6411-5bf1-48fd-a35a-6ccb781ab5e5 Store at 10-12° C (50°-55 F), 75% humidity.
566c63f4-d820-475b-a49b-4208542419a5 Grind pork through ⅜” plate (10 mm).
566c63f4-d820-475b-a49b-4208542419a5 Mix all ingredients with ground pork.
566c63f4-d820-475b-a49b-4208542419a5 Stuff firmly into 60 mm beef middles or protein lined fibrous casings. Make 8” (20 cm) long links.
566c63f4-d820-475b-a49b-4208542419a5 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
566c63f4-d820-475b-a49b-4208542419a5 Apply thin cold smoke ( < 20º C, 68º F) for a few hours.
566c63f4-d820-475b-a49b-4208542419a5 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 1 month. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
566c63f4-d820-475b-a49b-4208542419a5 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
77b9c769-c379-42bc-8585-3f1209ae342c Grind lean pork through 3/8” (10 mm) cubes.
77b9c769-c379-42bc-8585-3f1209ae342c Cut fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
77b9c769-c379-42bc-8585-3f1209ae342c Soak nutmeg and minced garlic in red wine.
77b9c769-c379-42bc-8585-3f1209ae342c 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
77b9c769-c379-42bc-8585-3f1209ae342c Mix meat and fat with all ingredients.
77b9c769-c379-42bc-8585-3f1209ae342c Stuff into large 40 mm hog casings.
77b9c769-c379-42bc-8585-3f1209ae342c Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90 → 85% humidity.
77b9c769-c379-42bc-8585-3f1209ae342c Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85→75% decreasing humidity for 30 days. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
77b9c769-c379-42bc-8585-3f1209ae342c Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
f044f949-5cbe-4583-bd0f-3a1990c77633 Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm). Grind beef with ⅛” (3 mm) plate.
f044f949-5cbe-4583-bd0f-3a1990c77633 Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
f044f949-5cbe-4583-bd0f-3a1990c77633 Stuff firmly into beef middles or 3” protein lined fibrous casings.
f044f949-5cbe-4583-bd0f-3a1990c77633 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
f044f949-5cbe-4583-bd0f-3a1990c77633 Cold smoke for 12 hours (<22º C, 72º F).
f044f949-5cbe-4583-bd0f-3a1990c77633 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity. In about 6-8 weeks a shrink of 30% should be achieved.
f044f949-5cbe-4583-bd0f-3a1990c77633 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity
18525c0c-6728-4719-815e-659243dd04ee Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm). Grind beef with 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
18525c0c-6728-4719-815e-659243dd04ee 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
18525c0c-6728-4719-815e-659243dd04ee Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
18525c0c-6728-4719-815e-659243dd04ee Stuff firmly into beef middles or 3” protein lined fibrous casings.
18525c0c-6728-4719-815e-659243dd04ee Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
18525c0c-6728-4719-815e-659243dd04ee Cold smoke for 12 hours at 18º C (64º F).
18525c0c-6728-4719-815e-659243dd04ee Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity. In about 6-8 weeks a shrink of 30% should be achieved.
18525c0c-6728-4719-815e-659243dd04ee Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
f18587a3-b0fa-4a10-b61f-b7dc4cdfa894 Curing: cut meat into 1 inch (25 mm) pieces. Place beef, pork and pork belly in separate food grade containers and mix with salt, Cure #1 and sugar according to the recipe (estimate amounts). Pack tightly to eliminate air and cover with clean cloth. Place for 72 hours in refrigerator. Discard any liquid brine and submit meat to grinding.
f18587a3-b0fa-4a10-b61f-b7dc4cdfa894 Grind beef through 1/8” (2 mm) plate. Grind pork through 1/8” (2 mm) plate. Slice pork belly into strips, ½” x ¼” x ¼” (12 mm x 5 mm x 5 mm).
f18587a3-b0fa-4a10-b61f-b7dc4cdfa894 Mix beef with spices. Add pork and mix. Add bacon strips and remix everything together. Don’t add any water.
f18587a3-b0fa-4a10-b61f-b7dc4cdfa894 Stuff sausages firmly into 45-55 mm beef middles or fibrous casings. Make links up to 20” (50 cm ) long.
f18587a3-b0fa-4a10-b61f-b7dc4cdfa894 Hang sausages for 5-7 days at 2-4º C, 85-90% humidity.
f18587a3-b0fa-4a10-b61f-b7dc4cdfa894 Apply cold smoke at 18-22º C (64-72º F) for 2-3 days.
f18587a3-b0fa-4a10-b61f-b7dc4cdfa894 Dry sausages for 5-7 days (depending on sausage diameter) at 11-15º C (53-59º F), 80-84 humidity. Dry 21 days more at 10-12º C (50-54º F), 74-78% humidity.
f18587a3-b0fa-4a10-b61f-b7dc4cdfa894 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
f18587a3-b0fa-4a10-b61f-b7dc4cdfa894 Finished sausage should retain 65% of its original weight.
7f994fb5-8b50-4119-b538-4ebde2065baf Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm). Grind beef with ⅛” plate.
7f994fb5-8b50-4119-b538-4ebde2065baf Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
7f994fb5-8b50-4119-b538-4ebde2065baf Stuff firmly into 40-60 mm protein lined fibrous casings. Make 12” long links.
7f994fb5-8b50-4119-b538-4ebde2065baf Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
7f994fb5-8b50-4119-b538-4ebde2065baf Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 1 month. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
7f994fb5-8b50-4119-b538-4ebde2065baf Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
f56c4575-920d-43ba-999e-36cf11e2a19f Trim meat from all gristle, sinews, tendons, and silver film.
f56c4575-920d-43ba-999e-36cf11e2a19f Grind meat through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
f56c4575-920d-43ba-999e-36cf11e2a19f Dice partially frozen fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
f56c4575-920d-43ba-999e-36cf11e2a19f Dilute starter culture in 15 ml (1 tablespoon) of distilled or spring water. Do not use chlorinated water.
f56c4575-920d-43ba-999e-36cf11e2a19f Mix lean meat with salt, Cure #1, spices and starter culture. Add fat and mix again.
f56c4575-920d-43ba-999e-36cf11e2a19f Stuff firmly into 50-60 mm hog middles forming sections 40 cm (16") long.
f56c4575-920d-43ba-999e-36cf11e2a19f Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
f56c4575-920d-43ba-999e-36cf11e2a19f Dry at 16 → 12º C (60-54º F), 85 → 80% humidity for 45 days (or longer depending on a diameter of the casing). The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost.
f56c4575-920d-43ba-999e-36cf11e2a19f Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity.
bbd919a2-c12c-4b0a-ba66-a8cc5940d3f7 Cut meat into 10 cm (3-4”) pieces and place in a slightly raised container with holes in the bottom to allow for draining of curing liquid. Leave for 24 hours at 1-2°C (33-35°F). Then grind with ¾” plate and leave for an additional 2-3 days following the above procedure. During that period turn meat around 1-2 times. Leave sheets of unsalted back fat for 2-3 days at -2° C (28° F) to -4° C (24° F) and then cut into 3 mm (⅛”) pieces.
bbd919a2-c12c-4b0a-ba66-a8cc5940d3f7 Mix meat, back fat, salt, nitrate and spices together. Grind through 3 mm (⅛”) plate.
bbd919a2-c12c-4b0a-ba66-a8cc5940d3f7 Leave the sausage mass for 36-48 hours at 2-4°C (35-40°F).
bbd919a2-c12c-4b0a-ba66-a8cc5940d3f7 Stuff casings firmly. Do not add water. Prick any visible air pockets with a needle.
bbd919a2-c12c-4b0a-ba66-a8cc5940d3f7 Hang for 2-4 days at 2-4°C (35-40°F), 85-90% humidity.
bbd919a2-c12c-4b0a-ba66-a8cc5940d3f7 Apply thin cold smoke 16-18° C (60-64° F) for 5-7 days, until dark red color is obtained.
bbd919a2-c12c-4b0a-ba66-a8cc5940d3f7 Hang in a dark, lightly drafty area at 10-12°C (50-53°F), humidity 90% for 2 weeks until salami develops white, dry mold on outside. If green and moist mold appears on salamis they have to be washed with warm salty water and wiped off dry with a cloth. Hang for 4-5 hours in a drier place, then move back to the original room and continue drying.
bbd919a2-c12c-4b0a-ba66-a8cc5940d3f7 Place salamis covered with white mold for 2-3 months in a dark and lightly drafty area at 12-16° C (54-60° F), 75-85% humidity, until desired yield is obtained.
23c440c9-0108-4193-9a4c-3463aebc84af Grind meats through 10 mm (3/8”) plate.
23c440c9-0108-4193-9a4c-3463aebc84af Mix meats with salt and spices and hold for 30 hours in refrigerator.
23c440c9-0108-4193-9a4c-3463aebc84af Stuff into 18-20 mm sheep casings forming 15-20 cm (6-8”) links.
23c440c9-0108-4193-9a4c-3463aebc84af Dry at 15-12° C (59-53° F) for 30-40 hours.
23c440c9-0108-4193-9a4c-3463aebc84af Refrigerate.
59808194-80e6-4fac-9d10-3c269d6a3983 Grind meat through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
59808194-80e6-4fac-9d10-3c269d6a3983 Grind 100 g of fat through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
59808194-80e6-4fac-9d10-3c269d6a3983 Dice partially frozen 100 g of fat into 5-8 mm (1/4-3/8") cubes.
59808194-80e6-4fac-9d10-3c269d6a3983 Mix all ingredients with wine, then pour over the meat and fat and mix all together. Hold for 48 hours in refrigerator.
59808194-80e6-4fac-9d10-3c269d6a3983 Stuff into 60 - 90 mm pork bungs forming sections 30-40 cm (12-16") long.
59808194-80e6-4fac-9d10-3c269d6a3983 Ferment/dry at 20º C (68º F) for 48 hours, 90-85% humidity.
59808194-80e6-4fac-9d10-3c269d6a3983 Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85-75% humidity for 2-3 months.
59808194-80e6-4fac-9d10-3c269d6a3983 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <70% humidity or refrigerate.
b2725cf5-996c-45e1-949a-14be368b991b Cut pork, beef and back fat into 25 mm (1”) pieces.
b2725cf5-996c-45e1-949a-14be368b991b Mix with salt, cure #2 and pepper and hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
b2725cf5-996c-45e1-949a-14be368b991b Grind meat and fat with 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
b2725cf5-996c-45e1-949a-14be368b991b Stuff into large diameter (55-60 mm) pork casings.
b2725cf5-996c-45e1-949a-14be368b991b Dry at 15° -12° C - (59-53° F) for 2 months.
b2725cf5-996c-45e1-949a-14be368b991b Store at 12° C (53° F), <65% humidity.
4dc495ef-71f1-4e50-93b1-bf69c1e6f9a4 Grind beef through 6 mm (1/4") plate.
4dc495ef-71f1-4e50-93b1-bf69c1e6f9a4 Grind pork meat and fat through 3 mm (1/4") plate.
4dc495ef-71f1-4e50-93b1-bf69c1e6f9a4 Mix spices with wine, then pour over the meat and fat and mix all together. Hold for 48 hours in refrigerator.
4dc495ef-71f1-4e50-93b1-bf69c1e6f9a4 Stuff into 60-90 mm pork bungs forming sections 30-40 cm (12-16") long.
4dc495ef-71f1-4e50-93b1-bf69c1e6f9a4 Ferment/dry at 20º C (68º F) for 48 hours, 90-85% humidity.
4dc495ef-71f1-4e50-93b1-bf69c1e6f9a4 Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85-75% humidity for 2-3 months.
4dc495ef-71f1-4e50-93b1-bf69c1e6f9a4 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <70% humidity or refrigerate.
2272ffe1-e2f0-4566-9cdd-e0fdba29e0b8 Dice back fat into 6 mm (1/4") cubes.
2272ffe1-e2f0-4566-9cdd-e0fdba29e0b8 Grind meats through 8 mm (3/8") plate.
2272ffe1-e2f0-4566-9cdd-e0fdba29e0b8 Mix ground meats with all ingredients.
2272ffe1-e2f0-4566-9cdd-e0fdba29e0b8 Hold for 24-48 hours at 4-6° C (40-43° F) or in refrigerator.
2272ffe1-e2f0-4566-9cdd-e0fdba29e0b8 Stuff firmly into pork bungs, 50-60 cm (20-24") long.
2272ffe1-e2f0-4566-9cdd-e0fdba29e0b8 Ferment/dry at 20º C (68º F) for 48 hours, 90-95% humidity.
2272ffe1-e2f0-4566-9cdd-e0fdba29e0b8 Dry at 15→ 12º C (59-54º F), 80 → 75% humidity for 45 days (or longer depending on a diameter of the casing). The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost. The sausage should develop a white mold which is expected and desired.
2272ffe1-e2f0-4566-9cdd-e0fdba29e0b8 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <70% humidity.
bb34105d-3eca-4775-b88a-645dc03c669c Grind meats and fat through 3-5 mm (1/8-1/4") plate.
bb34105d-3eca-4775-b88a-645dc03c669c Mix with salt, cure #2 and pepper and hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
bb34105d-3eca-4775-b88a-645dc03c669c Stuff into large diameter (55-60 mm) pork casings.
bb34105d-3eca-4775-b88a-645dc03c669c Dry at 15 -12° C, (59-53° F), 75-85% humidity for 2 months.
bb34105d-3eca-4775-b88a-645dc03c669c Store at 12° C (53° F), <70% humidity.
2e2b2613-d16f-418c-ae2e-55930a31e235 Cut pork class I into 20 mm (3/4 “) pieces. grind beef class II through 3 mm plate.
2e2b2613-d16f-418c-ae2e-55930a31e235 Mix meat with all ingredients.
2e2b2613-d16f-418c-ae2e-55930a31e235 Stuff into 36 mm hog casings.
2e2b2613-d16f-418c-ae2e-55930a31e235 Hang at 2-4° C (35-40° F) 85-90% humidity for 4-6 days, then at 10-12° C (50-53° F), 75-80% humidity for 3-4 days.
2e2b2613-d16f-418c-ae2e-55930a31e235 Apply cold smoke for 3-4 days until dark red color is obtained.
2e2b2613-d16f-418c-ae2e-55930a31e235 Cool and dry sausages in air at 10-12° C (50-53° F) for about 6-8 days.
f219f18e-7b2b-43c4-94f0-efe394523dcf Cut the meat into 2” (5 cm cubes.
f219f18e-7b2b-43c4-94f0-efe394523dcf Mix salt, cure #2, crushed bay leaf, spices, wine and water. Add meat and mix all together. Hold in refrigerator for 4 days.
f219f18e-7b2b-43c4-94f0-efe394523dcf Stuff into 50-80 mm hog middles or bungs.
f219f18e-7b2b-43c4-94f0-efe394523dcf Apply a thin smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 10 days. Smoking need not to be continuous, as long as the temperature inside of the smokehouse stays below 18° C. Think of the process as drying with smoke. Oak, chestnut or both is used for smoking.
f219f18e-7b2b-43c4-94f0-efe394523dcf Dry at 15 →12° C (59 →-53° F), 80→70% humidity for 30 days. Total smoking and drying time at least 40 days.
f219f18e-7b2b-43c4-94f0-efe394523dcf Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F).
b7d5d4fb-07b6-42e3-851f-44cec66f8ba5 Grind lean pork through 3/8” 10 mm cubes.
b7d5d4fb-07b6-42e3-851f-44cec66f8ba5 Cut fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
b7d5d4fb-07b6-42e3-851f-44cec66f8ba5 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
b7d5d4fb-07b6-42e3-851f-44cec66f8ba5 Mix meat and fat with all ingredients.
b7d5d4fb-07b6-42e3-851f-44cec66f8ba5 Stuff into large 36-40 mm hog casings. Twist into links 16” (40 cm) long or make individual horse-shoe shape loops.
b7d5d4fb-07b6-42e3-851f-44cec66f8ba5 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90 → 85% humidity.
b7d5d4fb-07b6-42e3-851f-44cec66f8ba5 Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85→75% decreasing humidity for 30 days. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
b7d5d4fb-07b6-42e3-851f-44cec66f8ba5 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
1341193a-e018-4d57-aa05-a171c49568b2 Grind lean meat into 3/8” (8 mm) particles.
1341193a-e018-4d57-aa05-a171c49568b2 Cut partially frozen back fat into 1/4 (6 mm) cubes.
1341193a-e018-4d57-aa05-a171c49568b2 Dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
1341193a-e018-4d57-aa05-a171c49568b2 Mix ground meats with salt and cure #2 until sticky. Add spices, culture, chopped fat and mix again. Finely add cheese and mix all together.
1341193a-e018-4d57-aa05-a171c49568b2 Stuff firmly into 60 mm pork bungs forming sections 20-30 cm (8-12") long.
1341193a-e018-4d57-aa05-a171c49568b2 Ferment at 20° C (68° F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
1341193a-e018-4d57-aa05-a171c49568b2 Dry at 16 → 12° C (60-54° F), 85 → 80% humidity for 30 days. The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost.
1341193a-e018-4d57-aa05-a171c49568b2 Store sausages at 10-15° C (50-59° F), <75% humidity.
8fa23fa0-f6d7-409d-942d-2255f46258d1 Grind lean meat into 3/8” (8 mm) particles.
8fa23fa0-f6d7-409d-942d-2255f46258d1 Cut partially frozen back fat into 1/4 (6 mm) cubes.
8fa23fa0-f6d7-409d-942d-2255f46258d1 Dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
8fa23fa0-f6d7-409d-942d-2255f46258d1 Mix ground meats with salt and cure #2 until sticky. Add spices, culture, whole hazelnuts, chopped fat and mix again.
8fa23fa0-f6d7-409d-942d-2255f46258d1 Stuff firmly into 60 mm pork bungs forming sections 20-30 cm (8-12") long.
8fa23fa0-f6d7-409d-942d-2255f46258d1 Ferment at 20° C (68° F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
8fa23fa0-f6d7-409d-942d-2255f46258d1 Dry at 16 → 12° C (60-54° F), 85 → 80% humidity for 30 days. The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost.
8fa23fa0-f6d7-409d-942d-2255f46258d1 Store sausages at 10-15° C (50-59° F), <75% humidity.
aa79ad72-80b3-4625-827f-0b24884e0a3c Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
aa79ad72-80b3-4625-827f-0b24884e0a3c 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
aa79ad72-80b3-4625-827f-0b24884e0a3c Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
aa79ad72-80b3-4625-827f-0b24884e0a3c Stuff firmly into beef middles or 3” protein lined fibrous casings.
aa79ad72-80b3-4625-827f-0b24884e0a3c Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 60 hours, 90-85% humidity.
aa79ad72-80b3-4625-827f-0b24884e0a3c Cold smoke at 18-22° C (64-72° F) 12 hours.
aa79ad72-80b3-4625-827f-0b24884e0a3c Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 1-2 months.
aa79ad72-80b3-4625-827f-0b24884e0a3c Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
5ab9f7e9-a2a2-47a3-a738-d1781a19eda5 Grind pork shoulder through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
5ab9f7e9-a2a2-47a3-a738-d1781a19eda5 Grind fat through 1/4” (6 mm) plate.
5ab9f7e9-a2a2-47a3-a738-d1781a19eda5 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
5ab9f7e9-a2a2-47a3-a738-d1781a19eda5 Mix pork shoulder with salt and cure #2. Add spices and culture. Mix. Add ground fat and mix all together.
5ab9f7e9-a2a2-47a3-a738-d1781a19eda5 Stuff firmly into 40 mm hog casings.
5ab9f7e9-a2a2-47a3-a738-d1781a19eda5 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
5ab9f7e9-a2a2-47a3-a738-d1781a19eda5 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 2 days. Smoking does not have to be continuous as long as 18º C temperature is maintained. Oakwood or beech wood is used. Juniper berries (not wood or twigs) may be added to fire as well.
5ab9f7e9-a2a2-47a3-a738-d1781a19eda5 Dry at 15→12° C (59→53° F), 65-75% humidity for 3 weeks, until the sausage loses at least 20% of its original weight (after stuffing).
5ab9f7e9-a2a2-47a3-a738-d1781a19eda5 Store at 10-12° C (50°-55 F), <75% humidity.
7907fce6-65d5-4744-a580-123f88b2c7c6 Cut with a knife or grind lean meat through 5/16” (8 mm) plate.
7907fce6-65d5-4744-a580-123f88b2c7c6 Using a sharp knife cut partially frozen back fat into 5/16” (8 mm) cubes.
7907fce6-65d5-4744-a580-123f88b2c7c6 Dilute culture in 1 tablespoon of de-chlorinated water around 30 minutes before mixing.
7907fce6-65d5-4744-a580-123f88b2c7c6 Mix ground lean meat with salt and cure #2 until sticky.
7907fce6-65d5-4744-a580-123f88b2c7c6 Add fat cubes, culture and spices and mix all together.
7907fce6-65d5-4744-a580-123f88b2c7c6 Stuff firmly into 36 mm hog casings.
7907fce6-65d5-4744-a580-123f88b2c7c6 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
7907fce6-65d5-4744-a580-123f88b2c7c6 Dry at 16 → 12º C (60-54º F), 85 → 80% humidity for 21 days. The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost. The sausage should develop a white mold which is expected and desired.
7907fce6-65d5-4744-a580-123f88b2c7c6 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
70c58b3b-fd7d-47f1-833b-5f36948d8cc9 Chop meat into 1/4” (6 mm) particles.
70c58b3b-fd7d-47f1-833b-5f36948d8cc9 Chop belly and fat into 1/4 (6 mm) particles.
70c58b3b-fd7d-47f1-833b-5f36948d8cc9 30 minutes before mixing step dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
70c58b3b-fd7d-47f1-833b-5f36948d8cc9 Mix ground meats with salt and cure #2 until sticky. Add spices, culture and chopped fat and mix again. Stuff firmly into 36 mm hog casings. Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
70c58b3b-fd7d-47f1-833b-5f36948d8cc9 Dry at 16 → 12º C (60-54º F), 85 → 80% humidity for 21 days (or longer when larger casing are used). The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost. The sausage should develop a white mold. Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
2f4b79eb-3ca8-4c9e-88b7-6b3d77cf7313 Grind lean meat through 1/4” (6 mm) particles.
2f4b79eb-3ca8-4c9e-88b7-6b3d77cf7313 Using a sharp knife cut partially fried back fat into 1/4 (6 mm) cubes.
2f4b79eb-3ca8-4c9e-88b7-6b3d77cf7313 Cut cheese into 3/8” (10 mm) chunks.
2f4b79eb-3ca8-4c9e-88b7-6b3d77cf7313 30 minutes before mixing dissolve the starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
2f4b79eb-3ca8-4c9e-88b7-6b3d77cf7313 Mix ground meats with salt and cure #2 until sticky. Add spices, culture, wine and chopped fat and mix again.
2f4b79eb-3ca8-4c9e-88b7-6b3d77cf7313 Stuff firmly into 50 mm hog or beef casings making 6” (15 cm) straight links.
2f4b79eb-3ca8-4c9e-88b7-6b3d77cf7313 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
2f4b79eb-3ca8-4c9e-88b7-6b3d77cf7313 Dry at 16 → 12º C (60-54º F), 85 → 80% humidity for 45 days. The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost. The sausage should develop a white mold which is expected and desired.
2f4b79eb-3ca8-4c9e-88b7-6b3d77cf7313 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), < 75% humidity.
479f0ed4-d1e8-45cc-9e34-e5c8ce0800fb Grind lean meat into 3/8” (8 mm) particles.
479f0ed4-d1e8-45cc-9e34-e5c8ce0800fb Cut partially frozen back fat into 1/4 (6 mm) cubes.
479f0ed4-d1e8-45cc-9e34-e5c8ce0800fb Dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
479f0ed4-d1e8-45cc-9e34-e5c8ce0800fb Mix ground meats with salt and cure #2 until sticky. Add spices, culture and chopped fat and mix again. Stuff firmly into 60 - 90 mm pork bungs forming sections 20-50 cm (8-20") long.
479f0ed4-d1e8-45cc-9e34-e5c8ce0800fb Ferment at 20° C (68° F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
479f0ed4-d1e8-45cc-9e34-e5c8ce0800fb Dry at 16 → 12° C (60-54° F), 85 → 80% humidity for 30 days. The sausage is dried until around 30% in weight is lost.
479f0ed4-d1e8-45cc-9e34-e5c8ce0800fb Store sausages at 10-15° C (50-59° F), <75% humidity.
91506965-d3d8-40df-9847-4953ea439182 Grind beef and pork through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
91506965-d3d8-40df-9847-4953ea439182 Grind partially frozen back fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
91506965-d3d8-40df-9847-4953ea439182 Mix meats, and all ingredients together. Add fat and mix again.
91506965-d3d8-40df-9847-4953ea439182 Stuff into 80-90 mm pork bungs.
91506965-d3d8-40df-9847-4953ea439182 Ferment for 3 days at 20° C (68° F), 95 → 90% humidity.
91506965-d3d8-40df-9847-4953ea439182 Ferment/dry for 2 days at 18° C (64° F), 90 → 80% humidity.
91506965-d3d8-40df-9847-4953ea439182 Smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 24 hours.
91506965-d3d8-40df-9847-4953ea439182 Dry at 15 → 12° C (59 → 53° F), 85 → 75% humidity for 8 weeks.
91506965-d3d8-40df-9847-4953ea439182 Store at 12° C (53° F), <75% humidity.
68b34bb7-6031-4f82-be46-557a4372ab6d Grind pork belly through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
68b34bb7-6031-4f82-be46-557a4372ab6d Grind beef through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
68b34bb7-6031-4f82-be46-557a4372ab6d Grind pork butt through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
68b34bb7-6031-4f82-be46-557a4372ab6d Partially freeze all ground material then grind again through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Mix meat and fat with all ingredients.
68b34bb7-6031-4f82-be46-557a4372ab6d Stuff into 45 mm artificial permeable casings forming 40 cm (16") links.
68b34bb7-6031-4f82-be46-557a4372ab6d Ferment at 18º C (64º F), 75% humidity for 24-48 hours.
68b34bb7-6031-4f82-be46-557a4372ab6d Cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 12 hours.
68b34bb7-6031-4f82-be46-557a4372ab6d Refrigerate.
b11ad02e-ba3e-4b87-90da-ecebe389ce04 Grind lean pork through 3/8” (10 mm) plate. Cut pork belly into 5/16” (8 mm) cubes.
b11ad02e-ba3e-4b87-90da-ecebe389ce04 Mix meat and spices together.
b11ad02e-ba3e-4b87-90da-ecebe389ce04 Stuff into pork stomach, bladder or artificial casing (the artificial casing must be permeable to allow the moisture escape).
b11ad02e-ba3e-4b87-90da-ecebe389ce04 Hold for 10 days in a cool room (4° C/40° F) between two wooden planks. Place weight on top board..
b11ad02e-ba3e-4b87-90da-ecebe389ce04 Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 2 days.
b11ad02e-ba3e-4b87-90da-ecebe389ce04 Dry between 10-15° C (50-59° F), 60-80% humidity for 3-5 months.
751f2d8a-905a-4c19-8d53-fa9b392f5482 Grind lean pork and pork belly through 6-8 mm (1/4") plate.
751f2d8a-905a-4c19-8d53-fa9b392f5482 Mix all ingredients with meat. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
751f2d8a-905a-4c19-8d53-fa9b392f5482 Stuff into 32-34 mm pork casings making straight links.
751f2d8a-905a-4c19-8d53-fa9b392f5482 Dry at 14-15º C (54-59º F), 75-80% humidity for 12 days.
751f2d8a-905a-4c19-8d53-fa9b392f5482 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <75% humidity or refrigerate.
c187e4c1-f206-4123-a722-207fb49e3afb Curing: cut beef into 1-2” (2.5-5 cm) pieces and mix with 12 g salt and 2.0 g cure # 1. Cut belly into 1-2” (2.5-5 cm) pieces and mix with 9 g salt and 0.5 g cure # 1. Pack tightly in separately container, cover with cloth and keep in refrigerator for 3 days.
c187e4c1-f206-4123-a722-207fb49e3afb Grind beef through 5 mm plate. Partially freeze and grind again. Grind pork belly through 1/4” (5 mm) plate.
c187e4c1-f206-4123-a722-207fb49e3afb Mix all meats with spices until sticky.
c187e4c1-f206-4123-a722-207fb49e3afb Stuff firmly into 65 mm synthetic fibrous casings forming 10” (25 cm) links.
c187e4c1-f206-4123-a722-207fb49e3afb Hang for 1-2 days at 2-4° C (35-40° F), 85-90% humidity.
c187e4c1-f206-4123-a722-207fb49e3afb Cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 1-2 days until casings are brown. Keep refrigerated.
12f6e4f3-26d0-46fd-91af-7afa9295e1e5 Curing meat. Cut meat into 1 inch (25 mm) pieces. Place beef, sheep meat and sheep fat in separate food grade containers. Mix sheep fat with 3 g (1/2 tsp) salt. Mix sheep meat with 24 g (4 tsp) salt, 3/4 Cure #1 and ½ sugar. Mix beef with 3 g (1/2 tsp) salt, ¼ cure #1 and ½ sugar. Pack tightly to eliminate air and cover with clean cloth. Place for 72 hours in refrigerator. Discard any liquid brine and submit meat to grinding.
12f6e4f3-26d0-46fd-91af-7afa9295e1e5 Grind beef through 1/8" (2 mm) plate. Grind sheep meat with 1/8” (2 mm) plate. Dice fat into 3/16” (4 mm) cubes.
12f6e4f3-26d0-46fd-91af-7afa9295e1e5 Mix beef with salt, cure, sugar and spices. Add pork and mix. Add bacon strips and remix everything together. Don’t add any water.
12f6e4f3-26d0-46fd-91af-7afa9295e1e5 Stuff sausages firmly into 40-55 mm beef middles or fibrous casings.
12f6e4f3-26d0-46fd-91af-7afa9295e1e5 Hang sausages for 5-7 days at 2-4 C.
12f6e4f3-26d0-46fd-91af-7afa9295e1e5 Using dry wood, smoke sausages for 2-3 days with cold smoke, 18-22 C.
12f6e4f3-26d0-46fd-91af-7afa9295e1e5 Dry sausages for 5-7 days (depending on sausage diameter) at 11-15 C, 80-84 humidity. Dry 20-23 days more at 10-12 C, 74-78% humidity.
040e8cb9-9264-4c56-9fdd-b80818c4e21d Cut meat and belly into 1.5” (30 mm) pieces and mix with pepper and smashed garlic.
040e8cb9-9264-4c56-9fdd-b80818c4e21d Fry salt briefly on a hot pan (removes moisture), stirring often. Rub salt thoroughly into the meat. Add sugar, cure #2 and alcohol. Pure alcohol evaporates rapidly removing moisture at the same time.
040e8cb9-9264-4c56-9fdd-b80818c4e21d Mix everything well together. Stuff firmly into pork stomach, bladder or 60 mm fibrous casing. Avoid creating air pockets. Reinforce with butcher’s twine: two loops lengthwise and loops across the casings every 2” (5 cm). Form 10-12 cm (4-5”) hanging loop on one end.
040e8cb9-9264-4c56-9fdd-b80818c4e21d Hang for at least 10 days in a cool, dry and ventilated area. This is when curing, drying and fermenting are taking place.
040e8cb9-9264-4c56-9fdd-b80818c4e21d Cold smoke (below 18º C, 64º F) for 3 weeks, applying smoke 3-4 hours daily. On the last day of smoking add juniper berries or juniper twigs into the fire.
040e8cb9-9264-4c56-9fdd-b80818c4e21d Dry for 2 months at 8° C (46° F) and 75% humidity. The sausage should lose about 35% of its original weight.
040e8cb9-9264-4c56-9fdd-b80818c4e21d Store in a dark, cool and dry place.
8cea22ba-a294-4c55-8988-eed64c7db62d Grind meat through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
8cea22ba-a294-4c55-8988-eed64c7db62d 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
8cea22ba-a294-4c55-8988-eed64c7db62d Mix lean pork with salt and cure #2. Add spices and wine. Lastly, add culture and mix all together.
8cea22ba-a294-4c55-8988-eed64c7db62d Stuff tightly into pork caecum, bung or bladder.
8cea22ba-a294-4c55-8988-eed64c7db62d Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
8cea22ba-a294-4c55-8988-eed64c7db62d Apply a thin cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 4 weeks using oak, beech or mixture of both woods. Maintain high humidity. Smoking does not have to be continuous as long as a low temperature is maintained. Cold smoking is drying with smoke. Fermentation takes place during the smoking step.
8cea22ba-a294-4c55-8988-eed64c7db62d Dry at 15→12° C (59→53° F), 80-75% humidity for 6 weeks.
8cea22ba-a294-4c55-8988-eed64c7db62d Dry at 10-12° C (50°-55 F), 75% humidity for 10 weeks.
8cea22ba-a294-4c55-8988-eed64c7db62d Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <75% humidity.
38b95e78-82e2-4b57-a528-a429d7c437fd Grind all meats through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
38b95e78-82e2-4b57-a528-a429d7c437fd Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
38b95e78-82e2-4b57-a528-a429d7c437fd Stuff into beef middles or 90-100 mm fibrous casings.
38b95e78-82e2-4b57-a528-a429d7c437fd Ferment at 24º C (75º F) for 48 hours, 90-85% humidity.
38b95e78-82e2-4b57-a528-a429d7c437fd Dry for 2 months at 16→12º C (60→54º F), 85-75% humidity.
38b95e78-82e2-4b57-a528-a429d7c437fd Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
90a69113-9004-48b2-8864-933f502c92c1 Grind pork through 10 mm (3/8") plate. Grind fat through 6 mm (1/4") plate
90a69113-9004-48b2-8864-933f502c92c1 Mix meat, fat, salt, cure and spices well together
90a69113-9004-48b2-8864-933f502c92c1 Stuff into large hog casings. Different casings are used including bladder and stomach. You can used fibrous synthetic casings.
90a69113-9004-48b2-8864-933f502c92c1 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
90a69113-9004-48b2-8864-933f502c92c1 Dry for 2 months at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity.
90a69113-9004-48b2-8864-933f502c92c1 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
d1a14b03-037e-4f6e-9341-ecd8dd162be9 Grind meat and fat through 5 mm (1/4 tsp).
d1a14b03-037e-4f6e-9341-ecd8dd162be9 Mix ground meat and fat with salt and spices. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
d1a14b03-037e-4f6e-9341-ecd8dd162be9 Stuff into 40-100 mm pork casings.
d1a14b03-037e-4f6e-9341-ecd8dd162be9 Dry at 15-18° C (59-64° F), 75-80% humidity for 30-45 days depending on the diameter of the sausage.
d1a14b03-037e-4f6e-9341-ecd8dd162be9 Keep refrigerated.
e20fd77a-513e-4f01-a2b7-3fce28fba76e Grind meat and fat through 5 mm (1/4 tsp).
e20fd77a-513e-4f01-a2b7-3fce28fba76e Mix ground meat and fat with salt and spices. Hold in refrigerator for 24 hours.
e20fd77a-513e-4f01-a2b7-3fce28fba76e Stuff into 40-100 mm pork casings.
e20fd77a-513e-4f01-a2b7-3fce28fba76e Dry at 15-18° C (59-64° F) for 30-45 days depending on the diameter of the sausage.
e20fd77a-513e-4f01-a2b7-3fce28fba76e Store at 12° C (53° F), 60% humidity or refrigerate.
a9fe600e-d360-4fd4-bf8a-db187ea81079 Grind pork and fat through 6 mm (1/4”) plate.
a9fe600e-d360-4fd4-bf8a-db187ea81079 Mix meat, fat, salt, cure and spices together. Hold for 12 hours in refrigerator.
a9fe600e-d360-4fd4-bf8a-db187ea81079 Stuff into large hog casings. Different casings are used including bladder and stomach. You can used fibrous synthetic casings.
a9fe600e-d360-4fd4-bf8a-db187ea81079 Dry for 2 months at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity.
a9fe600e-d360-4fd4-bf8a-db187ea81079 Store sausages at 10-12º C (50-53º F), <70% humidity.
e05bad99-cdb4-41e5-b6ba-65d8b1c150fa Grind meat and fat through 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
e05bad99-cdb4-41e5-b6ba-65d8b1c150fa Mix ground materials with all ingredients. Hold for 12 hours in refrigerator.
e05bad99-cdb4-41e5-b6ba-65d8b1c150fa Stuff into 60-80 mm pork bungs forming 30 cm (1 foot) straight sections or 30-40 mm pork casings forming 30 cm (1 foot) rings.
e05bad99-cdb4-41e5-b6ba-65d8b1c150fa Dry at 15-12° C (59-53° F), 65-70% humidity for 2-3 months depending on the diameter of the sausage.
e05bad99-cdb4-41e5-b6ba-65d8b1c150fa Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <70% humidity.
ecc1ac27-7a5a-437e-9964-e145737f1199 Grind meat and fat through ½” (12 mm) plate.
ecc1ac27-7a5a-437e-9964-e145737f1199 Mix ground meat with all ingredients.
ecc1ac27-7a5a-437e-9964-e145737f1199 Pack tightly in a container, cover with cloth and refrigerate for 48 hours.
ecc1ac27-7a5a-437e-9964-e145737f1199 Grind through ⅜” (10 mm) plate.
ecc1ac27-7a5a-437e-9964-e145737f1199 Stuff into 60 mm, 8-10” long hog middles.
ecc1ac27-7a5a-437e-9964-e145737f1199 Hang sausage at 68º F (20º C), 80-90% humidity for 2 days.
ecc1ac27-7a5a-437e-9964-e145737f1199 If smoky flavor is desired, apply cold smoke for 2 days.
ecc1ac27-7a5a-437e-9964-e145737f1199 Hold sausage at around 56º F (14º C), 80% humidity for about 2 months until it loses about 30% of its original weight.
ecc1ac27-7a5a-437e-9964-e145737f1199 If mold appears wipe it off with a cloth moistened with vinegar. You can cold smoke sausage again for a few hours which prevents the formation of mold.
4936b50d-5c66-4d55-8ef8-1d6969117c7c Grind lean meat through 5/16” (8 mm) plate.
4936b50d-5c66-4d55-8ef8-1d6969117c7c Cut fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
4936b50d-5c66-4d55-8ef8-1d6969117c7c 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
4936b50d-5c66-4d55-8ef8-1d6969117c7c Mix lean meat with all ingredients. Add fat cubes and mix again.
4936b50d-5c66-4d55-8ef8-1d6969117c7c Stuff into large 40-80 mm hog casings, middles or bungs. Make links 16-24” (40-60 cm) long.
4936b50d-5c66-4d55-8ef8-1d6969117c7c Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90 → 85% humidity.
4936b50d-5c66-4d55-8ef8-1d6969117c7c Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85→75% decreasing humidity for 40-80 days, depending on diameter. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
4936b50d-5c66-4d55-8ef8-1d6969117c7c Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
efe74913-f85f-4485-8b8d-f4182b031ca7 Grind lean meat through 5/16” (8 mm) plate.
efe74913-f85f-4485-8b8d-f4182b031ca7 Cut fat into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes.
efe74913-f85f-4485-8b8d-f4182b031ca7 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
efe74913-f85f-4485-8b8d-f4182b031ca7 Mix lean meat with all ingredients. Add fat cubes and mix again.
efe74913-f85f-4485-8b8d-f4182b031ca7 Stuff into large 80 mm hog casings - pork middles or bungs.
efe74913-f85f-4485-8b8d-f4182b031ca7 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90 → 85% humidity.
efe74913-f85f-4485-8b8d-f4182b031ca7 Dry at 15-12º C (59-54º F), 85→75% decreasing humidity for 80 days. The sausage is dried until around 30-35% in weight is lost.
efe74913-f85f-4485-8b8d-f4182b031ca7 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
887f201e-79a6-4cd1-9a84-d8dc9fa69d5a Grind pork and back fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm). Grind beef with 1/8” (3 mm) plate.
887f201e-79a6-4cd1-9a84-d8dc9fa69d5a 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
887f201e-79a6-4cd1-9a84-d8dc9fa69d5a Mix all ingredients with meat.
887f201e-79a6-4cd1-9a84-d8dc9fa69d5a Stuff firmly into beef middles or 3” protein lined fibrous casings.
887f201e-79a6-4cd1-9a84-d8dc9fa69d5a Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
887f201e-79a6-4cd1-9a84-d8dc9fa69d5a Cold smoke at 18-20º C (64-68º F) for 24 hours.
887f201e-79a6-4cd1-9a84-d8dc9fa69d5a Dry at 16→12º C (60→54º F), 85-80% humidity. In about 6-8 weeks a shrink of 30% should be achieved.
887f201e-79a6-4cd1-9a84-d8dc9fa69d5a Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
acae5bca-185f-486e-98c2-fdc96be62c9f Curing meat. Cut meat into 1 inch (25 mm) pieces. Place beef, pork and pork belly in separate food grade containers. Mix back fat with 10 g (2 tsp) of salt. Mix beef and pork with salt, Cure #1 and sugar according to the recipe (estimate amounts). Pack tightly to eliminate air and cover with clean cloth. Place for 72 hours in refrigerator. Discard any liquid brine and submit meat to grinding.
acae5bca-185f-486e-98c2-fdc96be62c9f Grind beef through 1/8" (2 mm) plate. Grind pork through 1/8” (2 mm) plate. Dice back fat into 1/8” (3 mm) cubes.
acae5bca-185f-486e-98c2-fdc96be62c9f Mix beef with spices. Add pork and mix. Add fat cubes and remix everything together. Don’t add any water.
acae5bca-185f-486e-98c2-fdc96be62c9f Stuff sausages firmly into 45-55 mm beef middles or fibrous casings. Make links up to 20” (50 cm ) long.
acae5bca-185f-486e-98c2-fdc96be62c9f Hang sausages for 5-7 days at 2-4 C.
acae5bca-185f-486e-98c2-fdc96be62c9f Using dry wood, smoke sausages for 2-3 days with cold smoke, 18-22 C.
acae5bca-185f-486e-98c2-fdc96be62c9f Dry sausages for 5-7 days (depending on sausage diameter) at 11-15 C, 80-84 humidity. Dry 20-23 days more at 10-12 C, 74-78% humidity.
ff80666b-5292-4712-85ed-c992e154400a Grind beef, lamb and lamb fat through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
ff80666b-5292-4712-85ed-c992e154400a 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
ff80666b-5292-4712-85ed-c992e154400a Mix all ingredients with meat.
ff80666b-5292-4712-85ed-c992e154400a Stuff firmly into 38 mm collagen or fibrous casings.
ff80666b-5292-4712-85ed-c992e154400a Ferment at 24º C (75º F) for 72 hours, 95-90% humidity.
ff80666b-5292-4712-85ed-c992e154400a Dry for 3 days at 22º C (71.6º C), 80-85% humidity.
ff80666b-5292-4712-85ed-c992e154400a Bake at 80º C (176º F) OR until sausage reaches 54º C (130º F) temperature inside.
ff80666b-5292-4712-85ed-c992e154400a Store in refrigerator.
e0271540-3c28-45c8-a1a8-d4edc0fc45c4 Grind beef and lamb through 3/16” plate (5 mm).
e0271540-3c28-45c8-a1a8-d4edc0fc45c4 Mix all ingredients with meat.
e0271540-3c28-45c8-a1a8-d4edc0fc45c4 Stuff firmly into 38 mm casings.
e0271540-3c28-45c8-a1a8-d4edc0fc45c4 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
e0271540-3c28-45c8-a1a8-d4edc0fc45c4 Dry at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity for 1 month.
e0271540-3c28-45c8-a1a8-d4edc0fc45c4 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
9bcf80b6-d470-4c14-8030-772b29e5ddb4 Meat is manually boned, which enables the thorough removal of sinews, gristle and connective tissue.
9bcf80b6-d470-4c14-8030-772b29e5ddb4 Cut the meat into 1/8” (3 mm) pieces.
9bcf80b6-d470-4c14-8030-772b29e5ddb4 Cut fat into 1/8” (3 mm) pieces.
9bcf80b6-d470-4c14-8030-772b29e5ddb4 Mix lean meat with all ingredients. Add fat and remix.
9bcf80b6-d470-4c14-8030-772b29e5ddb4 Stuff into 65 mm fibrous casings forming 6-22” (15-54 cm) long links.
9bcf80b6-d470-4c14-8030-772b29e5ddb4 Apply a thin cold smoke at 12° C (54° F) for 12-14 days using beech wood. Cold smoking is not a continuous process, it can be interrupted often, however, the temperature of 12° C shoud be maintained. You are drying the meat with smoke.
9bcf80b6-d470-4c14-8030-772b29e5ddb4 Place sausages in a fermenting/drying room at 16° C (60° F), 86-90% humidity to permit the growth of mold. The drying process continues for 2-3 months depending on the diameter (not the length) of the sausage at 60-90% humidity. The total production time from filling the sausages is at least 90 days.
60b921ca-0d5e-4c4a-a021-a0e9a50e9b93 Grind pork and beef through 3/16” plate (6 mm). Dice pork belly into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes or grind through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
60b921ca-0d5e-4c4a-a021-a0e9a50e9b93 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
60b921ca-0d5e-4c4a-a021-a0e9a50e9b93 Mix all ingredients with meat.
60b921ca-0d5e-4c4a-a021-a0e9a50e9b93 Stuff firmly into beef middles or 3” protein lined fibrous casings.
60b921ca-0d5e-4c4a-a021-a0e9a50e9b93 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
60b921ca-0d5e-4c4a-a021-a0e9a50e9b93 Cold smoke for 24 hours at 22º C (72º F) or lower.
60b921ca-0d5e-4c4a-a021-a0e9a50e9b93 Dry at 16→12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity. In about 6-8 weeks a shrink of 30% should be achieved.
60b921ca-0d5e-4c4a-a021-a0e9a50e9b93 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
2b806cfa-99cf-43bd-ad03-61c7977841f9 Cold smoke pork belly or back fat at 18º C (64º F) for 8 hours, then cool well in refrigerator.
2b806cfa-99cf-43bd-ad03-61c7977841f9 Grind all meats and smoked fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Cool in refrigerator and grind again OR emulsify in food processor adding all ingredients.
2b806cfa-99cf-43bd-ad03-61c7977841f9 Mix ground meats with all ingredients (if not done previously).
2b806cfa-99cf-43bd-ad03-61c7977841f9 Stuff into 40 mm natural or artificial permeable casings.
2b806cfa-99cf-43bd-ad03-61c7977841f9 Hold at 18º C (64º F), 75% humidity for 24-48 hours.
2b806cfa-99cf-43bd-ad03-61c7977841f9 Cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 12 hours.
2b806cfa-99cf-43bd-ad03-61c7977841f9 Refrigerate.
63c9a7f7-0ff2-4d23-8233-869d25906bd4 Grind pork and beef through 3/16” plate (6 mm). Dice bacon into 1/4” (6 mm) cubes or grind through 3/8” (10 mm) plate.
63c9a7f7-0ff2-4d23-8233-869d25906bd4 30 minutes before mixing dissolve starter culture in 1 tablespoon de-chlorinated water.
63c9a7f7-0ff2-4d23-8233-869d25906bd4 Mix all ingredients with meat.
63c9a7f7-0ff2-4d23-8233-869d25906bd4 Stuff into 32-36 mm hog casings and form 8” (20 cm) long links.
63c9a7f7-0ff2-4d23-8233-869d25906bd4 Ferment at 20º C (68º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
63c9a7f7-0ff2-4d23-8233-869d25906bd4 Cold smoke for 12 hours at 22º C (72º F) or lower.
63c9a7f7-0ff2-4d23-8233-869d25906bd4 Dry at 16→12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity. In about 6-8 weeks a shrink of 30% should be achieved.
63c9a7f7-0ff2-4d23-8233-869d25906bd4 Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), <75% humidity.
50a226ea-a206-4f65-9295-68ea3e792926 Grind lean beef through 3 mm (1/8”) plate.
50a226ea-a206-4f65-9295-68ea3e792926 Grind lean pork through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
50a226ea-a206-4f65-9295-68ea3e792926 Grind back fat through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
50a226ea-a206-4f65-9295-68ea3e792926 Mix beef and pork with all ingredients. Add fat and mix all together.
50a226ea-a206-4f65-9295-68ea3e792926 Stuff into 60 mm pork or beef middles or synthetic fibrous casings. Form 50 cm (20") sections.
50a226ea-a206-4f65-9295-68ea3e792926 Ferment at 20° C (68° F), 95-85% humidity for 3 days.
50a226ea-a206-4f65-9295-68ea3e792926 Ferment/dry at 18° C (64° F), 85-80% humidity for 2 days.
50a226ea-a206-4f65-9295-68ea3e792926 Cold smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 24 hours.
50a226ea-a206-4f65-9295-68ea3e792926 Dry at 15 → 12° C (59 → 54° F), 80-75% humidity for 4 weeks or until sausage looses 30% of its original weight.
50a226ea-a206-4f65-9295-68ea3e792926 Store at 10-12° C (50-53° F), <75% humidity.
67a34c9e-6f3b-4953-aa51-0e8bb8fa72cb Grind meat and fat through 3/16” plate (6 mm).
67a34c9e-6f3b-4953-aa51-0e8bb8fa72cb Mix all ingredients with ground meat.
67a34c9e-6f3b-4953-aa51-0e8bb8fa72cb Stuff into collagen or sheep casings 24-26 mm and form 5” (12 cm) long links.
67a34c9e-6f3b-4953-aa51-0e8bb8fa72cb Ferment at 24º C (75º F) for 72 hours, 90-85% humidity.
67a34c9e-6f3b-4953-aa51-0e8bb8fa72cb Dry for two weeks at 16-12º C (60-54º F), 85-80% humidity.
67a34c9e-6f3b-4953-aa51-0e8bb8fa72cb Store sausages at 10-15º C (50-59º F), 75% humidity.
3ead0011-ee91-4bf1-97df-94c25403cb47 Grind all meats through 5 mm (1/4") plate.
3ead0011-ee91-4bf1-97df-94c25403cb47 Mix ground meats with all ingredients.
3ead0011-ee91-4bf1-97df-94c25403cb47 Stuff into 42 mm artificial casings forming 45 cm (18") loops.
3ead0011-ee91-4bf1-97df-94c25403cb47 Hold at 18º C (64º F), 75-80% humidity for 24 hours.
3ead0011-ee91-4bf1-97df-94c25403cb47 Cold smoke at 18º C (64º F) for 12 hours.
3ead0011-ee91-4bf1-97df-94c25403cb47 Refrigerate.
45a9d956-48e2-46bf-a6a4-d8d21d86394b Grind all meats through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Cool and grind again.
45a9d956-48e2-46bf-a6a4-d8d21d86394b Grind partially frozen back fat through 3 mm (1/8") plate.
45a9d956-48e2-46bf-a6a4-d8d21d86394b Mix meats, and all ingredients together. Add fat and mix again.
45a9d956-48e2-46bf-a6a4-d8d21d86394b Stuff into 60 mm beef middles or synthetic protein lined fibrous casings.
45a9d956-48e2-46bf-a6a4-d8d21d86394b Ferment at 3 days at 20° C (68° F), 95 → 90% humidity.
45a9d956-48e2-46bf-a6a4-d8d21d86394b Ferment/dry for 2 days at 18° C (64° F), 90 → 80% humidity.
45a9d956-48e2-46bf-a6a4-d8d21d86394b Smoke at 18° C (64° F) for 24 hours.
45a9d956-48e2-46bf-a6a4-d8d21d86394b Dry at 14→12° C (57→53° F), 80-75% humidity for 5 weeks or until sausage looses 33% of its original weight.
45a9d956-48e2-46bf-a6a4-d8d21d86394b Store at 12° C (53° F),<75% humidity.
538c8244-bdba-4bf4-9d29-c6dfce001ace Grind lean pork through 3/8” (10 mm) plate. Cut back fat into 5/16” (8 mm) cubes.
538c8244-bdba-4bf4-9d29-c6dfce001ace Mix meat and spices together.
538c8244-bdba-4bf4-9d29-c6dfce001ace Stuff into pork stomach, bladder or artificial casing.
538c8244-bdba-4bf4-9d29-c6dfce001ace Hold for 10 days in a cool room (4° C/40° F) between two wooden planks.Place some weight on top board.
538c8244-bdba-4bf4-9d29-c6dfce001ace Dry between 12-18° C (53-64° F), 60-80% humidity for 3-5 months. The sausage should loose at least 36% of its original weight. It should be covered with a grayish mold.
538c8244-bdba-4bf4-9d29-c6dfce001ace Store at 8° C (48° F) or lower.
3e594282-e10a-4736-8e03-630b19d0f9d7 Except spleen, brains and blood, poach other meats in a small amount of water:lungs, tripe and bloody meats at 85°C (185°F) until soft heads, skins, lips, udders, tripe and pork stomachs at 95°C (203°F) until soft jowls at 85°C (185°F) until semi-soft
3e594282-e10a-4736-8e03-630b19d0f9d7 After poaching remove gristle from lungs and meat from bones. Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool.
3e594282-e10a-4736-8e03-630b19d0f9d7 Cut jowls into 8-10 mm (3-4”) cubes. Grind udders and lungs through 5 mm plate. Grind raw spleen ground through 3 mm plate. Grind all other meats through 3 mm plate.
3e594282-e10a-4736-8e03-630b19d0f9d7 Mix all ground meats with spices and blood.
3e594282-e10a-4736-8e03-630b19d0f9d7 Stuffing materials: veal bladders or 60 mm (2¼”) synthetic casings. Butcher’s twine. Stuff casings loosely and sew the bladder ends with twine. Tie the synthetic casing ends with twine.
3e594282-e10a-4736-8e03-630b19d0f9d7 Poach bladders at 82°C (180°F) for 78-80 min (depending on size) and synthetic casings at 78-80°C (172-176°F) until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 68-70°C (154-158°F). Remove air with a needle from pieces that swim up to the surface.
3e594282-e10a-4736-8e03-630b19d0f9d7 Spread head cheeses on a flat surface at 2-6°C (35-43°F) and let the steam out. Then flatten them with weight and cool them to below 6°C (43°F). Do not flatten synthetic casings. If there is no proper cooler available, cool them down to less than 12°C (53°F).
3e594282-e10a-4736-8e03-630b19d0f9d7 After cooling clean head cheeses of any fat and aspic that accumulated on the surface, even them out and cut off excess twine.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 Cure all meats in wet brine. Make 40° Salometer brine (10° Baume):
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 1 gal water, 333 g (0.73 lb) salt, 120 g (4.2 oz) Cure #1. About 3/4 qt (710 ml) of brine is needed for 1 kg of meat. Place meats in brine in a suitable container. Hold them completely submerged for 4-5 days. Drain and wash briefly.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 Cover meats with sufficient amount of water and cook at 95° C (203° F) until soft (about 2 hours). For best flavor add soup greens to water: celery, carrot, leek, parsley root, whole peppers, onion, allspice. Remove meat from bones when still warm. The skins are done when they can be penetrated with a finger. Save meat stock.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 Chop onions and fry in fat until golden.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 Cut lean meats and tongues into 12 mm (1/2") pieces.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 Cut bellies into long strips.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 Grind skins and onions through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Place in food processor and emulsify with milk and spices.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 Mix all meats with emulsified skins and meat stock.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 Stuff into pork stomachs or 100 mm synthetic waterproof casings.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 In a large pot bring the water to a boil. Insert sausages in hot water, lower the heat and cook pork stomachs at 80° C (176° F) for 180 minutes, 100 mm casings for 2 hours.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 Immerse sausages for 20 minutes in cold water, then place them on a flat surface to finish cooling. Roll over periodically the sausages stuffed into round synthetic casings to prevent jelly and fat from accumulating in one area.
779c8534-71fd-4a08-a65d-ab7e29195561 Refrigerate.
3019a4aa-137c-4448-990a-7a2b03f3c080 Curing. Cut meats into 1 inch (25 mm) pieces and then mix with salt and cure 1. Pack tight and place in refrigerator for 48 hours. Meats not cured will not develop pink color.
3019a4aa-137c-4448-990a-7a2b03f3c080 Poach meats in a small amount of water hearts, kidneys, lungs at 85°C (185°F) until soft. skins, heads and legs at 95°C (203°F) until soft. jowls at 85°C (185°F) until semi-soft. After poaching remove gristle from lungs and meat from heads and legs. Spread apart on a flat surface to cool.
3019a4aa-137c-4448-990a-7a2b03f3c080 Cut jowls into 10-12 mm ( 3/8-1/2”) cubes. Grind skins through 1/8" (3 mm) plate. Grind other meats through 1/8" (3 mm) plate.
3019a4aa-137c-4448-990a-7a2b03f3c080 Mix salt, spices, semolina or bread crumbs with ground meats and blood.
3019a4aa-137c-4448-990a-7a2b03f3c080 Stuffing. Sausage casings: pork ( middles, bladders or stomachs), veal (bungs), lamb (bungs), beef (large or medium bungs), 100 mm synthetic casings. Stuff casings loosely and sew (or tie) the ends with butcher twine.
3019a4aa-137c-4448-990a-7a2b03f3c080 Cook head cheeses in water at 82°C (180°F) for 90-120 min (depending on size) until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 68-70°C (154-158°F). Remove air with a needle from pieces that swim up to the surface.
3019a4aa-137c-4448-990a-7a2b03f3c080 Spread head cheeses on a flat surface at 2-6°C (35-43°F) and let the steam out. Then flatten them with weight and cool them to below 6°C (43°F). If there is no proper cooler available, cool them down to less than 12°C (53°F)
3019a4aa-137c-4448-990a-7a2b03f3c080 After cooling clean head cheeses of any fat and aspic that accumulated on the surface, even them out and cut off excess twine.
4d2e32b1-f161-4b14-958b-9dd418756351 Cook meats (except liver) in small amount of water until soft: snouts, lungs, jowls at 85°C (185°F); skins and heads at 95°C (203°F); fat at 85°C (185°F) until semi-soft.
4d2e32b1-f161-4b14-958b-9dd418756351 Remove gristle from lungs and meat from heads when still warm. Spread apart on a flat surface to cool.
4d2e32b1-f161-4b14-958b-9dd418756351 Cut jowls and snouts into 3/8 -1/2” (10-12 mm) cubes. Remaining meats ground through 1/8” (3 mm) plate
4d2e32b1-f161-4b14-958b-9dd418756351 Mix all meats, salt, Cure #1 and spices well together.
4d2e32b1-f161-4b14-958b-9dd418756351 Stuff loosely into stomach, bladder, pork middles or 100 mm synthetic strong casings. Cook in water at 82° C (180° F) for 90-150 min (depending on size) until meat reaches 68-70° C (154-158° F) internal temperature. Remove air with a needle from pieces that swim up to the surface.
4d2e32b1-f161-4b14-958b-9dd418756351 Spread head cheeses on a flat surface and let the steam out. Flatten stomachs with weight and cool to 6°C (43°F) or less.
4d2e32b1-f161-4b14-958b-9dd418756351 Clean head cheeses of any fat and aspic that accumulated on the surface, even them out and cut off excess twine. The shape of the finished product: flattened pork or beef bladders in a shape of irregular disk up to 10” (25 cm) diameter and 3 “ (8 cm) thick; flattened pork middles, 7-10” (18-25 cm) long, about 6” (15 cm) wide and 3” (7 cm) high.
049caae1-6bb5-4b9d-bbe4-4694062c00c2 Cook meats in a small amount of water: pork heads at 85°C (185°F), and pork skins at 95°C (203°F) until soft. Add soup greens for better flavor.
049caae1-6bb5-4b9d-bbe4-4694062c00c2 Spread meats on a flat surface to cool. Save meat stock. Separate meat from bones when still warm.
049caae1-6bb5-4b9d-bbe4-4694062c00c2 Cut meat into smaller pieces, cut skins into short strips. Mix all meats with spices adding 10% of meat stock in relation to the weight of pork heads with bones. The meat stock is the result of boiling meats.
049caae1-6bb5-4b9d-bbe4-4694062c00c2 Stuff mixture loosely into hog stomachs or beef bungs about 12” (30 cm) long.Cook in water at 82°C (180°F) for 90-150 min (depending on size) until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 154-158°F (68-70°C). Remove air with a needle from pieces that swim up to the surface.
049caae1-6bb5-4b9d-bbe4-4694062c00c2 Spread head cheeses on a flat surface at 2-6°C (35-43°F) and let the steam out. Place sausages between two boards and place heavy weight on the top. Leave undisturbed for 12 hours at cool temperature. After cooling clean head cheeses of any fat and aspic that accumulated on the surface. Store in refrigerator.
6c862163-2521-44b8-a5cc-d1aa1ac814ef Cut all meats and fat into 18 mm (3/4”) pieces.
6c862163-2521-44b8-a5cc-d1aa1ac814ef Mix with blood and all ingredients.
6c862163-2521-44b8-a5cc-d1aa1ac814ef Stuff into pork stomachs or bladders.
6c862163-2521-44b8-a5cc-d1aa1ac814ef Cook in water at 80-90° C (176-194° F) for 2-3 hours.
18718358-eeab-40dd-a57e-05d821506640 Making Broth: 1/2 pork picnic (front leg) or pork butt. The amount of boiled meat available for further processing will be about 2.2 lbs. (1 kg). Picnic meat is fattier with more connective tissues (collagen) and will produce more gelatin than a butt. The butt has only one little bone and its meat is leaner than a picnic and a commercial gelatin (natural product made from bones and skins) will have to be added. Two pig feet (hocks). If you use hocks and picnic enough natural gelatin (broth) should be produced to create jelly on cooling. If pork butt is the only meat used you will have to mix your own gelatin. 3 bay leaves 1 stalk celery 1 carrot Salt and pepper to taste 1 package of gelatin (if needed)
18718358-eeab-40dd-a57e-05d821506640 Place meats and other ingredients in a pot and cover with about two inches of water. Cook below boiling point for about 3 hours or until meat separates easily from bones. Strain liquid and save for later.
18718358-eeab-40dd-a57e-05d821506640 Separate meats from bones. It is easier to perform this task when meats are still warm. Cut meats into smaller pieces. It is easier to cut them when they are chilled. Normally the leaner the meat the larger diameter the cut. Fatter meats and fat will be chopped into smaller pieces.
18718358-eeab-40dd-a57e-05d821506640 Dissolve gelatin in 1/4 cup room temperature water and add to your hot meat broth.
18718358-eeab-40dd-a57e-05d821506640 Mix meats with meat broth/gelatin and add garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Head cheese does not require much salt and a low sodium product can be made.
18718358-eeab-40dd-a57e-05d821506640 Now you can go two different ways: pour your head cheese into containers, let them sit for 2 hours at room temperature and then place in a refrigerator. Keep it there for 12 hours to give the head cheese time to set. stuff with a ladle into large diameter waterproof casings, clip the ends and cook (simmer) in hot water at about, 185º F (85º C). A rough estimate will be about 20 min for each ½” (12 mm) of diameter of a casing. Or using a thermometer cook to 160° F (72° C) internal meat temperature. Then place at room temperature for about 2 hours for gelatin to set. Place for 12 hours in a refrigerator.
1787b28a-b731-421f-abf5-9447efb8f72a Wash pork heads and legs in cold running water.
1787b28a-b731-421f-abf5-9447efb8f72a Poach heads and legs in separate containers at 185º F, (85º C) until meat can be removed from the bone (try not to cook the meat). Save some of the left over stock liquid for later. Spread all cuts on a flat surface to cool.
1787b28a-b731-421f-abf5-9447efb8f72a Cut head meat into 1/2” (12 mm) cubes. Grind leg meat with 3/16” (3 mm) plate.
1787b28a-b731-421f-abf5-9447efb8f72a Mix all meats with salt, spices, blood and add some of the saved stock.
1787b28a-b731-421f-abf5-9447efb8f72a Stuff mixture not too tight into hog stomachs or beef bungs about 12” (30 cm) long, 8” (20 cm ) wide and 3” (8 cm) thick. Saw the ends with butchers twine.
1787b28a-b731-421f-abf5-9447efb8f72a Cook in water at 180º F, (82º C) for about 90-120 min (depends on a size) until internal temperature of 154º-158º F, (68º-70º C) is obtained. If stuffed bungs swim up to the surface prick them with a needle to release air.
1787b28a-b731-421f-abf5-9447efb8f72a Place head cheeses on a flat surface to cool them down and let more moisture evaporate. Then cool them down to below 42º F, (6º C), place in refrigerator and put some weight on top of it (determines the shape and the thickness of the finished product).
1787b28a-b731-421f-abf5-9447efb8f72a After cooling clean head cheese of any fat and aspic that accumulated on the surface, even them out and cut off excess twine.
1787b28a-b731-421f-abf5-9447efb8f72a Store in refrigerator.
9ae1c89d-6293-423f-a4a0-79ada7aac4c8 The goose and calves’ feet are cleaned and well jointed, then put to boil in cold water with all other ingredients. When the goose is tender, take it out of the broth, remove all spices that may adhere to it, place it into a porcelain or stone jar. Let the calves’ feet cook until boiled down to 3 quarts, remove all fat and season with vinegar, meat extract and salt if necessary. Put in the crushed egg shells, beat the white of egg with water and add it to the bouillon, let it come to a boil and then set aside to simmer until the white of egg curdles. After one hour, strain the bouillon and pour it through a white cloth over the goose meat.*
9ae1c89d-6293-423f-a4a0-79ada7aac4c8 If you wish to prepare the head cheese quickly, omit the calves’ feet and use 35 pieces of gelatin (follow gelatin making instructions) dissolved in 3 quarts of bouillon, which is also clarified with white of egg and egg shells.
9ae1c89d-6293-423f-a4a0-79ada7aac4c8 The meat of the calves’s feet may be breaded in roll crumbs, fried in butter and served with a raisin gravy. If you wish to make this head cheese from duck, take 2 ducks.
9ae1c89d-6293-423f-a4a0-79ada7aac4c8 * If you want to produce a stuffed sausage follow the common procedure: stuff loosely into stomachs, bladders or 100 mm synthetic casings. Sew or tie the ends with twine.
9ae1c89d-6293-423f-a4a0-79ada7aac4c8 Cook in water at 85° C (185° F) for 90-180 min (depending on size) until meat reaches 68-70° C (154-158° F) internal temperature. Remove air with a needle from pieces that swim up to the surface. Spread head cheeses on a flat surface and let the steam out. Flatten stomachs with weight and cool to 6° C (43° F) or lower. Clean head cheeses of any fat and aspic that accumulated on the surface, even them out and cut off excess twine.
aefccf18-29f8-4feb-8d7a-2df3927dda35 Cover meats with sufficient amount of water and cook at 95° C (203° F) until soft (about 2 hours). For best flavor add soup greens to water: celery, carrot, leek, parsley root, whole peppers, onion, allspice. The skins are done when they can be penetrated with a finger. Remove meat from bones when still warm. Save meat stock.
aefccf18-29f8-4feb-8d7a-2df3927dda35 Chop onion and fry in fat until golden.
aefccf18-29f8-4feb-8d7a-2df3927dda35 Cut lean meats 12 mm (1/2") pieces.
aefccf18-29f8-4feb-8d7a-2df3927dda35 Cut bellies into long strips.
aefccf18-29f8-4feb-8d7a-2df3927dda35 Grind skins and onions through 3 mm (1/8") plate. Add a little meat stock if needed.
aefccf18-29f8-4feb-8d7a-2df3927dda35 Mix all meats with emulsified skins, meat stock and spices.
aefccf18-29f8-4feb-8d7a-2df3927dda35 Stuff into pork stomachs or 100 mm synthetic waterproof casings.
aefccf18-29f8-4feb-8d7a-2df3927dda35 In a large pot bring the water to a boil. Insert sausages in hot water, lower the heat and cook pork stomachs at 80° C (176° F) for 180 minutes, 100 mm casings for 120 minutes.
aefccf18-29f8-4feb-8d7a-2df3927dda35 Immerse sausages for 20 minutes in cold water, then place them on a flat surface to finish cooling. Roll over periodically the sausages stuffed into round synthetic casings to prevent jelly and fat from accumulating in one area.
aefccf18-29f8-4feb-8d7a-2df3927dda35 Refrigerate.
be5ec460-b5bc-4f06-ad23-9e96c42d591a Poach meats in a small amount of water: pork heads at 85°C (185°F), beef head meat and pork skins at 95°C (203°F)
be5ec460-b5bc-4f06-ad23-9e96c42d591a After poaching remove meat from heads and spread all meats apart on a flat surface to cool. Save meat stock.
be5ec460-b5bc-4f06-ad23-9e96c42d591a Boiled pork head meat: cut into strips 1.5 x 2 cm (⅝ x ¾”) by 7-10 cm (2 x 4”); boiled beef head meat: cut into strips 1 x 5 cm (⅜ x 2”); boiled skins and tougher meat parts: grind with 3 mm (⅛”) plate.
be5ec460-b5bc-4f06-ad23-9e96c42d591a Mix all meats with spices adding 10% of meat stock in relation to the weight of pork heads with bones. The meat stock is the result of boiling pork heads.
be5ec460-b5bc-4f06-ad23-9e96c42d591a Stuff mixture not too tight into hog stomachs or beef bungs about 12” (30 cm) long, 8” (20 cm ) wide and 3” (8 cm) thick. Saw the ends with butchers twine.
be5ec460-b5bc-4f06-ad23-9e96c42d591a Poach head cheeses at 180°F (82°C) for 90-150 min (depending on size) until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 154-158°F (68-70°C). Remove air with a needle from pieces that swim up to the surface.
be5ec460-b5bc-4f06-ad23-9e96c42d591a Spread head cheeses on a flat surface at 2-6°C (35-43°F) and let the steam out. Then flatten them with weight and cool them to below 6°C (43°F).
be5ec460-b5bc-4f06-ad23-9e96c42d591a After cooling clean head cheeses of any fat and aspic that accumulated on the surface, even them out and cut off excess twine. Store in refrigerator.
a995c314-4e52-4cf6-935f-752740de81c2 Rinse meats in cold running water.
a995c314-4e52-4cf6-935f-752740de81c2 Except spleen, brains and blood and skwarki (* see note), poach other meats in small amount of water: lungs, kidneys, veal heads, veal casings and pork trimmings at 85°C (185°F) for about 90 min beef trimmings, skins, heads, tripe, and udders at 95 C (203°F) for about 2 hrs until semi-soft. jowls at 85°C (185°F) until semi-soft.
a995c314-4e52-4cf6-935f-752740de81c2 After poaching remove gristle from lungs and meat from heads. Spread meats apart on a flat surface to cool. Soak skwarki (* see note) in stock (remaining after boiling meats) taking 40 liters of stock for 100 kg of skwarki (* see note).
a995c314-4e52-4cf6-935f-752740de81c2 Cut jowls into 8-10 mm (3/8”) cubes. Meats, spleen, kidneys, udders, tripe, sheep casings and veal head meat ground through 5 mm plate. Skwarki (* see note) and skins ground through 3 mm plate.
a995c314-4e52-4cf6-935f-752740de81c2 Mix all meats with salt, spices and blood together.
a995c314-4e52-4cf6-935f-752740de81c2 Stuffing materials: beef or veal bungs, middles, 60-100 mm synthetic casings. Butcher’s twine. Stuff casings loosely and tie the ends with twine.
a995c314-4e52-4cf6-935f-752740de81c2 Poach head cheeses at 85°C (185°F) for 90-120 min (depending on size) until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 68-70°C (154-158°F). Remove air with a needle from pieces that swim up to the surface.
a995c314-4e52-4cf6-935f-752740de81c2 Spread head cheeses on a flat surface at 2-6°C (35-43°F) and let the steam out. Then flatten them with weight and cool them to below 6°C° (43°F). If there is no proper cooler available, cool them down to less than 12°C (53°F)
a995c314-4e52-4cf6-935f-752740de81c2 After cooling clean head cheeses of any fat and aspic that accumulated on the surface, even them out and cut off excess twine.
657ad3bd-e6f4-4b92-a804-f5e9980a8f92 Cut back fat into 3 mm (1/8”) strips, about 8 cm (3”) long.
657ad3bd-e6f4-4b92-a804-f5e9980a8f92 Grind all meats through 2-3 mm (1/8) plate.
657ad3bd-e6f4-4b92-a804-f5e9980a8f92 Mix blood with salt and spices.
657ad3bd-e6f4-4b92-a804-f5e9980a8f92 Mix ground meats, fat and blood well together.
657ad3bd-e6f4-4b92-a804-f5e9980a8f92 Stuff into pork blind caps (caecum), about 20 cm (8”) long.
657ad3bd-e6f4-4b92-a804-f5e9980a8f92 Cook in water at 80° C (176° F) for 60 minutes.
657ad3bd-e6f4-4b92-a804-f5e9980a8f92 Keep in refrigerator.
42a20213-1ee3-4568-98d1-56be8d7eb183 Pigs’ feet and calves’ tongues are cleaned well, put on to boil with the water, salt, pepper, onion, bay leaf. Cover the pot and boil until well done, then take the skin off the tongue and cut it with the rest of the meat into small pieces. Strain the bouillon and add vinegar, lemon juice, wine and meat extract. Put the meat into a dish, pour the bouillon on and set to cool. **
42a20213-1ee3-4568-98d1-56be8d7eb183 Then turn it out on a platter and serve with head lettuce or potato salad, vinegar and oil, mayonnaise dressing or with fried potatoes.
195fa4bc-74dc-4aff-aff6-7d20ca8f6587 For pink color cure meats. Cut the meats into one inch pieces, mix with salt (12 g) and cure 1. Pack tightly and leave for 48 hours in refrigerator. Meats not cured are rinsed only.
195fa4bc-74dc-4aff-aff6-7d20ca8f6587 Poach meats in a small amount of water: pork heads,snouts and jowls, lungs and pork class IV at 85°C (185°F) until soft. skins, heads and legs at 95°C (203°F) until soft. dewlaps at 85°C (185°F) until semi-soft.
195fa4bc-74dc-4aff-aff6-7d20ca8f6587 After poaching remove gristle from lungs and meat from heads and legs. Spread apart on a flat surface to cool.
195fa4bc-74dc-4aff-aff6-7d20ca8f6587 Cut boiled snouts and jowls and poached dewlaps into 15 mm (5/8”) cubes. Except skwarki * grind all meats through 3 mm plate.
195fa4bc-74dc-4aff-aff6-7d20ca8f6587 Mix ground meat with spices and blood.
195fa4bc-74dc-4aff-aff6-7d20ca8f6587 Stuffing. Pork middles, bladders or stomachs, beef, veal and lamb bungs, 60-100 mm synthetic casings. Stuff casings loosely and sew the ends with twine.
195fa4bc-74dc-4aff-aff6-7d20ca8f6587 Poach head cheeses at 82°C (180°F) for 90-120 min (depending on size) until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 68-70°C (154-158°F). Remove air with a needle from pieces that swim up to the surface.
195fa4bc-74dc-4aff-aff6-7d20ca8f6587 Spread head cheeses on a flat surface at 2-6°C (35-43°F) and let the steam out. Then flatten them with weight and cool them to below 6°C (43°F). If there is no proper cooler available, cool them down to less than 12°C (53°).
195fa4bc-74dc-4aff-aff6-7d20ca8f6587 After cooling clean head cheeses of any fat and aspic that accumulated on the surface, even them out and cut off excess twine.
074cdb8d-2a37-4219-8d6c-73eff64068a5 The fried chicken is cut into small pieces, the pickles are peeled and sliced. The strong beef broth is heated and the gelatin i dissolved in it with wine, meat extract and salt added, then strained and tasted as to seasoning.
